name: MAJESTY
description:
Mobile Armour Jousting pits two mobile armours - the agile mechanoid suits you see on the news putting down Jovian revolts and guarding the President - against each other in one-on-one combat. The aim isn't so much to kill your opponent as to force them out of the ring, sumo-style; once you damage their engines a bit they'll probably do it themselves just by accident, MAs are hard enough to control at the best of times.

A lot of colonists think that the MAJ circuit is their ticket Earthside, and the prizes are certainly magnificent. But the tricks you learn docking with fuel ships or dodging bandits under the rings of Saturn don't prepare you for a Mobile Armour. There's nothing like it; these beasts are as twitchy as they are powerful. And that's not to mention that the Extra-Solar Tournament is the only open tourney that unranked knights from the colonies can even enter, and that's held right the way out in the Reaches where you're just as likely to be hit by a lump of floating rock as a missile from your opponent...

MAJESTY - Mobile Armour Jousting: Extra-Solar Tournament - is a dexterity game in which you move little cardboard tokens around on a hex map. Players take turns to flick discs on their control boards - one for Throttle and one for Manoeuvre thrusters - which determine whether their Mobile Armour executes a perfect slide behind the enemy mecha to deliver a solid shot to the rear or spins wildly in place before careening off in the wrong direction. Players' mecha retain momentum from previous turns' acceleration, and half the challenge is to stay in the arena while being buffeted by cannon fire and homing missiles.

The use of small control boards means that unlike many dexterity games, MAJESTY doesn't require a large, flat and smooth surface upon which to play.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Final Attack!
description:
Final Attack! is a real-time cooperative tabletop strategy game for 1-5 players. You will pilot the K-Machines, ancient yet technologically advanced fighting mecha that can combine to form Final Kaiser, champion of justice. You will do battle against shapeshifting mechanical monsters called Robeasts, gigantic foot soldiers of the starfaring artificial intelligence FANGER. Your only way to defeat these terrors is to use the Final Attack, an all-powerful weapon that takes the entire game to charge.

Final Attack! is a unique blend of card game, worker placement game, social game, and arcade game. You will play cards, you will move chips around the table, you will solve resource puzzles, you will yell attack names, and you will endure hardship by yourself or with whatever companions fate has provided, all in real time. The game takes between 20 and 30 minutes to play, and there is absolutely nothing else like it.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Darkenbeast Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Darkenbeast Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rivet Wars: Man in Charge
description:
"Some men are born to follow and some are born to lead. The Colonel, as everyone refers to him, is definitely the man in charge. When he walks into a room one can feel his presence. And the gaze of his eye is always scrutinizing his men, looking for any flaw, any weakness. When charging into battle, this is the man you want in charge!"

This was a KS Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars. The Man in Charge has special leadership abilities.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Intercardinal Yavalath
description: Intercardinal Yavalath is an asymmetric N-in-a-row game. Players take turns placing pieces on an 8x8 board. The first to make a row of 4 contiguous pieces of their colour orthogonally wins, but a line of 3 pieces diagonally loses.

name: Turds: The Card Game
description:
Turds is a Fun, Strategic, Humoristic and Nasty card game.

Turds is so nasty!! For the first time you really have "Sh#tty Cards" and "This is some bullsh#t!" moments. Be ready for everything, Turds are coming from everywhere!!

How it's played;
Every player has 4 Turds in front and want to get rid of them as quickly as they can.

You can do two things in a turn;
Play and Draw or Discard and Draw from your hand. When you play a card, you fulfill the written action. On the cards you find actions that can destroy, capture, teleport, transfer, disable and more.
The first player to lose his or her turds wins the game!!

There are alot of different cards in one deck (total of 86 cards) and for that reason there are plenty strategic and dirty ways to win the game.

Are you ready for the most nasty and explosive fight of the world!?

name: Eccentric Exhibits
description:
Eccentric Exhibits is a 2-player, 20-card trick-taking game. In this game, players are rival museum curators trying to arrange the most prestigious exhibitions of bizarre and unusual artifacts - unicorn hooves, kraken tentacles, books of pure evil, and alien skulls, to name a few.

Over four rounds, two players will play a series of tricks, trying to win artifacts for their museums and score prestige. The twist is that the highest scoring cards are not always the cards most likely to win a trick. So huge bonus points are available if you can deduce what cards your opponent is able to play and which tricks they are able to win.

With only 20 cards to keep track of, skills in deduction and risk management are paramount. Eccentric Exhibits is a tense, high-skill game for two players.

name: Ulična trka
description:
Ulična trka (Street race) is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one car. All cars drive around a city. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles that slow down the cars. The winner is the player whose plane first gets to the finish line.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Pits
description:
The Pits is a card game for 5 players using a pack of 54 cards, 4 normal suits of 13 cards each and 2 Jokers. The Jokers need to be distinguished as strong ("red") and weak ("black").

The cards are ranked from the strong Joker, weak Joker, all the twos, Aces, Kings etc down to the threes. There is no difference between cards of the same denomination. Jokers are completely wild and can replace any card in forming a meld. Twos are partly wild and can be used to represent a card of equal denomination to another. Twos can never be used in a single sequence.

The object of the game for all the players is to discard all their cards. The dealer initially leads and can play any meld. Players wishing to play must play the same number and type of meld, but higher ranking (e.g. a pair of fours above a pair of threes) or they may pass. It is not compulsory to play cards if a player can do so. Play continues until all players pass. The last person who played can then proceed again with any meld he chooses. If the player who played last goes out (and all the other players have passed) then the player to his left proceeds.

The dealer shuffles the cards and deals them to his left (any cutting of the cards is entirely optional and is left to the choice of the dealer). All the cards are dealt and there should be 11 cards for all players except for the dealer who has 10. In the first hand the dealer is chosen at random, usually the first person to turn up a Jack.

Pits is a corrupt version of the Chinese game Zhēng Shàngyóu.

41 (or Forty-One) is a traditional card game commonly played in Syria and Lebanon. It is a partnership trick-taking game, in the same family as Whist and Boston, with a substantial difference from most such games: players bid and score individually.

Bidding and play is counter-clockwise, and traditionally trumps are always Hearts. In turn, each player bids a number of tricks they expect to take. The dealer, who bids last, can potentially cause the hand to be re-dealt by the next player if the total bid score count is less than 11. Play is as in most trick-taking games: match suit if possible, otherwise trump if desired or throw off; highest card of the suit led wins, unless trump is played, in which case highest trump wins, and winner leads to the next trick.

A player scores a number of points equal to their bid if they get at least that many tricks on their own (so 3 points for bidding 3 and winning 3 or more tricks), and loses that many points if they fail to get their bid (so -3 points for bidding 3 and winning 2 or fewer tricks). A bid of 7 or above is for double stakes (14/-14 for 7, 16/-16 for 8) and guarantees that the hand is played.

The winning partnership is the first to have a player reach at least 41 with their partner's score above 0.

name: Dolmen: The rituals
description:
Expansion for Dolmen that adds ten ritual cards to the game.

Before starting the game shuffle and deal each player two face down cards. Return any spare cards to the box. The ritual cards are goal cards that may give additional victory points in the scoring round at the end of the game.

name: 100 A.D.
description:
It is 100 A.D. The present emperor is Trajan; one of Rome's greatest generals, leading Rome's greatest military expansion. He has ruled for two glorious years. The senate is largely perfunctory, but those in power still seek the Emperor's ear in order to push their own agendas. This game is about trying to gain Trajan's favor and rule Rome from the shadows.

In 100 A.D. players are members of a secret cabal attempting to control the Senate from behind the scenes. By manipulating the system, passing Bills that improve their status, and gaining influence over the city's factions, the players gain control over various aspects of Rome. Victory points are earned by having influence over the Senate, factions, Senators, and Emperor's Favor. At the end of the game, the player with the most extensive power structure (i.e. victory points) wins.

Throughout the game players take various actions to impact three different portions of the game board in order to accumulate victory points. Players can control the Emperor's Favor, the Senate, or the various factions of the game (or some combination thereof). Players also need to manage their corruption, as too much will lose them points. Generally, players have only one action per turn, but various cards and tokens can be used to gain additional actions.

Each round starts with the Orator, who advances the round token one space and takes an action. During a player's turn, he or she takes one action play then passes clockwise. The actions a player can take on their turn are: Call in a Favor (by playing a faction card); Contact a Faction (by placing influence tokens on a faction space and drawing the appropriate card); Control a Senator (by buying their seat); Remove Influence (withdrawing influence tokens from factions); or Subterfuge (a special action that can vary depending on the circumstances).

When all players have taken a turn, the round is over. At three different times during the game (after rounds 5, 10, and 15) Recess is called and victory points are tallied. Recess is also where players adjust their faction points, and vote on Bills. Players need to be keenly aware of how little time they have before the game is over.

name: Conquest At Kismet
description:
In the Kismet Sector of the Raccroc Galaxy, huge self-sustaining motherships fight over control of the sector's vast natural resources. But you have to get past other races in order to obtain it. Hailed by its alpha testers as the Magic: The Gathering of sci-fi, this game breaks traditional card game mechanics and rearranges them into something that feels new and fresh!

In Conquest at Kismet, you play as one of two races vying for control of the Kismet sector in the Raccroc Galaxy. This simple game uses a lottery-like method of resolving battle, something that's never been used in a card game before. This allows for a very small table footprint while having a healthy mix of tactics and luck.

name: Zombie Brawlerz
description:
Are you brave enough to enter the Brawlzone and start Brawlin' with your 'Rookie Deck'? The fast-paced card game, packed full of mini zombies all with attitude. Power-up your zombies and become unstoppable, use your Rare & Super Rare zombie cards to be UNBEATABLE! Pick-up and Play - Play Anywhere - There's always a chance to win. 50/50 Play:The Rookie Deck has been designed so it can be split equally between two players, so each player can use 20 Zombie Cards and 5 Add-on Cards. Using 50/50 play means that if your friend, Brother or Sister doesn't have a deck or has forgotten theirs, they can still play this great Zombie card game! Simple and easy game-play makes Zombie Brawlerz great fun straight out of the box.

Zombie Brawlerz is a top trumps mechanic game with strategy cards that alter the dynamics of each round, with incredible cartoon style zombie artwork.

name: Panzer Grenadier: Special Free Set
description:
This little set includes everything you need to play an introductory Panzer Grenadier scenario: the rules and charts (in downloadable form), a scenario card, a set of 40 superb laser-cut, mounted real playing pieces, and an 11x17-inch real full-color map on heavy cardstock.

The pieces, map and scenario are drawn from Panzer Grenadier: Burning Tigers.

Comes packaged in 9"x12" ziplock bag.

name: Age of Craft: Rebel Army
description:
A promo blueprint card.

Once built, you will win automatically on your next turn.
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: ATS Sealed Fate: Case White 1939
description:
From the publisher's website...

This is SEALED FATE: Poland 1939, the first ATS module to bring in the Polish of 1939. That means tasty new counters, yes! AFVs, and personnel. PLUS a juicy collection of scenarios all playable on the collection of 11” × 16” folding boards provided. It is all in there in terms of the flavor of ‘Case White’ ... and the Germans don’t always have to win! Not when YOU, valiant owner of the ATS Rulebook 2014 edition (with that handy E Rules edition for full searching of rules) is in command.

But you better be ready to handle your 7TPJW tanks, because the action is going to be HOT. Includes all the combat counters needed to play.

INCLUDES ALL THE COMBAT COUNTERS NEEDED TO PLAY, JUST BRING MARKERS AND YOUR ATS RULEBOOK 2014.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Air Raid: Pearl Harbor!
description:
Air Raid - Pearl Harbor! is a detailed simulation and study of an iconic event in U.S. and, indeed, world history. It is an extensively researched wargame inspired by the nearly life-long interest of the designer in the subject matter. Units are individual ships and also individual aircraft, although these are amalgamated into various counters by aircraft type. There is area movement for some portions of the map, and the areas of particular interest are modeled using 250-yard-wide hexes. The simulation is detailed but not overly complex and includes various subsystems to render results for air-to-air, air-to-ground/ship, anti-aircraft, and also anti-submarine operations, to engage any full-size and/or midget Japanese submarines brought into action.

The initial scenario may be played by two players, although it is designed to be a solitaire introduction to the system and also a way to let players experience and study this historic battle, to give insight into much of what happened and why. The likelihood is that you will achieve the historical result, a Japanese Tactical Victory. The standard scenario presents all of the forces available to both sides and allows the Japanese player to modify his or her deployment and attack plans up to and including the composition of the two attack waves. If you think you can plan a more successful attack than Minoru Genda did, you have here the tools to try. Conversely, the U.S. player has the opportunity to fight back to the best of his or her ability, and various optional rules - particularly variations in the initial Alert Level - give the U.S. player more assets with which to fight and more assets to save through evacuation.

There is also a scenario which has one or two American aircraft carriers in port and your initial thought is probably that this is a huge bonus toward Strategic Victory for the Japanese. However, the main Japanese player dilemma of this simulation is that the Japanese have a finite amount of aircraft and ordnance, and more targets are not necessarily a guarantee of victory. You will find that you need to target appropriately and generally roll for damage well in order to successfully hit everything you need to hit. The options allowing a third strike later in the day or the next day are a gamble - you can strike again, but at a fully alerted, albeit weakened, set of targets and you risk losing more aircraft, which equal Victory Points for the U.S.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Indukto
description: Each player owns six pieces of heights 1, 2 or 3. The objective of the game is to move the pieces thus the pieces of same height are in orthogonal adjacency. A single piece may move exactly as many steps in any direction as it is high. As soon as a piece is adjacent to an other piece it loses its own movement but may only move as far as one of the neighbours induces by its height.

name: Schäferstündchen: Riese Rübezahl
description:
Promo Role

From the card:

Bewegung 6
Kampf 2

Du darfst nur 4 Handkarten haben.

Movement 6
Fight 2

Your max. handsize is 4 cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Racing

name: Orcorrida
description:
"It is known that from time to time Orcs perform races with steam cars, aka "Goratank Racing". Racers, riding pimped machines, run till death on a crazy race. The winner gets a championship title, a special "Trophy-Gun", fame and money. This competition is also known as "Orcorrida" (SpeedOrc)." - Lyzarbhi Chronicles

Orcorrida is a card game where you´re an Orc on a deadly race that takes place at the Fields of Gore World. Prove your courage and driving skills on a competition where anything goes. During the race, Orcs release all their wildness and skills with killing machines in an exciting competition on tracks through Orc Island.

It's a 3-6 player game where laughthing and fun is guaranteed.

Game Components: 54 cards and 1 "pole position" token

Game comes in 3 languages: Portuguese, English and Orcish

You're an orc racer and you have to play "road cards" to create your "path for victory". You start with 5 cards and use one of them at a time to make an action. You may have an "Orcrook" card to difficult the race: missiles, mines, bump actions or turbo to increase car speed are some of the tricks you can use against the other players.
"Road cards" have point values and you must play them to run for victory. The player with the biggest number of points is the Champion of this crazy race.

name: Monster High: Potworrrnie wciągająca gra!
description: A simple kids' game about collecting monster girls of Monster High. The deck consists of 14 different girls, 4 of each. On your turn you play a card and draw a card. If you played a card that's already visible on the table (either in the centre or at another player) then you put the card on the top of the similar card(s) and place the stack in front of you. When a player starts their turn with a given number of stacks in front of them (2 players: 8 cards, 3 players: 6 cards and so on) the game ends and they've won!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tinker Tactics
description:
Tinker Tactics is a free, abstract microgame for 2 or 4 players and takes around 5-10 minutes to play.

Rules:


1D8, 2D6, 2D4
Each player rolls dice but hides them from opponent
Each player announces score. All players adjust dice to match the highest score (except highest scorer)
All players arrange dice as they wish on their board
Players reveal and connect board to each other
Players take it in turn to move each die. Die move the same number of spaces as pips on the die
They can move across filled spaces but must land on empty space
Dice cannot move diagonally, nor are diagonally situated dice affected by enemy dice
Any enemy dice adjacent reduce number on die by 1
Any dice reduced to 0 are removed from the board
A player is eliminated from the game when they have only 1 die left
The last player remaining is the winner

name: And a Bottle of Rum
description:
Battle on the high seas or in the crowded streets of the Spanish Main as a Pirate, Pirate Hunter or a simple Merchant in this minatures game!

Using the Chain Reaction System found in all of Two Hour Wargames, you field a group of characters with very simple stats: Reputation and Weapons. Activation rolls tell you when you are able to go (higher rolls go first, but only activate higher Reputation groups) and then you may move and fire/charge. That's it!

Of course, being the reaction system, the other figures on the board won't be sitting and waiting for you to finish in a IGO-UGO fashion, but will react to your moves using a series of tables that may have them running from you, drawing pistols and firing, or charging into combat swords shining!

Be the last pirate standing and win!
Or play a campaign and retire with the most gold to win!

Rules to adventure ashore?Check!
Big Land Battles to sack Panama? Check!
Ship combat with boarding actions? Check!
Big Sea Battles to fight fleets? Check!
Treasure maps and buried treasure? Check!
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play
publishers: (Web published), Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: One Arm Bandit
description:
One Arm Bandit is based on the concept of a slot machine. Players pay a silver dollar for the privilege of selecting a red, yellow, or blue tile which they hope will complete a combination that pays off according to the House Odds chart.

After cashing in a winning combination, a player selects three new tiles and continues the search for another combination. If a player runs out of cash before putting together a winning combination, he pans out and is out of the game.

Certain combinations with Jackpot tiles are more valuable than others, earning the holder additional silver dollars from the Bar.

The player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.

name: MISI
description:
A family kitty strategy card game.
Many kitties (called in kichua language "misi") are in the streets and they need a home. Your goal is to gather as many of them as you can, and take them to your house.
You use resources (milk, tuna and stamen) to "adopt" them.
Take a card from the resources deck and manage those resources to adopt the best kitty you need for your strategy. All the kitty cards have effects you can use to gather more resources, to steal cards from the other players or destroy opponent's strategies. And you can combine them for a greater benefit!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That

name: The Working Dead
description:
You work a thankless office job at a faceless corporate entity. Its stark, lifeless cubicles bleed grey into your very soul. Before you can even start your day, an old co-worker wanders into your workspace. He's been long dead but that doesn't stop him from being a distraction. You manage to blow his brains out with a modified staple gun and get back to work. Maybe you can make it to Friday. Maybe.

The object of The Working Dead, a negotiation-driven strategy game, is straightforward: Be the first to earn $250,000 by the end of the week by negotiating for fellow co-workers! Check in on Monday, manipulate others to do your work for you, grab a beer on Friday. Don't let the undead get you down. Use them to your advantage or die trying. Always follow corporate policy — or don't.

name: duck, duck, Go! Junior
description: Do you like duck! duck! GO! but you have younger children that love the ducks? duck! duck! GO! Junior is a 16-card expansion for the beloved rubber-ducky racing game. These cards are an alternative deck for use with younger players. The cards ease players into the game by including numbers instead of hex space symbols. As players become used to the game, they can gradually switch to increasingly complex hex space cards. The duck! duck! GO! Junior deck is a great way to introduce players to your favorite rubber ducky game!
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Animal Upon Animal: Pig Promo
description: This promo was available at GenCon 2015 at the HABA booth and consisted of 4 Pigs for the game Animal Upon Animal. The Pig figures have a HABA logo on one side and a QR code on the other.

name: Legend of Vyas
description:
Legend of Vyas is a two-player strategy card game based on the the Mahabharata. Each player chooses a hero from the story and builds a deck of warriors, weapons, spells, astras, advisor, artifacts, and formation. Each player then uses these cards on the Kurukshetra battlefield in an attempt to reduce the opposing hero's health to zero. Cards are in general closely linked to the way the characters, spells and weapons are used in the epic itself.

In game's initial release, the available heroes are the legendary bowmen, Arjuna and Karna.

Each game set comes with 3 unique Indian stick-dice that determine a player's energy allowance for using cards.

name: Fantasy Stables: Regular Edition
description:
In the game of Fantasy Stables you're trying to make it in the horse business. Your friends will now be your rivals as you compete to see who will end up on top. The object of the game is to collect the most money in cash, horse value and bonuses. Bonuses are awarded for collecting certain groups of horses. They add another level of strategy to the game. Game play is very easy and intuitive for horse people but no horse knowledge is needed to play.

Everyone begins the game with money and horses to start the fun right away. There are several suggested winning scenarios for you to choose from for one hour of play to days of fun. All the turns are cooperative but competitive to keep things lively!

Collect and show horse cards featuring fabulous pictures of real horses in 8 equestrian sports (Dressage, Driving, Trail, Western Pleasure, Western Performance, Racing, Cross Country and Hunter Jumper).

Add horses to your stable at public auctions where everyone can bid. Bid as high as you dare – you know the range but the horse’s actual value is kept a secret until the winning bid has been paid!
Everyone can enter the shows and choosing the right horse will give you an advantage but anyone could steal the win if luck is on their side.

There are random and yearly horse expenses to watch out for so manage your salary and show winnings well. All the players get a real-life horse job (vet, farrier, trainer etc.) who are paid the expenses to keep those interactive too!

Horses are unpredictable so you never know what will be around the corner – wins or losses!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Colours and Shapes
description:
In Colours and Shapes players take on the role of one of the eight colours and shapes:

Red Triangle; Orange Oval; Yellow Line; Green Square; Blue Circle; Indigo Diamond; Violet Rectangle; or Grey.

Each has their own special power creating a unique gameplay experience. Battle friends in this match making card game and learn your colours and shapes!

The base game of Colours and Shapes is an exciting 2-4 player game that can either be played in minutes, or for hours, requiring you to combine thoughtful strategy, luck, and in-your-face gameplay to create a fun, fast, and casual game that can be played anywhere, anytime.

Players decide whether to lay down sets of at least three of a kind, or push their luck to wait and lay down more than three. However, if they wait too long and get caught with cards, each one is -2 points. After playing certain sets, players may activate extra powers that stop their opponents from winning or help them move a step closer to victory.

name: Carrots and Broccoli
description:
Billy and Mandy really want to set up a garden in their backyard. The problem is Billy wants a garden of carrots and Mandy wants a garden of Broccoli. The only way a garden can grow is if all of the plants group together. Otherwise, the weather, animals and other gardeners can destroy the garden. In this war over the garden, there is no compromise, no surrender. You either win or become rabbit food.

This game uses the Looney Pyramids, some dice and a checkerboard to recreate the sense of total victory of your crop surviving while others fail.

Included with the Kickstarter shipment of Pyramid Arcade as one of the twelve bonus Looney Pyramid cards created for $333 level backers.

Number of Players: 2 or 4

Equipment: Timer (optional), 8x8 board, a rainbow stash per player (up to four), a Pyramid die and a Color die

Who Starts: The player who has spent the most time in a garden goes first. If it is a tie, rock-paper-scissors to see who goes first.

Setup: For a two player game, set up the a chessboard with one red trio and one yellow trio on one corner of the board just off the side of the board (they represent the carrots) & one green trio and one blue trio on the opposite corner of the board just off the side of the board (they represent the broccoli). Place the remaining red, yellow, green, and blue pyramids off the board at a neutral corner.

On the diagonal of the board in between the two players, form a line of random black pyramids. One pyramid per space. There should be an empty square at the corners of the board. The black pyramids represent the garden wall. For a four player game, set up the chessboard with each color at a corner just off the board. Form an x of black pyramids in the middle of the board. One pyramid per space. There should be an empty square at the corners of the board.

Each of the open spaces represents a part of the backyard. Place two of the same color trios off each side of the board near the opening of each of the x sections, touching the edge. The remaining trios should be accessible to the other players off the side of the board.

Gameplay: The first player rolls the Color and the Pyramid die. The player selects the pyramid based on the color and size rolled on the dice. If the dice roll shows two pieces, select one of the two pieces. If the dice roll shows the atom (*), select any color. You may place that pyramid any square on the board that does not have a pyramid already. This represents planting the seed in the garden.

If you roll black, you may move one of the black pyramids from the wall that matches the pyramid from the other dice. The black pyramid can only be moved one orthogonal space and must be no more than two squares away from the other black pyramids.

If your roll matches a combination that is already on the board, you may move one of the pyramids one square orthogonally on the board. If there is already a pyramid on that square, a player can not move into that square. If the pyramid was moved by the previous player, it can not be moved this turn.

Winning: During a two player game, the player wins when they have ten of their pyramids in their corner of the chessboard. All of the pieces must be orthogonally touching with one of the pieces in the corner of the board. In addition, all of the pieces must be on the same side of the wall. If a piece in on the wall line, it does not count as being on your side of the wall.

During a four player game, the player wins when they have ten of their pyramids in their side of the yard. All of the pieces must be orthogonally touching. In addition, all of the pieces must be on the same side of the wall. If a piece in on the wall line, it does not count as being on your side of the wall.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Grid Movement

name: In Kahoots
description: In Kahoots is a party game. Players draw a card, and when roll the die to see how many clue words they get. The players then guesses for hidden phrases on the card. The players can score up to 3 points on each card. The player in the end of the game with most points is the winner. The game comes with 6 card racks, a die, 500 phrase cards (1 000 phrases), a timer, and 60 point chips.

name: Clench
description:
We have all been there. An endless queue of people rather desperate to relieve themselves, and only one toilet cubicle! Roll the custom dice and see who can hold onto their dignity the longest, and who will fail.

Clench is a speedy dice game of player elimination. Players take it in turns to roll the two dice to see if they will be clenching, losing some "dignity", or giving another player the stink-eye and thus causing them to lose a point.

A fun and hilarious game for two to twelve players. Who will be the one to triumph and avoid incidents?

name: Vulture Race
description: Vulture Race is a simple game where players race around a track. On each player's turn, he rolls a die, and either moves his piece ahead that many spaces and distributes the same number of cards to other players, or takes that many cards and moves another player's piece forwards that many spaces. The game ends when someone crosses the finish line, or the cards run out. Only the first and second place players on the track are eligible to win, and the one with the most cards is the winner.

name: Stripes
description: In Stripes, players have a row of seven cards on the table featuring many horizontal lines in a variety of colors. The goal is to make a single stripe of one color across your card set. Each turn, you select one of the action cards to change your cards: flip, swap, steal, draw, etc. There are a certain set of actions available each round, depending on the number of players. How many moves will you take to complete your stripe and win?
mechanics: Action Queue, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: Super Powered Smash Masters
description:
Description from the publisher:

Super Powered Smash Masters The fast-paced, tongue-in-cheek, superhero-themed, customizable card game you can play with your whole family! It’s crammed full of humor, amazing heroes, bizarro story twists, and dangerous puns.



Game Features:
Recruit a team of heroes to battle other hero teams — for no reason! It’s just like comics!
Defeat all rivals to win.
Customize your deck! Choose your best heroes and create a deck that compliments their abilities.
Can be combined with other SPSM sets.
Groups of up to 8 people (or more) can play together!
Fast-Paced Fun! Beat up your friends and still have time for… well… another game of Smash Masters!




Cores Set Includes:
184 fully illustrated cards
24 Unique Character Cards, each with their own powers and corresponding Super Cards
36 Story Cards full of crazy, comic-book themed twists and turns.
20 Team Up Cards
80 Smash Cards
Rule Book




New Recruits Standalone Expansion Set Includes:
92 fully illustrated cards
12 Unique Character Cards, each with their own powers and corresponding Super Cards
18 Story Cards full of crazy, comic-book themed twists and turns.
10 Team Up Cards
40 Smash Cards
Rule Sheet
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip

name: Crazy Robot Factory
description:
Description from the publisher:

Crazy Robot Factory is an abstract/puzzle solving/token placement solitaire/co-op game where you are the owner of a new robot parts factory and you've arrived to find out that the robots who setup the main factory floor must have had a glitch and placed the robot assemblers and conveyor belts randomly across the factory floor. What's worse is you have a huge order that is going to start processing and your factory isn't ready!

So to try and get everything working again you must quickly program your factory Robots to help move the equipment into their correct positions. You will have to do this while you use your Factory Assembly Arms to bring in new equipment onto the factory floor. Don't take too long rearranging the conveyor belt because once the START conveyor belts begins moving you must make sure the conveyor belts have a continuous path or the widgets will drop to the factory floor and end up destroyed.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Bakudan Takarabako
description:
User summary
爆弾宝箱 (Bakudan Takarabako), in English is Bomb & Treasure.

In the game of Bomb & Treasure, players are pirates who try to grab treasures while avoiding bombs.

Each round, a player (sender) places a card face-down, which is either a treasure of 1-10 value or a bomb, and sends it to another player (receiver), saying the value the card. The sender may lie if it is a bomb and say any value, but if it is a number card, they cannot lie and must say the actual value of the card. The receiver may either accept and reveal it, or sends it back to the sender and forces the sender to reveal it, or adds another card and passes both cards to any other player, including the sender.

Now the card or cards must be revealed and the player who has them takes all of them, including bombs revealed, and puts them face-up in front of themself. After each player has taken a turn as sender, players draw back to five cards in hand.

With total of three bombs, that player is out of the game. If a player has two bombs in front of them, they don't want to risk getting a third bomb, and so may easily decline an offer of a high value card.

If a player gets a set of 1,2 & 3, they equal 10 points, so players may accept low value cards and be fooled into taking a bomb.

You win the game if you accumulate 30 value of treasures, or all other players are out of the game, or you have the highest value of treasures when the ninth bomb is revealed.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは海賊となって、宝物と爆弾を送りあいます。うまく宝物だけをゲットし、爆弾を相手に押し付けましょう！
手札のカードを1枚伏せて、他の人の前に出します。
カードを出された人は、「受け取る」「返す」「さらに1枚追加して他の人に渡す」のどれかを選びます。
宝物であれば点数に、爆弾であればダメージを受けます。爆弾を3枚引き取ってしまったら脱落です。
「先に30点以上集める」「自分以外の全員が脱落する」「9枚爆弾が出た時に、一番多くの点数を持っている」のどれかで勝ちになります。

name: Animals Frightening Night! Tortoise and Skunk
description:
Animals Frightening Night! Tortoise and Skunk is a mini-expansion for Animals Frightening Night! that replaces the geese tiles with a tortoise and a skunk. What do they do?

• Skunk — In the Hiding Phase, after every player decides where to hide, the skunk may take their character token and activate their special ability. After doing so, whoever is hiding in the same place as the skunk must change their hiding place to another until the end of Morning Phase.

• Tortoise — In Morning Phase, before any player activates their character's special ability, they may take their character token and activate their special ability. By doing so, they hide in their shell and cannot be eaten by the wolf.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Acting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Skyways
description:
The cities of the future continue to expand…upward! As buildings get taller, skyways are constructed to connect buildings above street level to allow for easier foot traffic between them.

In Skyways, you and your opponents are building the city, floor by floor and skyway by skyway. By placing tiles of the same color, you can score large numbers of points. By placing a building capital on top, you finish a building and claim a colored area for yourself for bonus points at the end of the game. Do you want to score more now and risk giving your opponent a larger area connected to their capital, or do you want to get your capitals out as quickly as you can and enlarge your own areas for the end game?

The player with the most points when the tiles have been placed wins!

name: Great Comics Adventure
description:
Great Comics Adventure is a tabletop card game celebrating the history of Comic Book Characters from the Golden Age. The deck includes 90 Triumph Cards and 18 City Cards. Several major cities are represented in 'The Great Comic Adventure' (GCA) all featured as post-cards. On the back of each post-card is the sequence of cards required to 'claim' that city. Once the five cards in your hands match the post-card, it is then claimed. Once you claim a city you will grab another, and once you claim three cities you win the round!

All the characters and images used in this game are from the Public Domain, so they belong to all of us! In general, works published after 1977 will not fall into the public domain until 70 years after the death of author, or, for corporate works, anonymous works, or works for hire, 95 years from the date of publication or 120 years from the date of creation, whichever expires first. Pre-1978 works what are in the public domain because they were published without proper copyright notice, or, in the case of pre-1964 works, were not timely renewed, do not receive retroactive protection under the CTEA. Similarly, works published before 1923, do not receive retroactive protection, and remain in the public domain. All of these comic books were published in the Golden Age of Comic Book History which all started with one super hero, Superman. The Golden Age could be given a specific start time thank to Superman #14 (Feb. 1942), this is when we ushered in the Golden Age of Comic Books. The Golden Age of Comic Books describes an era of American comic books from the late 1930s to the early 1950s. During this time, modern comic books were first published and rapidly increased in popularity. All the comics in the game feature comics from the 1940's and 1950's along with the post card designs featured as well.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Ypsilonie: Cesta do vyjmenované země
description: Ypsilonie: Cesta do vyjmenované země is an accessible light family game about an expedition to a magical kingdom. The game is mainly roll and move while trying to teach children(as well as adults) a little bit about czech grammar rules. The game is one big adventure (cca 50 minutes playing time) and three mini games (each around 25 minutes).

name: Hellweg Westfalicus: Doppeltes Einkommen
description:
Hellweg Westfalicus: Doppeltes Einkommen (double income) is a postcard mini-expansion for Hellweg westfalicus.

The postcard says:
Add the new Merchandise Card "Double Income" to play.
The owner of the card needs also the "+1" card of this kind. Every time he must remove a Carriage from the game and take it back into his Supply, he receives two Thaler instead of one from the Bank.

name: The Restoration of Ilkannon
description:
The ruins of Ilkannon have been discovered! After being lost for centuries, you now have a chance at learning about the heart of that mythic civilization! Choose your character and begin your adventure into the wilds! But watch out! The curse which brought Ilkannon to ruin is still housed within its walls! Restore the city - but make sure you don’t unleash corruption upon the world!

You play one of four characters: An adventurer, a politician, a scholar, or a mechanic. Each person has their own goals within the city, and each one has their own faults that make them susceptible to various curses. The ultimate end goal is to find four power crystals to revitalize the city or to find one item to bring back to tell of their great discovery!

There are four main stats which each character has: Corruption Resistance, Movement, Restoration, and Ingenuity. Corruption Resistance is how susceptible a character is to the dark forces still at work in Ilkannon. This is used mostly during events. Movement is how far the character can move on their turn. Restoration is how many tiles a character can restore on their turn. Ingenuity is used for events, and is based on how well the character deals with certain situations outside of their normal state. Corruption Resistance and Ingenuity affect how many dice the character rolls during certain events.

The city of Ilkannon is composed of sixteen tiles, laid out in a grid of four by four. These tiles are double sided, with one side being Wilderness and the other side being the Restored city.

Turn order is as follows:

1) Move or Restore
2) Draw an Event
3) Corruption activates. This only happens once part of Ilkannon is Restored. If no tiles are Restored, Corruption sleeps.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Where's My Chainsaw?
description:
Description from the publisher:

"Where's My Chainsaw?" is a game about life in the zombie apocalypse, which of course means it is full of adventure and hilarity. Players compete to see who can achieve victory, or at least to see who will be the last one alive...

Inspired by the possibilities found in Munchkin but frustration with its gameplay relying on random luck, "Where's My Chainsaw?" is a strategy-based evolution that minimizes randomness and emphasizes social interaction. You'll also find many added game mechanics we've loved over the years, such as varying win conditions, multiple forms of currency, and a strong comeback mechanic to ensure everyone stays in the game. Are you curious what a "take-that" game would be like if it was designed for serious gamers? So were we!

Gameplay occurs as the players take turns accumulating Special cards (actions) and Weapons, and then battling various enemies. Strategy is very flexible and social interaction is key, as alliances and betrayals are the driving forces behind whether you will succeed or fail in combat.

Each character has a slightly different goal to achieve victory, although anyone can win by being the only player who hasn't died yet. This allows gaming groups to adjust their approach as players try to find a balance between cooperation and competition. Other ways to win include collecting items, a high combat score, or defeated enemies (depending on your character). A new comeback mechanic ensures that no player is ever out of the game, so everyone can continue to compete and win even after dying multiple times.

Where's My Chainsaw? includes over 200 unique full-color cards, beautifully and hilariously illustrated by Paul Dozier. This cooperative and competitive game supports 4 to 8 players and lasts 60-90 minutes. If you're looking for a great social game where your decisions and tabletalk determine the outcome, you're in the right place!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics: Wermacht Heavy Flame Grenadier Squad – "Desert Sun"
description:
The unarmoured Afrikakorps troops love to have these guys around. A heavy squad is just the thing for tackling stubborn opposition head-on while the other Grenadiers manoeuvre around the flanks. Seeing the destructive heat of their flame-throwers’ gout of burning fuel, it’s little surprise that they are nicknamed ‘Desert Suns’.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Crazy Palace
description:
crazy palace - Two "crazy" builders with one goal: build the highest palace without it tumbling down!


COMPONENTS: 21 wooden blocks, 1 die, 2 coloured little figures

INSTRUCTIONS:
Distribute 10 blocks each and place the printed block on the game table, laying it with the word LARGE facing upwards: this will be the base of the building. Choose your pawn and decide who starts first by throwing the dice: the biggest size starts (S, M, and L).
The one who starts throws the dice and, using only one hand, positions a block on any part of the building, placing it so that it rests with the face indicated by the dice (S, M, and L). Each time you position a block you must place the pawn on any part of the block you have just placed and then pass the turn to your rival.
To position a new block you can move your pawn, taking it temporarily from the building. You can position a new block on one of your rival’s blocks, but without moving your pawn.

name: Kaosball: League Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Kaosball League series is about to begin! Choose your team, hire your ringers, give them the best upgrades, and prepare for the most brutal season yet! There will be many contenders, but only one can raise the Kaosball Chalice!

The Kaosball: League Pack allows you to plays Kaosball in League Play Mode. Four to eight players engage in a series of connected matches, with special rules for upgrading your team between matches and special achievements that can make your team even more powerful!

The League Pack adds enough components to your Kaosball core box to play two simultaneous matches. To play with more than four players, you'll need extra Team Boxes, sold separately.

The League Pack also includes two brand new Ringers for your team to hire, the powerful Frank, and the speedy Wheels!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Skyscrappers
description:
Building a skyscraper is tough, but working together might be even tougher. Skyscrappers pits players against each other, only to force them to cooperate a few floors higher. Elevate your status when others fail to be the best person at NOT knocking down a tower.

A winner of our Nano Contest, this had us from the pitch, but the game ended up a blast.

In this game for 3-8 players, players will be picking cards simultaneously and stacking them on top of a tower, hopefully keeping it standing. Players could be placing cards on their own, or they could be working with the other players to stack a single card on the tower.

The player who is the best at keeping the tower standing wins!

—description from the publisher


Released in the February 2017 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

name: Osprey Adrift
description:
After being attacked by an angry kraken, The One Winged Osprey is lost at sea. Food is running low for you and your fellow pirates, and there won’t be a rescue any time soon. To make matters worse, there seems to be a group of cannibals on board, making their way through the crew at night, one by one…

Osprey Adrift is a card game of deduction, deception, and cannibalism for 4 to 12 players, set aboard the cursed One Winged Osprey during the golden age of piracy.

Before the game begins, each player is given the role of one of the hardened and storied pirates of the Osprey. In addition to their public Role card, each player is given a secret Identity card: Sane or Cannibal. If you’re Sane, it’s up to you to figure out who the Cannibals are so you can force them to walk the plank. And if you’re a Cannibal? Convince the Sane that you’re one of them so you can turn them into your next dinner…

Osprey Adrift's gameplay centers around a dual pronged flow of eliminations: The Cannibals eliminate one of the Sane each round, and the entire crew votes to eliminate one more player each round (with the Sane hoping they're getting rid of a Cannibal).

Players draw cards off the Scavenge deck to stock their hands with Food (needed to stay in the game), Coins (used to bid on the right to be Captain each round, and as victory points should the player survive to the end of the game), Actions (used to perform special feats to help or hinder players), and Resources (needed to power many of the Actions). Or, if a player knows they need specific cards, they can dare to ask their fellow crewmates if they'd like to make a trade - in a separate room from the rest of the players, where a pirate's parley can be formed.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants – Second Chance Promo
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Promo

On your own turn, bring any number of your own dice (except dice at the Puddle) back to your Anthill. You may reroll them in normal turn order.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Nefarious: Masquerade
description: "After any players Research, each player with any cards in hand simultaneously passes the card left to the next such player. (Players with no cards in hand are skipped.)"

name: The Contender: 2016 Expansion Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

Augment The Contender with cards based on the wildest primary season in American political history. Fresh quotes from Bernie Sanders, Marco Rubio, Hillary Clinton, Jeb Bush, Martin O’Malley, Ben Carson, Ted Cruz and so much Donald Trump you’ll need to build a big beautiful wall to keep yourself away from it.

91 New Argument cards
9 New Topic cards
For a total of 100 new cards!

Made in the United States of America by patriots who give a damn!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Political

name: Stupid Users: BETA
description:
Description from the designers:

Stupid Users: BETA is a one of a kind, IT vs Zombies, Card Game about building up an army and stealing or looting anything to win. You read that right, IT vs Zombies. This isn't your typical card game. Get ready for a fast paced, trash talking, turn on a dime, army building card game. It starts like this; choose your IT Champion, cards are dealt, you're fighting against the other players, and the evil Der Magicker a diabolical hacker. You see Der Magicker is building his army of zombies to take over the world and more importantly beat you and the other players. Champions must gather or steal weapons, troops, and strategically play cards to beat Der Magicker and the other players. There are many ways to gather your army, draw a card, attack another player, kill a higher powered zombie, etc. Pay close attention because one card will change the game entirely or can be a win card with the correct gameplay. No sleeping allowed! Let the game begin, if you dare......
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game, Zombies

name: Space Editor
description:
Description from the publisher:

Space Editor is a battle card game whose theme is the creation of the universe. As a player, you will become an incarnation of a god that governs an element constituting the universe. Create the universe and own it with strong control!

In Vedic mythology, the entire universe including five elements and the earth we live in were completed when Brahma emerged. In Space Editor, you will recreate the moment the universe was created through the friction of the five elements.

Each player chooses one of four out of five elements: water, wind, earth, and fire, and start a game with a deck of cards of the chosen element. Players take turns placing planets and stars with energy as powerful as God. You have to read stars like an astrologer and advance the game so that the element you govern has the strongest control.

One universe will be created as each game finishes. The player who governs the most dominant element in the universe is a winner.

name: Say Anything Uncensored
description: Say Anything Uncensored plays just like the classic party game Say Anything, but it does not have any of the benign "we might be playing at church with a bunch of people we don't know very well" questions.

name: Enfutown Bumpers
description:
Description from the publisher:

Enfutown Bumpers is a 2 player strategy card game with a fun art style you can't put away! It's got a lot of elements for outstanding gameplay.


Board positioning
Outwitting your opponent
Hidden Information
Bump Battles!


It's reminiscent of games like Stratego and Poker. Units move face down on the 3x5 board and after bump battles, they are revealed. There are many opportunities to read your opponent and bluff too!

Each card has a Rank which determines the winner of a bump and when a bump battle begins, more of your cards can be added to the battle!

Each card has their own abilities too, creating a deep game of strategy and out playing your opponent.

name: Dreamwars: Dark Times Decks
description:
Inside this box:
30 New Outland Mysteries Cards
30 New City Intrigue Cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Freedom of Speech: The Game
description:
The kind of party game you probably shouldn’t play with your mother. Freedom of Speech is a hilarious card game that almost guarantees that you will laugh and have a good time. The game comes with a deck of 400 cards, each containing a bizarre and silly word, a timer and instructions. Every other person around the table is on the same team and the rotation moves counter-clockwise. The deck stays at the center of the table and whoever has their turn draws from the deck. The aim is to get your teammates to guess the word on the card before the timer runs out. However, you cannot say the word that is on the card. In addition, there are other rules, like no rhyming or pointing, that you can find in the full instructions on the website. Finally, once your team guesses the word, the play moves to the other team immediately. The first team to guess 21 cards correctly wins.

—description from the designer

name: Schoolgirls Love Tentacles: Aitako
description: Promo Card from Delicious Orange featuring a Wild Card character "Aitako"
mechanics: Action Points, Memory, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Pirat & Co: Mau Mau
description:
Four brave pirates are on a wild race to the legendary Treasure Island. Each of them is trying to be the first to get rid of all their cards. But only a player with plenty of luck and the right tactics will win the round, and be allowed to sail their ship toward Treasure Island. Who will win the race?
A classic card game on the high seas.

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Booster – Fashion Furious
description:
Munchkin Collectible Card Game is a combat game in which players level up turn after turn, put loot into play to give themselves benefits, and attack (or bluff attacks!) against one another. Eliminate the other player first, and you win!

Each Fashion Furious booster pack contains twelve randomized cards, one of which is at least rare.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Early Railways Collection
description: This boxed set contains three games: Lancashire Railways, New England Railways, and Australian Railways. Components are reused amongst them and a variant is included for each game.

name: The Valley of Alchemists: Ghost Expansion
description: The Ghost Expansion allows for a 5-player game, as well as adding two new game modes! The first one - “Companions” - introduces direct player on player interaction as well as increasing the options available to players. The second game mode - “Dragon Contest” - introduces intense competition between players as they try to further their alchemy career while completing unique elixir sets which will award the highest-ranking player with a generous bonus.

name: Chrononauts: Teeny Tiny Time Machine Promo Card
description:
This Gadget works in either type of Chrononauts deck.

Text says:
"If you have this Gadget on the table, any Inverter you play works like a Reverse Fate. You may only use one Time Machine action per turn."

It debuted as a promo card at GenCon 2004, and was added to the original game during the 3rd printing.
It was also available for purchase by itself from the Looney Labs webstore
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Au suivant
description:
Answer the questions correctly and with a little strategy and luck. Every turn, answer correctly 3 questions on 4 on a specific theme to collect enough money to seize the Champion’s chair. Be careful not to lose everything and challenge the “interim champ” with the Kif-Kif Duals. The player with the Champion’s chair at the end of the game (30 minutes) goes on to play the GRAND JEU DU 21. If the champion answer all the last 21 questions in 150 seconds, he/she is the GRAND CHAMPION.
Only available in french.
Box contains:
396 question cards
40 GRAND JEU DU 21 cards
55 cylinder cards
1 cylinder card container
CHAMPION’S CHAIR card
1 plastic base
1 small box
Game rules
(Description from the publisher)

name: Sussed?: Showcase
description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Sussed All Sorts is a family friendly quiz with a twist: instead of general knowledge, you’ll be answering questions about each other! As you read aloud a series of real and imaginary scenarios, you’ll be given choices to make. Whoever can suss you out scores. Who has the most points wins.

Over 200 topics to talk about including robot pets, bubble baths, horror films, medieval banquets, ostrich racing and urban insect farms (to name a few!). So, who've you got sussed?

—description from the publisher

name: Convoys in Flames/Cruisers in Flames
description:
CoiF/CliF provides you with both Convoys in Flames and Cruisers in Flames. It includes 800 counters (CS 36, 2 x CS 37 & CS 38), rules and charts.

Note: CoiF/CliF requires World in Flames in order to be played.

(from ADG's website)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Qyps
description: Qyps is a connection game played with a hand of domino-like pieces on a triangular board. Like it predecessors, Wyps and The Game of Y, the player who connects all three sides of the board wins. Also like Wyps, opponent pieces can be converted. Qyps differs in that connections are built with chains of pieces sharing the same values.

name: Tor-Duell
description:
Kick off an exciting football match with Tor-Duell, with players trying to move into the opponent's penalty area. Hey, that was a clear foul! Now my opponent got in front of my goal. It's a clear shot, and "Goooooooal!"

—description from the publisher

name: かくされた部屋 (Hidden Rooms)
description:
User summary
In this game, the player, as a child searching a space in darkness, aims to get out of there without getting caught by the roaming monster.
—description from the publisher

The monster follows a preset path unless it sees you. The player (child) can explore at most one new tile per turn. You lose if the monster catches you or if the monster exits the maze before you do.

かくされた部屋 (Kakusareta heya) is 'Hidden Rooms', a solitaire game where your objective is to escape from the dark room you are trapped in with a random monster. If you escape, you get a point. If the monster catches you, or the monster walks to the end of its path: you fail. Get 2 points for victory in the game, or fail 3 times and you lose.

The monster is determined randomly at the beginning of a round. The game has a small booklet, showing the monsters and their paths. The monster's movement depends on the monster's type, different monsters move differently. Although the monster has predetermined 'movement path', when the player is in close range of the monster, it ignores the path and starts to chase, until the player gets out of sight of the monster.

Each turn consists of the following phases: monster moves (2 steps), player moves (2 steps), player searches (1 tile). Monster moves are mandatory, the player's moves or searches are optional.

On the monsters turn, when in close range, monster moves to chase the player. Or else, it follows the predetermined path.

On the player's turn, first, you may move up to 2 tiles. Then, you may do a search. To search, you draw a tile from a face-down shuffled pile of tiles. If the tile drawn may be legally connected to the tile you are standing on, you may place that tile. It is legal when: the tile colors are the same or the number is greater than the tile you are on.

If you fail to connect, the tile drawn must be placed on a 'memory area'. In further turns, you may draw a tile from this area instead of drawing from the pile. But this area has a max capacity of 5, whenever you placed the 6th tile, it spills. You must then place all the 'memory tiles' back in the pile, face-down, and shuffle them.

You start from the bottom-right tile. You escape if you successfully reach the top-left tile. You fail when the monster catches you, or the monster reaches the end of its track.

Publisher's summary
「かくされた部屋」”Hidden Rooms”は、1人プレイ専用のすこし変わったボードゲームです。

ゲームの目的は、あなたを封じ込める忌まわしい暗闇から抜け出すこと。
あなたに与えられた行動範囲は、はじめこそ僅かなものですが、手番を消費し探索を行うことで、徐々にこれを拡張していくことが出来ます。
幸いゴールがどこかはわかっています、しかし注意してください。ただ出口を目指して突き進むだけでは、足元をすくわれることになるかもしれません。

なぜならこの空間にはもう一つの徘徊者が存在し、それはあなたを捉えようと蠢いているのです。
かれを振り切るには、ときには脇道を探し、自由に動ける空間を確保する必要があるでしょう。
あなたの知恵と勇気、機転と運を駆使して、光を掴み取るのです！

"Kakusareta Heya"(Hidden Rooms) is a unique solitaire board game.

Your objective is to get out of this hideous darkness. You may only move in a limited range at first, but by spending your "search actions" may expand your mobility. Fortunately, you know where the goal is. Unfortunately, rushing towards the goal may swipe your feet.

In this void however, there is also a prowler, wriggling around to get you. To outrun them, you may need to find some sideways, and secure some area to freely move around. Gather all your wisdom and might, wits and luck, to grasp the light and flee from darkness!
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Bee Hive Game
description: Players take turns testing their dexterity skills by flipping bees into the hive. Where the bee lands gains the player a certain number of points. The queen bee in the center is worth 100! But wait! Can the player make the bee land in the right spot while the hive is rotating? The player with the most points after launching four bees is the winner!

name: 1859: The Railroad Card Game
description:
1859: The Railroad Card Game is a pure card game, comprised solely of 72 “protean pieces of pasteboard.” In that year, the railroad industry in the United States was still in its infancy. Your simple goal is to be a better railroad baron than your opponent. You do this by winning contracts to build track which connects one USA city to another in a series of competitions. The major elements you need are materials, labor and cash, although interesting people (contacts, investors, etc.) and effects such as material shortages and labor unrest will come your way. Engaging in a little trickery won’t hurt you, either.

A game of 1859 is played over eleven competitions (rounds). At the beginning of each competition, one player will choose a card from two which show the possible routes to be contested. Each player has a hand of five cards.

After a player plays a card, a replacement is drawn from the deck, replenishing his hand back to five cards. After a number of competitions, usually eleven, the game ends. The player who earned the most profits wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Triangul8
description: Triangul8 is a 2-player abstract game played with triangular tiles (1 red, 23 black, 23 white). There is no board; the game starts with the placement of the red tile, after which each player takes a turn placing a tile of their color next to an already placed tile. The goal is to use your tiles and potentially the red tile, which is neutral and counts for both sides, to form the corners of a triangle that encloses the red tile. The first player to achieve this wins the game.

name: El Túnel del Tiempo
description:
The Tunnel of Time is a board game for 2 to 4 players whose purpose is to gather 3 groups of historical chronicles regardless of the era to which they belong. To do this, we must move around the central area of ​​the board in order to acquire passport cards with which to jump in time and face the challenges that each season brings us. Surviving the challenge entails getting us one of the coveted chronicle letters. The six epochs are: Prehistory, Ancient Age, Middle Ages, Modern Age, Contemporary and Future Age.

The board is divided into its central part by 6 seasons that can be skipped if you have the right passport, simply moving the vintage sheet so that they end up configuring a completely new board suitable for the time in which it is played.

Around these moving sheets are the squares by which players will move to get the coveted passports with which to jump to the time whose chronicle letters need, or simply to face the challenges that the current era proposes.

When changing the era, we will move the moving parts of the center of the board so that it changes along with the elements common to the era.
—description from the publisher (translated)

El Túnel del Tiempo es un juego de mesa para 2 a 4 jugadores cuyo fin es el de reunir 3 grupos de crónicas históricas independientemente de la época a la que pertenezcan. Para ello, deberemos movernos alrededor de la zona central del tablero con el fín de adquirir cartas de pasaporte con las que saltar en el tiempo y enfrentarnos a los desafíos que nos depare cada época. Sobrevivir al desafío conlleva hacernos con una de las codiciadas cartas de crónica. Las seis épocas son: Prehistoria, Edad Antigua, Edad Media, Edad Moderna, Edad Contemporánea y Futuro.

El tablero está dividido en su parte central por 6 épocas a las que se puede saltar si se tiene el pasaporte adecuado, simplemente moviendo las hoja de época para que éstas acaben configurando un tablero completamente nuevo adecuado a la época en la que se juega.
Alrededor de éstas hojas móviles se encuentran las casillas por las que los jugadores se moverán para conseguir los codiciados pasaportes con los que saltar a la época cuyas cartas de crónica necesiten, o simplemente para enfrentarse a los desafíos que la época actual proponga.
Al cambiar de época, moveremos las partes móviles del centro del tablero para que éste cambie junto con los elementos comunes a la época.
—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Napoleonic, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Dagon's Bones
description:
A fast and fun Lovecraft-inspired dice game played in the pubs and bars of Innsmouth. Roll the Bones, pray to Dagon.

In the seaside pubs of Innsmouth they play a game of chance and fortune called Dagon's Bones. It's a dice game that requires both luck and daring and maybe a small blessing from the Elder Gods.

Players attempt to steal enough coins from each other or Cthulhu himself, in order to please Dagon. But, beware, Cthulhu demands a tithe and if he gets too much, he wakes!

—description from the publisher

name: Court
description:
Court is a trick taking game with a twist. If you like classic trick taking games like Spades, Euchre or Hearts, you will love the extra strategy in Court which includes special card powers, varying objectives and set collection.

Each player has a hand of cards, they take turns playing a card into the "trick" like traditional trick taking games highest card played wins the trick and a crown worth -2 points at the end of the game but in Court the lowest card played in the trick gets to trigger its card power. Winning tricks is powerful but sometimes you want to come in last to trigger that special power just at the right moment to swing the game. You have to watch out for the powerful character cards though, when played they not only win the trick but also get to use their power.

After a trick is completed the winner gets to distribute the cards played to the "Court" in front of each player, the court serves two purposes, first the cards in each players court at the end of the hand is the players score for the round. Second after scoring each player picks up the cards in their court and that is their hand for the next round.

There is also random special objectives in play rewarding players with negative points for getting specific card combinations in their court.

The game is played over 3 rounds. At the end of three rounds the player with the lowest score wins.
mechanics: Contracts, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Across A Deadly Field: The War in the West
description:
The War in the West, the new supplement for Across A Deadly Field brings to the tabletop the bitter struggles of the Western Theatre of the American Civil War.
The special rules and scenarios included in this volume give players everything they need to recreate the battles, both great and small, of this theatre of the war.
Battles such as Shiloh, Stone River, Vicksburg, Chickamauga, Chattanooga and Atlanta are presented in great detail, offering players of Across a Deadly Field not only a range of scenario options, but the ability to play through a full campaign.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Variable Player Powers

name: Lustprinzip
description:
Good communication with one’s partner is important - providing one can also converse clearly with them. Who is best able to re-phrase ambiguous Terms?

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Evil Baby
description:
A Russian Roulette style NSFW card game, last player alive wins against an indestructible Evil Baby...Don't Lose Your Head!

Players take turns drawing cards, if you draw an Evil Baby Card you lose if you don't have a counter card to send it to another player or defense card to defuse the attack.

Each player starts with a Defense Card for fast loadout, or a Defense Card, Counter Card, Skip Card & Attack Card each. The aim of the game is to build as many defense cards in your hand as possible to ensure your survival.

Players must take turns picking a card from the deck in clockwise order from
the dealer, the dealer is voted for by group decision or coin toss if just 2 players.

EVIL BABY CARDS

If you draw an Evil Baby Card, you are out if you
don't have a Defence or Counter Card to play.
The Evil Baby Card always goes back into the
deck and then the deck is shuffled.

DEFENSE CARDS

When you draw this card from the deck
keep it in your hand for when you need to use it.
If you play a Defence Card, you must discard the
Defense Card after use.

COUNTER CARDS

When you draw this card from the deck
keep it in your hand for when you need to use it.
You can play a Counter Card instead of a
Defense Card if you have one in your hand when
you draw an Evil Baby Card. Choose any player
to send the Evil Baby Card to and they must face him
immediately.

SKIP CARDS

When you draw this card from the deck
keep it in your hand for when you need to use it.
You can use a skip card to miss your go, you must
discard the card upon use. You must present the skip
card before you pick up a card on your turn.

ATTACK CARDS

When you draw this card from the deck
keep it in your hand for when you want to use it.
Present this card to another player to pick up an
extra card on their go, the card must be
presented during their turn but before they have
picked up their card. Multiple attack cards can be
used by multiple players at once.

Important: When drawing extra cards, cards must
be drawn 1 at a time and each turn completed before
drawing the additional cards.

JUMP SCARE CARDS

When you draw this card from the deck
you must discard one of your cards immediately.
If you have any cards in your hand, you must discard
one of them as soon as you draw this card type.

GOO GOO VOODOO CARDS

When you draw this card from the deck
you can choose whether or not to use it.
These cards change the rules of play, if you
draw one of these, you can choose to use the
special abilty the card offers, then card is
discarded.

DOUCHE BAG CARD

When you draw this card from the deck
you must discard all of your cards immediately.
If you have any cards in your hand, you must discard
all of them as soon as you draw this card type.
There is only 1 card of this type in the game and
definitely the most annoying card you can run into.

name: Golden Journal Winter 2012: Assorted naval variants
description:
This is the second of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 20 additional counters for ships in various Great War at Sea and Second World War at Sea
—user summary


Japanese Repair Ship Akashi. On a “long” counter.
Dutch fast battleships. Dutch naval constructors admired the Italian Littorio, when allowed to tour her, and tried hard to acquire her plans. While they initially intended to reap modern design ideas for their own battle cruisers, some hoped to use those plans to make their own. You can try out these powerful ships in Dutch colors in Spice Islands or Orange Waters.
Austrian destroyers. The Tatra class on “long” counters.
Lion Reborn. Lion and Princess Royal, as they might have been reconstructed in the 1930’s.
Brandenburg Battleships. Revised pieces for the six-gun pre-dreadnoughts that served Germany and Turkey.
Australia Reborn. Australia’s battle cruiser as she might have been rebuilt for the Second World War (or Second Great War).


—description from the publisher

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Roxanna Darknail – Star Player
description:
As one of the Darkside Cowboys’ most successful players, Roxanna makes such a show of spilling the blood of her foes that it is rare indeed when she does not end a match with her skin slick with the blood of fallen opponents. And the fans love it, especially the cruel-hearted Dark Elves and other, equally mean-spirited types. Some however claim that Roxanna uses her status and role as a means of retaining her youthful features and soft, pale skin, and indeed several cosmetics brands have sought to sponsor her in order to be associated with such a starkly beautiful player. Others whisper that as a Witch Elf, Roxanna is compelled to bathe in the blood of her enemies lest she age and wither into a stooped crone – none to have voiced such a suspicion, however, have lived to repeat it.

This multipart resin kit contains the component necessary to assemble Roxanna Darknail, a Star Player for use in Dark Elf and Amazon Blood Bowl teams. She’s very much the archetypal Witch Elf – minimal armour, an enormous headdress, incredibly long hair (whose weighty plaits are not something you’d want to be whipped by…) She can be modelled either running with a ball, or with a spiked fist on her left hand.

description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Booster – Grave Danger
description:
Laugh in the face of danger – Grave Danger!

This expansion for the Munchkin Collectible Card Game helps you build a deck that's more fun than a barrel of mummies! Each booster pack contains 12 randomized cards, at least one of which is rare or better. It's a killer addition to your CCG collection!
