categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Small Sugar Mill
description:
A new one of micro-game series made by Jog Kung.

In this game, each player try to arrange the production line in his/her factory, the one who completes more lines and makes the longer pipeline transport will earn more points and win the game!

The game contains two or three rounds according to the number of players. During each round 9 cards are drawn to form a common card row. Each player then takes a turn to pick a card from either end of that common row, and then places the card to expand the production line in his/her factory.

When there are 10 cards in each player's factory, the game ends and compare each players' score.

name: Museum Rush: The Annex
description:
The Annex expansion allows thieves to play with more friends. The game, made for 2-4, is now expanded up to 6 players.

This expansion includes:

9 new room tiles
2 new thieves
2 new treasures
10 additional search deck cards
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Tile Placement

name: MAUW: Moa Promo Card
description:
On your turn, play the Moa to free all columns blocked by spirits. The Moa is then flipped to its Mauw side and placed in your play area.
Card found in Plato magazine 110
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: This is It
description:
Three cards with pictures on them are dealt. You pick one card and write down the name of what's written on the card, then everyone reveals what they wrote at once. If you gave the same answer as someone else you get points. It sounds simple but it's surprisingly difficult!

For example, if you see brown liquid in a cup with steam coming off it, is that coffee, tea, cocoa, or something else?

There are also further complications. You get extra points for matching the dealer most of the time, so you have to think about what they'll write. If all the background colors match, matching the dealer doesn't give you an advantage, but all points are tripled! Some cards have a star on them that means points are doubled, but they might be harder to give a single name to than the other cards...

The rules are in Japanese and many of the cards are chosen with relevance to Japanese culture or language, but you don't need to read or understand Japanese to use them. (Example: there is a picture of a snail. This has only one obvious name in English, but in Japanese there are a number of words for snail varying by region.)

—user summary

name: The Perfect Moment: Las Vegas Gone Wrong
description: The Perfect Moment: Las Vegas Gone Wrong (2019) is a six-card expansion for The Perfect Moment series that replaces one of the three base sets for a very different playing experience.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Novice Novice TRPG Steampunk
description:
The latest entry in the Novi Novi series is Steampunk! Carrying over all the additions of The Horror, this adds a few new features. One of those is the addition of cards you can roll on to generate goals, mysteries, machines, and items.

For the unfamiliar, Novi Novi TRPG is like a tabletop RPG in a box. Using just cards and your imagination, you roleplay through a series of scenes until you reach the conclusion. Unlike a traditional RPG, the GM rotates every scene and there's no need for preparation.

—user summary

name: Homia
description:
Build your Nigerian home regardless of tribe or religion and be the first to do that if you want to win. The story behind Homia is that Nigeria is a multi-cultural, multi-ethnic and multi-religious country and the player must create a family regardless of the culture or religion. It’s designed to be easy to play. You choose a family and build the family.

Homia is a Memory-style game, where you look at a face down card and try to remember what kind it is. Until you find a homestead tile (also called a "family pad"), you will only memorize where the various tiles are, and put them back face down on the table. Once you finally discover a family pad, you take it into your area. The family pad has various symbols that represent different parts of a household, such as fathers, mothers, sisters, brothers, and pets. The color of the symbol tells you what kind of other cards you will need to complete your family pad. If your family pad has a green symbol, for example, you need to collect one "father" (green background) card to add to your family pad. If there are three yellow symbols on the family pad card, it means he has three daughters, so you'll need to find three of the "daughter" (yellow background) cards to complete your family. If you have a good memory of the cards you looked at before finding your family pad, it will be much easier to find the members of the household required to complete your family pad. Whoever completes their family pad first is the winner!

name: SSO: Parasites
description:
A 31 card tuck box including 24 Challenge Cards, 6 Mission cards and 1 Achievement card. Allows players to face a new threat and tell a new story of survival horror on the SSO.
The new deck's theme features a deadly alien parasite which will infect, control and kill the crew.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Twilight of Divine Right: From Defenestration to Restoration – Wargame Rules for 1618 to 1660
description:
Twilight of Divine Right: From Defenestration to Restoration is a version of the Twilight of the Sun King: Birth of the Age of Reason rules targeted at refighting large battles from the period 1618 to 1660. The rules feature scenarios for the battles of Fleurus, 1622 and Cheriton, 1644.

All measurements in the game are based on a scale choosen by the players, the base width. Movement distances, weapon ranges, etc, are then multiples of whatever base width has been chosen. The base width is half of the frontage of whatever you wish to use as a unit. Therefore any size of figure and also any basing scheme can be used with the rules. Units represent between 1000 and 2000 infantry or 500 to 800 cavalry, depending on the type of unit.
Battles can be fought to a conclusion in a reasonable amount of time, most in around 4 hours. Most battles are suitable for a single player a side if you wish. Using a unit frontage of 80 to 120mm means most battles are played on a table 120 to 180cm wide (4 to 6'). The system is simple and innovative. It concentrates on you being a high level commander and bringing out the characteristics of the various troop types.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Theta-7 Acquisitus: Adeptus Mechanicus Kill Team
description:
Each member of Theta-7 Acquisitus was hand-picked by Balphamus Vaulk for their combat expertise and rigorous stealth-engagement protocols. Together, they embark upon numerous secretive actions at the behest of their calculating master. Sometimes these missions are part of a sanctioned Imperial offensive, in which Theta-7 plays a small but decisive role, but often they kill only to further Vaulk’s own ends. Regardless of the nature of their task, the warriors of Theta-7 Acquisitus engage the enemy with furious fervour, eliminating their foes in the name of the Blessed Omnissiah.

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 6 miniatures – one of which is an exclusive Commander, the Tech-Priest Manipulus – a scenery set, a background booklet, as well as brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- 8-page Theta-7 Acquisitus booklet
- 17 Adeptus Mechanicus Tactics cards
- 5 Adeptus Mechanicus Commander Tactics cards
- 4 Mission cards
- 2 Adeptus Mechanicus Kill Team tokens sheets
- 6 Adeptus Mechanicus datacards
- A Balphamus Vaulk Tech-Priest Manipulus ability tree card that presents a new Adeptus Mechanicus Tech-Priest specialism that can only be used by Balphamus Vaulk.
- 1 multipart plastic Tech-Priest Manipulus (exclusive to this set), armed with magnarail lance, omnissian staff and mechadendrites, supplied in pre-coloured red plastic
- 5 multipart plastic Adeptus Mechanicus Sicarian Infiltrators armed either with stubcarbine and power sword, or taser goad and flechette blaster. They can be built instead as Sicarian Ruststalkers, depending on your preference, carrying either paired transonic blades, or a combination of chordclaw and transonic razor. All miniatures are supplied on red-coloured plastic.
- 1 set of Ryza-pattern Ruins

Also included in this box are rules for using all of these miniatures in your games of Warhammer 40,000.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: White Peak
description:
Get first to the Top of the highest Mountain. Be aware of the Yeti! He doesn't really like Mountaineers. Push the others down, set up traps and use special Items to hinder your opponents!

White Peak Board Game is a Mountain crawler boardgame. The Players (Mountaineers) goal is to reach the Top. You and your friends will compete against each other. The Game plays on the biggest Mountain, which is divided to Levels. The higher the Level, the harder it is to continue your journey to the top.

Every Player receives a starting equipment and has a fixed amount of Steps for each turn, which can be increased and decreased, because You will face the dangers when climbing a mountain.

But the Mountaineers' biggest enemy is the Yeti. He is ferocious, he is angry, he will throw everybody off, if he can get close enough to any of You.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game – Fish and Tackle
description:
Tournament Fishing: Fish and Tackle adds a couple new and exciting things to the core game experience!

First of all, 10 new Baitshop cards are added, bringing the total to 80.

Secondly, 7 new Lake cards are added to the Lake deck. During set-up, remove 7 random Lake cards from the deck before dealing out the Lake. The new fish in this expansion take 2 or more colors to attract, but lower Angler Power.

The 10 new Baitshop cards focus somewhat on helping to add more colors to Lures to catch these new Fish.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Slytherin Students Pack
description: Includes Draco Malfoy, Crabbe and Goyle.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Paean: Greek City State Wars – Rules for Hoplite Warfare: Greek Archaic Period 800BC to 480BC
description:
"Paean" is a free set of miniatures wargame rules for Archaic Greece, circa 800-480 BC. Intended for 1:300 scale or 6mm figures, but easily adapted to larger figures by doubling or tripling all measurements.

While basically historical, the rules give great emphasis to Heroic individuals.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Azarashi Attack
description:
Become an AZARASHI (seal) and fetch your yummy food!
All you need to do is just slide on the ice!
If you wish, you can attack other AZARASHI and rob their food too!

Players move their AZARASHI tokens on a field made of multiple hexagonal tiles and aim to get more foods. Players can rob a food from rivals too.
You can get a food when you stop on target tile. You can charge “Attack Power” when you stop in your zone.

Player chooses an action up to three times in his turn and acts. You can do any combination of the following three actions.

Keep on moving stright until you hit a rival or ice token.
Generate the ice token on the field.
Attack rivals or ice token. (It is necessary to charge the “Attack Power” in advance)


　You can take his food from him by dropping rival to the sea.

It is a strategic game that aims to get a lot of food by using the ice tokens and the arrangement of rivals.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Take That

name: Nonchalant
description:
Included in the December 2018 installment of the Button Shy Board Game of the Month Club.


A press-your-luck word game.

nonchalant
: having an air of easy unconcern or indifference
: a word-based trivia game where you come up with an answer, but keep your cool while the pool of letters gets smaller and smaller.


Components

9 letter/list cards


Players must provide:

25 letter tokens (pennies work just fine)
Pen and Paper to keep score


Setup
Choose a starting player to shuffle the cards and deal one card with the list side face up. Place a token on the number 1 to show which round it is. Place the remaining cards onto the table, letters side up in alphabetical order. The #1 item on the list card is the first category.

Gameplay
Players have 30 seconds to think of words that fit the category. Do not say yours aloud! Then the starting player will take their turn and play clockwise.

On Your Turn, you must do one of the following:

1. Place a token on top of a letter on a card, you will place that card in front of you until the end of the round. It may help you gain points, or cause you to lose points, depending on the outcome of the round.

2. Challenge the last player to say their word.

The player must state their word out loud.

If the word fits the category AND only uses letters that are still available, they will receive points equal to the total value on all cards in front of them.

If their word doesn't fit the category OR uses letters that are no longer available, the challenger receives points equal to the value on their own cards.

If the winner of the challenge does not have a card in front of them, they will receive points equal to the round number. Round 1 is 1 point. Round 9 is 9 points.

At the end of the round, tally up points, and the winner of the challenge starts the next round by flipping over the card of their choice, and flipping back the previous list card. They will start the next round using the #2 item on the new list card.

End of the Game
After 9 rounds, the game ends. The player with the most points wins! In the event of a tie, the player with the most points in a single round wins.

- For name categories, use last names only
- if there is a debate on whether a word fits a category, players should vote on it.

name: Test Tube Challenge: The Social Experiment
description: A fast-paced collection of five party games with attitude. Explosive fun for teens and adults, the essential party pack can be combined, split or added to in any way you want. It's the ideal party ice-breaker. Each tube is stored in a plastic extendable rack and contains 80 dipstick question cards. 'Off the chain' involves each player thinking of a different answer to the same question card until the tongue-tied loser goes down in flames. Prepare to be embarrassed in 'testing friendships' as your friends try to absurd question about you. In 'test I mat I on' the closest guess will beat the rest in this mind scrambling game of useless facts. You will be determining fact or fallacy in 'truth test', and you will be rhyming celebrity name for hilarious results in 'rhyme off'.

name: FNG: Tour of Duty
description:
In FNG: Tour of Duty you’ll step into the dusty, muddy boots of a Grunt, a Boonierat who slogs through jungle and rice paddies, and fights house to house in Hue City and scores of villages and towns across Vietnam. You will be Infantry, but you will encounter people of different Professions during your Tour of Duty that will serve as the focus of Missions, help or hurt you in your campaign – or just add to your story.

Because it’s all about the Story; your Story!

What: Wargame/RPG rules for the Vietnam War.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: カエルの王国 (Kaeru no Oukoku)
description:
カエルの王国 (Kaeru no Oukoku) means Realms of FROGS'. It is a territory occupation game for 2-4 players. Basically, this game is for two players, but there are several game modes which can be played with three or four players.

During setup, tiles are placed to form an NxN square grid board. The board is divided into five sections which are painted in different colors. The board varies game by game depending on allocation of tiles.

At the beginning of the game, each player has several stacks of their frogs outside of the board. Each turn, you may place one of your stacks from outside into any vacant space on the board, or move one of your stacks on the board orthogonally, leaving one frog on each square passed, until all frogs are unstacked or the stack cannot move any more.

The game ends when no player can place or move stacks any more. For each section, check which player has the greater value of frogs. The player who has dominated more sections wins the game.

「カエルの王国」は２～４人用の対戦陣取りゲームです。基本は２人対戦ですが、３，４人で遊べるさまざまなルールも用意しています。
正方形の盤面が5つのエリアに分かれています。盤面はタイルを組み合わせることによって毎回変わります。プレイヤーは複数積まれた手駒を「配置」または「展開」します。双方「配置」も「展開」もできなくなったらゲーム終了です。エリアごとに判定し、ポイントの多い方がそのエリアを制します。5つのエリアをより多く征したプレイヤーの勝利です。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board
publishers: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

name: アンジェリストゲーム (Angelist Game)
description:
A quirky double-layered rock-paper-scissors card game with a "you don't get your cards" draft at the start.

Cards are in five types: Three Elements and Light and Dark. The Elements have a Rock-Paper-Scissors relationship. All Elements beat Light, Light beats Dark, and Dark beats all elements.

At the beginning of the game, 8 cards are dealt to each players, and then drafted half at a time (first choose 4 cards, then 2, then 1), but the players normally don't get the pile that they created.

After the draft, the game is played by one player specifying an opponent and revealing one hand card each, winning as per the above relationship. Winning with an Element deals 1 damage, but gives points. Winning with Darkness deals 2 damage, but gives no points. Winning with Light heals yourself for 1 damage and gives many points.

Rince and repeat until one player runs out of cards (most points wins) or just one lives (that player wins).

Special character extra power cards are added to the fray for spice.

—user summary

name: Dexplicații
description: It's a Romanian board/card game in which you have to make your partner guess the name of the object that you have drawn from the pile. All of the cards in the game represent objects, it has 1000 cards, and 172 of them are regional words specific to historical regions of Romania. The game takes place in three rounds: In the first round you can use as many words as you like, in the second round you have to use only one word, and in the third round you have to mime the object or it’s use. Each player has 60 seconds to explain or guests as many cards as he/she can. The team that gathers as many cards as they can in all the three rounds wins the game.
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Xero-G
description:
Xero-G is a sci-fi themed strategy game designed to be played with Components: Looney Pyramid Games. It is a two-player game with zero luck and perfect information, played on a 6×6 grid.

Players take on the role of spaceship pilots from warring planets, each competing to the be first to invade their opponent's alien base. Pyramids represent vacant spaceships available for use by either player. Movement is orthogonal, increases with the size of the ship, and can be supplemented by boosts and special movement rules.

name: Capital Vices
description:
Anyone who seeks to lead a virtuous existence knows that sin lies everywhere. In Capital Vices, you are a new resident of the Capital trying to coexist in a community where food and money are limited but the temptation to sin abounds. Careful distribution of these resources is the path to virtue, but beware: your actions are not without consequence. Every operation may help the individual’s spiritual progress at the expense of the whole… or vice-versa. Avoid the seven deadly sins, embrace the seven heavenly virtues, and you’ll be victorious!

In Capital Vices players take actions in order to distribute colored resources of food and money. Doing so will earn you virtues but be sure not to generate a sin penalty! Ending a round with sin will omit you from scoring that round. Have the most virtue and earn a bonus point. The first player to have 7 points at the end of a round is the winner.

name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary – Ride Darryl
description:
"Ride" Daryl includes a miniature of Daryl riding his motorcycle, three new Daryl survivor cards, and a scenario sheet with 10 new event cards.

In this Kickstarter-exclusive expansion, the players will use Daryl to draw the walkers away from the group while the other members of the group get down to business.

Note: "Ride" Daryl is actually included in the Kickstarter edition of the base game, but was also offered as an add-on.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Rowing Fun
description:
Rowing is one of the oldest Olympic sports.
There are no good games about this sport

This is a competitive game in which each player controls one or more crews that move in a water field in a rowing race.

The lenght of field is 2.000 meters.

The race is divided in 8 sectors. One sector covers 250 meter.

In each sector players draw cards until they have 5 cards on hand and then play and move crews in three complete rounds.

Each card has printed a primary effect (movement) and a secondary effect (various effects in relation of others crews, performance and so on).

The movement in the game field, squares by squares or lines by lines, is made by cardboard figures and obtains saving seconds starting from a basic race time of 9 minute and 00 seconds.

The winner is the crew that reach the lower time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Upstream: Human Impact
description:
Upstream: Human Impact pitches the players' runs of salmons against the impacts due to humankind. This brand new content includes a salmon "elevator" and merciless fishermen!

This expansion contains a punchboard with 8 new tiles (5 fishermen and the 3 tiles of the elevator) and 5 boot tokens. It includes the rules.
categories: Animals, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Racing
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Resonance
description:
A stolen love, a business prejudice, an unforgivable mistake, …
You have so many reasons to seek revenge. And there are many demons that can give you this satisfaction...

Resonance is a wicked game of observation and manipulation, set during a hazardous ritual of black magic.

Your quest for revenge has brought you this far, where the border of Hell is the most fragile. You will need a full lunar month to open a passage and summon the demon that will serve you.

But you are not the only one to have had the idea of playing with the dark forces to achieve your purpose. Demonstrate skill, determination and of course spells to ensure the pursuit of your goals.

Resonance is a game for 3 to 8 witches which lasts about twenty minutes per game.
Game rounds are nothing more than the different phases of the Moon. Each phase of the Moon corresponds to a slot on the summoning circle, and you have Ritual Objects such as Herbs, Minerals and Potions to place on these 8 slots.
If the right combination of Ritual Objects resonates with the Moons, you pass one of the 3 steps required to summon your demon.

The first witch to complete the summoning ritual wins the game.

Play quickly to leave no respite to your opponents, carefully manipulate the course of this adventure and above all do not let victory escape you!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Party Game

name: Electoral College Combat
description:
Unpredictable up to the last hand, Electoral College Combat combines strategy and chance as two players amass Electoral College votes while navigating Fake News, Russian collusion, recounts, celebrity endorsements, and swing states to become President of the United States.

There are 56 cards: 50 state cards and Washington DC, whose value is reflected in their electoral vote count, and five wild cards. 28 cards are dealt to each player who take turns laying five cards face-down and sight unseen from the top of their stacks. Each player turns over one card. The player with the higher card can take that card and any other or the lower card and two of the remaining face-down cards. Opponent gets the remaining cards.

Electoral College Combat is designed to simulate the wild swings and uncertainties of election night. A sound strategy--like a well-run campaign--does not guarantee results. That's all part of the fun. While not a gambling game, Electoral College Combat finds its roots in video slots/poker where the wild cards activate bonus rounds.

Each wild card has specific rules. A player who turns over a second wild card in the same hand wins the remaining cards.

There are twelve hands. In the 11th and 12th hands each player has only three cards remaining. When their turn arrives, players must add two cards of the cards they've collected to their hand: their highest card and another of their choice, shuffle the cards, and place them in front of their opponent. Play continues as before. When play is concluded, the player with 270 or more electoral college votes wins the presidency. 2nd prize? Hindsight and book deal. Ghost writer available upon request.

—description from the publisher

name: Memento Mori
description: This deck has 72 NEW and intriguing questions to ignite conversation and curiosity about death. Memento Mori can be played as a standalone conversation starter or as an expansion deck for the original deck.

name: Say What You See!
description:
This quick-fire catchphrase guessing game asks players one thing: SAY WHAT YOU SEE! Deceptively simple, this game contains over 100 catchphrase cards and instructions. With so many pictorial rebus puzzles, the fun will go on and on! See how many popular catchphrases you can recognize.

—description from the publisher

name: Ancients Part 2: Lost In Time (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description:
The seeds of doubt about the real intentions of the Agency are growing inside you and the next destination is certainly not what you expected...

The trilogy is set in several times and timelines (AT and NT) and will take you on a journey where not only the background of Elois, Syaan and the third faction will be revealed eventually but also the question of your allegiance will be raised.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Activity Crime
description: 660 words from the world of crime - from the "ax murderer" to the "fire devil" - are waiting to be guessed .. The supplied handcuffs limit the presentation of the searched terms considerably, but full body use is desired Players may also explain themselves through sounds and noises or pointing to body parts, but speaking is forbidden! Only imagination, speed and a good combination of powers are required!

name: Think Fast
description:
Think Fast is a loud, sociable, quick-fire party game where you know all the answers already, but can you identify the clues?!

Teams go head to head in 3 rounds of this fast-paced quiz games! With each round the answers stay the same but the questions get progressively harder, until you're only given one word! You have 30 seconds to answer in, so you need to Think Fast if you want to win!

Get your random facts at the ready to answer questions on avocado, Darth Vader, reindeer and so much more!

—description from the publisher

name: Highway to Hell: Lonesome Patroller
description:
This expansion set for Highway to Hell will take you on a lonely journey across the roads of district 31 to fight the new cads who wish to build a reputation.

This new simple and fast rule set will make it possible for the patroller to play solo games of Highway to Hell.

-description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Saboteur: Das Stollenfest
description:
Postcard for Saboteur (basic game) and Saboteur 2 (expansion).
Effect: when connection is made, all players switch roles.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Mini Bac
description:
Discover words based on the different themes shown by illutrated cards, and the letter indicated. "[The game of "Baccalauréat"] in its special pocket format", according to the front of the box.

The game evolves on a special board where players put their individual marker, at the beginning of the game they put them at the top of it. A round goes like this : the youngest player starts with a new picture drawn randomly. The goal is for player on their turn, to find a word that begins with the letter indicated by his/her marker position. If the player succeeds to find a word, his/her marker is moved to the next position ; if not, it stays in place for the next round. Once everyone played his/her turn, a new round begins with a new picture, and so on.

The first player who reaches the last line of the board represented by stars wins the game.

There is a possibility to make the game harder for advanced players by flipping the cardboard : this will reveal more difficult letters to find a word that begins with.

name: Gloom: Went Dark in the Night Promo
description:
This is an Untimely Death Promo card for Gloom.

To play with this promo, shuffle it into the pile of cards at the beginning of the game. It adds a new Untimely Death card to the game.

The card's ability reads: [continuous effect] Worth an additional -10 with the Death icon.

This promo was released in issue #237 of Game Trade Magazine.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor

name: The In-famous Gulch War of Gutterman's Gulch
description:
Inspired by Palm Island, this sequel to The In-famous of Gutterman's Gulch, is a hand held solo game where you must move up the gulch and battle seven enemy roosters who have a developed a thirst for war and total domination. Gather your ammo, recruit troops and make sure your army is strong enough to do battle. There will be skirmishes you will have to deal with, so stay under the shade of the trees. Watch out for snakes who love eating baby chicks. See how many roosters you can defeat. Add the Event Card to face even more difficulties. The "Absurd" Robot Expansion will give you two new, stronger enemies to battle with. Will you be the hero of The In-famous Gulch War of Gutterman's Gulch?

—description from the designer

name: Alien Café
description:
A GAME OF COOPERATION
OBJECT: place the tiles according to the wishes of each alien
All of the players play at the same time: they take care of their corner of the room (their board) and have to place “customer” and “order” tiles while respecting the restrictions of each one. They can interact and help one another to exchange tiles and fill their board. At the end of the round, when the hourglass runs out, everybody wins if each player has 10 points on their plate.

+++ 4 levels of difficulty to season the game to taste.

—description from the publisher

name: Frozen 2: Seasons
description:
Anna and Elsa went on a trip with their friends, but Olaf the Snowman got lost! Help them find him!
Frozen 2: Seasons is a fun and challenging memory game: reveal a Goal card and try to reveal the cards that would match its features! If you want to make it harder, try three different game variants!

—description from the publisher (English)

Холодное сердце 2: Времена года

Анна и Эльза с друзьями отправились в путешествие, но внезапно снеговик Олаф потерялся. Помогите героям найти Олафа!

Весёлый тренажёр для памяти
Новое слово в жанре мемори-игр
3 разных игровых режима

—description from the publisher (Russian)

name: Objective Frankfurt: 7 Days to the Rhine, Volume 3
description:
"Objective Frankfurt" is a two-player alternative history wargame intended to investigate the operational parameters that would have been in place during the first four days of fighting in that border area of West Germany had the Soviet Union decided to try to attack sometime in the early 1980s. It was during that time frame the Warsaw Pact achieved a possible decisive “correlation of forces” between their militaries and those of the West.

This game is the third volume of the AFCENT (Allied Forces Central Europe) Series. Each single-volume game uses the same system and will be playable alone or mated to other games in the series. Each hexagon on the map represents 2.5 miles (four kilometers) from side to opposite side. The Warsaw Pact regiments, while the units of maneuver on the NATO side are battalions. Air power and electronic warfare counters and rules abstractly represent, the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary superiority within those sub-realms of conflict. Each day of real time consists of one nighttime and two daylight turns.

Components: One 22" x 34" map on one sheet & 280 counters

name: Commander
description:
Commander is a regular deck "climbing" card game for 4, 6, or 8 players playing in teams. (As a climbing game, Commander shares some features of its play in common with other climbing games such as President, Tichu, The Great Dalmuti, and Haggis.) Four players play in two partnerships. Six players can play in two teams of three or in three partnerships; eight players can play in two teams of four or in four partnerships.

The goal of the game is to shed your cards sooner than opposing team members can shed their cards. The sooner you shed, the more points you score for your team.

Prior to the start of each hand, a unique blind bidding mechanism elects one player per team as that team's "commander" and also decides which of the newly-chosen commanders has the privilege of playing first. The commander of a team is expected to be the first of the team to shed all their cards -- and ideally, is expected to shed their cards before the other commanders can do so. Otherwise, a commander faces a penalty that reduces their team's score.

For a complete set of rules to Commander, see the files section or the forum posting in the rules forum. (Note that the playing chips described in these rules and pictured in the representative image are primarily for scoring convenience. The game can also be played with a few spare coins and pen and paper scoring.)

—description from the designer

name: Pixel Tactics: Empyreal Promo Set
description:
These cards bring some of the classic characters from Empyreal: Spells and Steam into Pixel Tactics.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Synchronized
description:
Two teams come face to face to perform the best routine in this synchronized swimming card game!

Memorize your routine, and recreate it all with cards. The team with the highest score after four rounds wins the game.

Every round is in three faces: Rehearsal, Competition, Performance.
In Rehearsal both teams will lay out a routine with 6 to 11 pose cards and memorize the sequence. Once a team has their routine memorized, they grab the whistle to end this phase for both teams, and cards are flipped face down.
For the Competition, a duplicate deck is dealt among team members. Players place cards face down below their corresponding rehearsal cards.
Once both teams are done, each team will Perform, flipping and comparing all their cards. For each matching rehearsal and competition card pose, they score a point.
Each round increases with one additional routine pose, and a Challenge card adding rules.

—description from the publisher

name: Rising Sun Over China: Japan vs China 1931 – 1937
description:
Rising Sun Over China: Japan vs China 1931 – 1937 is an operational-strategic level two player wargame covering the campaigns in northern China, 1931 to 1937. These campaigns revolved around the regions of Manchukuo (Manchuria) and Menjiang (Inner Mongolia), and culminated in the Japanese invasion of China proper, taking the capital at Peiping (Peking). There was also the possibility of Soviet intervention. The game has two players: the Japanese Empire and the Republic of China. The Japanese objective is to gain control of northern China to provide a strategic advantage for the ensuing Sino-Japanese War which commenced in July 1937. The Chinese objective is to retain control of strategic regions of northern China, thereby forestalling a larger Japanese invasion. Each hex on the map represents 75 kilometers across. Each turn of play represents one year of operations. Japanese ground units are divisions and brigades. Allied Japanese, as well as most Chinese units, are at the army and corps level, representing shifting arrays of forces. Air units represent various numbers of sorties needed to accomplish missions.

—description from the publisher

name: Backdoors & Breaches: Core Deck
description:
Backdoors & Breaches, an Incident Response Card Game, from Black Hills Information Security and Active Countermeasures contains 52 unique cards to help you conduct incident response tabletop exercises and learn attack tactics, tools, and methods.

At the start of the game, the Incident Master will create an incident scenario by selecting an Initial Compromise, C2 and Exfil, Persistence, and Pivot and Escalate cards and give a narrative of the incident to the Responders. Responders will have access to a set of four documented Procedures and will begin to take actions to try and investigate and resolve the incident. For every action, the Responder team rolls a d20 with any available advantages or disadvantages to see if they are successful. Successful actions will lead to revealing additional cards in the scenario.

If all of the scenario cards are revealed or if the Responders take 10 rolls without revealing a new card, the game is over. When the game is complete, the team can discuss their successes and failures and apply what they have learned to their real-life incident response program.

name: White Bear Red Sun
description:
White Bear Red Sun

A campaign system and tactical rules for pre-dreadnought naval warfare

A mini campaign covering the Russo Japanese War from the initial surprise attack on Port Arthur through to Tsushima and beyond.

Also included is:

a brief history of the naval campaign and
the “Broadside and Salvo” fast play pre-dreadnought rules and
a complete set of ship data for the rules allowing the campaign to be fought out over a weekend or a few club nights.


—description from the publisher

name: Eye Found It: Journey Through Time Card Game
description:
Explore seven historic eras, from Ancient Egypt and Medieval Times to the Wild West and the Future. Race to find hidden treasures in this fast-paced game of visual perception!

Each card has an object on one side and then an intricate picture on the other. Each player gets 5 cards/scenes to start with and then you flip the top card of the deck to see which object needs to be found. The first player to find the object on one of their cards "wins" that round and then flips the card they just used to reveal the next object to search for. Once a player finds that object on one of their cards, they flip it over to reveal the next object, etc. This continues until one player has flipped all five of their cards, and they are the winner.

An example would be: the first object to find is a barrel. I find a barrel in one of my scenes that takes place in the Wild West. I show everyone the barrel, they confirm it's correct, and then I flip my Wild West card over - the object shown on the back of that card is flowers. I find a garden of flowers on another card that I have, a scene in Medieval Times. Again, I show everyone to confirm and then flip the card over. The next object, on the back of this card, is a bird. Another player is the first to find a bird on their card, they reveal / we confirm, and they flip that card over to reveal the next object we must look for. This continues until one player has found five objects (one on each of their cards that they started with).

name: Hobiti: Dlouhé svátky
description: 112 cards that can serve as an expansion to Hobiti or a stand-alone game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Memory, Party Game

name: The Exiled: Siege – Hero Cards
description:
Additional Hero cards available as an add-on in the Kickstarter Campaigns

Comprises "Arsonist", "Favourite" & "Forger" cards Hero Cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Gone Caving!
description:
Gone Caving is a card game in which you and your friends are exploring an underground world together. You can compete with each other, or choose to work together to discover the most passage possible. During your journey you’ll discover beautiful cave formations and curious animals. There will be challenges along the way, but you can overcome them and then find your way back to the surface.

Players first find a cave entrance, then explore cave passages, overcome challenges, and exit the cave safely to end. Score points by tallying the lengths of cave passage explored; get bonus points for specializing in one or more areas of cave research such as geology, biology, or cartography. Each of 104 cards is illustrated and based on accurate depictions of the formations, animals, and equipment that cavers encounter in the underground world. On each turn, a player draws a card and plays or discards a card. They may: play a card in their own play area to gain points or skills or to resolve a challenge;
or play a challenge in another player’s area; or discard a card with no effect.

A large portion of the proceeds from the game benefit the National Speleological Society (NSS).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Zulu!
description:
"Zulu!" is a Zulu Wars miniatures wargame rules booklet directly inspired by regular contributor Dan Mersey's "Well of Tarka" article that appeared in Battlegames issue 14.

It just so happened that I had a participation game to run at a forthcoming show, and Dan's article, originally set in the Sudan, inspired me to pillage it wholesale and transfer it to the Zulu Wars so that I could make use of my own collection.

The game ran at several shows, as well as with friends, and was a resounding hit, producing lots of excitement and plenty of laugh-out-loud moments.

I hope that you enjoy it too!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Savage
description:
Animals have always lived in peace and harmony with the environment. However, with the unruly rise of humanity they have less and less space to live. Tired of this situation, the animals have decided to unite and retaliate. Take control of the animal resistance and decide how to best use your resources.

Savage is a card game that pits various players one against one another as they try to conquer the most human territories. Every card in your hand can either be used as part of an attack at the humans localizations or as a special power targeted at your rivals.

Conquer territories by playing cards to build big groups of animals together and attack big human cities, or by taking harmonious groups of animals from the same habitat and attacking smaller localizations to gain bonus points. Stop your rivals by taking what they conquered or by attacking them directly using your cards.

The winner is the one with the most territories and bonus points accumulated!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Vanguard of War: Madness
description:
Brings The Madness Within, a hero from Deep Madness, to Vanguard of War.

Contains
1 boss
5 abominations
6 stat cards
5 spawn cards
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Alea Iacta Est: The Die Is Cast
description:
Ancient Wargames Rules

Designed to cover the rise and fall of the Roman empire. These rules are especially suited to refights of historical battles. No, you don't have to rebase your figures. Yes, they play as fast as DBM. No, you won't have to buy new army list books, in fact you can use the armies you use for other rules. Included are morale rules so that bad troops run away, good troops hang around a bit longer. General figures don't fight but have command and combat ratings to inspire the troops that do. The rules are designed to encourage historical tactics.

—description from the publisher

name: VACCINE
description:
A new virus emerges, threatening society as we know it. Help the world fight the deadly virus by finding the best possible vaccine!

Each turn you pick one of the face up Vaccine Tiles and add it to your Science Lab (player board). When completing a row or a column in your Science Lab, you make breakthroughs and can complete objectives on Research Cards to gain Vaccine Points. Breakthroughs also let you gain valuable knowledge by secretly looking at a Disease Card - showing you which traits you should try to avoid on the Vaccine Tiles you pick in the future.

All players will start the game with asynchronous information (you all know something, but none of you know the same), so keeping an eye on the other player's choices can increase your chances of picking the best Vaccine Tiles!

At the end of the game, the weaknesses of the virus is revealed and final scoring commences - It's time to see how many final Vaccine Points each player scores, for having potent Vaccine Tiles to counter the weaknesses. The player with the most Vaccine Points in total is the winner!

Released as a free Print & Play during March, 2020.

Why?

Many people world wide are isolated in their homes to prevent spreading the virus that causes COVID-19 (Corona Virus Disease 2019). If making and playing a simple board game can keep people indoor for even just a little while longer, we can add that to the prevention of the spreading of the virus.
Scientists are working hard to find the best possible vaccine for the virus. If, or when, the time comes to administer the vaccines, the number of vaccinated people will directly impact its effectiveness. It’s a scientific fact that people fear what they don’t know. By educating - even just a little bit on vaccines through play - we’ll be able to reduce that fear and make the vaccines more effective.
On a personal level, this is my contribution to help the global COVID-19 crisis (and similar in the future). I hope to inspire you to find your own way to contribute, and to remind you that help comes in all shapes and sizes.


—description from the designer

name: Козацький похід
description:
Козацький похід ("Cossack Campaign") is an atmospheric historical game with which you will plunge into the times of the glorious cossacks.

This board game successfully combines strategic actions on the playing field and card mechanics, which reproduces political intrigues that Cossack leaders weave. The political and military center of Ukraine is the Zaporizhzhya Sich, with its well-established laws and democracy. Several prominent personalities, real leaders and cossacks, are simultaneously trying to lead the state to success, but each of them sees his own way.

Cards of hetman for the boardgame cossack campaign

Players must play the role of atamans and hetman, leading the Cossack campaign of the famous Zaporozhye army, and conduct a successful military-political campaign to defeat rivals and prove that they are worthy of the hetman's mace. Wins the one who successfully fulfill their strategic and tactical tasks, giving hetman orders to atamans, and receive the greatest number of achievements in the Cossack campaigns.

The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible:

After completing the task from the card of hetman;

Capturing cities and settlements on the map during campaigns;

After completing the task from the additional task cards;

Using all your trekking chips.

Players strive to complete their tasks and capture as many cities and settlements as possible. But power belongs to the one who holds the hetman's mace, and he has the right to give orders only and lead the Cossack campaigns. Therefore, after receiving the coveted mace and hetmanship, the player uses card orders to send the formidable Zaporozhye army on campaigns and raids, to capture cities and settlements under his flag. Getman punishes the recalcitrant and generously encourages the obedient.

name: Spitzbub
description:
Spitzbub is a bidding and bluffing game with 66 cards: 9 times the number cards 1 to 6 and 12 jokers, which can copy any number card.

Each player has 6 cards on their hand. It is played in turn.

The player picks one or more cards from their hand and the value of the cards, e. g. two times wolf (value 3). The player must claim that all of their cards have the same value, but may lie. Jokers can adopt any value. Then the player draws up to 6 cards in hand. The player to the left may accept or reject the claim. If they accept the claim, they take the cards in their hand.

Each bid must be higher than the previous one, either with the same number of cards with a higher value or with a higher number of cards with any value.

name: Life of Cats
description:
Your cat lives a secret life you don't know about.
Although she looks like just an average cute house cat, she has enemies outside of her territory.
Her one desire is to rule over her enemies in the neighboring territories.
So every day, after you have left the house, she secretly sneaks out to use her special house cat abilities in the five other territories to defeat the other cats and rule them all.
Will the house-cat be able to concur all of the territories and become the leader of the land? Or will one of the other cats take control and send the house-cat back home? It's all up to you! Assume the role of one of the cats and use his or her special abilities to take control of other territories by earning points. The first cat to win fifteen points will become the leader of all the territories! Good luck, and may the best cat win!
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Set Collection

name: Bunker
description:
Each player has 5 pawns and 2 bunkers. Additionally each player hides 3 mines inside his starting area (numbered spaces). The goal of the game is to get ones pawns into the opposite starting area. Points are awarded for pawns in the opposite starting area (5), prisoners (2) and surviving pawns on the game board (3). The player with the most points wins the game.

Movement is determined by a number die (1-3) and a color die with the following meanings:

white (2x) - forward movement according to the number die,
black - backward movement at will 1, 2 or 3 spaces,
blue - sideward movement left or right and another turn,
red (2x) - Joker (white, black or blue at will)


If a pawn gets on the red center space, a command card is drawn. A pawn is captured and transferred to the prisoner camp if an enemy pawn reaches it's exact position.

Pawns that land on water spaces drown and are removed from the game. But water spaces may be passed. If an enemy pawn land on a hidden mine, it's removed fron the game too. Bunkers are obstacles that can't be landed on or be leaped over.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Dungeon: Masterclass – Witch Exterminator
description:
The sprawling metropolis of Areals at the heart of Clockwork Cove is a twisting labyrinthine city of technological wonder and ceaseless change. As new structures are built upon the old, less savory denizens begin to fill the abandoned districts and subterranean depths of the city. When infestations of chimeric rats, undercover goblins, and malfunctioning clockworks grow too large Witch Exterminators are called in cull their numbers and maintain the safety of the city.

CONTENTS:
1x Witch Exterminator Masterclass Miniature
1x Witch Exterminator Hero Card
1x 25mm Black Base

Take your Super Dungeon hobby to the next level with Super Dungeon: Masterclass! This premium line of resin models is specifically designed for hobby enthusiasts and gamers alike! Featuring Heroes and monsters from throughout the realms of Crystalia, these finely detailed miniatures bring the world of Super Dungeon to life as never before. Each Masterclass miniature includes cards that allow it to be used in your games of Super Dungeon!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Not On Our Turf
description:
Not On Our Turf is a card game that can be played with 3-6 players and roughly takes around 30-45 minutes to play.

In Not On Our Turf, you and your friends build animal armies in order to remove humans from your turf by using their weaknesses and sabotage your friends with animal treats, items and special abilities. If "The Peace Bringer" arrives twice, it's game over.

Each animal card has a special ability - If you play two of the same animal on your turn, you can use that ability.

Each human has three individual weaknesses - If you have either the animals and/or colours in your hand, you can remove that human from your turf. The most humans removed decides the winner of this game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, Matching, Take That

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Gloriel Summerbloom – Star Player
description:
Gloriel Summerbloom is famously whimsical and carefree, even for a Wood Elf! She revels in the beauty and grace of a well-played game, though she doesn't care for the violence which everyone else seems to enjoy so much. Her fans find this refreshing, whilst her detractors find it hopelessly naive. What none dispute, however, is her almost supernatural throwing accuracy and agility on the pitch.

Your Wood Elf team can hire this Star Player to ensure a stunning passing game. Not only is the model incredible, encapsulating the grace and fluidity of Wood Elfs, but her Skill list is amazing. She’s posed mid-leap, holding the ball back in a wind-up to a throw, her long braid and sash flowing around her. If you're looking for a fun painting project, the detailed leaves, vines, and hair will make for a suitably impressive display piece!

This finely detailed resin model is supplied in 9 components, including a 32mm round base. Gloriel Summerbloom is exclusively available to play for Wood Elf teams. You can find all the rules you need to use her in your games of Blood Bowl in the 7th issue of Spike! Journal, the Team Card Pack: Wood Elf Team and the Blood Bowl Almanac 2019.

Key Features
- Give the already-impressive Wood Elf passing game a boost with this unique Thrower.
- Her dynamic pose captures the beauty and grace of the Wood Elf team.
- Highly detailed leaves, vines, sashes and flowing hair make for a fun painting challenge.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: "Cimeree" Elfin Maid
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


This book represents Cimeree the Elfin Maid a character in the Lost Worlds Series of combat picture games, and is playable with all other books that carry the Lost Worlds logo. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities. Collect them and discover for yourself their magic.

(from the book: Lost Worlds: "Cimeree" Elfin Maid)
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: "Othere" Djinn of Distinction
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


This book represents Othere The Djinn a character in the Lost Worlds Series of combat picture games, and is playable with all other books that carry the Lost Worlds logo. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities. Collect them and discover for yourself their magic.

(from the book: Lost Worlds: "Othere" The Djinn of Distinction)
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: "MacAber" A Highland Warrior with Claymore
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Ducking High
description: A "judge chooses best" ADULT card game full of crazy questions (225 in the first edition to be exact)that incite some long, out of this world conversations. Players choose responses from cards in their hand which were acquired from a random draw pile. A "judge" asks a question from on of their hand cards and then chooses a best response from all the responses that the other players played from cards in their hand. Players use their "ducking high" mind to think of funny, exaggerated and out of their mind but brilliant brilliant answers to mind bending questions. The game requires very little set up whose game length can be tailored to the players time constraints with a typical game allowing for each player to be "the judge". Game length depends on the number of players but is best with a group of three or more. An average game length is about 30 minutes, however, it has an addictive random response effect that can be entertaining for hours. Due to the nature of the game, obscenities and scenarios this game is recommended for adult groups.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fourth Edition): Codex – Eldar
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Agents: Sword and Shield – Big Game
description: Agents Sword and Shield: Big Game is a first expansion to the Zvezda's game Agents Sword and Shield. This expansion adds 2 new factions: the German Stasi and the PRC MGB. Thus, up to six players can now take part in the game. In the expansion there is a new mechanic of the revolution that can occur in third world countries. Revolutions provide players with the ability to make new tactical decisions in the game. Also, the expansion include a new type of agent - influence agent, which allows a draw in favor of a player who has such an agent in the region.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Zombies!!!: We're Not Gonna Take It Promo Card
description:
Automatic: All players discard down to 1 card and all players may only hold 1 card in their hand until this card is played again.

Included in issue #200 of Game Trade Magazine

name: Coconut Pirate
description:
Coconut Pirate is a visual agility game. Each player has a group of dices with sides of colors and different icons. Every player's turn it throws a dice and the first locating a combination of three dices with the same colour or icons claims it. If more than one combination found, claim it saying the number of combinations.

The fastest player gets the dices and moves its pirate token in the scoring path, the "Treasure map", the same number of steps as the combinations found. The first one to reach the top wins.

name: Plonk !
description:
Plonk is a game of bluff and fun, with friends or family.
How to play ?
1- Three kangaroos and eleven cards each (six numbered 2 to 7, two Plonk! And three paw prints).
2- Shuffle your cards, uncover one, and call a number, or Plonk! to jump further! You can try the bluff, but beware, when you come across a paw print, you will have to lie!
3- If no one challenges you, move on! Otherwise, reveal your card. You lied? Hop, back! Did you tell the truth? Go ahead! and it is those who have doubted your sincerity who recoil!
4- At the end, everyone counts their points on the board.

A game that will make you jump with pleasure!

—description from the publisher (translated)


Plonk est un jeu de bluff et rigolade, en famille ou entre adultes
Comment jouer ?
1- Trois kangourous et onze cartes chacun (six numérotées de 2 à 7, deux Plonk ! et trois empreintes de pattes).
2- Mélangez vos cartes, découvrez-en une, et annoncez un chiffre, ou alors Plonk ! pour sauter plus loin ! Vous pouvez tenter le bluff, mais attention, lorsque vous tombez sur une empreinte de patte, vous serez obligé de mentir!
3- Si personne ne vous conteste, avancez ! Sinon, dévoilez votre carte. Vous aviez menti ? Hop, en arrière ! Vous aviez dit la vérité ? Allez, en avant ! et ce sont ceux qui ont douté de votre sincérité qui reculent !
4- A la fin, chacun compte ses points sur le plateau.

Un jeu qui vous fera bondir de plaisir !

—description from the publisher

name: Zombies!!!: Social Distancing Promo Card
description:
Text says:
Target player cannot share a tile with another player until the end of their next turn. if currently on a tile with another, must use all movement to move the shortest distance off the tile.

Part of the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter campaign (Adventurers Pack).

name: Dobbeltime
description:
Dobbeltime is a dice game, which is about speed and reaction time.

Each player has a scorecard with numbers from 1-12 in green, black, blue, yellow and red. The goal is to be the first player to make a vertical, horizontal and diagonal row of five numbers.

The active player rolls all the six dices (1 white, 1 black, 1 red, 1 green, 1 blue and 1 yellow). At the moment the dices are on the table, every player can find a number by adding the value on the white dice and the value of one of the coloured (except white) dices. The active player also has the possibility to find a number with only one of the coloured. When a player finds a number, the player needs to put a hand on the base and needs to say the number and the color. If the player is right, he can put a cross on the number. If the player is wrong the player should put a cross in the wrong area.

The first player with a row of five numbers, wins the game

—description from the designer

name: Mord bei Tisch: Zirkus
description:
Mord bei Tisch is a criminal dinner game in which 6-8 players can participate to find out who among them is the murderer of the found victim. In addition to that, every player gets a personal task to fulfil during the evening, which can include finding certain information via asking, hiding certain information during the game, convince other players to join them in certain acts or act in a very specific way during the game.

The Zirkus case is about the murder on Freddy, the tamer of circus Martini. Circus Martini is run in the eighth generation, but spectators become less and less. On top of that, tonight there was a fire and Freddy was found stabbed. It is up to you to find his murderer!

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Space Wolves
description:
The Space Wolves are a savage Space Marine Chapter of merciless hunters. They hail from the icy death world of Fenris and strive to emulate the strength, cunning and howling ferocity of their Primarch – Leman Russ, the Wolf King. In their pursuit of the enemies of Mankind across the Sea of Stars, the Space Wolves employ the advanced technology and deadly weapons of the Adeptus Astartes under a skin of seemingly feral barbarity. The armoured flanks of their battle tanks are inscribed with runic totems. In the glare of plasma coils glint the fangs of primitive fetishes and over power armour the colour of threatening storms are hung the pelts of alpha predators. Alongside them lope the giant wolves of their home world, and the Space Wolves take up their loud howls when the warriors' keen senses detect their quarry at last run to ground. With audacious boasts, the taking of impetuous risks and the joyful roars of warriors born, the Space Wolves are a Chapter of heroes who wage war without fear or doubt, each seeking to forge a saga worthy of immortalisation.

Inside this 88-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Space Wolves in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection, including:

The history of the Space Wolves, with a look at how they relentlessly take the fight to the enemies of the Allfather across the Sea of Stars
A Space Wolves bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Space Marines units that are uniquely available to the Space Wolves
Rules for Sagas – a unique form of Warlord Traits – and how the mighty heroes of the Chapter can inspire their battle-brothers by performing the Deeds associated with them
Stratagems, the bespoke Tempestas psychic discipline, Relics of the Fang, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Space Wolves wage war
Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Space Wolves
And more!


You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 Core Book to use the rules included in this codex.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Trump Wall
description:
Trump Wall is a game for 2 players or two teams of 2 players where one person/team is trying to connect the Pacific Ocean to the Caribbean Sea and the other person/team is trying to connect Mexico to the United States.

The game board shows a hex grid, and each hex is labeled with either a traditional card suit (e.g. hearts or clubs) or a traditional card rank (e.g. Ace, 3, 4, Jack). The rules state that the game does not come with the necessary writing implements or playing cards, and that you should charge Mexico for the cost of these.

On a turn, a player chooses to either play a card from their hand and mark an appropriate hex for their side or pass. If a player passes, they discard their hand and draw replacement cards for each and one additional card. If a player did play a card and mark a hex, they also draw one card.

The game ends when one player/team connects their two-sides through hexes marked for their side.

name: Hippos & Crocodiles: Marabou
description:
Marabou Stork is an expansion of Hippos & Crocodiles that contains 12 bird pieces.

You can use this animal to play games from 2 to 4 players. For 4 players I recommend playing in pairs with the members of each pair facing each other, so the turns alternate between pairs:

Team A: Anna
Team B: Bob
Team A: Carl
Team B; Diana
… and so on.

The couple that places the last animal wins.

The Marabou Stork has an exception to placement: Once per game, the player can place one and only one of her tiles with the beak or feet outside the board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game

name: Catacombs Cubes: Cosmic Portal
description:
New Structure Tile Cosmic Portal. Requires 20 blocks to complete but rewards 5 points

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building

name: Portal: Demo Game
description:
This Demo Game of contains 24 game cards from the Magic the Gathering — Portal trading card game, a tip card, and two instruction sheets — everything two players need to play their first Magic games. All you need is a brain, this Demo Game, and a friend.

—description from the publisher

name: The Adventure Zone: Bureau of Balance Game – Reclaimer Rewards Bonus Pack
description:
The Reclaimer Rewards bonus pack is a mini expansion that came with each copy of the game if you were part of the advanced preorder (Dec 2019- Jan 2020)
It includes:
The Rogues Gallery Mission Card + 10 Challenge Cards
6 unique Fantasy Kostco Cards
3 Surprise Cards including Clint McElroy, G'Naash, and NO-3113
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Move Through Deck, Role Playing

name: Flip-it: Musical Thrones
description:
It's time to decide who will be the next king. The Lion is ready to keep its position, but the Tiger, Panther and Puma are committed to take the crown for themselves. Be the fastest to meet the challenges, earn crowns tokens and become the King of the Forest!

Players reveal a random challenge token.

Someone press PLAY on the companion app and players start flipping through the pages of their flip-book viewing the animation. While the music is playing, keep flipping and making your character dance around the throne.

When the music stops be the fastest to complete the challenge. You must stop exactly on the page indicated by the challenge. There are two types of challenges:

Throne Challenge

Stop on the page where your character sits on the throne


Animal Challenge

Stop at one of the pages where the animal from the challenge token appears.


When a player gets 3 Crown Chips they are the winner and declared the King of Forest.

Includes variants to play with any music, solo mode, and much more!

COMPONENTS:
04 Flip-books
03 Order tokens
12 Crown Tokens
12 Challenge Tokens
01 DJ Marker
Rules

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching

name: The Next Thing
description:
Who doesn't like cloud spotting?

In THE NEXT THING, playing stones represent clouds. Players take turns adding them to the board, and try to match the resulting combination to one of the displayed patterns.

As a player realizes that one of the patterns is going to be matched soon, they can bet on it. When a pattern is completed, the bets are revealed and those who predicted it first get a reward.

The game is over when all 7 stones from the prize pile have been taken or when one of the players runs out of stones. The player with the greatest number of stones wins the game.

In THE NEXT THING you will need to use both your social and pattern recognition skills to guess what other players are betting on, and your wits to outsmart them.

It is a fun, fast-paced game with a very simple rule set yet surprisingly complex strategies, suitable for both kids and adults.

-description from designer

name: Grab A Pig
description:
Players simultaneously pass cards from their hands to their neighbours in the hope of acquiring a full matching set. When a player completes a set, they must grab a pig from the centre of the table. At this point all other players must also grab a pig, but there is always one pig less than the number of players. Failing to grab a pig kicks that player out of the game, and leaves the remaining players to battle it out in the next round. Last player standing is the winner.

Components: Soft Plastic Pigs, 1 Pencil, 4 Rule cards, 1 double sided Score Pad, 24 game cards (4 of each of the 6 characters).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Speed Matching

name: Tick Tack Bumm: Vibrations
description:
The bright berry-red bomb, which is known to end the round by exploding, also has another surprise in store: it vibrates randomly and once again makes the other players sweat.

The random vibration of the bomb during the game is new and particularly appealing. The vibrating becomes a wild card that provides unexpected climaxes in a flash.

The starting player grabs the hot bomb and covers one of 220 categories. Now it's a matter of quickly finding suitable words, for example to "pick-up lines", "(im)possible porn titles", "excuses for "not today, honey", "that hangs" or "that is not socially acceptable".

As soon as the word is pronounced, you place the bomb in front of the next player in a flash - because no one knows how long it will tick before it explodes. If it blows up right in front of you, you lose the round and take the card on display as punishment.
categories: Electronic, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Tudor Trail
description:
Tudor Trail is a solo roll & write board game with a Tudor theme.

As you follow the timeline from the reign of King Henry VII to the final years of Queen Elizabeth I you will attempt to stop rebellions, destroy the Spanish armada, and keep your closest rivals from the English throne.

Each turn you will roll the 8 dice, choosing one pair to advance on the timeline, and using the other groups of dice to fill in the points scoring bonus sections. Each monarch of the Tudor period has their own section requiring clever use of the dice you roll to score the most points. Crown spaces allow you to reroll the dice and flag spaces must be landed on or your rivals will advance on the English throne!

The timeline starts in 1485 and once you get to the end of the Tudor timeline in 1603 you've completed the game and you add up your total score. The game takes 15-25 minutes to play and you can play again to try and beat your best score!

Tudor Trail requires logic and reading skills as well as basic sorting and simple maths. It's recommended for those aged 9 and over.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: CardWeaver: Character Pack 1
description:
Character Pack 1 adds two new Animus Characters and one new Nemesis Character to CardWeaver.

A high-powered hybrid, the Psiblade uses a mix of Attacks and Direct Damage to quickly deal high amounts of damage. Protect and heal your teammates with the Light Bringer's sturdy Artifacts, stalwart ally cards, and versatile spells.

More of a Nemesis fan? The Necromancer can quickly flood the field with undead Reavers that unleash negative effects in both unlife and death.

Contents:
1 Nemesis Deck (20 Cards)
2 Animus Decks (30 Cards Each)
3 Character Cards
3 XP Dials
3 Health Dials
3 Divider Cards
Rules
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Interrupts, Market, Team-Based Game

name: Capital Punishment: The Party Argument Game
description:
This is the party game that puts pop culture on trial. In our deck of cards, you’ll find the names of hundreds of celebrities, politicians, and pop culture trends. You have one goal—to convince the Judge and the other players that your card is the worst one on the table. Brush up on your lawyer skills.

See you in court.

—description from the designer

name: Sushi Do
description: Players offer trades by crying out the number of cards they want to swap (“One! One! One!”, or “Three! Three! Three!”) but not their sushi flavor. The winner of the hand is the first to collect all of one flavor (6 cards), declaring “Sushi Do!”. The winner of the hand scores points equal to the value of the flavor, and the winner of the game is the first to 500 points.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Party Game, Real-time

name: Goldfish Merchant 金魚商
description:
It is said that goldfish are living works of art. A passionate goldfish merchant is capable of breeding yet-unseen beauty in goldfish.
