In Goldfish Merchant, players will will crossbreed varieties of goldfish in an effort to create a new species. Players will trade fish cards with an open market to make pairs with the correct color and values, all in hopes of creating a yet-unseen variety of goldfish. By combining special combos of cards and keen hand management, players can compete to become the greatest goldfish merchant of their generation!
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Beaver Tower
description:
There are vigorous beavers in the mountain valley.
We need to make a cool and vertiginous tower for beavers to play at. Build a tower they want and bring as many as possible to the tower!

Use only the hands and fingers presented on the construction rule card to build the tower shown on the tower card. When you finished building the tower, you have to put the beavers on it. You will earn additional points for the number of beavers you put on your tower. After the 6th round, the player with the highest score wins.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Real-Time, Speed Matching, Stacking and Balancing

name: TrumPen
description:
TrumPen is a card game system that uses dry erase cards for players to write the suit and rank on the cards themselves. The game comes with four rulesets for different games to play with these unique cards.

In TrumPen Poker, you mark 5 cards while trying to avoid duplicating cards with the other players. If the same cards are written by multiple players, the player with stronger hands will be eliminated from the game. Among the remaining players, the player with the strongest hands wins.

In TrumPen Blackjack, you collect played cards so that the sum of the numbers you have is as close to 21 as possible. You score points depending on the sum of the numbers you have. The winner is decided after 3 rounds.

In TrumPen Trick Taking, you play 3 tricks per round for 3 rounds, therefore you play 9 tricks in total and score the points. Write down the numbers to 3 cards when they are dealt, then write the suit when you play. This is a trick-taking game with must-follow, no trump, and no bidding.

In TrumPen Speed, you play your cards in a way that cards are stacked in sequential order as quickly as possible. The player who played all of their cards first wins.

name: Takaro! Into the wild
description:
This is a standalone expansion for Takaro! that can be played with the original game or on it's own.

Learn more te reo so you can korero about our beautiful ngāi kīrehe (fauna) & ngāi tipu (flora).

Takaro! Into the wild adds 57 new words from animals and nature into the Takaro family. Game play follows the original game so these 57 new playing cards & 8 new reference cards can be combined with the new version or played on their own.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Takaro!: Bits + Bobs
description:
This is a standalone expansion for Takaro! that can be played with the original game or on it's own.

This time we're learning everyday household objects to make it even easier to start using te reo in your whare. Gather around the tēpu and kēmu on!

Takaro! Bits + Bobs adds 57 new words from everyday life into the Takaro family. Game play follows the original game so these 57 new playing cards & 8 new reference cards can be combined with the new version or played on their own.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Gadianton
description:
Welcome to South America! We are in Yucatán around 50 BC. Cities, emerging from the jungle, are prey to the Gadianton robbers. Through this strategy game, you will embody one of these thieves whose goal is to steal crowns in the city and return with them in the rainforest. But watch out: both the city guards and your fellow robbers will try to stop you! Fights, arrow shots and action cards will animate the game...

Gadianton is a board game. To win, you have to be the first to bring back all your stolen crowns in the lush forest surrounding the city. By choosing the number of crowns, you control the duration of the game.

Players move their thief figure and depending on the result of the dice, one of the city guards during the same turn. They can attack in hand-to-hand combat or by shooting an arrow to prevent another thief from fleeing with his crown and taking the advantage. Action cards spice up the game: break your opponent's bow to prevent him from shooting at you!

A bit of strategic thinking, surprises, dynamism and a lot of interactions between players for a successful game and good moments shared by up to 4 players.

An instruction booklet in English /French / German is included in the box. It can also be downloaded in Spanish, Portuguese and Italian. However, the action cards have no text on them: the illustration is clear enough, so language will not be a problem when playing. And kids can play even if they can’t read yet.
mechanics: Action/Event, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Medusa: El Desafío del Héroe
description:
Medusa: The Hero's Challenge from EPICA Games is a game where mighty Gods, brave Monsters, and ferocious Heroes face off in an all or nothing battle, recreating the Greek myth of Medusa and Perseus.

Fight your way to victory and eliminate all other players to be crowned victor. Choose between Perseo, Zeus, Andromeda, Atenea or Las Grayas (Graeae) to help you pave your path to victory.

name: Soccer 17: Team Cards
description: Soccer 17 Kickstarter add-on expansion. 8 team cards representing Argentina, Brazil, England, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, & Spain representing the best teams from 1930-2014. Each team has one or more special abilities to make the game more exciting.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: The Final Light-Year: The Frey Sector
description:
July 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, new enemies and new parts, but instead of a new boss, the kit brings a Spaceport postcard for campaign play.

You'll place the spaceport between two sector maps and play two full games, with a little extra trouble in-between. The enemies and boss at the second sector are boosted, but you can use actions in the first sector to weaken them. It's an all new type of balance, looking toward the long game.


Released in the July 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The Valley of Alchemists: Kickstarter Edition
description: Kickstarter exclusive edition available as the "Dragon Box" pledge during the 2017 Kickstarter campaign. This edition includes the Kickstarter Exclusive metal experience tokens, an additional "16" denomination metal experience token not in the regular "Alchemist" pledge edition, as well as the otherwise separate Ghost Expansion inside the sealed game box.

name: Dekoder
description:
A 1-5 players logic game, where all the players lay rectangle tiles with 2 digits and 2 colours on a square common board.
When you lay a tile you count all the tile's squares on the board in the same rows and columns as the tile you just put - that's the number of points you get.

But there is a restriction - no colour and no digit can appear in a row or column more than once - similarly to Sudoku.
You can also put tiles on top of other tiles. That gives extra 5 points, but there are 4 conditions to be met:

there must be at least 5 tiles on the board
your tile must cover two squares of two separate tiles
you can't cover the same digits and colours as the ones on your tile
both tiles you cover need to be on the same level


—user summary

Wyjątkowa gra logiczna, oparta na układaniu szyfrów na planszy w taki sposób, żeby powstały niepowtarzalne układy. Osiem cyfr i osiem kolorów – żaden nie może pojawić się więcej niż raz w rzędzie lub kolumnie na siatce planszy. Im sprawniej będziesz kodować, tym więcej zgarniesz punków i tym szybciej wykonasz zadanie. Czy uda Ci się złamać szyfr i zgarnąć laur zwycięstwa?

—description from the publisher

Unique logic game about laying unique cipher patterns. 8 digits and 8 colours - none can appear more than once in any row or column on the board. The better you code, the more points you get and reach the goal faster. Are you able to break the code and claim the victory?

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Layering, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Palabrerío
description:
A creative game to find the best words.
Like tutti frutti game, but with five different ways to play it!

Five forms of play: "everyone plays", "challenge", "just drawings", "go ahead" and "say it with mimicry". Each with a different score. We just have to find the best words. Highly competitive!

name: Myriorama: La Biblioteca Infinita
description:
An ideal game to create and tell endless stories!

Seven game suggestions. The myrioramas can be created individually, in groups or collaboratively, and the stories can be told orally or in writing.

name: Mud Cakes
description:
Mud Cakes is a tribute to childhood memories when our grandma took care of us in her home, and we played in the garden creating stories, imagining adventures, and even cooking mud cakes.

Some dirt and water are enough to get in a culinary mud challenge and create the most exquisite preparations to fulfill your client’s wishes. Clay, bugs, dry leaves, stones, grass, even snails may help you to delight you special guests: you granny, little brother, teddy bear, your dog, cat and Nina doll.

Get as many satisfaction points from the guests by having fun in the mud and cooking the most suited mud cakes.

What’s the order?

----español

Mud Cakes, es un bello homenaje a los recuerdos de la infancia, cuando la abuela nos cuidaba en su casa y nos divertíamos en su jardín creando historias, imaginando aventuras e incluso cocinando pasteles de lodo.

Un poco de tierra y agua es suficiente para eludirnos en un desafío culinario y preparar los postres más exquisitos para satisfacer las preferencias del público. Arcilla, bichos, hojas secas, rocas, pasto y hasta caracoles en el menú para deleitar a nuestros invitados especiales: Abuelita, hermanito, osito de peluche, cachorro, gatito y muñeca María.

Consigue la mayor cantidad de puntos de diversión de los invitados, jugando en el barro a preparar los pasteles de barro más adecuados. Lanza y selecciona dados, enlódate eligiendo la ubicación de tus pasteles, para finalizar registrando los pedidos de tus invitados; Al final del juego obtendrás puntos de diversión por la ubicación de tus pasteles y por tener los pasteles adecuados para cada pedido de los invitados.

¿Qué quiere ordenar?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Bloodfields: Eternal Sorrow
description:
Bloodfields is a tactical miniature combat game for 1 to 6 players. Players will build their armies paying a blood cost for each unit. Equipment and spells can also be purchased to improve the units performance or make them more versatile in combat.

Types of play vary: there is a solo mode, a co-op, a free-for-all, capture the flag, and Leslie area control.

Bloodfields Eternal Sorrow expands upon original blood fields by adding over 14 new armies and restructuring previous army play. Players can purchase miniatures from the publisher directly or purchase 3-D printable files and print their own.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: The Final Light-Year: The Gamma Sector
description:
August 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

You'll be squared up against Jackal Flotilla in the Gamma Sector. For this sector's event you'll be answering the call to collect a bounty. The presence of the Serpire Prison and a Scarab Buzzship in this sector just makes tensions even higher!


Released in the August 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Rush Out! Goodies: The Familiars
description:
Both the sorcerer and the heroes now have creatures to help them in their adventures.

Use your familiar to help you complete cards faster.

Included with the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter as part of the Bone pack.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Real-time

name: Ashes
description:
Ashes is an annihilation game for two players played on a hexhex board with stackable pieces of two colors. The board starts out empty. Still, all you ever do in Ashes is move stacks. This is accomplished by the help of a very liberal understanding of "stack": A single piece is considered a stack of size 1, and an empty cell is considered to contain a stack of size 0.

The basic principle of movement is simple: A stack may move to a cell it can see – i.e. one that is adjacent or joins it in flanking a line of empty cells – if this cell is not occupied by a bigger stack.

It is important that, every time you remove a stack from the board, whether it was one of yours of an enemy stack, you keep one of its pieces in a designated area (off the board) as a reminder. I'll get back to why you need to keep count of removed stacks.

There is an economy to moving whole stacks, which is responsible for stack's coming into and going out of existence (rules for moving proper parts of stacks are given farther down):

Outward movement gains you:
When a move increases the number of steps away from the center cell the moved stack is, it grows by the addition of 1 piece per step further away it ends up. Pieces initially only come onto the board by moving a stack of size 0 at least 1 step away from the center cell.

Non-outward movement costs you:
When a move does not increase the number of steps away from the center cell the moved stack is, it shrinks by the removal of 1 more than 1 piece per step closer it ends up. This means that a stack not moving outward can travel no farther inward than 1 less than its size.

Reproduction tax:
If you increase the number of stacks you own, the resulting size of the newly created stack must be big enough to pay a reproduction tax equal to the number of stacks you have removed from the board (whether friendly or not). For each removed stack, you must subtract a piece from the newly created stack, and the gross size of the stack must be bigger than the number of stacks you have lost, so that its net size is at least 1. If white's reproduction tax is 2, moving a 0-stack three steps away from the center will only result in a 1-stack.

Splitting stacks:
Instead of moving a whole stack, you may move a proper part of a stack. Only the reproduction tax applies to the moving of proper stack parts. This means that a splitting move can get you places a whole stack move can't.

Splitting a stack can (and normally does) increase the number of stacks you own. When it does, a reproduction tax must be paid.

There is no free passing in Ashes. If you can move, you must. This ensures that stacks must eventually (if they are not captured before that) spend all their pieces moving "non-outward", and the reproduction tax will eventually be too high to enter a new stack on the board. The game is over as soon as one player has no stacks on the board and is unable to grow a new stack.

—description from the designer

name: Coyote Peterson's Wild Adventure
description:
Hey, Coyote Pack! Join me as I explore six different biomes and learn all about the animals that inhabit them in this fun, fast, and strategic game. Offering a host of interesting animal facts alongside intuitive game play, it’s competitive, but light-hearted and will take you on your own Wild Adventure!

Claim the highest score by secretly laying down animals from different biomes. The only problem is the values of the biomes are constantly changing! Strategically use Coyote’s signature Hat and Backpack, infamous Bites & Stings, and the Animals themselves to alter the game to your own advantage...but watch out for the Snapping Turtle!

On your turn, play as many cards from your hand as you wish with the exception that at least one (preferably Biome) card must be reserved to add to your Wild Adventure. Use Biome cards to change the positions of the Biome tokens on the game mat, Hat & Backpack cards to add bonuses to Biomes of your choice, and Bite & Sting cards to gain an extra edge. Build your Wild adventure with one or two cards. These are laid face down. At the end of your turn refill your hand. Once any player has taken enough turns to create a full Wild Adventure, all other players get a final turn. Biome cards in each player's Wild Adventure are scored against their positions on the mat. Play as many rounds as you like, highest score wins!

name: The Final Light-Year: The Heton Sector
description:
September 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

You will be taking The Final Lightyear to the Heton Sector where the Spaceport J77 is located. In this sector the Market makes an appearance, so now's your chance to load up on some Burster Bombs. Lurking in this sector is both the Scarab Mother and a Terradact Fighter, so beware!!


Released in the September 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The Family
description:
The Family is a 2-4 player tabletop card game, putting YOU in the shoes of a crime boss.

Pit yourself against your friends and family and see who comes on top as the best crime boss. You’ll need to draw from the deck, place associates on locations and eliminate your rivals to gain control of your turf and win.

Turn types:
Draw cards for nifty ways to make your position better or maybe worse (a gamble worth taking most of the time).
Attack rivals using dice when you’ve gained the right strategic advantages.
Command locations to receive strategic bonuses.
Reinforce locations you occupy to ensure success.

Be ruthless, or you will not succeed.

This game requires both strategy, and a little bit of luck too.

It’s turn based, you each get a turn in order, however some strategic bonuses you earn will allow you a second turn, such as attacking after you’ve drawn cards.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Mafia, Party Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Postcard Guadalcanal
description:
A couple weeks ago my 11 year old daughter beat me in this in a typical last-minute cliff-hanger game.

The game is so unpredictable - all the chances are 50% die rolls or coin tosses - it is ideal for solitaire play too.

8 half-month turns for U.S. or Japan to take and keep Henderson Field, Guadalcanal.
2 battleship, 2 cruiser - a 3rd for U.S. if/when 1 is lost - 2 carrier, and 2 transport pieces each, plus Yamato for Japanese if an IJN battleship piece is lost.
6 ground units each
5 U.S. and 4 Japanese air units.

Codebreaking, night combat, radar, Torpedo Junction, Long Lance torpedoes for Japanese cruisers with Night surprise.

And anyone is free to print this or my other 3 (so far) postcard games off in postcard format ... as long as my copyright statement and the Dedication are retained ... to mail/give to family and friends.

(Of course, for your own personal copy you will want to photocopy-enlarge the components ... the front at both A4 (for the units) and A3 (for the chart) and the back/rules as large as you need them. :-) )
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Set-up

name: Volle Scholle: Postkartenspiel
description:
Climate change has major consequences for all of us. The polar ice caps are also melting.

In Volle Scholle, you have to pull your penguins across the melting ice to the finish line as quickly as possible. But watch out! If you risk too much, you'll swim.

Each player receives two game pieces (penguins). A player may roll the dice as many times as he wants. The numbers 3 to 6 each bring one movement point - if a player stops, he may distribute the movement points earned among his two penguins. On a 1 or 2, all points are lost and it is the next player's turn. After each round the ice melts, penguins standing on melted ice fall into the water and are out of the game. The winner is the player who gets the most penguins to the finish line, in case of a tie the fastest penguin.

The special thing about it: the game consists of only one postcard and can be sent. All other materials needed can be found in a well sorted household. :)

name: Rivals for Catan: Hostel Scenario
description:
This is a free official print & play scenario released during the 2020 pandemic.

From the scenario:
All of us are longing for eateries, hotels, and B & Bs to reopen. Fortunately, there are still hostels on Catan that offer traveling merchants excellent room and board. You can use these special hostel cards as an addition to the Rivals for CATAN™
introductory game and when playing the theme games.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Notaufnahme: das kranke Kartenspiel
description:
This card game was crowdfunded via startnext.com. It is about treating patients in the emergency room. It contains patients, doctors, nurses, other professions, special cards and action cards.

Try treating as many patients as possible while getting rid of your initial 6 hand cards. Every turn you can place one of your cards in the middle, if this is not possible you must draw a card from the pile. As soon as someone‘s last card was played, the round stops and points/band aids will be counted for each player.

Whoever manages to collect the most points after 10 rounds, wins the Game.

name: Death Note 人狼
description:
Death Note 人狼 (or Death Note Jinrou, meaning Death Note Werewolf) is a draw one, play one card game with social deduction in the setting of the Death Note manga.

Players are first assigned to two teams – Team L and Team Kira – depending on which True Identity card they are dealt, which include L and Kira themselves, as well as Kira's believers and L's police allies.

Two item cards are then distributed at random to each player, including the Death Note and Arrest cards that Kira and L must use respectively to attain victory. The rest of the item cards form a draw deck. Each player spends their turn drawing one card and playing one of the three cards in their hand.

For Team L, victory lies in getting the Arrest card to L and using it to expose the true identity of Kira. For Team Kira, victory lies in getting the Death Note card to Kira and using it to kill off L while trying to stay incognito.

Things won't be that easy, however. Players have no idea which True Identity card the other players hold, meaning that a Kira player could very well pass himself off as L, getting his hand on the Death Note in the process. You'll need to use the item card abilities, as well as your deduction skills, to prevail.

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Khorne Team – Card Pack
description: Redesigned for the Second Season ruleset, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles for your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Khorne teams.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Into the Dark
description:
The ancient Tombs and Darkened Caves of Skyrim are home to many treasures - and many dangers. Dare you venture into the dark to claim them? Take on the foes and threats that the world of The Elder Scrolls throws at you, where ancient enemies and fierce creatures the outcome is all up to you.

Into The Dark provides the core rules for random dungeon generation, and includes modules for Nordic Tombs and Wilderness Caves. Future releases will feature additional settings, such as Bandit Camps and Dwemer Ruins.

17-page random delve designer system to allow you to procedurally generate multi-level dungeons.

name: Shades of Ink
description:
You weren't supposed to see them, the weathered cards with starnge inkblots. You didn't know the ink would curl and writhe as you looked at them. You tell yourself it's a nightmare, but the Shades you see are real... and they can see you too.

An interesting premise as a solo RPG told with only a few cards. When playing, you’ll get the chance to define the particular Shade you are encountering. This happens by a unique pair of prompts as well as an image, and it is up to you how to interpret these, as well as how to play out the encounter. Let your imagination run wild, telling of adventures that bring the storylines to life. Or just think of things in a practical way, coming up with a solution that is grounded in sensibility. The choice is yours, and only you can determine the right or wrong way to go about this unique encounter.

Shades of Ink is a solo role playing game where you will look at inkblots, note what you see, and then fight to destroy the shades that manifest from your visions. As you accumulate knowledge, the spirits' power also accumulates until it coalesces to form one final encounter.

Will you be able to overcome the Shades to escape the nightmare?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Florist
description:
Your goal in Florist is to create bouquets of three flowers as whoever first creates five bouquets wins.

To set up, shuffle the twenty flower cards, deal four to each player, then lay out the remaining twelve cards in a row. Each player places their florist card next to one of the six cards in the middle of the row, then the game begins.

On a turn, play a card from your hand to move your florist in the market, then pick up the card adjacent to where you moved and leave the played card in its place. If you now have a bouquet in hand — three cards of the same value or type or three cards in a straight — score a bouquet by revealing one flower on your scoring card, then replace the three cards in the bouquet with the three cards at one end of the flower market.

If your florist lands on the same space as the opponent in the market, reveal all cards in your hand to see who has the higher value and wins a point — except that you don't count cards that match the revealed symbols on your opponent's scoring card.

name: Crescendo
description:
Deal 52 cards (or 36 if three play. For 2 players, see below) ranking AKQJT9876(5432). Deal them all out in ones. If five play, discard the odd two.

The objective is to win tricks of higher rather than lower value. The player with the highest number of points, wins.

Dealer's left-hand neighbour leads to the first trick. You must follow suit if you can, but may otherwise play any card. The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led and the winner of each trick leads to the next.

Each trick is worth a different value, with values ascending, then dropping in value, then ascending again over the course of 10-13 tricks (depending on player count).

name: Harry Potter: Memory Master
description:
A CARD GAME FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY: Put your memory to the ultimate test with your fellow witches and wizards at your next magical party and game night with this incredibly entertaining Harry Potter card game that the whole family can enjoy.

—description from the publisher

In this game, players are split in pairs. Each round, each player receives five cards. They get a moment to study their cards, and then exchange them with their partners. Then, each player plays one card facedown (with the intention to pick one that matches the one their partner will play). The played cards are then turned face-up. A team scores two points if both the color and the character on their cards match, and one point if either the color or the character matches. The first team to reach twelve points wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mittelmäßig
description:
A 2 player Jass with a traditional deck. Each player plays against the other player and also a single shared “dummy” who is considered a player in its own right but whose cards are played by both. The goal is to capture tricks so that one’s total captured card-points are either the highest or the lowest of the two humans and dummy--that is, avoiding being in the middle. After each hand the top and bottom slots earn sticks (positive game points) while the middle slot earns potatoes (negative game pts). As both players compete against each other over eight hands to earn the most sticks, the Winner must also ensure the Dummy doesn’t beat them both--because if it wins, both humans lose, equally. A perverse game of positioning!

Part of the Twisted Dummy series of two player games in the European tradition.

—description from the publisher

name: Blaseball: Wild Cards
description:
The Sun 2 sits high in the sky as the birds in the outfield lazily pick at discarded peanut shells. As the teams take to the field, the fans erupt, knowing that they're about to witness the best of the best. On one side, the Auric All-Stars — the pinnacle of Blaseball talent. On the other, the Canis Underdogs — the scrappiest fighters that the game has to offer.

One final match will decide the outright winners. Will you be the one to coach your side to a tremendous victory?

Blaseball: Wild Cards is a two-player, competitive card game in which you each control a Blaseball team, with the two of you playing out the top and bottom of the ninth inning.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: 24 Days Escape: 3D-Adventskalender – Sherlock Holmes und das Anwesen Moriarty
description:
Are you brave enough to embark on a mysterious adventure? Then brace yourself and enter the Moriarty estate. The 24 DAYS ESCAPE Advent Calendar ensures an exciting Advent season not only for Sherlock Holmes fans. This special Advent calendar consists of 24 doors with an exciting story, 24 puzzles and mysterious objects as well as the 3D mansion of Professor Moriarty - arch enemy of Sherlock Holmes - to set up and explore. Solve the puzzles around the mysterious mansion and find all the mysterious items to solve the big master puzzle on December 24th.

- description by the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cuius Regio: The Thirty Years War
description:
In May 1618, two imperial regents of the Habsburg Empire, along with their secretary, were thrown from the window of the council room in Prague Castle for violating an agreement that protected Protestant religious rights. The act, known as the Defenestration of Prague, marked the beginning of 30 bloody years of warfare—the Thirty Years War.

Cuius Regio explores the operational military aspects of this pivotal period in European history and focuses on the maneuvers and battles that shook Europe for three decades.

The game includes scenarios covering the Bohemian Revolt, the Danish intervention, the Swedish intervention, the French intervention, and a Thirty Years War campaign of 31 turns lasting from 1618 to 1648. Each scenario has a unique character, and the game can be played in as little as an hour and a half (for a short scenario) or can be a multi-session game for the full campaign.

The turns are divided into two seasons (summer and winter), and each turn has a variable duration that depends on the number of armies activated. In addition, armies can conduct operations several times but become less effective as they accumulate fatigue during each action.

Combat is an integrated system for field battles and sieges and is resolved by a die roll, modified by each army's leadership, composition, and condition, on a simple Battle Results Table.

—description from the publisher

name: There's a Song for That
description:
There’s A Song For That is an adult party game inspired by Cards Against Humanity and What Do You Meme. Music fans will love this game. There’s A Song For That is for 3 or more players and is intended for adults. Gameplay lasts between 30-90 minutes. There are over 200 cards in a deck.

How To Play

Each player picks six random song title cards.
Players take turns picking a situation card.
Each of the remaining players play a song title card that they think best goes with the situation card.
The player who played the situation card picks the song title card they think goes best. that player gets a point.
The Player at the end of the game with the most points wins.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Music, Party Game

name: Chronopia (Third edition)
description:
It is a dark time. The Old Gods have deserted the world. A new dark pantheon of Gods watches over the earth and feeds upon the spoils of war; a banquet of souls slain on the wretched battlefields of Chronopia.

Chronopia is a 32mm-Skirmish-Fantasy-System. In principle there are two kinds of strategy plays: Skirmish or Massive Battles. First turns around smaller engagements in loose formation, the other tells large mass battles. Chronopia has alternating activation of the units, different actions, basing on d20´s and the general simplicity and an nice playing speed. All this was formed into an extremely flexible and innovative game.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: MOOGH
description:
MOOGH is a 1 to 4-player competitive programmation game where tribes of cavemen are joining forces to defeat big beasts. They will fight in order to decide who should lead the new combined tribes. By hunting Big Beasts, they will win savage points. At the end of the game, if the cavemen win, the team with most savage points may then claim the leadership of the tribe. If the cavemen don’t meet the winning conditions before the end of the game, all the tribes will lose the game.

In MOOGH, the players will have to anticipate the actions from the other tribes and from the beasts (manage by AIs) in order to win Savage points. Each tribe will have its own actions and skills (most of the actions will be resolved by rolling dice and their success will depend of the cavemen characteristics). The game has different ways to counterbalance the randomness of the dice (rage token to reroll dice, idea cards with special actions that can be activated if you meet specific condition, etc.). There are four tribes in the base game and a lot of interesting content (a solo mode, a skirmish mode, a campaign mode, a lot of different beasts, scenario with different winning conditions, items to win, etc.).

—description from the publisher

name: FOURCAST
description:
A weather-themed, pattern-making card game. Use strategy and manipulation to complete your pattern while foiling your opponents. Finish all four weather types to win.

Players use a combination of "plain" and "action" weather cards to manipulate the weather cards in front of them or other players. If they align all four cards to the same color/type, they win that weather type/color.

On your turn, you can choose one action: draw a new card, take the top card from the discard pile and place it, place a card from your hand, or use an action card (Tornado, Rainbow, Lightning, Wind) to perform a special action.

name: 적룡객잔 딜럭스 (The Red Dragon Inn Deluxe)
description:
Korean deluxe edition of Red Dragon Inn. Includes all 12 characters of Red Dragon Inn 1,2,3.

- 1 : Deirdre the Priestess, Fiona the Volatile, Gerki the Sneak, and Zot the Wizard
- 2 : Dimli the Dwarf, Eve the Illusionist, Fleck the Bard, Gog the Half-Ogre
- 3 : Wizgille the Tinkerer, Brewmaster Phrenk, Kaylin the Renegade, Serena the Pious

In Red Dragon Inn, you and your friends are a party of heroic, fantasy adventurers. You've raided the dungeon, killed the monsters, and taken their treasure. Now you're back, and what better way to celebrate your most recent victory than to spend an evening at the Red Dragon Inn. You and your adventuring companions will spend the night drinking, gambling, and roughhousing. The last person who is both sober enough to remain conscious and shrewd enough to hold onto his Gold Coins wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Darkhouse
description:
Darkhouse is a one page print and play roll and write game created by Garrett Sendlewski for the 2017 GenCant roll and write contest.

"Congratulations! Today is your first 30 hour shift working in the Darkhouse, the notorious upside down lighthouse that guides the ships that sail the underground sea. The head engineer gnome is on vacation, and it's up to you to cover his 30-hour shift and keep all the power gems in the Darkhouse energized. The job will test your physical and mental endurance! Survive your first day on the job, and your career is all but guaranteed!"

name: 24 Days Escape: 3D-Adventskalender – Sherlock Holmes und die letzte Fahrt der Titanic
description:
All aboard for the greatest escape experience of this Advent season!

1912, somewhere in the North Atlantic: Dark machinations are going on aboard the Titanic - and the luxury liner is heading straight for disaster. To bring light into the darkness here, a genius alone is not enough: Master detective Sherlock Holmes meets the "thinking machine" Professor van Dusen!

On the hunt for your next story, follow master detective Sherlock Holmes and his faithful companion Dr. John Watson on the maiden voyage of the RMS Titanic. And aboard the luxury liner, crime is not long in coming. Who is the culprit? Is it the eccentric Professor van Dusen, the mysterious Miss DeStrese or even the captain himself? You have 24 hours to solve the case ...

Open 24 doors with exciting tasks and puzzle your way through the most magnificent cruise ship of all time. Discover the secrets of the proud 3D Titanic and combine them with the many finds from the Advent calendar. Only with the right solution will you find out where the adventure continues. If you manage to solve all the puzzles, close the case and save the ship, then it's free sailing for a happy holiday!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Akte 001: Kunstfehler
description:
A MULTIMEDIA HUNT WITH REAL INDICATIONS - Detected with real letters, credit cards, photos, documents, and digitally on the Internet - the perpetrator has left traces everywhere. Combine together and collect evidence. Everything is allowed in this detective game - just like in real police work! Check your solutions on the game website and the inspector will tell you if you're right.

THE PERFECT GAME NIGHT because there are no complicated rules, you can start right away. It doesn't matter whether you're a puzzle game beginner or a pro: Thanks to the selectable difficulty in the game app, every team gets their money's worth. Whether as a gift, for a murder mystery evening, a murderous dinner party or just because - this Cold Case crime scene game sweeps everyone away.

CAPTIVATING STORY - Two bodies are found at an art gala. How did the botox doctor and the art hunter die? What was a windy car mogul and an ambitious influencer doing at the crime scene? Find the killer, determine the motives and solve the Murder Mystery!
?

NOW YOU ARE THE COMMISSIONER - Become a homicide detective. Places the perpetrators in an exciting jungle of intrigues, clues and spicy details. But be careful: the perpetrator is still one step ahead of you! The game does not have to be destroyed and can therefore be played more often.
? If you are not 100% satisfied with the escape room game, we find a solution - just write to us! What are you waiting for? Add Crime Cases detective game to cart now!

name: Lumen Void
description:
Game- A Score and Reset Hand Management Game involving a process of discarding and drawing cards to complete sets and combos with the objective of achieving the highest point values. The Players of the game collect creatures, anatomy, and valuable information as they gain experience points playing this exciting new sci-fi adventure card game!

Story- Experience the thrill of being a Voider on Mission Scorpius! Enter an unusual scientific realm where knowledge is the key to survival, and beware of the space creatures lurking within the unknown territory of the Lumen Void. Much is to be discovered from the unique space monsters to astronomical events (Expansion packs) but only those who gain the most experience will have what it takes to survive.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The Tinderbox
description:
The Tinderbox is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Play cards simultaneously and reveal them to see what treasures you got this round. You want the most valuable but too much of a good thing might leave you with a bitter taste and zero points.

About the fairy tale:
Heading home the soldier meets a witch that offers him gold and silver coins, if he climbs into a hollow tree and gets a Tinderbox for her. The soldier is greedy and also claims the Tinderbox. Later he discovers its power to call upon the dogs with huge eyes. With his new found power the soldier attempts to win the princess and the entire kingdom.

—description from the publisher

name: Dark Cases: Tiefer Fall
description:
A mysterious incident in the small town of Dennsberg! During a climbing tour on the Talbachhorn, Thomas Borgmann, Managing Director of the traditional soup manufacturer BORGMANN's, fell from a height of several meters. The local police department believes it was a tragic accident. But there are signs that point in a different direction...

Your criminalistic skills are required! As a team of experienced investigators, you know exactly what you have to do: Research, discuss, combine – and solve this mysterious case together!

name: Mint Rails
description:
This is a mint tin game in the style of a light cube rails train game. Players collectively operate railway companies to increase company's worth and gain funds. Players can use funds to buy stock which is used at the end of the game to pay dividends out to determine the winner.

The theme is a Western theme with fictional train companies. The game is 1-4 players. The game can be played solo with a bot deck that is used to control the 2nd player.

On a player's turn, they can either

Buy stock
Lay track


When laying track, the companies worth will increase and stock price decrease. So players need to find a balance when laying track.

—user summary
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Investment, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Mimic Octopus: Cringe Edition
description:
Have the craziest conversation of your life – and provide unforgettable moments to be ashamed with a lack of beat, disturbing behaviour and selected behaviour for coming off as the weird daddy joke-uncle.
ABSURD SMALLTALK - Make extremely fun conversations with multiple conversation topics per round - at the same time! Score points through thoughtful listening and creative communication

HIDDEN IDENTITY - Play with hidden roles and secret missions that you don't know at the beginning of the round. Even about your own role you first have to find out due to detective sense.

COOPERATION OR BLUFF - If you have pulled the same conversation card, you play in the team and need to find each other. As Mimic Octopus you are about to lie and manipulate and that way secretly sneak into a team and steal points.

Card game without plastic - all films are biodegradable. Board game with 110 cards for 4-8 people, from 12 years, playing time approx. 30 minutes. Can be combined with all Mimic Octopus editions.

name: Fuga de Creta
description:
Your heroes are trapped in the labyrinth of the minotaur on the island of Crete. Their hope is to find their way out and sail to other lands, through a board that is a puzzle, with two game modes.

The first mode is turn-based. Each player wants, in his turn and using only two actions, to move his hero to the exit of the labyrinth, but by the longest way he can, because each piece his hero passes through will bring him more points at the end of the game.

The second game mode is done through challenges. A number of actions and a special power are shown to all players, who simultaneously imagine the longest possible path. When a player says how many pieces he can do, the other players have 1'30'' to try to make a longer path. The player with the longest path wins the challenge.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Action Points, Map Addition, Speed Matching

name: SKETCH
description:
Test your ingenuity with party game Sketch!

In this dice game from the makers of Party and Co, you must use your ingenuity and imagination to create the smartest and most original drawing.

The challenge? The drawing board already contains a number of scribbles that you should use!
You don't have to be a Picasso to win this game, by drawing the most original objects or concepts you score the most points!

The rules of this game are simple, making it easy to learn and quick to get started. The small size of this board game makes it easy to take with you to any occasion with family or friends!

Sketch and win!
The goal of Sketch is to make the most original drawings, so that you score the most points after 6 rounds! How to play Sketch:
1. All players take the same board with basic scribbles
2. The first player rolls the die with letters. The letter placed on top determines what will be drawn.
3. Fast! Everyone has to make 4 drawings that start with this letter. The drawing board contains basic scribbles that you should use to create your drawing!
4. The first player to complete their four drawings yells STOP! All players must then stop drawing and show the drawings made, after which a number of points are awarded.
5. Repeat this with the different boards until there have been 6 rounds of play. The player with the most points at the end of 6 rounds wins the game!

--

Test je vindingrijkheid met het partyspel Sketch!
Bij dit dobbelspel van de makers van Party en Co moet je je vindingrijkheid en fantasie gebruiken om de slimste en origineelste tekening te maken.
De uitdaging? Het tekenbord bevat al een aantal krabbels waar je gebruik van moet maken!
Voor dit spel hoef je geen Picasso te zijn om te kunnen winnen, door het tekenen van de meest originele voorwerpen of begrippen scoor je de meeste punten!

De spelregels van dit spel zijn simpel, waardoor het makkelijk aan te leren is en snel opgestart kan worden. Het kleine formaat van dit gezelschapsspel maakt dat het dat makkelijk mee te nemen is naar elke gelegenheid met familie of vrienden!

Sketch en win!
Het doel van Sketch is om de meest originele tekeningen te maken, zodat je na 6 rondes de meeste punten scoort! Zo speel je Sketch:
1. Alle spelers pakken hetzelfde bord met basiskrabbels
2. De eerste speler gooit de dobbelsteen met letters. De letter die bovenop komt te liggen, bepaalt wat er getekend gaat worden.
3. Snel! Iedereen moet 4 tekeningen maken die met deze letter beginnen. Het tekenbord bevat basiskrabbels die je moet gebruiken om jouw tekening te maken!
4. De eerste speler die zijn vier tekeningen af heeft, roept STOP! Alle spelers moeten dan stoppen met tekenen en de gemaakte tekeningen laten zien, waarna er een aantal punten wordt toegekend.
5. Herhaal dit met de verschillende borden tot er 6 speelrondes zijn geweest. De speler die aan het einde van 6 rondes de meeste punten heeft, wint het spel!

name: Answer This: Black
description:
WHO KNOWS WHO BETTER? - Answer questions about your friends. The first to answer 10 questions correctly wins the game. Get ready to unveil shocking information about your friends.
FUN GAME NIGHT - Hilarious game to get to know your friends even better. Real-life questions for unbelievable stories and amazing facts. Which friend knows you the best?
NOT FOR KIDS - Questions that will reveal everything about you. Themes ranging from love, parties and problems with the law. Not suitable for kids.
PERFECT GIFT - Bring the game to a bachelorette party, birthday, pool party or camping. Perfect gift for adults that are not easily offended.

—description from the publisher

name: Dice Monsters Missing Mythics
description:
Collect dice, capture monsters, and sabotage your friends in a race to capture a Mythic Monster!

Long ago, Mythic Monsters roamed the land, bringing awe and wonder to anyone lucky enough to catch a glimpse of them. Last Thursday they all went missing.

Dice Monsters is a fast, light strategy game for 3 to 6 players that takes just a few minutes to learn, and 30-40 minutes to play.

With fast setup, simultaneous actions, and no end of game score-tallying, games move quickly.

Each round, every player will pick a monster to try to capture, or choose to place a wager, risking dice for juicy payoffs. Choose and use your monsters wisely, each monster comes with a special ability that could improve future rolls, provide bigger dice bonuses with greater risk, steal dice from other players, or even sabotage their dice rolls.

Upgrade your dice to tilt the odds in your favor. Finding the right combination of monsters and dice upgrades is key to being the first player to capture their own Mythic Monster.

Options: players consistently have a variety of meaningful and interesting decisions to make
Action: fast setup, simultaneous player actions, and no player elimination minimize time spent waiting
Crescendo finish: games finish with a roar and a laugh, not with an accounting exercise
Focused interaction: meaningful player interaction without information overload

—description from designer

name: Dive Adventures
description:
A map showing a rich sea of ​​amazing beings has been discovered. The world's greatest divers heard the news and rushed to explore this new underwater universe. You and your crew race to catalog the marine life. But in this ocean adventure, your progress will depend on your strategy to make the most of oxygen in the dives and the best stops to refill your air tank.

During a game of Dive Adventures, players will roll dice and use the result to move their diver into the sea depicted on the map, trying to catalog the greatest amount of marine life.

Each time the diver reaches a location with a helm, he fills this icon on his sheet and can spend this icon later to reroll some dice.

After 4 rounds, players can have one last round with the remaining helm icons on their sheet (the number of helms will be the number of movement points in the last round).
mechanics: Area Movement, Connections, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: El Oso
description:
EL Oso is a one-player board game. You need 24 checkers (12 in each of two colors), five 6-sided dice, and a simple 5x5 game board.

The challenge of El Oso is to move your stacks of pieces across the board, without encountering the pieces of your opponent (“The Bear”). Your moves are completely under your control, but the Bear’s moves are random. Plan carefully and don’t expose yourself to too much risk, and you’ll get your team across the board.

name: Superclub: Liverpool Player Cards 2022/23
description: Player cards pack containing the entire up-to-date Liverpool first team squad – hot off the press. Perfect for passionate Liverpool fans, as well as Superclub fans who just want more player cards but not necessarily all club manager folders. This is a real bargain on the transfer market!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Command Cards, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Ownership, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Command Decision: Black Powder Cold Steel
description:
Black Powder Cold Steel is a pre-20th-century rules supplement for Command Decision (2nd edition).

The rules are intended to give "Command Decision" players the ability to game an unfamiliar period without having to learn a new rules set.

The time scale and the ground scale are the same, the figure scale are effectively the same, and the firepower values are all compatible.

Sample organizations for the Seven Years War, the Napoleonic Wars and the Crimean War are provided, as well as tables for artillery and small arms. The rules are mainly intended for periods since 1700, but a table for pre-1700 small arms is also included.

A folder of playtest rules was provided, free of charge, to "Command Decision" players through a variety of channels. The aim was to have as many gamers as possible play the rules and discover areas which required additional work.
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Raccoon Tycoon: DeepThought PossumBot
description:
This small expansion facilitates playing Raccoon Tycoon solitaire.

The pack contains 9 Action cards and 16 Railroad Auction cards.

name: Reclaim
description:
Reclaim is a flip-and-write game where players will be drawing polyominos on their board and drawing triangles within certain terrains of already placed shapes to pay the cost of the new shapes.

Once a shape has been entirely filled with such triangles, the triangles within that polyomino are shaded in.

After 10 rounds, an initial scoring happens, where players earn points based on the number of castles connected by paths of hollow triangles. After a few more rounds, where the costs of placing a piece have doubled, players again score for connecting castles with hollow triangles but also the largest rectangle of shaded triangles (and castles). The player with the most points wins.

name: Большая Бродилка: Ещё Больше Приключений (Big Adventure: Even More Adventure)
description:
Большая Бродилка: Ещё Больше Приключений is addition for Большая Бродилка. It adds more "Ta-Dam!" cards and some new characters with unique abilities. For example, if Ernest the Gecko enters the game, other players have to be more careful. Ernest may steal their cards!

—description from the publisher

Большая Бродилка: Ещё Больше Приключений — дополнение для Большой Бродилки. Оно добавляет больше «Та-Дам!» карт и некоторых новых персонажей со своими уникальными способностями. Например, если в игру заходит Геккон Эрнест, другим игрокам нужно быть осторожнее: Эрнест может украсть их карты!

—description from the publisher (Russian)

name: Devine The Sogne
description:
Gather your best friends
Read the song
Guess the song!


A game for anyone who loves songs! All together or in teams, try to guess the songs that were translated by people who think they are bilingual.

name: Dobble Access+
description:
Discover the Access+ version of the popular Dobble speed and observation game, which has been adapted for players living with cognitive disorders.

The cards and symbols are bigger for easier handling and recognition, and progressive levels of difficulty are proposed in the rules to make the game accessible to as many people as possible.

Dobble Access+ remains true to the original version of the game: Players must find the symbol in common between their card and the drawn card. The adaptions make it possible for everyone to play together and have a great time.

Dobble Access+ stimulates attention, observation, speed, memory and motor skills, among other functions.

—description from the publisher

name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Heritage: Reset Pack
description:
This pack includes everything you need to begin a new chronicle using your copy of Vampire: The Masquerade – Heritage. Just replace the characters modified during the course of play, reset the chronicle deck in order, and steel yourself for another 700 years of human and vampiric history.

Includes all 80 character cards and stickers to begin a new campaign
Contents: 80 Double-sided mortals / 106 ability stickers
publishers: Conclave Editora, Fabrika Igr, Galakta, Nice Game Publishing

name: Drylands
description:
Drylands are fragile ecosystems where deserts border savanna and/or forest biomes. These places can easily be degraded into desert like conditions or nurtured to be greener and more productive. It depends on how the land is managed.

In this two player game the desert player competes with the forest player to decide the outcome of a small section of drylands.

Each turn players can “grow” by placing a new tile next to their established tiles, or they can “leap” using an existing tile to move to a location farther away. Whenever you place one of your tiles next to opponent tiles, either through growing or leaping, those opponent tiles flip and become yours.

The game ends when all spaces on the board are occupied. The player with the most tiles of their type wins!

A game that’s easy to learn but hard to master, it is suitable for a wide range of ages, from 5 to 105.

name: Blade: Sisterhood
description:
In this solitaire game that aims to recreate fictitious events of 18th century France you will roam around the city of Paris looking for targets, followers of the order. For this you will need to carefully navigate the streets and rooftops, avoiding guards or neutralizing them from the back. But be careful, don’t look ahead or ignore your action grid and you will find yourself cornered and you will have to flee. Your goal is to assassinate as many targets as you can before getting to the end of the deck.

To start the game you will gather the map cards into deck in front of you. All cards are face-up and oriented upright. These are the cards you will be moving through throughout the game.
Behind this deck of cards you will place the action tracker card, sideways and with the action grid visible..
These cards you will hold in the palm of your left hand. Using your left index finger to keep track of the game's rounds and your right thumb will be held onto the last used action on the action grid (this is important for later on).

The map cards:
The map cards are the cards your character will be traversing. Your position on the cards must be remembered when playing in-hand. Each map card has one target and many guards, all of which can be assassinated. However the target is of course... the target. And you will gain points depending on how many targets you have assassinated at the end of the game.
The map cards are divided into squares, and most of these squares have one of two "heights", ground level or rooftop. Movement through connecting squares of the same height is unlimited, however to change height or do other parkour maneuvers you will have to use the action grid.

The action grid:
The action grid contains 4 possible actions, of which you may perform one each round. The catch is that you can never do the same action 2 rounds in a row, and you can only do an action that is connected via an arrow (or line without arrow) to the last used action.

A summary of the actions:

Jumping. Take a run-up of one square to jump from one over a ground square in the same direction as the run-up.
Descending. Go down a height.
Climbing. Go up a level.
Assassinating. Assassinate a target to claim that card as a point. Or assassinate guards to open up new paths.


These actions are explained in greater detail in the game's rulebook.

Game end:
As explained above you attempt to beat each card by assassinating the target, thus getting a point. Or getting caught by a guard and having to flee to the next card.
You play until you've finished the deck and then tally up your points to see how skilled an assassin you are.

Welcome to the sisterhood!
mechanics: Area Movement, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Now or Never: Merchant Caravan Promo Card
description: This promo tile is awarded to the first person to visit the Monument in the game; it offers an exclusive exchange rate for some of the goods, adding a new way to make coins.

name: Mining Colony: Secret Missions
description:
In Secret Missions, a mini-expansion pack to Mining Colony, players receive a secret missions card showing 6 items in specific spots in the colony. Players score points at game end for placing the specified items in the specified locations.

—description from the publisher

name: Roll and Control
description:
The game lasts 3 eras. During every era, players fight over control in provinces.
Using dice, players can perform the following actions:

Recruit new troops
Send troops to the area
Take control over roads


At the end of the era, players check who has control over provinces, castles, and roads.
The player with the most points after 3rd era is the winner.

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Naxxramas Raid Deck
description:
An asymmetrical two-sided card game where one player takes on the role of the raid bosses and their minions, and is opposed by one or more other players who take on the role of the raiding heroes.

The expansions contains the deck and special rule cards for the Raid player. The raiding heroes will need 60-card decks (not included) to defeat them.

name: Dungeon Blitz: Blood Castle
description:
First module in Dungeon Blitz, a series of fast-playing solo adventure games.

Vardak Castle leers over the village of Greyhollow like a hungry vulture. For decades the villagers have shuttered their windows after dark and lived in fear of the evil that watches over them. You have journeyed along the Vova River to the haunted village, prepared to put a stop to whatever unnatural creature stirs in the cursed halls of the BLOOD CASTLE!

In each adventure you create a character and undertake an exciting and dangerous dungeon crawl with little more than your trusty weapon and wits. All you need is some paper, a pencil and three six-sided dice. The dungeon is randomly generated and you will map it as you play. As you discover new locations you might be attacked by monsters, set off a trap or find wondrous treasure. Eventually, you will find the terrible monster at the heart of the dungeon and either defeat it or die trying!
categories: Adventure, Book, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Quests Over Coffee: Expansion #02 – Haunted Manor
description:
Down the block materializes a grandiose house that strikes fear in the deepest and darkest areas of your soul. Is it because of the spirits floating around the outside with their groaning? Maybe it's because those same spirits are asking about your extended car warranty. Do you have what it takes to navigate the quests here?

—description from the publisher

Expansion 2 - Haunted Manor expands Quests over Coffee, offering new cards:

- 4 New Items
- 5 New Quests
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Gra roku
description:
Gra Roku is a quick and very fun family game where you create your year consisting of up to 12 cards (you play cards representing the 4 seasons: SPRING, SUMMER, AUTUMN, and WINTER.). You try to have cards that give you the most points in your year.

However, you have to be careful because - as you know - nothing happens twice, so each card of the year must have a different symbol! For every card with a symbol you already have in your year, you'll get a negative point! The person who creates the year with the largest number of points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Archangelis
description:
The deckbuilding battle for all creation!

You and your opponents start with identical decks of low-level angels. Each turn, you will have the opportunity to purchase cards to add to your deck. Angels…will form your “host” army. Demons…will oppose the actions of your opponent’s host. Relics can be attached to angels, making them more powerful. Humans…can also be added to your host and your horde, granting group bonuses. And miracles, bring incredible powers into play each time they are drawn.

Build your host…and when you have enough points, challenge one of the three locations in play. If your host is strong enough and can survive a horde challenge from your opponent, the location will be yours. The harder the location…the greater the rewards.

Once three locations have been won by either player, it is time for the final battle. You’ll examine the rewards granted by conquered locations: They will allow you to add a certain number of angels and demons to your final army. You’ll search your deck, pull your rewards, form your army…and compare against your opponent.

Greatest power among final armies wins all!

name: Quatro City
description:
Quatro City is a one-of-a-kind wooden puzzle with unique pieces and a catching detective quest to be solved. Each piece with a detailed and bright illustration is soaked with the mysteries. This puzzle brings leisure activities to a whole new level by adding interaction and activity to routine puzzle assembling.

The first challenge facing you is to assemble the puzzle of the numerous streets of Quatro City. Having thoroughly scrutinized the mazes of the Quatro City, you will have all trump cards to get to the truth of the mystery that welcomes you on the next step. Scan the QR code to fully dive into the atmosphere of the town and continue the interaction with the game on your device.

From now on, you become a detective’s assistant who investigates the catastrophe in the City. Meet Mark Eidos - your partner in solving dozens of quests, riddles, and mysteries to unravel the secrets somebody is hiding from people. He will be a starting point for your new goal - becoming a professional sharp-eyed detective.

The game goes in an involving story-telling manner enabling you not only to observe the events but to take part and appear as a character. This engaging narrative keeps you participated in the investigation and makes it entertaining.

Do not put the assembled puzzle away - separate pieces will help you to solve the quizzes and riddles. Additional detective tools, such as magnifying glass and vacuum pen, will be extremely useful for catching even the smallest details of the city parts.

Get to the truth of the mystery.

1943 pieces
4 reference poster for each part
30 quest quizes and riddles
1 visual novel
8 side quests
Access to website or App for solving quests
Detective magnifying glass
Set of 4 Parts of the detailed and bright illustration

name: Бавовна (Cotton)
description:
In the card game Бавовна, you have to collect a set of cards and create the perfect trap for the occupying tanks by setting up decoys with washing machines and fueling the farmers' tractors to quickly rid the enemy soldiers of their machinery.

How to do it? Play the cards correctly and try to be the first to collect the right combinations of card collections.
categories: Card Game, Farming, Humor, Modern Warfare

name: Cartref
description:
You are a goblin land baron and member of the Hut Barons guild -- purveyors of magical real estate for weefolk, bigfolk, and everyone in between. Laid out in a square grid, the buildings of Cartref possess magical effects that vary depending on their residents. Use your wits and magic to amass the greatest wealth in the budding city of Cartref.

On your turn, take 2 actions from the following options. (A) Build a new building and invoke the magic of adjacent goblin buildings. (B) Fulfill a guild Mandate and invoke the magic of bigfolk (human) buildings. (C) Impel the gnomes in one of your gnomish buildings to use their magic. (D) Purify the bad karma (pollution) emitted by the buildings so that you can invoke them again.

Players score Mandates (objective cards) twice -- once when initially fulfilled and again at the game's end. This creates the tension of a race while also provides a framework for strategic planning through the very last turn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Map Addition, Ownership, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tags, Tile Placement

name: Wortwiesel
description:
Wortwiesel is a speed word-building game (German language). Each card has 2 letters. There are three types of cards: Cards with 2 consonants, cards with 2 vowels, and cards with 1 consonant and 1 vowel.

Two things are special:
- The cards can be placed next to each other or partially overlapping, so that one letter is covered. Just by smart placement of your cards you can cover and replace letters with those of another card. The combinatorics of just a few cards are breathtaking, and it is this puzzle effect which creates most of the fun.
- The sand timer does NOT define an upper time limit for finishing an action. Instead, the timer defines lower(!) time limit i.e. the period before the next drawing of cards is triggered. It is merely an option: You do not have to trigger drawing immediately once the timer is finished! Instead, it is perfectly fine to take it easy and to grant yourselves more time before taking the next card.

The game starts by flipping the sand timer. Players race to build words out of their cards, using as many letters as possible. Individual letters which are in the way must be covered by other cards, but no card may be covered completely.
Each player has four tiles with which to cover letters at the end or at the beginning of a word, and one wild card tile which can be used for any letter. These tiles can only be used once in the game.
When the sand timer runs out, any player can announce that they are drawing an additional card. All other players must then also draw another card. After a player shouts “stop”, the sand timer is started one last time. The other players may try to improve their word in that time. The round ends when the timer runs through again. Players mark their words on a score sheet – the longer a word is, the more points are awarded.
Play three rounds. Deduct points for unused cards, get bonus points for unused tiles. The player with the highest combined score wins.

There's a significant learning curve involved: The more experienced you get the faster you will play. That's when the sand timer kicks in and becomes a tactical element: You can decide whether to rush to a solution or to trigger the next drawing right before your counterpart(s) can finish and conclude the round.

NOTE: The present version Wortwiesel (2023) is designed for German language. Based on the combination of letters and letter frequencies, it ist not directly playable in most other languages.
NOTE by Author: Other language versions are in preparation

name: Time Guardian Adventures: Chaos auf dem Mond
description:
Dr. Maxwell Mayhem has travelled back in time to 1969 and prevented the moon landing of the "Apollo XI" mission. The course of history then went completely off the rails, and now Mayhem not only controls the largest rocket manufacturer in the world, but also considers the moon his property.

But that's not all! With his giant bulldozers, he had an image of his face carved into the surface of the moon, so that you can't look up at the sky at night without seeing Mayhem's grinning visage. And no one knows what this megalomaniac will do next!

Time Guardians, the world is counting on you! Travel back to 1969 in the time machine. Undo Mayhem's manipulations. Put history back on track!

name: Aeon‘s End: Resonanz-Stein Promo
description:
German version of the Echo Stone promo.

Echo Stone is a gem that allows players to gain an additional aether on their turn if they have played another Echo Stone in the same turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die ewige Kälte – Der magische Sturm
description:
Single card expansion for Legends 2-4 of The Legends of Andor: The Eternal Frost.

When it comes into play, it temporary changes the function of some ice tiles.

name: Five by Five
description:
In this easy-to-learn game, you attempt to manipulate dice on a shared board to achieve your objectives. The game is pretty straightforward as you fulfill objectives to get points and the most points at the end of the game is the winner. Throughout the game, you'll play action cards to place and manipulate dice on a board in an effort to complete your objectives. At the same time, others may have conflicting objectives and may end up altering your gameplan. Once the board fills up, the game is over and the person with the most points wins.

The game is great for gamers and non-gamers alike as it's pretty quick to pick up and play. The dice mechanics make sure that the game is different each time, however. There's plenty of strategy and many different ways to play your turns.

—description from the publisher

name: Midnight Market
description: The Midnight Market is a big event in the middle of the night where evil spirits of rivers and mountains walk around. Now, now, tonight, too, unusual guests are coming to the market for special products. You are a merchant who dreams of becoming a millionaire. Your job is to sell your goods at the highest possible price. But beware, in a pitch-dark marketplace, merchants don't know what each other has in store. Some unscrupulous merchants may take advantage of this and participate in the bidding with the aim of lowering the price even if they do not have the product that the customer is looking for. Will you be able to win the midnight market and become a millionaire?

name: Crime Files Adventskalender – Fallakte: Selbstfindung mit Todesfolge
description:
An internationally acclaimed author vanishes during a journey to Europe. The players' task is to find out what's behind his disappearance. They have 24 days - and each day, new clues are revealed.

The box contains 24 envelopes with mysterious items and new evidence. Each day brings you one step closer to solve the case.

name: Sync or Swim: Promo Routine Cards
description:
Available: https://beziergames.com/collections/all-games/products/sync-...
Cards 1-5 for each routine. (25 cards)

5 additional routines originally included in the kickstarter version of the game:


Splash Showdown
H2 Open
Fishy Finals
Tidal Tournament
Synchrolympics

name: Mindreader: Der thelepathische Partyspaß mit den WIRKLICH heißen Fragen
description:
In this part game for 3-12 players, ages 16 and up, the players have to guess the answers to questions from the categories "Sexy Time", "Criminal Funny" and "Fun and Facts".

Another player draws a card, reads one of the two questions out loud and writes down their assessment. The other players assess what the questioner answered. Whoever is closest gets a point.

name: Velocirapture
description:
A comet speeds toward the earth. When it collides, you and every other dinosaur you know will die. But talking about it is “a bummer” and “we don’t want to think about that right now” and “why are you like this”, and after all it is game night.

In Velocirapture, you play as dinos playing Human Games while waiting for The End. Each dino’s unique Coping Mechanism prevents them from thinking too hard about their mortality. Xoe Allred brings a characteristic playfulness and charm to this experimental and delightfully meta party game made up of three dozen small games that are by turns surprising, compelling, irreverent, and perplexing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Area Majority / Influence, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Communication Limits, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, I Cut, You Choose, Matching, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Real-Time, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Take That

name: IRK
description:
Play cards and create connected clusters that match the colors you've played in your Scoring Pile. Block and disrupt opponents' patterns to tank their scores. Determine player majorities for each color/symbol then reward points based on Clusters in the Center Area.

The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: My First Adventure: Argonuts
description:
Today, you’re going to live a mythical odyssey!
Today, you’re setting off to find the helmet of the legendary Jason!

Which hero do you want to be for this adventure?
SAM
PATTIE
CHICKOS
Make the right choices! In this exceptional story, each of your choices will affect your adventure!

Choose your character and enter a story like no other, a story where each of your choices changes your adventure!

Argonuts is the 10th book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Children's Game, Civilization, Exploration, Mythology

name: Ghost Peppers
description:
Ghost Peppers is made up of several matches. In each match, players will be drafting the peppers, drinks, and ghost powers that they will use during the match. Players will then take turns giving their opponent peppers to cool until one player can’t cool their pepper. Whoever wins the match gets a trophy token. The first person to get two trophies wins the game!

—description from the designer

name: DCeased: A Zombicide Game
description:
Protect Earth from the Anti-Life Virus and its hosts in this epic DC Universe Zombicide game!

Not even the most powerful Super Heroes in the universe are safe from the the Anti-Life Equation, a techno-organic virus that quickly spread around the world’s digital networks. The Justice League has been torn apart (quite literally) and now former enemies join forces as old allies must be put down before they can sow even more destruction. So, assemble you Super Hero team, muster all the power you can, and stand against the DCeased!

DCeased – A Zombicide Game is a cooperative game were 1 to 6 players control the last uninfected Super Heroes facing off against Zombie Heroes and the zombie hordes controlled by the game itself.

The goal is to complete Mission Objectives, defeat the Enemies, and rescue Bystanders. Eliminating zombies gives you the experience needed to become an even more powerful Super Hero. But the stronger you are, the more zombies appear to hunt you down! Only by working together and pushing their powers to the limit can the Super Heroes hope to put an end to the Anti-Life threat!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, DC, Guillotine Games, Spin Master Ltd.

name: That's You
description:
Are you the nerd, the jock, the princess, or the weirdo of the group? You'll find out in That’s You, a simple game about letting your friends know exactly what you think about them.

In this game, a Clue Giver will be secretly assigned one out of six traits on the table that she will have to indicate to the other players. The Clue Giver must clue in the other players by indicating which among them are the most likely and least likely to be associated with the trait.
