Wsiąść do Pociągu: Komorów is based on Ticket to Ride Märklin Edition rules, but it's a little bit expanded. Generally all rules are the same (like in the TTR:ME) with one exception. There are four special "WKD" routes. When claiming such route the player has to throw a D6 dice and draw the corresponding number of cards from the deck. Now analogously to the tunnels, the player has to discard from his hand the adequate number of cards.

This game is made available as a print and play expansion for Ticket to Ride and may not be produced for commercial reasons.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Lützen: 16 November 1632 – Gustavus Adolphus' Last Battle
description:
Part of the Thirty Years War quad, covering the Battle of Lützen, 16 November 1632, between the Swedes and the Imperialists, during which the Swedish king Gustavus Adolphus was killed. Also published separately as a Folio game.

17"x22" map, 100 counters.

name: Super Secret Stealthy Spies
description:
Super Secret Stealthy Spies is a fast-paced, easy-to learn strategy game of big moves. You have four spies who need to leave your home base and enter the field on a very important mission. Covertly move through parks, buildings, and subways and be the first to infiltrate the rival bases! Use the subway entrances to travel to other subway spaces. Use parks as cover to travel several spaces in one turn. Mix up the game board tiles for a different game each time. a little luck and a lot of stealth will help you to win this spy game. Includes 12 Game Tiles, 4 Home Bases, 1 Subway Die, 1 Rules Sheet, and 16 Spy Movers in four different colors.

From the publisher

name: Boss Monster: Dragon Prince Hero Pack
description:
A pre-order bonus for The Dragon Prince: Battlecharged, by Brotherwise Games.
Pack was also included in the February 2022 issue of Tabletop Gaming Magazine.

Pack contains 8 cards:

4 Hero cards (Amaya, Callum, Ezra & Rayla)
3 Epic Hero cards (Claudia, Soren & Viren)
1 Boss card (Aaravos)


This pack was also given out by Brotherwise at their booth at Gen Con 2022. Also included in the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Babylon 5: A Sky Full of Stars
description:
From the Publisher:

Sky Full of Stars is a major supplement for the A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat space combat game. Within these jam-packed pages, you will find rules updates, new rules, advanced fleet lists, many new scenarios and a revised campaign system. Everything the Call to Arms player needs to take his fleet into the next war!

New Rules
Including rules for Boarding Actions, Planetary Assaults, Space Stations, Famous Commanders and much more.

Advanced Fleet Lists
Many new ships grace these fleet lists, both variants of existing hull designs and some brand new ships (such as the dreaded Shadow Omega). In addition, the League of Non-Aligned Worlds have now been split so you can field independent fleets, and the White Star has been revised to become born again hard!

New Scenarios
As well as a great many new tactical challenges, included are many scenarios based on the TV series, allowing you to fight out the conflicts that took place on the screen - will you do better?

BOX SET OWNERS: If you own the original A Call to Arms box set (as opposed to the new Revised Edition), all you need to fully update to the new rules set is this book - you do NOT need the Revised box set as well.

Expands:

A Call to Arms: Babylon 5 Space Combat
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tacticum
description:
Are you ready to lead your Legionnaires?!

According to the Gamealogical Institute History Department (wink, wink), this strategy game is derived from teaching methods used in the development of new Centurion Candidates in the far reaches of the north-west during the Late Roman empire.

Protect your flanks, master the use of the column and square formations and prove to the Training cadre that you are ready to lead. This is a 2 player strategy game with very dynamic play; particularly as columns and square formations can break up and new ones be formed as you direct individual units on the battle field.

Tacticum includes multiple play setups known as "training scenarios". Additional scenarios are added to the Gamealogical Institute website.

name: En Pointe Toujours !: Guadalcanal
description:
En Pointe Toujours !: Guadalcanal is a module for En Pointe Toujours ! series.

En Pointe Toujours !: Guadalcanal includes:
- two A4 (GA, GB) maps - 29,7x21 cm
- two A2 (01, 02) overlays
- 108 die-cut counters
- One 24 pages rules and scenarios booklet

The game features WW2 Tactical Warfare in the Pacific, with five different scenarios:

Tanambogo (3 scenarios campaign )
Tasimboko
Matanikau


In each one, the first player is in charge of US soldiers, the other one plays the Japanese.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Penny Farthing Catapult
description:
You are well-mannered nobles settling grievances in the time-honored tradition: Dueling catapults attached to old-timey bicycles, launching wealth at each other!

Your goal is to hit and collect valuable items from the track. Unfortunately, your catapult is so rickety, it moves backwards the same distance that you launched!

Try to stay out of range of your opponent's catapults, because if you’re hit, you lose one of your valuables!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Humor, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Dice Brewing: Upgrade Kit
description:
If you have first edition of Dice Brewing and you don't want to buy second edition of this game, but still you are interested in changes and new components, we have a special set of elements for you.
We have decided to prepare a Dice Brewing: Upgrade kit, where you can find 4 new player boards (bigger ones and with new rule about getting the blue die) and 3 sets of tokens. All new materials are high quality, well made (with exacly the same materials as basic, second edition of Dice Brewing) and of course they are an effect of players comments for the first edition of Dice Brewing.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Kingrunner
description:
Kingrunner is a card-driven board game about running a marathon. During the first part of the game, the players "train", which means they draft cards that will be used during the second part, the "run". During the latter part, each players has a hand of three cards, plays one - which usually moves him on the racing track on the board, and draws a card. Each player has three attributes: speed, form and psyche.

The game was designed through Polish crowdfunding platforms, with support of Polish Internet portals for fans of running.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

description:
Game description from the publisher:

This (2016) is a very special year for GRANNA - we are celebrating our 25th anniversary! Throughout all this time we have tried to provide all of you with the best games - the kind we would like to play ourselves. We would like you to celebrate this very special anniversary together with us. For this occasion we have prepared a little surprise. Open the box and enter the land of good games. Thank you for being with us!

The game 25 consists of a deck of 54 double-faced cards. They show pieces of the covers of 6 games published by Granna. Each cover picture is divided into 6 pieces. Each card's 2 sides show pieces from the same position of 2 different cover pictures. Each specific piece of a cover appears on 3 different cards in the deck. In a 2-player game, the goal is to make 2 complete pictures on the table. With 3 and 4 players, the goal is to make 1 complete picture on the table and collect 1 piece each of the 5 other pictures.

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Dig & Write Game
description:
This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a postcard expansion with a dig & write variant game.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

name: Los nietos de Frankenstein
description:
Roll the dice to get the different parts of your Franky: head, trunk, legs, arms, brain, heart and bring them to life with lightning! Is the missing piece not available? Well, maybe you can snatch it from another player. Use the tiles to save your created monsters and become Grandpa Frank's favorite grandson. A fast, simple and fun game for the whole family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Tumult
description:
"I know 3.029e+30 ways to drive you crazy."

Dive into the tumult and test yourself against the game and your friends in this frantic rush to prevent the disintegration of an otherwise nice and comely family. (Yeah, right...)

Tumult is a speed-puzzler that utilizes a random puzzle-generator mechanism to reach as many as 3.029e+30 different puzzles. All players solve the same puzzle simultaneously and compare results when time has run out. Every mistake causes tears, and whoever has caused the fewest tears at the end of a certain number of rounds wins.

Tumult reimplements Uluru/Pelican Cove, with some notable differences in the card set and gameplay. The physical and thematic design is also new; one particular improvement is that Tumult is playable even if you are colorblind!

name: Les Bâtisseurs: Moyen-Âge – L'officine Tric Trac
description:
A special set of cards with a Tric Trac theme.

Three workers :

Monsieur Node
Docteur Mops
Monsieur Phal


One building :

l'Officine Tric Trac.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: Marble Pursuit
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: Lemming
description: Lemming is a reverse-race game, wherein players attempt to have their lemmings go over the cliff last. Movement is conducted through the play of cards; the movement of one lemming can cause a series of additional movements through jostling.

name: Cannae
description:
Massive simulation of the battle of Cannae (216 BC) between Romans and Carthaginians. It has three maps and 1200 counters, of which approximately 800 are combat units.

Roman legions are represented in some detail; each legion and wing contains 40 counters - 10 each of triarii, princeps, hastati, and velites.

The sequence of play is fairly traditional. There are 32 turns, each representing 15 minutes. Because of the short turn length units generally take losses in 25% increments.

There are superior and subordinate leaders. Subordinates must be within the command range of a superior to function. Leaders give combat bonuses and also improve the morale checks of units in their command ranges.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Etc.
description:
etc. : The Game of Abbreviation

The reader will give you a letter combination... like DH, and a clue. It is up to you to solve the clue, and if you do, you get the points, which are scattered across the table.

For example, if the letter combination is "DH", the clues read might be:
1. A miniature dwelling for toy people (Doll house)
2. He bats but doesn't play the field (Designated Hitter)
3. Skiing that's faster than cross-country (Downhill)
... etc...

Each player takes a turn at being the reader. First person to 50 points wins.

name: Championship Drag Racing: 2005 Funny Car Edition
description:
From the publisher's description:

"Re-live the excitement of the 2005 Funny Car Season. The 2005 Season was one of the closest Points races in the history of the sport. The top 3 drivers were separated by a mere 32 points, and the top 10 in points were separated by an amazing 442 points."

"Anything that can happen in a real life drag racing event; can and will happen with the same frequency in Championship Drag Racing. Drivers will red-light, have tremendous reaction times, blow up their engines, and even crash with the same frequency as the year represented. And as with any replay game that is worth its salt there are allowances made within the confines of realistic frequency for ANYTHING to truly happen."

"In general, your results will be very close to the on-the-track action of the season represented. However, keep in mind, that this game simulates hundreds of variables that can occur in any race. As with any sport, sometimes pure luck can be the deciding factor. That’s no exception with Championship Drag Racing. On the whole, you’ll experience very realistic results. But, within the confines of a single qualifying run or elimination race, anything can truly happen!"

"Championship Drag Racing: Funny Car Edition gives you every Funny Car Racer that made a qualifying attempt in 2005. You also get all 23 circuits rated by lane making the lane choice strategy just as important as real life. A full schedule, complete points standings, complete final ladders for each event, as well as a list of drivers that attempted to make every field are included."

name: Κατασκήνωση Στα Μέτρα Σου!
description:
Players in this game try to build the best children's Summer Camp in a period of 3 years. They do that by selecting location cards (using a draft mechanism) and placing them in front of them, next to already placed cards.

Each location scores a number of points when built, according to its ability (and where it is placed). At the end of the 3 years, whoever has the most points is the winner.

This game was published in Greece in 2011 for a Greek christian organization ("Saint Basil the Great"), in order to be given to the children of its Sunday Schools.


Στο παιχνίδι αυτό οι παίκτες προσπαθούν να χτίσουν την καλύτερη παιδική κατασκήνωση σε διάστημα 3 ετών. Για να το κάνουν αυτό χρησιμοποιούν κάρτες με τοποθεσίες τις οποίες και τοποθετούν μπροστά τους, τη μία δίπλα στην άλλη.

Κάθε τοποθεσία όταν κατασκευάζεται δίνει κάποιους πόντους, ανάλογα με το που θα μπει και το τι ιδιότητα έχει. Στο τέλος των 3 χρόνων, όποιος έχει τους περισσότερους πόντους κερδίζει.

Το παιχνίδι εκδόθηκε την άνοιξη του 2011 από το σύλλογο "Ο Μέγας Βασίλειος" για να δοθεί στα παιδιά των κατηχητικών σχολείων του.

name: Santiago de Cuba: La revolución
description:
One card expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba

name: Lost Legacy: Merchant of Mystery (promo)
description:
The Merchant of Mystery is a single Promo card given out at Game Market 2014 in Japan.

His ability reads:

Play: Look at all cards in the Ruins, take one into your hand.
Trash: if there are 4 or more cards in the ruins, this card's number becomes 15.

name: When Tigers Fight: Tiger of China
description:
In this alternate history, Nazi Germany and Japan were victorious in WW II have turned on each other to start WWW III in 1948.

A small German force helped by Indians attack the Japanese in China. They enter through west and north China or via airlanding, naval movement.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Game
description: The modestly named The Game, billed as "The Superior Game of chance & skill" and "more exciting than backgammon", is played on a circular grid with numbered spaces. Players roll the dice and move pieces of their own as dictated by the results, trying to capture the pieces of other players. A player with no remaining pieces is out of the game, but until that happens, eliminated pieces can be brought back into the game by rolling doubles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Glenn Drover's Empires: Galactic Rebellion Revenge or Redemption Expansion
description:
Expansion for Empires: Galactic Rebellion

Includes:

16 Playing Cards (8 Covert Mission and 8 Imperial Action)
1 Punch board (with 10 VP tokens and 6 new Tech Tiles)
Rules -- either 4 or 6 pages with pics of cards and explanations

name: Smack Talk Showdown
description:
Description from the publisher:

Smack Talk Showdown is the party game where smack talking your opponents is not only encouraged, it's necessary! The game is all about the art of the wrestling promo. Two players assume the guise of professional wrestlers and go head-to-head for verbal supremacy while a third player dictates the action as a Producer. Everyone not competing in the current turn (which we call a Segment) is the Audience and gets to choose the victor of the round!

When a round starts, each Wrestler draws one name card from each of the two Name card decks. This is their wrestling persona. The Producer then draws a Segment card. This tells the Wrestlers where they are and what they are fighting about. The Producer then draws three Smack cards to play on either Wrestler during their promo. These cards dictate the action and can be played on either Wrestler during their promos.Each Wrestler has 45 seconds to cut their promo. After which, the Audience votes for the victor. If only three people are playing, the Producer decides.

name: Dinomals
description:
Dinomals: the action packed, mix and match, create a creature card game made by kids for kids!

Your goal: make a Dinomal!

Dinomals are half dinosaur and half modern day animal. Get the right dinosaur card and animal card and smush them together to make your Dinomal before your opponents. You can also mess with your opponents hand to stop them from building a Dinomal with SLAM cards!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Memory

name: Race for Manila: The Philippines Campaign, 1941-42
description: This is a small wargame of the Philippines campaign from December 1941 to January 1942, included in "This Sim-Game is Awsome! 2012", an annual zine of wargame review.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: HeroTec: Job Insecurity
description:
Bring HeroTec to more (and less!) players. Job Insecurity is a 6-card expansion with rules for solo and 3-4 player games.

Contents:

Mini Reactor (gadget)
Trash Vest (costume)
Shiftcycle (vehicle)
Grab Crab (vehicle)
Fortress of Aloneness (lair)
Sewer Lair (lair)



Released in the February 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Enemy at the Gates: Battle for Moscow 1941
description: Enemy at the Gates: Battle for Moscow 1941 is a two-player game of the Operation Typhoon.

name: The Battle of Sacile, 16 April 1809
description: "The Battle of Sacile, 16 April 1809" is a free Print & Play Tactical level board-wargame simulating the battle fought on 16 April 1809 that saw an Austrian army commanded by Archduke John of Austria defeat a Franco-Italian army led by Eugène de Beauharnais and force it to retreat. Sacile proved to be the most notable victory of John's career. The action took place east of the Livenza River near Sacile in modern-day Italy during the War of the Fifth Coalition, part of the Napoleonic Wars.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: September Storm: The Invasion of Poland
description:
"September Storm: The Invasion of Poland" is a 2-player wargame of the September 1939 German invasion of Poland, which signaled the start of World War II. The game covers the period from September first to the 17th when the Soviet Union invaded Poland from the East.

As a "solitaire" game, the human player controls the Polish side and rules marked “solitaire” supposedly "control" the German side, but they are only loose guidelines and require the human to make decisions; it is essentially soloing both sides of a 2-player wargame.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Nusfjord: Expansion Pack #1
description:
Nusfjord: Expansion Collection #1 consists of the previously released Plaice and Salmon expansion decks.

Any of these decks can be used to replace the three base game decks of Nusfjord according to the established rules.

Both decks come in a set within a new box size, offering enough space to hold both decks (2 x 44 cards), two elder cards and 35 wooden coins.

ATTENTION: This set is meant to cater to players who already own Nusfjord base game.
Both expansions (Plaice deck and Salmon deck) are included in the new Nusfjord Big Box (2024).

name: Fly Further
description:
The far future. The First Space Republic gathers an expedition to colonize the Andromeda galaxy. With representatives of all races, the intergalactic ship Ark sets out to explore new planets.
In the game Fly Further players will have to colonize different planets. Each has its conditions for victory points.
Discovering a new planet, players will secretly decide - to build a colony or a mine on it or to fly further to restore their energy. All 18 races of colonists have their special abilities, and the more effectively you use them, the more chances you have to win!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Butterfly Effect: A solitaire weather deduction game for rainy days.
description:
You love to look at the clouds. You always have.
They call you a dreamer. Don't listen!
One day they'll know what you are:
A true expert in your field!

The weather is represented by a small deck of cards. Each card shows a weather (sunny, cloudy, rainy or windy).
On turn, you assign one of your forecast tokens to any of the four weather types and flip the top card of the deck.
If you're wrong, you lose the token.
To win the game you have to forecast the weather correctly seven times in a row.

- Are you joking? That's random! You're just guessing!
You'd better not tell a meteorologist!

But of course there is more to it...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Palam
description:
The game is a duel based on pawns which have different symbols drawn and in different numbers.

Each player has 12 pawns distributed randomly (or not, to be chosen at the start) in 2 lines of 6, slightly offset from each other. On one side of the board is a sign representing the "even" and on the other the "odd".

On your turn, either you advance a pawn to provoke the other into a duel, or you swap two pawns on your side. If one player swaps, the other must cause a duel immediately afterwards. During a duel, the other must respond by advancing a pawn that has the same symbol (but in a different number) or the same number of drawings (but it is the drawing of another symbol) or if it does not can't, the leftmost pawn in his game. The total number of drawings represented in duel is counted. If it is even, the one with the pawn closest to the even sign wins the two pawns, if it is odd, the one with the pawn closest to the odd sign wins the two pawns..

4 particular pawns have a light background. These are the key pieces to capture to win. They are worth 11 points, the others are only worth 1 point.
Whoever has the most points at the end of the 12 duels wins.

name: Sports Dice: Hockey
description:
Roll into the action in this easy to learn and quick to play dice game for 2 or 4 players. Sports Dice: Hockey includes all the drama of a real game. Shoot your puck at the net and reach beat the goalie to score. Try to stop the opposing team by checking and preventing them from entering your defensive zone.

Win the initial faceoff at center ice and push your team to the offensive zone. The closer you are to the goaltender, the better. Shoot at the net and beat the goalie die's number to score!

Both team simultaneously roll all their dice. The symbol that appears the most on each team’s set of dice becomes their play. The team that rolled the most dice with the same symbol wins the roll. Apply the outcome of the winning play by moving the puck accordingly. See the Dice chart for a description of each symbol.

The game ends when Game ends after 15 shots at the goa. That team is victorious!

—description from the publisher

name: Numbers League: Dinosaurs Expansion
description:
Super Hero Dinosaurs have come to Infinity City! This Expansion deck is to be added to the original Numbers League game. It adds 30 new cards to the base game. Included in this expansion is:

21 heroes building cards(or when placed together 7 new heroes)
6 devices cards and
6 new villains

Note: Expansion needs the base game, it does not stand on its own. For more information on how this game plays, please see base game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math

name: Das Spiel mit der Schlange
description: Das Spiel mit der Schlange is a limited edition (1,111 copies) expansion for Sternenhimmel, released at Essen in 1995. The Serpent (Schlange) is always the last constellation played.

name: Hanau 1813
description:
Simulates the abortive attempt on 30 October 1813 by the Austro-Bavarians under Wrede to prevent Napoleon's escape from Germany after the defeat at Leipzig, by blocking him near Frankfurt in Hessen. Uses an early, lower-complexity version of Didier Rouy's Vive l'Empereur! tactical system, which employs roster sheets and oblong counters to simulate formation changes between line and column. The battle is fought at regimental level on an attractive mounted mapboard (55x41cm) at a scale of 250m per hex, and in 30-minute game turns. Losses are recorded on roster sheets, and the rules, in French, are of medium complexity (12 pages of system rules and an 8-page scenario booklet).

Game System:
scale = 250 m/hex;
time = 30 min/GT;
strength = 600 men/SP (Regimental/Brigade Size)

name: Spelljammer: War Captain's Companion
description:
This is a ship-to-ship combat game that was published as an expansion to the AD&D campaign setting Spelljammer. The game is set in outer space, but the ships and rules are much like you'd expect in a traditional naval combat game like Wooden Ships & Iron Men. The added dimension is that ships generally come with mages that can fire off many spells. Rules are included for ramming, boarding, over 25 types of missile and small arms weapons, and lots of magic.

Components include rules for ship-to-ship combat, two large hex maps, and over 30 cardboard punch-out ships.

name: Scarabs & Scorpions
description:
What did all those laborers of the great Egyptian monuments do with their time off? Just like us, they played games!

This exciting dice game is a race to the best score. Will the ancient Atum bless you with many Scarabs or will you be plagued by the Scorpions of Hedetet?

Players roll the dice trying for special scoring combinations, but, just when you think you have a good score, another player rolls the Scorpion die! Will you be Stung?

name: Munchkin Quest: Promo Cards
description:
User Summary

This is a catch-all entry for various Munchkin Quest promo cards that have been handed out at various cons, release events, and by MiB. Most of these cards are not released with any set and are/were only available as promotional items at events. The six hexahedron cards were included with the correspondingly colored Jumbo D6 Dice now OOP that SJG produced circa 2011.

Part of the Munchkin series
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Mein erster Lernspielzoo
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Mein erster Lernspielzoo, Zookeeper Tim and his curious animals are ready to play with you! Twenty-five wooden play figures and ten different games make up this beautiful and big HABA educational games collection. Find animals by touch; help the giraffe detectives or search for the colorful chameleons. Ten educational topics vary from counting, concentration and memory skills to quantities, tactile skills and color/shape recognition. All wooden pieces are made from sustainable forests.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Memory, Number

name: Dr. Boom
description: Dr. Boom is a 2-5 player variant of Two Rooms and a Boom, which requires at least six players. Dr. Boom is a wallet-sized, take-with-you-anywhere game of social deduction. One player is the President who needs to let the real Doctor into his/her office. Careful! If the President chooses the nefarious Dr. Boom, the end result is explosive failure.

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Blitzmania Special Play Promo Cards
description:
A set of 5 limited edition Special Play cards provided during the Feb-March 2017 Blitzmania League.


Heel Turn,
It's all to play for!
They think its all Ogre?!
Blitzmania Mania!
Pampered Players!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Grimslingers: Collector's Card Pack
description:
Contains two exclusive characters cards, Icarus the Iron Witch and Lord Briar, as well as three sets of light and dark element cards. The light and dark elements will add more variety and strategies to your duels. Can be used with Grimslingers and Grimslingers: Duels.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Unsolved Case Files: ​Buddy Edmunds
description:
In the small backwoods town of Jethro, Texas on April 3rd, 1989, Buddy Edmunds—owner of Big Daddy’s Used Car Lot—was brutally murdered in his own living room.

Candy Edmunds, his bride of only three months, was wrongly convicted of his murder and spent the past 30 years of her life behind bars for a crime she didn’t commit.

Your job is to get Candy released from prison and figure out who really killed Buddy. Do you have what it takes to crack this unsolved case file?

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First prove why the convicted woman must be innocent. Then disprove a key suspect's alibi and finally identify the clue that will close this case for good. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

name: Huddle Up
description:
In this game, each player begins by spreading their neighboring player's penguins on the 61-hexagon board (which has 7 holes in it).

Later each player tries to gather their own penguins in one group. On their turn, a player will move a penguin to an adjacent space or jump over one or more other penguins. If a penguin lands on one of the holes, it will emerge from another hole if possible.

name: Hordes: High Command – Elemental Rage
description:
Bolster your armies with Elemental Rage, the second expansion for Hordes: High Command!

Elemental Rage contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warlock cards, to bring new strategies to your Trollblood, Circle Orboros, Skorne, and Legion of Everblight decks.

Requires HORDES High Command core set to play.

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Tödliches Alpenglühen
description:
What a schock: The jaunty Franz lies battered to death behind the barn.
Has he found a poacher out? Was it the jealous Resi? Or had he to die, because he was on the track of the saturnine family secrets?

name: No Good Gremlins
description:
It's Rocket Festival in Junktown! This is the time of year when the mayor awards medals to everyday folks for building and launching rockets using the abundant scrap lying around town. Everyone loves Rocket Festival, but no one loves it more than those hungry little gremlins. That's because there are tons of tasty rockets to munch! As soon as you think you have a prize-winning rocket, a horde of ravenous gremlins just might sweep through and leave you with nothing! So launch those rockets fast, because when the festival ends, whoever has the best medal collection wins!

No Good Gremlins is a family card game for two to five players. Use your turn to start construction on new rockets or build up the ones you already have. Completed rockets can be launched for points, but the bigger the rocket, the more points it will earn. Be careful though! The longer you wait to launch a rocket, the greater the chance it will be eaten by gremlins.

name: L-Tiles
description:
Join tiles edge to edge to expand your territory and finally turn your areas into victory points
Watch out though, making your areas too big detracts from your score and can even lead to losing points
Can you keep your areas at just the right size to get the highest score?
It's a territory control game with concise rules and interesting dilemmas

name: Hydras
description:
Hydras is a quick and easy card game with elements of tile laying games and some "take that" mechanics. The game is for 2-4 players, takes about 5 minutes to teach, and around 15-30 minutes to play.

Each player starts with a hydra body card and takes turns playing and drawing cards. Cards can be played on their own hydras to build up their defenses, thwart or undo their opponent's attacks, and increase the number of heads on their hydra. They can also be played to attack your opponent's hydras by cutting off heads or burning stumps.

The game ends when the deck runs out. The player with the most heads at the end of the game wins!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Inuyasha: Das Action Würfelspiel
description:
Japan in the Middle Ages. The world of Inuyasha is full dangers and adventures. Demons and creatures are in possession of the mysterious jewels.

Each player is armed with a set of unusual and varied dice to fight the monsters and demons to gain possession of the jewels.

Each set comes with six demon cards to fight over, but there are more than six different demons - it is not known if those in each set are random or if there are defined groups of six.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cosmic Domination
description:
A game of galactic struggle for 3-6 players (with variants for two player and solo play) by Thomas Staudt. The battle mechanism is taken from Button Men with kind permission by James Ernest.

Players represent the leaders of alien races battling for survival and supremacy in a system of six inhabitable planets. Eradicate your enemies, or simply suppress them with your superior numbers.
Each alien race has their specific powers and limitations that define their viable strategies.
Choose your fights and battle them out using lots of 6, 8, 10, 12 and 20 sided dice.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Tá na Mesa
description: Tá na Mesa is a game about a cooking contest between famous chefs who must prepare traditional dishes. To prepare a dish, one must collect the required ingredient cards, then combine dishes to achieve the best presentation in order to win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: My Little First Sale
description:
Have fun at the school festival !

Join the exciting school fair and take part in the grand mission, with students acting as little merchants selling premium stationary, from pricing, store layout, to marketing! Who will take the no.1 winning spot at the school fair? Time to give it all you’ve got at My Little First Sale!

Before starting the game every player receives their own player board which is their shop, player screen and item cards. Open the customer cards and place them in a row on the table. They are students who come to buy things in each player's shop.

Every player places an item card on their player board. He can set the selling price and the attractiveness of the items sold by placing ranking cards. The Player screen will help keep the placement of cards secret.

When everyone is ready we will remove the player screen and start selling. The customers lined up on the table go one by one to buy the items they want. The customer will see which store sells the item he or she wants at the cheapest price. If there are two shops with the same price, The customer will look at the attractiveness of the item.

The game is played over 4 rounds and the player who earns the most money from sales wins the game.

-description from graphic designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, End Game Bonuses, Income, Set Collection

name: Railway Rivals Map CH: China
description: Railway Rivals Map CH: China, a map for use with both Railway Rivals and Dampfross, covers from Shenyang in the northeast, the Mongolian border in the northwest, the Laos/Vietnamese border in the southwest, and the Pacific Ocean in the southeast/east.

name: Blue Chip
description:
Blue Chip (also published as Dow Jones) is a very simplistic stock market game with an interesting twist (sliding pegboards). There are 12 companies divided into Industrials (such as GM), Railroads (such as Union Pacific), and Utilities (such as AT&T). There are four of each type, and each type has a peg board of a different primary color.

On your turn you may take one and only one action. An action is either buying or selling stock in one company. (You don't have to sell all when you sell.)

When you buy stock in a company, you move its individual peg up one, two or three spaces depending on how many shares you buy. Likewise when you sell: you move the stock price down one, two, or three spaces.

After each action, draw a card and see what happens. Many of the cards refer to the stock just transacted: a split, or all players holding the stock collect a dividend, or are assessed a fine, or the company goes bankrupt, etc. (Yes, it's as fierce as the dot.coms a few years ago: five of the twelve companies will be bankrupt by the game's end!)

Other cards are general and refer to the whole board. Sometimes you roll dice which affect all industrials or railroads or utilities. In that case, you slide the whole peg board for that particular color up or down as necessary. There are dice in three colors with sides of +2, +4, +6, -2, -4, -6 on them.

name: Imperialism
description:
According to Sid Sacksons - A Gamut of Games: Travel accross the sea to establish colonies. Die throws indicate the wealth potential, which can be used for armies and fleets; or for ports, cities, and fortifications, which are marked by grease pencil on the plastic surface.

Flying Buffalo published three versions of the game. The first had linoleum counters and hand-cut cards, details otherwise unknown. The second had cardboard counters and machine-cut cards (both somewhat crude), and came in a white box with a pasted-on cover sheet. The third had more professional components and came in a red printed box.

The game was later published by Gametime Games in a revised form as Grand Imperialism.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: La Guerre d'Indochine, Tonkin 1950-1954
description:
This game simulates combats in Tonkin (north of french Indochina), 1950 to 1954.
One player controls the "Corps Expéditionnaire Français (CEF)" - French expeditionary Corps - in far east, the other player controls Vietminh (VM) forces.
Each turn represents 4 months.
182 counters.

Very simple game, 3 pages rule book (in French), one page history analysis.

name: Grands Stratèges
description: This ones´s a game to learn "strategic components". It isn't based on an historic conflict, but you can learn about moving and acting in different scenarios with Infantry, Artillery and Cavalry units from the 18th/19th century

name: Operation Compass & Wavell's 30,000 (Special Edition Critical Hit Magazine)
description:
Critical Hit's long awaited SPECIAL EDITION of CH Magazine, the Operation Compass & Wavell's 30,000 issue. How did the 'Desert Rats' of O'Connor's Western Desert Force, consisting of 7th Armoured Division (minus a brigade), a support group of two regiments of Royal Horse Artillery, and two motor battalions, do it? The story is laid before you, from the Italian invasion of Egypt to the dramatic ambush at Beda Fomm in the pages of Critical Hit Magazine's Operation Compass & Wavell's 30,000 SPECIAL EDITION. In one of the most memorable campaigns of World War II the British defeated the Italians in Egypt, Libya and Cyrenaica in the last weeks of 1940 and early 1941. The magazine includes a full historical map and 22 scenarios.

Note: the map edition of the magazine is sold out and out of print. The magazine is available with 19 scenarios.

name: Tygrysy w śniegu
description:
Tygrysy w śniegu (Tigers in the Snow) is about battles fought on foregrounds of Kharkov during winter 1942-1943.

The game uses rules of the B35 (Battles of World War II 1943-1945) system designed for dealing with medium battles of World War II. Counters represent battalions (Germans) or regiments (Russians), one hex represents 1500m, one turn represents 12 hours.

name: Tenjiku Shogi
description:
Tenjiku Shogi (天竺将棋 tenjiku shōgi, or 天竺大将棋 tenjiku dai shōgi "exotic chess") is a large-board variant of shogi (Japanese chess). The game dates back to the 15th or 16th century and was based on the earlier chu shogi, which itself was based on dai shogi.

Tenjiku is played on a 16x16 un-checkered board.

Surely, Tenjiku Shogi is one of the deeper and most interesting large Shogi variant. While based on Chu Shogi (Middle Shogi), Tenjiku boasts a menagerie of wonderfully powerful pieces which make it a far more dynamic and fast paced game than the other large variants. It really stands out from the other great Shogi variants and deserves its name of "exotic". The exotic pieces include range jumpers which can jump over any number of pieces in order make a capture, and the Fire Demon which can "burn" all enemy pieces on the squares adjacent to where it lands!

Unlike in most other Shogi variants, tactics in Tenjiku are critical right from the first move of the game. Despite the large board, the power of the pieces can mean that careless play is rewarded with a lost game in only a few moves.

name: Elevation of Privilege Card Game
description:
The Elevation of Privilege Card Game is a game released by Microsoft which models threat modelling in software development.

Elevation of Privilege is the easy way to get started threat modeling. Threat modeling is a core component of the design phase in the Microsoft Security Development Lifecycle (SDL).

The Elevation of Privilege (EoP) card game helps clarify the details of threat modeling and examines possible threats to software and computer systems.

The EoP game focuses on the following threats:

* Spoofing
* Tampering
* Repudiation
* Information Disclosure
* Denial of Service
* Elevation of Privilege

EoP uses a simple point system that allows you to challenge other developers and become your opponent’s biggest threat.
publishers: (Web published), Microsoft, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Sanitarium: The Foyer
description:
The Sanitarium: The Foyer expansion includes a revised rulebook for Sanitarium--which completely replaces the original rulebook, a Foyer starting location, four double-sided Character cards, and revised scenarios (which also completely replace the originals).

The Solo Scenario was unintentionally omitted from the revised scenario cards, but a printable PDF may be found at the Asmadi website at http://asmadigames.com/files/sanitarium_solo.pdf
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Modular Board

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – P.W.B. Aj'rmr Expansion Pack
description:
PWB Aj'rmr was a Romulan warbird in service to the Romulan Star Empire's Star Navy in the late 24th century. She was a participant in the Dominion War.
In 2375, she was one of several ships that filed a listing of the missing and killed. This list was seen in the conference room of Deep Space 9.

This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Card Crawler
description:
Game description from the designer:

A solitaire dungeon crawling and deck-building game.

Your land is under attack by monsters, lead by the Dark Lord and his four Knights. They hide in the shadows of the Cursed Fortress, not so far from your village. Several attempts have been made to stop this
evil, but none of the brave adventurers ever returned...
It is now your turn to attempt the impossible. Go forth and slay the Dark Lord!

The game uses a standard deck of 52 cards + 1 Joker to represent the dungeon, friends and foes, hero and actions. As you explore the dungeon, you defeat monsters and collect loot which improves your action deck, until you are ready to fight the Dark Lord and return victorious.

name: Vault Wars: Dragonkeeper Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was available during the Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter campaign.

Card effect:
Worker
BEFORE SELLING
Discard: Trash 1 Dragon Egg Item from your Item Pile
Discard: Buy 1 Dragon Egg Item from the trash. pay 5 gold to the bank.

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – "Ring of Rejection" Promo Card
description:
Ring of Rejection

Bury this card to evade your encounter.

Bury this card to ignore any power on a card that happens when you examine it.

This promo card was included with Pathfinder ACG subscriptions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Boss Monster: Kingkiller Hero Pack
description:
Introducing the limited edition pack of hero cards for Boss Monster, a dungeon-building game inspired by classic video games! This pack includes six all-new hero cards: five ordinary unique heroes (Auri, Denna, Elodin, Kilvin, and Vashet) as well as one epic hero (Kvothe).

Designed and donated by Brotherwise Games, this card pack is exclusive to Worldbuilders.org, and only a limited number of them were printed. Claim yours while you can!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Ignite: A New Enemy
description:
Ignite: A New Enemy takes the "battling deckbuilder" system of Ignite and turns it into a Solo or Cooperative game. It requires both the Ignite base game as well as Ignite: The Freeze expansion.

In Ignite: A New Enemy, a powerful ancient force is summoning water minions which are attacking the residents of Oshos. The races must band together (under a banner of temporary truce) in order to stop this new threat.

Each turn, water minions will be summoned at the top of the board. Each minion is equipped with a specific weapon or spell (associated to the color of its base) and follows simple rules to move and attack the players. If players survive long enough, the ancient foe will present itself. With its death comes freedom for the land.

The expansion includes:

Double sided enemy cards, allowing the minions to "level up" upon reaching the 11th round.
3 sets of Round cards (depending on the player count) with 3 possibilities of minions to spawn.
Power cards which are drawn each turn to effect the players or minions.
Deadly Apocalypse cards which can severely shift power in battle.
A giant dragon miniature measuring roughly 130mm in height.
A special set of 10 battle cards which allow you to use the dragon miniature during competitive games.


Players will have to work together, conserve resources, and make terrible choices if they expect to live to see the ancient foe... much less kill it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Versa
description:
Versa is a dice game of luck and visualisation from Sabrewolf Games.
Roll, turn and swap the coloured dice on the grid. Make shapes from five dice of the same colour to match the cards in your hand. The first player to match away all of their cards wins.

—description from the designer

name: Escape Adventures: Von Drachen und Samurai
description: Family friendly escape game in a feudal japanese setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints.

name: Escape Adventures: Von Mythen und Aztekengold
description: Family friendly escape game in the world of the Aztecs. You have to solve puzzles and find clues. More geared towards a younger audience than other series.

name: Malebranche
description:
Malebranche is a small abstract strategy game inspired by Mitsuo Yamamoto's King's Valley, with the addition of special powers on the pieces. It's published in XVgames's bagstract format.

In this small portable game with the board printed on the bag, players randomize with dice a set of 4 pieces plus a damned soul. The pieces have different powers. Players will need to move them in straight lines to try to make blocks and paths so that the damned soul can move into the central space of the board, the Hell's pit. The player who can do so first wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: King of the Hill, Slide/Push, Square Grid

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement
description:
The Loot-Splosion Campaign Supplement will collect all digital scenarios and campaigns in physical printed format. It also includes an additional two complete campaigns.

Available scenarios and campaigns include:
- Ravenous Wattle Gobbler Scenarios
- Steve the Psycho Scenarios
- Crumpets and 'Zza Campaign
- 2x Loot-Splosion Campaigns
- All Bounty Scenarios (Bounty scenarios have their special rules printed on the bounty card and use an existing scenario map layout.)
- Core Game Campaign
- Skags at the Gates Campaign
- Robot Revolution Campaign

–description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Yak: Birdwatch
description:
This mini-expansion adds an extra action card that will offer you more to think about when selecting which action to play. Plus, yaks are not the only animals in the game anymore. Their friends, the birds, have joined and will offer you a new way to score. Those birds are easily scared away, so choose well where you place them on your stone tower. And remember, an opponent can also attract these birds to his own tower! This mini-expansion adds eight colorful birds, a bag, 4 birds action cards and 16 feathers tokens. This item is a Webshop exclusive and is a must-have. These birds are simply too cute!

- description from the publisher's website

name: UNO Flip: Marvel Super Heroes or Villains
description:
UNO Flip! card game adds an exciting twist to the classic UNO matching card action that everyone loves, and now the action includes heroes and villains from the Marvel universe! Play a Flip card and the deck FLIPS from the Heroes' side to the Villains' side which has penalties that are extra tough. A 'Draw 1' card on the Heroes' side becomes a 'Draw 5' card on the Villains' side! A Heroes' side 'Skip' card becomes a Villains' side 'Skip Everyone' card! Only another Flip card can change things back. And when you're down to one card, don't shout, 'assemble,' shout, 'UNO!'

UNO Flip! Marvel card game features a two-sided deck, Heroes and Villains, and the Villains' side has penalties that are especially tough!

UNO Flip! Marvel card game has special rules for both the Heroes' side and the Villains' side that really change the game!

name: Sherlock: Villa Diodati
description:
The Frankenstein manuscript has been stolen from the Villa Diodati. The residents of the villa protest their innocence, but one is lying. who stole it How was it stolen? And why? Follow the clues with your investigation team and try to answer these and many other questions. Will you solve the riddle of the Frankenstein manuscript?

In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

A) Reveal information:
Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: Liars & Looters
description:
Liars & Looters is a fun and quick game where you trade resource cards and outsmart your opponents with strategic deceit.

If you enjoy games like COUP, Chocobo Crystal Hunt and Werewolf this game is definitely for you!

3-6 Players embrace their inner trickster while searching for the resource cards their chosen TRIBE is gathering. Only by collecting all of them FIRST you can win and prove your superior skills in bluffing and spotting a liar.

Your TRIBE CARD will show you what to hunt for, and what to dismiss as unusable -
but keep in mind, everyone can see your TRIBE CARD and knows exactly with which resources they can bait you.

By drawing from the DECK each turn, more RESOURCE CARDS come into play OR a special EVENT will be triggered.

Your main focus should lie on the TRADES where 1 Player offers a card FACE DOWN, while everyone else is competing –also cards faced down- in the trade to get OR NOT get the offered card.

The TRADES and their results are your chance to lie your ass off or be honest while acting guilty. You are allowed to claim anything as „truth “, but NEVER to REVEAL your cards.

Read the room.
Catch the tiniest grin.
Try to remember what cards you traded with whom-
Then you´ll be unstoppable in this GAME OF WITS and DECEITE.

-description from designer

name: MetaCheckers
description:
Game description from the publisher:

MetaCheckers is chess, played with checkers. The goal is to capture the opponent's King Checker. Checkers make chess moves based on the roll of a special pair of dice. One die -- the Numbers Die -- is a standard D6. The other -- the Chess Die -- has the 6 chess symbols.

Roll a King, Knight or Pawn and pick ANY checker -- including your King Checker -- to move as King, Pawn or Knight. The Numbers Die does not matter on these rolls. Roll a Queen, Bishop or Rook and Numbers Die tells you how far the checker MUST move as a Queen, Bishop or Rook. So, if you roll a BISHOP 6, the checker you select must move diagonally for 6 spaces, unless it makes a capture, hits the edge of the board or is blocked by a fellow piece.

Again, any checker can be moved by any roll of the dice. So, the King Checker may move as a Knight or a Pawn or even a Queen 6 if desired. But no checker retains any chess rank after the completion of the turn. Every roll of the dice wipes the slate clean. For the length of the turn, the selected pieces behave as chess pieces. But pawns do not get 2 spaces on their first turn. They don't get promoted for reaching the opposite side of the board. But they do still capture diagonally. There is no check or checkmate or castling. Just capture the king.

Roll a King on your first turn, and you may flip your King Checker over. This hides your king -- STEALTH MODE -- and your opponent has to keep track of it to capture it and win.

name: Accasta
description:
Accasta is an abstract strategy game played on a 37-cell hexagonal board. Players are provided with 20 pieces each (Shields, Horses, and Chariots) and try to place at least 3 of them in the opponent's home area.
Accasta is also a stacking game. Pieces can be stacked and stacks can be split at any point. Tactical potential arises from the fact that there is a 3 pieces limit for stacks.

name: Kharnage: Cthulhu
description:
Cthulhu rises in the world of Kharnage! You have no more choice to be more powerful than him by destroying more units or by banishing him!

Cthulhu is an expansion for Kharnage, drawn by Goomi.

—description from the publisher

Game changes:
SET UP
Set a Horror pile with 3 Cultists cards, 1 card from the Shoggoth and 1 card from Cthulhu (except the head). Shuffle this pile and put it face down next to the Domination tokens.

END OF THE ROUND
During the Domination token distribution, the 4th player who destroyed the most cards draws 1 card from the Horror pile. If it is a Cultist or the Shoggoth card, deploy it in your Army (and immediately take the other parts of the Shoggoth if necessary). Otherwise, the Master of R’lyeh, Cthulhu himself, appears!

Set the 9 cards of Cthulhu between 2 players.

During each next End of the Round phases, before the Domination token distribution, Cthulhu attacks each player separately with all its Strength with its 3 Crushing skill symbols. During the Domination token distribution, Cthulhu is considered as a player.

The player who destroyed Cthulhu suffers the Cthulhu’s Revenge and keeps the 9 cards for the Domination token distribution.

The cards which are parts of Cthulhu are not casted face down on the Hill at the end of the End of the Round phases because Cthulhu cannot die, it is just banned. The player who destroyed it keep the Cthulhu’s Head with its 3 Domination points.

END OF THE GAME
Cthulhu may win the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Versus
description:
Players try to score the most points by moving pieces they control to the central marked hexagons on the board. The VERSUS piece of each player can be used to block or convert the opponent's pieces.

The first edition is limited to 300 copies.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Sentinel Tactics: Wagner Mars Base
description: This is a poster map and scenario for Sentinel Tactics based on the Wagner Mars Base environment from Sentinels of the Multiverse.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Greater Than Games, LLC, Living Worlds Games

name: Croda
description:
Croda was invented by the Croatian mathematics professor and Draughts champion Ljuban Dedić in order to create a draughts game with a smaller margin of draws. In issue 9 of Abstract Games Magazine, Christian Freeling argued its superiority to Draughts.

Object: If a player has no legal move, then he loses the game. This may come about either by being eliminated or being blocked completely.

Players takes turns moving their pieces. Pieces are either men (which can only move straight forward or diagonally forward one space) or kings (which move and capture at a distance). When a man ends a move on the opponent's backrow, it is promoted to a king. Pieces capture by jumping, as in Draughts, but capture is only orthogonally, not diagonally. Capture is enforced. A player must capture the biggest number of pieces when different ways of capture are possible.

name: Fidhchell
description:
The Irish tafl game variously spelled Fidhchell or fitchneal or fithcheall is the subject of much debate. The variance of spelling simply reflects the non-standardization of Old Irish [Gaelic] pronunciation and therefore spelling. When pronouncing these names, one should realize that a e or i which occurs in combination with another vowel is generally not pronounced separately but indicates only that the adjacent consonant is slender, which is to say palatalized. The h is used as a mark of lenition (a kind of consonant mutation that appears in many languages) or aspiration and hence th becomes roughly pronounced like the same letters in English "think" and the ch as in Scottish "loch". Just to add to the confusion of names, the name in modern Irish Gaelic means Chess.

Some scholars say the name referred not to any tafl game but in fact to a form of Latrunculorum. Others say that the name was used for the diceless form of Tawl-Bwrdd, a Welsh game believed by some to have included dice.

If this name does refer to a separate game, it would be a game played on 9x9 not 7x7 grid. The basic rules are described here but this site leaves out several details. Namely, if the king is by the center square so that an opposing piece cannot be placed on that side of the king, the the king can be captured by being surrounded on only three sides rather than four and similarly, if the king is beside a defender, the attacker can do same thing, i.e., simply place pieces on three sides in order to capture the king. The site does mention that only the king can either land on or pass through the center square but not that attackers move first. There is also a stub article http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fitchneal on wikipedia which concurs on the initial placement of pieces. Notably the corners are occupied which emphasizes that the king need only reach an edge of the board, not necessarily a corner, for the player playing the defenders to win.
publishers: (Public Domain), MacGregor Historic Games, O'Gowna Studio

name: Meridian
description:
Meridian is an easy-to-learn strategy game for two players, played with a normal deck of cards (without Jokers). In many ways, it's a simple race game like Chutes and Ladders or Candy Land. The first player to each the center of the board (the Eclipse) and return to their starting point (the Meridian), wins.

Unfortunately, when the game begins there is no way for the players to reach the Eclipse at all. The board must be built by the players by playing cards. The game becomes a struggle to craft a path for yourself while still blocking your opponent.

The Rules

Not to be confused with Meridian by Leo Colovini.

name: Set Europe Ablaze: The Resistance War 1939-1945
description:
There were mixed feelings among the few people in the British government or military high command who heard of Churchill establishing the SOE -- Special Operations Executive HQ. While many approved of the idea of consolidating efforts that had been scattered among at least four small, unfunded departments, not everyone agreed with the whole idea.

Churchill's directive, "Set Europe Ablaze," had grand sound to it, but many felt that the diversion of crack military personnel would be a waste -- Churchill's penchant for disastrous side-shows pre-dated Gallipoli -- while others wondered at the relative value and morality of arming civilians... something not recognized by the Geneva Convention. The fact that SOE took some of its ideas from the IRA's efforts in Ireland just emphasizes the shocking reminder that those we see as brave Resistance fighters might be viewed as "terrorists" through a different lens. Having seen how the Germans handled "francs-tireurs" in 1870 and 1914, none would suppose that these Germans would be less ruthless. But, faced with propaganda about the "Thousand Year Reich," the Allies felt compelled to create a "second front" of some sort, long before Normandy.

Set Europe Ablaze captures the spirit and complex choices involved in Occupied Western Europe. Award-winning designer John Prados, who last gave us Beyond Waterloo, again focuses on action in France, Belgium, and the Netherlands. Prados brings us a card-driven game pitting the Occupying Axis forces against the combination of Allied intelligence efforts and brave local citizens, fighting the shadow war that made "the Maquis" a name to remember proudly.

Unlike many board strategy games, the focus is not on movement and combat by military units but on political-economic strategy. The Axis player wants to extract as much raw materials and finished goods as possible, to aid the war effort, and the Allied player seeks to avert this. Allied tactics include sabotage, interdiction, and intelligence gathering.

Axis responses include partisan sweeps, counterintelligence operations, and labor pool mobilization to repair damage. Turns abstractly represent about six months each, with rounds within each turn varying according to cards played. While there is no "combat" in a literal sense, there are competitions for resolving actions that have both players rolling dice. Excitement levels will be high, as players wonder what the next card will bring.

Allies will take advantage of infiltration and special units (SAS, Jedburgh, OSS) while the Axis will use Security forces, the Abwehr, Gestapo, and even Vichy police. "Barbie" competes with "Passy" and "Giskes" versus “Jean Moulin." There is even Stalag XVII.

Set Europe Ablaze and the 2014 ATO Magazine Annual

Maps - One full color 22"x34" mapsheet
Counters - 176 colorful die-cut large 5/8" pieces
Cards - 48
Rules length - 20 pages
Charts and tables - 8 pages
Complexity - Medium
Playing time - Up to 3 to 4 hours
How challenging is it solitaire? - Poor

Design - John Prados
Development - Lembit Tohver
Graphic Design - Mark Mahaffey

(from publisher's website)


(Note: Read more about the game's development in Prados' article in ATO No. 38, Guns of the Askari.)
categories: Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II

name: World of Tanks: Rush – M2 Light Tank
description: World of Tanks: Rush — M2 Light Tank, a promotional card for the World of Tanks: Rush base game available at conventions and through hobby stores, features a light Amercian tank that costs 1, gives 1 resource, and has a Sabotage ability.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Sussed?: Emotional Intelligence
description:
Finding out what everyone thinks about things has never been easier or more fun! Sussed All Sorts is a family friendly quiz with a twist: instead of general knowledge, you’ll be answering questions about each other! As you read aloud a series of real and imaginary scenarios, you’ll be given choices to make. Whoever can suss you out scores. Who has the most points wins.

Over 200 topics to talk about including what makes you happy, angry, interested, afraid, strong, disgusted, relaxed, jealous, trustworthy, lazy and curious (to name a few!). So, who've you got sussed?

—description from the publisher

name: Hammered Heroes
description:
A balanced strategy game with attitude that's designed to get your drinking friends into card games and your card game friends drunk.

Hammered Heroes is a kickass battle card game that is great for any gaming night. Why waste time with friends playing silly games like quarters or king's cup, when you could play something with a little more brains, and a lot more treachery?

Hammered Heroes is a great way to introduce new friends to tabletop, and the initiated will find plenty to love as well.

Your numbered HAMMERED HEROES compete with your opponents' numbered heroes, for QUEST CARDS. CHEAP SHOTS are used by players to disrupt your opponents' plans, or increase your chances of winning.

After FIVE ROUNDS, the player with the most QUEST CARD POINTS wins. But be wary, CURSES and PARTY FOULS abound!

—description from the publisher

name: Lotus: Loves Me Not Tokens
description:
Four new Loves Me Not Tokens to add to your games of Lotus.

When a flower is completed, if you have control of that flower you may earn one of your Special Power Tokens (or a Scoring Token). If you choose to earn a Special Power Token, you may choose the Loves Me Not Token in your player color.

Once you have the Loves Me Not Token, you may spend one of your actions each turn to pluck any one Petal Card from an incomplete flower in the Lotus Garden. Remove that Petal Card and place it in your scoring pile. At the end of the game, that Petal Card will be worth one victory point for you, as normal.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Catan Scenarios: Global Warming
description:
Dear Settlers,
Welcome to Catan, a land of plentiful resources and perfect spaces. You’ve found the ideal place to settle and expand! But settling a land comes with certain challenges, and accommodating the needs and desires of your expanding population won’t be easy, on you or on the land itself. Developing villages and cities, roads to connect them, and armies to defend them, will all take a toll on the environment. Rapid development, and the destruction of the natural landscape will result in emission of greenhouse gases, which, should it go unchecked, will have potentially catastrophic effects. As settlers you have a choice, tackle global warming with sustainable development, or pursue individual victory, no matter what the cost...

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Race, Random Production, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: Time Guardian Adventures: Eine Welt ohne Schokolade
description:
Time Guardian Adventures - cooperative 3D puzzle adventures inspired by escape games. The new dimension of riddles and puzzles!
The eccentric criminal “Dr. Maxwell Mayhem" repeatedly manipulates the past to carry out his megalomaniac plans and change the present for his own benefit. It's up to you, the Time Guardians, to travel back in time to right Mayhem's evil deeds and restore the true course of history! The world is counting on you!
In this 3D adventure, Dr. Maxwell Mayhem went back in time and prevented the Maya from discovering chocolate over 3000 years ago! He stole their first cocoa tree, has claimed the precious beans for himself ever since and now hoards all the chocolate supplies in the world in his private vault.

—description from the publisher

name: CATAN: Big Box
description: The 2023 edition of CATAN: Big Box contains the classic CATAN board game, along with the expansion that allows up to six players to compete on the base game, the Beste Freunde (Frenemies) scenario, , the Iberian Halbinsel scenario, the Rickshaw Run scenario, and the Der Weihnachtsmann (Santa Claus) and Der Osterhase (Easter Bunny) scenarios.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Three Wishes
description: Three Wishes is a game of intuition, knowledge, empathy, and perception. In it, you will have to try to score as many points as possible by guessing the favorite wishes of the other players.

name: Anchorage
description:
Take the helm of a small shipping company, deliver valuable cargo and out-sell your opponents! You face an exciting challenge to bring your fledgling company up to speed with the changing demands across the region.


Anchorage is a fast moving strategy game where you build factories, create high-speed shipping routes and devise tactics to make sure you deliver the most valuable cargo. Steer your merchant ship to take advantage of the high tides, and weather the impact of the low tides in order to prevail. The region can only support one company in the long term so you have a lot to prove!


No game of Anchorage is the ever the same, due to the interchangeable tiles which allow different game-board layouts and the ever-changing demands of the ports.


This game is available from arcticfoxgames.com. Limited copies will be available at the UK Games Expo 2013.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: The Road to Honnoji 1576-84
description: This is an area movement card driven wargame on the Japanese feudal wars.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Pirate Dice: 5th Player Expansion
description:
Pirate Dice: 5th Player Expansion includes everything you need to play Pirate Dice with a 5th player (dice, player mat, and player screen).

Note (from the BGG Store):
The rules for the 5th player were included on the reverse side of the Rough Waters expansion rules. Just to avoid any potential confusion, this does NOT include the expansion boards explained in the rules you receive.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Pirates

name: Rocódromo
description:
Rocódromo is a climbing game for 2-4 players, 7+ years old and about 10 minutes of playing time.

Rocódromo is a game in which we compete to be the first to reach the top of a climbing wall. As if it was a race, we combine colour sticks of different lengths which simulate the routes of the wall that was built at the beginning of the game. Who will be the first to conquer the climbing wall?

Rocódromo has two game modes: Basic and Advanced. The differences between them are the difficulty and the levels of the wall that we set to climb:

In Basic mode, the wall to be climbed will have three levels.
In Advanced mode, the wall can have more levels, a different shape or it can include some special settings.


If it’s the first time you play, we recommend the Basic mode; once you know the mechanics, we encourage you to follow the rules to set up the game in Advanced mode.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Measurement Movement, Modular Board, Movement Template, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: The Monitor and the Merrimack
description: Game of the Battle of Hampton Roads. The Confederate player must destroy the Union fleet in two days. Although there are no hexes, the movement definitely could have been plotted with them. Uses a spinner as a randomizer to determine movement and combat outcome.

name: The Siege of Hong Kong
description:
On December 8, 1941, Japan launched a land, sea and air assault that conquered all of Southeast Asia and the East Indies in six months.

One important event in this campaign was the capture of Hong Kong. This British colony on the south coast of China was an economic prize the Japanese could not pass up, and a fortress they could not leave standing.

The Siege of Hong Kong is a simulation of the final invasion of Hong Kong Island, which began after five days of shelling on December 18, and ended on December 25, with the surrender of the last surviving defenders.

The 11 x 17" map shows Victoria island at 800 metres per hex. The 120 back-printed counters show Japanese and Commonwealth companies.

name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Day of the Dead Command Deck
description: Unlike other decks within the Risk 2210 AD arena the Day Of The Dead deck neither requires a unique commander nor does it require players to expend valuable resources both purchasing the cards themselves or paying their activation costs. Instead, at the beginning of each player's turn a single card is drawn from the deck, revealed to all players and it's effects resolved.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Waterloo: Tabletop Wargaming in the Age of Napoleon
description:
From the Publisher's Website;

"Battles in the Napoleonic Wars were brutal and bloody. Vast armies fought with musket and bayonet on rain-soaked fields, half-blinded by acrid smoke and deafened by the ceaseless barrage of distant artillery. Men fell in great swathes, marching to death or glory to the rhythmic beat of drums.

Waterloo is a tabletop miniatures game for two or more players, set against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars. With these rules you are the general, with an army of miniatures at your command, representing the forces of France, Britain, Prussia or their allies. This rulebook is focussed on the campaign and battle of Waterloo, the climax of the Napoleonic Wars, but the rules within allow you to recreate battles from across the entire period (1792-1815) and even beyond.

This 288 page hardback book contains all the information you need to get started, including full rules for fighting tabletop battles in the Napoleonic era, army lists and historical orders of battle, a brief history of the French Revolution and the Napoleonic Wars, a complete campaign to get you started, and a hobby section detailing how to collect, assemble and paint your army of miniatures. In addition, you will find an inspirational showcase of beautifully painted models and lavish illustrations."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Полтавская битва 1709
description:
This simple wargame is devoted to decesive Russian victory on Swedish army in Battle of Poltava in 1709. After this battle Russians took their place as the leading nation of northern Europe. Poltava is classical hexogonal wargame of low complexity for begginers in wargames. Russian player has to defend his position aganst desperate Swedish atack and provide shattering counterstrike after it.

Game scale.
1 hex is 150m.
1 turn is 1 hour.
The counters represent regiments or battalions.

name: Auction
description:
Auction was first published in Abbott's New Card Games; a significantly revised version called Auction 2002 appeared in GAMES and in a self-published booklet.

Players have got to bid poker combinations for cards in an open line in the middle of the table - with these cards they should improve their hand and get the best possible poker combination for when the round ends.

Each turn a card is drawn from the pile and added to the line, afterwards there's an open auction - the cards in the highest combination are exchanged for the last cards on the line. The remaining cards on the line dictate the score at the end of the round.

The winner is the player with the highest score after four rounds or the first one to achieve 100 points.
