- 202 tokens representing combatant units and markers.
- A book of rules
- Seven Tables and Four Markers.

name: Black Pawn Trucking
description:
As the owner of a small freight operation, you must travel around the U.K carrying raw goods and finished products to their destinations.

This is a solitaire game for the piecepack system where the aim is to stay solvent for one game year, and if possible make a profit. Plan your routes and where to bring each good carefully, and don't take too many loans, or it could mean the end of your business.

name: Finland at War, v. I: Jatkosota
description:
This game contains twelve scenarios for the Advanced Squad Leader system, detailing the conflicts between Finland and Russia as well as Germany during WWII. Components include 106 new counters and two 8.5" X 11" mounted maps.

Ownership of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 is required for play. However, it is printed to be consistent with the First Edition of Beyond Valor.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Ides of March: The End of the Roman Republic 44BC – 30BC
description:
On the Ides of March (15 March) 44BC, ruler of Rome, Gaius Julius Caesar was assassinated in the Senate house by a small group of disaffected senators. After a brief period of confusion, three factions began to emerge to fill the vacuum left by Caesar’s death. The Tyrannicides led by Marcus Junius Brutus and assisted by Gaius Cassius Longinus left Rome and took provinces in the East to govern, there to bide their time, gather strength, and hopefully complete the restoration of the Republic. A second faction under Marcus Antonius, Senior Consul and Caesar’s chief lieutenant, and supported by Marcus Aemilius Lepidus, initially attempted to come to an accommodation with the Tyrannicides with the intent securing a power-base in Cisalpine Gaul and subsequently to seize control in Rome. The third faction under Gaius Octavius, Caesar’s nephew and adopted son, was intent upon claiming his inheritance and assuming the position that was Caesar’s in the state. Initially making common cause with Decimus Brutus (a tyrannicide) and the Senate, he attempted to check Antony’s ambitions whilst pursuing a dual agenda of avenging Caesar and assuming primacy in the state. By 30BC, Octavius (later Augustus Caesar) had eliminated all competition and become the undisputed Leader of Rome.

Ides of March is a three-player simulation representing the end of the Roman Republic, with each faction vying for control of the state through both political and military means. As the Leader of one of the three major factions, you control the Leaders, forces, and political resources of your faction in a struggle to win personal control of the machinery of state and thus become “Princeps”, or undeclared Emperor of the Roman World. Rules to play the game with two-players are found at the end of this rulebook.

A shorter Rubicon Module simulates the earlier struggle between Julius Caesar and Pompey the Great who was backed by the Senate that ultimately led to Caesar’s victory and assumption of the position of Dictator-for-Life. Each separate game shares a common set of Strategy Cards, with cards specific to period of civil war added the common deck for the play of that module. Players share a force pool of land and special Units, as well as factional naval forces and major Leaders/generals.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Epic Funhouse
description: Epic Funhouse is an interlocking suite of solitaire games representing a trip through a fun house with stops in six rooms. The rooms are designed to be played together in order, especially since the setup for each is affected by how you play the previous game. However, with a little ingenuity, each game can also be played separately.

name: Ships of the French Arm
description: A 96 page supplement to Star Cruiser, this atlas of starship designs provides illustrations, descriptions, and status sheets for warships (including fighters, drones, and missiles), commercial ships, couriers, survey ships, and others.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Vikings
description:
From the game's website:

Vikings is a strategy game for two to four players, 10 years and older. The game is set in Iceland in the Age of Vikings. You draw an objective and must be the first player to reach your objective to win the game.

To become the next Chieftain of Iceland you must occupy counties, harbours or fight for the opponents' Manors with your Berserker at the forefront! Players get taxes from the counties to buy new vikings or Berserkers.

There is more to the game than this though, since there are limits to the number of vikings on each county so you must plan your battles well. On your travels you can move on ships, find magical runes, get hit by a mudslide or meet monsters so there are many things that can alter your plans!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mirador
description:
Game published in January 2010 in Games Magazine

Mirador is a connection game played on a 27 x 27 grid of small squares. It can be played on graph paper (by marking off a 27 x 27 area) using coloured pencils to indicate the placement of watchtowers, or miradors, each of which will occupy a 2 x 2 square.

Several factors combine to make this a very fast and unusual game: line-of-sight connection (which is a feature of Sid Sackson's game Network); graded placement (incorporating the use of micro squares); and equivalent goals - that is, either player can win by connecting the board edges either from north to south or from east to west.

A significant feature of the game is that players can use their opponent's placements to facilitate their own connections. So, in trying to win the race to connect, you must check that the next move you plan to make doesn't inadvertently improve your opponent's chances more than yours.

name: Cuba: El Stadler
description:
El Stadler is an expansion for El Presidente (the Cuba expansion). It is a single card to be added to the other Cuban-cards. The card was created by Michael Rieneck and designed by Michael Menzel for the anniversary of the author of the base game Stefan Stadler. The card was produced in a micro edition of only 40 cards that were never sold and only available for friends of Eggert-Spiele.

This card allows to remove a ship from the harbor or the one on the sea.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Juwelenjagd
description:
Description by the publisher: An adventurous tactile game using math for 2 – 4 pirates ages 6 – 99.

Background story

Once a year, the best junior pirates meet to sit their pirate exam. In order to pass, they have to find the correct island and then grab a pirate ship as quickly as possible. If you correctly add up the numbers on the die and are the first to find the matching number of treasure holes on the islands, you win the most precious jewels and become master pirate.

Gameplay

All players try to pass the pirate exam simultaneously. The hunt for jewels starts as soon as the two dice have been thrown. The sum of the numbers on the dice tells the players which island they have to find. Each island (cardboard square) consists of two halves. Each island half has 0 to 6 "treasure holes" on the underside which can be felt by touch. All players try to find and put together an island with the same number of holes as the sum of the numbers on the dice. They are not allowed to look at the holes - they have to count by touch only. As soon as a player thinks they have the correct island, they grab a pirate ship. There is always one ship fewer than there are players, and the ships are in different colors. The first player who thinks they have an island with the correct number of holes grabs the red ship, the second one the blue ship, and the third one the green ship. When the last ship has been claimed, the round ends and the number of holes on the islands are counted. If the number is correct, the player earns a jewel in the color of the ship. If not, the ship is passed on to the next player. The jewels are worth a different number of points (red = worth most), and the player with the most precious jewels (= player with the most points) wins the game.

name: Mondo Micro
description:
Mondo Micro is a 2 player Expansion for Mondo.

The new player board lays between both players and will be played with the "first-time" rules, unless the timer will be set upon 3 minutes only.

The board has two different player boards (double-sided)

It also contains a small variant: Before a round choose 2 identical tiles (various animals are allowed). Place one with random direction on one of the fields which differs to the colors of the other fields. The second player has to use the 2nd tile in the same direction.

The playerboard was available at Essen fair 2011.
categories: Animals, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Phantoms of the Ice: Rainbows
description:
This is a one card mini expansion which was included in the White Wind game Tricks to promote the games Rainbows and Phantoms of the Ice.

The expansion consists of a new foward player named Rainbows and a rules card. Rainbows has only a value of "1", but before a match, you may select one player from your opponent's hand and switch it with one of your players.

name: Lost Worlds Fantasy Cards
description:
Each box contains 15 to 17 cards for use with the Lost Worlds combat books.

The cards depict weapons, spells, items, tactics and luck. Some are useable over an entire campaign of battles.

Before a battle, characters can buy some of these cards depending on their skill values. The cards offer special abilites for the characters that can be used during or between battles, depending on the card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kleine Helden: Geheimnisse aus der Gruft
description:
A small booklet with scenarios for Kleine Helden that was available as a promotional item.

"Geheimnisse aus der Gruft" is German for "Secrets from the Crypt". The card can be used as an additional hero for Kleine Helden. The booklet offers rules for solo- and coop-play.

name: Outcasts (fan expansion for BattleCON)
description:
A fan-made expansion for BattleCON featuring a full roster of characters tied together with their own story and several new game modes.

Character Roster (to be updated as characters are released):

- Tharusk Zahn
- Masika / Layla
- Sol the Majestic
- Shihai Desuka
- Takijiro
- Kara Whyte
- Ashara Tokoru

Game Modes:

- Solo Play against the sparring robot Tobor
- Boss Mode: 3v1 Against Uber Shihai, a character designed to face off against a team of 3 opponents
- Alternate Arenas: The War Zone board depicts a new arena in which you must both battle your opponent and avoid catapult stones that rain down on the field of battle!

And more to come!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Ævintýralandið
description: From the publisher: Ævintýralandið is a story driven boardgame for children 3-12 years old and their parents. Besides providing a framework for children and parents to have a nice time with stories and fun, it helps children to express themselves, find out how others think, and harness their creative thinking to solve problems. It's not less important for parents to play Ævintýralandið with their children, it is healthy for everyone to see their imagination in action and the children's honesty. One player is the game master. He's the storyteller in an adventure but other players create and play the characters. Stories are drawn randomly and to each story is added some extra element, like animals, exciting people and all kinds of objects, some of which might even have supernatural powers. The characters act along and take their part in shaping the adventure together with the storyteller. At the end of the story each character gets it's reward which can be used to improve the character before he takes part in the next adventure.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Produto
description:
from the designer:

"The basic idea is simple: players take turns placing stones on a board, forming groups. When the board is full, each players calculates the product of the sizes of his two largest groups. Whoever has the larger number wins."

name: Empire of the Dead: Requiem
description:
Requiem is a miniatures expansion of the game "Empire of the Dead", a whole host of new characters, and ingenious steampunk machines, from Victorian fiction.

The game is set in an age where a steampunk victorian empire rules the world. An empire fueled by an extraordinary discovery. The mineral that has become known as infernium. But all is not well, dark shadows from our deepest nightmares stalk the smog shrouded streets of London. An ancient evil is rising from defeat.

Players choose from 4 starter factions which they can expand and add to from a range of special character models. Each game is played over several turns, each turn consisting of four distinct phases (maintenance, initiative, activation and combat).

The expansion, Requiem, adds 70 new characters to the original game and introduces new factions like the Clickers (a race of automata) or the Supernatural Branch (new character types, weapons and machines used by Scotland Yards Occult Police force) and also the rules covering the new Victorian Machines.

name: Civilization Central America
description:
Civilization Central America is a variant of Advanced Civilization. Players build cities, collect and trade commodities, and buy technologies, dealing with many recurring calamities along the way.

Set in Central America, the map includes the same number of territories, population density, and city sites as Advanced Civilization with the Western Extension Map. There are 3 commodities each in 9 trade card decks, for a total of 27 commodities. There are eight minor tradable calamities, eight tradable calamities, and eight non-tradable calamities. All commodities and most calamities are new. Players may purchase sixty-three new and revised technologies from the Civilization: The Expansion Project rules, with a unique point system used to progress on the Chronological Advancement Chart.

The game comes with all parts required for play except the rules, which may be downloaded from the publisher website and The General (Avalon Hill magazine) archives. Players need not own Civilization or Advanced Civilization.
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Trading

name: Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching
description:
The Zombie Apocalypse has begun!

Fortunately, YOU have your priorities straight. What could be more important? It’s time to grab your shotgun and go out Geocaching!
The Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching expansion pack adds an incredible amount of fun, twists, and strategy to Cache Me If You! Nothing puts a thrill into geocaching like running down a few Zombies along the way. A Zombie or two won’t be much of a problem, but watch out when they start to gather and overwhelm. And if they get to you, you will play out the game as a geocaching Player Zombie!
The expansion pack includes all of your favorite items… shotguns, chainsaws, crowbars and more!
A New Zombie Hunting Character
Specialized Equipment Cards
Additional Event Cards
Even More Caching Area Cards
The Zombies will be moving and gathering their numbers… Geocaching will never be the same!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-3: Election Day
description: In Pixel Lincoln: The Deckbuilding Game – Expansion 2-3 – Election Day, Pixel Lincoln is up for re-election and along with that comes a new style of character. These will provide you votes, which can lead to big points. Snag the swing vote card to break ties. This expansion also comes with Secret Item: Vote cards and a brand new Item Card designed by the people.

name: Krimi Total: Die Pracht der Vampire
description:
Translation - "Splendour of the Vampires"

Minni Harkort, the vampire princess of London, has invited the vampires of the city to tell them an important message and to celebrate a lavish party. But only ashes from the hostess is found - the princess has been killed!

8 or 9 players slip into the roles of vampires and one of them is the murderer. His goal is not to be convicted, while all the others try to find out the truth.

name: MASH: Field Hospital – Vietnam
description:
A solitary game about commanding a US Army field hospital during the Vietnam War. The game features a resources management aspect in the building of the base and its staff as an effective task force, plus a detailed handling of casualties according to their medial triage level, having to be treated in different medical modules.

The game prototype is currently playable as print-and-play or using a Vassal Game Engine Module (see Files section). The Vassal Module supports an Observer player for a tutorial session or online shared play.

During the game, the player will recruit new personnel for the base, also improving its installations. The game engine will challenge the player with events and the need to fulfill missions to score points. The scarcity of resources will test your judgement as the base commander, having to prioritize, push-your-luck and even to make hard sacrifices.

From the rulebook:

Nha Trang, Vietnam. November 1967. Orders come from Long Binh HQ.
You are assigned to 498th Medical Company, 55th Medical Group, 44th Medical Brigade, as Battalion Surgeon with the rank of Captain (O-3). Your duty is to set up and manage a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital (MASH), to be deployed as part of the Counteroffensive Phase III Campaign.
In order to do so, you will be recruiting Personnel (specialist operatives and general personnel), and commissioning new buildings and vehicles (installations). With those assets, you will face threats to your facilities (events) and be called upon to participate in military operations (missions).
Sometimes you will be ordered to take wounded people into treatment in your Base. Wounded people will also flow your way as a result of enemy opposition during missions, and sometimes in the case of security, health or supplies threats to your Base. Having a poorly managed Base, forfeiting missions, and suffering casualties will reduce your promotion merits. Stay sharp, or your men will suffer and you’ll never make it to Major (O-4).
Taking part on the campaign operations (your combat readiness), along with an overall good security, healthiness and supplies situation in your Base will grant you promotion merits (victory points).
Godspeed, Captain!
categories: Medical, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Resource to Move

name: Arbalester
description:
Arbalester is a medieval battle game for 2, 3 or 4 players. Mixing wargame and strategy, the player has at his hands an army with wich should eliminate all enemies.

To compose the army, the player can choose from 7 kinds of soldiers. Each class has certain range of attack, life points and special abilities. Simply, move with two dices and attack with one, but complex too, the player can combine their soldiers for over 100 different army combinations.

The board is divided into squares, as in Stratego.

Turns are alternative, one player moves and attacks with his army in his turn and when it finish, take certain cards.
Cards may be of many types (objects, siege weapons, terrain, etc)and provide variety and duration to the game.

Spanish description:
Arbalester es un juego de batallas medievales para 2, 3 o 4 jugadores. Mezcla de Wargame y juego de estrategia, el jugador tiene a su disposición un ejército con el que deberá eliminar a todos sus enemigos.
Para componer el ejército, el jugador puede elegir entre 7 clases de soldados. Cada clase tiene cierto rango de ataque, puntos de vida y habilidades especiales. El jugador podrá combinar los soldados según su estrategia existiendo más de 100 combinaciones distintas.
El tablero se divide en casillas cuadradas, como en el Stratego. Para el movimiento se usan dos dados y para el ataque un dado. Los turnos son alternativos, cada jugador mueve y ataca con todo su ejército en su turno y al finalizarlo, coge ciertas cartas.
Las cartas pueden ser de muchos tipos y aportan variedad y duración al juego. Pueden aparecer objetos, armas de asedio, tipos de terreno, etc.

name: Nanjing! Nanjing!: Defense of Guanghua Gate
description:
Nanjing! Nanjing!: Defense of Guanghua Gate is a postcard wargame about Battle of Nanjing during Dec.7 to 12 in 1937.

Nanjing! Nanjing! uses the same rotated action point system in "800 Heroes". Every unit represents one infantry battalion/regiment or one anti-tank artillery company. Players spend action point to move, attack, or retreat by rotating the unit to different direction. The side who occupies Guanghua Gate wins the victory.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Ascension: Sadistic Laboratory Promo Card
description:
Promo card from Gencon 2015

Cost: 6 Runes

Void Construct

Once per turn, gain 1 Power
When you defeat a monster in the center row, banish any monster under this and place the defeated monster under this. You may defeat the monster under this as though it were in the center row. If this leaves play, banish any monsters under this.

3 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Frog Menu
description:
Frogs are very hungry, and a whole menu of insects is within reach. With Frog Menu, you should eat as many insects as possible, and to do this you must jump from insect to insect, eating non-stop. Be sure not to get isolated while doing so!

To start, shuffle 2-4 starting tiles with a bunch of insect tiles, then lay out the tiles face up in a 6x6, 7x7, or 8x8 square (based on the number of players). Each player starts with two random power tiles (fish, egg, tongue), with each type of tile having a different special action. Each player starts on the board wherever their starting tile turns up.

On a turn, the active player jumps their frog based on the possible move shown on the tile where that frog is currently located; the player can rotate the tile to use the move in one of four directions, claiming this tile and removing it from the board. As tiles are removed, the board gets holes in it, and players can jump their frogs over these holes. Once a frog is isolated, that player takes no further turns. Once every frog is isolated, players claim the tile under their frog, then tally their points.

Players score based on the types and quantities of insects they've collected, with the game including seven types of insects. A player's starting tile counts as an insect of their choice. The scores for the different groupings of insects are:


5 insects of the same species, 50.
5 different insects, 40.
4 insects of the same species, 30.
3 insects of the same species + 2 insects of the same species, 20.
3 insects of the same species, 10.
2 insects of the same species, 5.


Whoever has the most points wins, with ties being broken by whoever has the combination of insects with the most value.

name: Koromo Lean Management Game
description:
Koromo Japanese workshop is an educational game of Lean Management. Players take on the role of the owner of the garage, which is still working to bring the greatest gains. The game allows you to familiarize yourself with concepts such as efficiency, quality and continuous improvement.

In each round, players perform moves in two rounds. In the first round followed by perfecting his workshop in three categories (quality, productivity, order). Such an action requires an adequate number of points of knowledge from the player. Points knowledge obtained at the beginning of the game and wins throughout its duration. In the second round, each player receives one car repair order, which is placed on the player board (workshop). The player uses their moves (moving pawns) to repair the damaged car best. The game ends when one player accumulates the appropriate number of experience points (20). Experience points are awarded for the improvement actions and repaired cars.

name: Monopoly: Christmas Limited Edition
description: Welcome to Christmas! The Festive Season starts here, with Monopoly: The Christmas Edition! Play as one of 6 special tokens as you travel round the board collecting the great (and not-so-great) things about the season of goodwill. From Santa and his reindeer, to a full festive feast via decorating the tree and doing your shopping, no stocking would be complete without it!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Doshboardgolf
description:
The Original Doshboardgolf is a golf strategy board game. A mathematical model coupled with a professional course design creates an experience that rivals the real thing. The winning player will be the one whom manages risk v.s. reward and the conditions in the most favorable way.

Doshboardgolf uses a hex-based board to simulate a 9 hole golf course. Players have the choice of 12 directions to shoot from each hex and can even plan for fade and slice!
This course has everything a real course would; straight fairways; water and trees as hazards; elevation changes and even simulated wind conditions.

The game is different every time – there are 60 different wind settings and 32 different clubs. Four 12-sided dice establish the strategic variability expected with ace runs, doinked putts, roll-aways, out-of-bounds, elevation change, lost clubs, and difficult lies. You will feel the joy of an excellent shot and the defeat of a poor decision. Doshboardgolf is all the strategy of golf on your table.

In Doshboardgolf, each player selects a set of 8 club cards that have differing distance and hook numbers. Players will have all the clubs they need, from the maximum distance driver and mid-range approach club down to the putter which will be used when holing out.
The distance will be determined by rolling a blue die, and the hook determined by the red die only after consulting the players chosen club card.

Using advanced rules, a black die is introduced to simulate roll-aways when you land next to a downhill hex. Also making the game more realistic is elevation changes and penalties when having to shoot out of a hex containing trees.

During a turn, each player in order will:
1. Plan a shot direction using one orange pawn as a directional marker on the board. Players have the ability to execute planned fade and slice to overcome obstructions on the board such as trees, water hazards and elevation changes
2. Select a club card from your 8 available options and place it face up for all players to see
3. Execute the shot by rolling the blue and red dice. After consulting the chosen club card, the blue die determines the distanced travelled, and the red die determines the hook which will happen after the distance is calculated
4. Place your player token in the new lie or if you have successfully holed out, mark your score on the included scorecard
Play continues in this way with the player furthest from the hole always going next.
As in real golf, the player with the lowest score at the end of the 9 hole round is the winner!

name: Beasties
description: Object is to line up 3 cards of the same colour, and three cards of the same insect.

name: BIOTIX: Microbes Mini Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

This mini expansion introduces two new types of BIOTIX microbes, Adaptive and Hyper-reactive, with new abilities to enhance your game. The Incubator cards and rules add a new mechanic to the game, allowing players to pass a BIOTIX at a time of their choosing. Finally, Eureka cards replace the pen and paper notations of the end game rules with a more elegant set of materials. Everything is included in a miniature bag.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Greenest
description:
Greenest is the third game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Greenest is a game for 1 player with the same mechanism as Green.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6×6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6×9 – 9×9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids.

- Black can only capture Green
- Green can only capture White
- White can only capture Black

The goal of the game is to end up with a single stack, by making captures also as in Green (Black can only capture Green and so on), but in any order. This is, you can capture several times with the same colour, or reverse the order.

Whether all initial configurations are solvable or not still remains an open question. Your feedback on this will be greatly appreciated.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.

name: SAM la Pagaille
description: SAM puts the mess in the rainbows ... Be the fastest to spot SAM's mistakes by finding the color that is missing or the one that is duplicated in every rainbow!

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Oberth Class Card Pack
description:
The U.S.S. Grissom is a Federation Oberth class ship. As a card pack, it comes with cards, token and a dial.

It is a part of card pack wave 1.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Ves Batlh Card Pack
description:
The I.K.S. Ves Balth is a Klingon Raptor class ship. As a card pack, it comes with cards, token and a dial.

It is a part of card pack wave 1.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Flucht aus der Piratenbucht
description:
Anyone who thinks that ghost ships and the fearsome ghost of Capt'n Whitebeard are just spooky seaman's stories is wrong. To retrieve the legendary gold treasure from dangerous Pirate Cove, the crew must work together. Skillful strategy and a little luck will allow you to escape from Capt'n Whitebeard, defeat all the ghost ships and fight your way out of the cove to freedom!
Contents: 1 Pirate Cove game board, 1 ghost of Capt'n Whitebeard figure, 30 ocean tiles, 1 fortune coin, 4 treasure chest layouts, 1 die.

name: Superfight: The Sword & Sorcery Deck
description:
Ancient dragons, powerful wizards, and deadly quests await you in this high-fantasy themed expansion for Superfight. Grab your wand and your sword and prepare for the most epic verbal battles you've ever encountered!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Mundialito: El Juego de Cartas
description:
Mundialito is the 2018 edition of The World Cup Card Game 2010 by Shaun Derrick. Made by Peruvian Juan Diego de la Piedra, the remake adds the terrible and amazing own-goal card and adds a new mechanic to the resolution of penalties and attacks.

In this game the players will go through the whole cup trying to find the one and only champion. Players will go through group stage matches, qualify, and the go through all knock-out stages from Round of 16 up to the great final.

To win this game you will need intuition, strategy and, like football, luck!

—description from the publisher

name: Fantastory
description:
Every card is a doorway into a world: the Fantastory world. Invent exciting and fun new stories each time and then try and remember them.

Shuffle the story cards, take the first 10 and place them face up on the table. The narrator tells a brief story taking inspiration from 5 or 6 of the 10 cards. When he tells a part of the story which refer to a card, the players should identify and indicate it.

Once the story has ended, the narrator shuffles the 10 cards and place them faceup on the table. The game ends as the correct sequence of the story is reconstructed by the players.

name: Hail Hydra: Hawkeye Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2018 as part of GameStop event

Hail Hydra - Hawkeye

Player Card

Weapon of Choice:
Take all attack cards used this offensive. Secretly place 2 of them into your hand. Secretly discard the rest
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pumpkin Patch: Gourd Attack!
description:
Pumpkin Patch: Gourd Attack! is a mini-expansion for Pumpkin Patch: Bad Seeds.

Pumpkin Patch: Gourd Attack expands on the base game by adding the "recycle" mechanic. Recycle is a new keyword that allows you to remove a plot from your pumpkin patch and replace it with a gourd!

This mini-expansion contains 6 cards and can be added to any version of Pumpkin Patch.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Hungry!
description:
A cooperative game with focus on communication and attention. Great fun for the whole family!

Feed the animals and feed them fast.

Players are dealt a hand with food cards. Meat, grass, nuts, fish or something else...like cake.

A timer is set...

Animal cards are drawn and revealed on the table. Players must now quickly feed them. When all open animals are fed player get to draw ONE new card. New animals are revealed and so on until the timer sounds.

Players win if ALL animals in the deck are fed before the time runs out.

You can't see each others cards, you MUST talk about them. And communicate fast! Use the food at the right time so that you are able to feed all animals. A miss in communication may lead to animals being without food...and that's a lost game.

The game offers many different variations to game play.

Lets feed those animals!

name: Battle Ravens: Welsh Army
description:
Battle Ravens army packs offer players three new armies to command in battle: choose from the Normans, the Welsh, or the Scots.

Battle Ravens is a game of Viking Age warfare: a brutal clash of strength, cunning and luck, where subtlety and nuance are neither welcome or commonplace. Army packs offer new artwork and strategies for play.

Each army pack includes 18 Hirdmen, 18 Bondi, 4 Thralls, 20 Ravens, an information sheet including optional rules for Battle Ravens, and 10 Tactics Cards themed to the army.

—description from the publisher

name: Sushi Holic
description:
Sushi Holic is a memory game of sushi-making theme. It consists of 40 pieces of tiles: 12 pieces of 3 pieces of tiles for sushi, 12 pieces of wasabi tiles, 12 pieces of rice tiles and 4 pieces of special tiles, green tea tiles.
To play the game, first place all the 40 tiles face down on the table. The starting player chooses one tile and turns it over. If he/she succeeds in turning the rice-wasabi-material tile in order, one sushi is completed and the three tiles are taken by the player. If one of them fails, the turn is immediately passed on to the next player. If you turn over a green tea tile, take that tile and turn over another tile again. The obtained green tea tile can be used to inspect another tile at any time during the player's turn. When one player completes the number of sushi set according to the number of people, one round ends, and the person who earned the specified goal round score first wins the game.
Sushi holic comes in two editions: 'Maguro edition' and 'Tamago edition' which have different material tiles but same rule. The two editions can be combined to play with up to 8 players.

—description from the publisher

name: Just One: Gathering of Friends Promo Cards
description:
A set of three promo cards distributed at the 2019 Gathering of Friends. These cards feature words themed around the Gathering of Friends, which is an annual meet-up of board game enthusiasts hosted by game designer Alan R. Moon.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Mars Ravelo's Lastikman: Tagu-Taguan
description:
"Can you beat Lastikman in a game of hide and seek?

In Lastikman: Tagu-taguan, you're racing to find Lastikman using given Clues! Who can think and move fast? Be the fastest in this game for the whole family.

Each round players try to be the first one to find Lastikman by showing 2 clue cards which will determines Lastikman's transformation (Palit-Anyo card). Each clue card shows puzzles that might be right or wrong and depending on the matches of the 2 clue cards they need to have the sharpest eyes and the fastest hand to find the right Palit-Anyo card. The first player to tap or place their hand on the right Palit-Anyo card will get 1 point. The game continues until a player scores 5 points and will be declared as the winner of the game."
-Translated from Filipino.

Contents:
3 Lastikman Cards
16 Palit-Anyo Cards
42 Clue Cards
1 Rule Book

name: Warrior of the Wastes
description:
It is all about Conquest – conquest of the treacherous Wastes! The Wastes are a realm of mystery, magic and most definitely death. You WILL become the Warlord who takes your lowly Clan and raises it to the realm of Empire, if you can only advance through the challenges, quests and battles that lay ahead. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing hierarchies, while engaging in 22 different Quests and acquiring up to 15 different Skills and Spells. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page. You roll. You write. Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for us humble few, is all we ask. This takes the 1 Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) further into the Fantasy Realm.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jigūan: The Eastern Mechanist – 2019 Essen Promo Cards
description:
This Promo Cards offer four new ability that can replace the original ability.

Replace your Workshop ability with this new ability.

- Once per turn, you may pay 3 of the same Gears to advance your level by 1 on a Pagoda or gain 5 Points.
- Anytime during your turn, you can +1 or-1 to the value of your Blueprints. Every time you get a new Blueprint, gain 1 Point.
- At the end of the game, if you have one of each of the 5 Mechanical Beasts, gain 15 Points. If you have 2 sets, get 30 Points.
- Every time you perform Action [A] Get Gears, you gain 1 Coin. Anytime during your turn, you may pay 1 Coin to gain 1 Energy (Unlimited times).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Math
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: NEUBURG: Ottheinrich – Ruhm und Intrige
description:
As friends and advisors of the Prince Ottheinrich, you want to satisfy his interests by offering him exotic journeys, organizing great feasts, and erecting impressive buildings. In just five rounds in NEUBURG: Ottheinrich – Ruhm und Intrige, give all you've got. Only one of you will win the game as the best advisor. How your fame points come about in the end — whether through strategy, perfidious intrigue, or some luck — doesn't matter. Win by any means necessary. Enjoy the fruits of your success!

—description from the publisher

name: Leo: The Snake
description:
Contained in Deutscher Spielepreis Classic Goodie Box

Components: 5 path tiles.

SET-UP: Mix the 5 path tiles with the snake together with the other path tiles. Then, as usual, lay out the path, which is now 5 tiles longer.
Game Play: If you turn over a path tile and it shows a snake, you always lose 2 hours. The color of the just-played card doesn’t matter.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Lizardmen Team Card Pack
description:
Keep your head in the game instead of flipping through books. This crucial deck of 45 cards is loaded with reference material to help you make the most of your Lizardmen team. Easily look up your player stats, Star Players, Magical Memorabilia and Benefits of Training.

This pack also includes 8 Special Play cards, which can be used by any team!

CONTENTS

Reference cards for Lizardmen Skink Runners, Saurus Blockers, Chameleon Skinks and Kroxigors
Reference cards for Star Players like Anqi Panqi, Glotl Stop, and the Skink twins Drull and Dribl
Blank cards to create your own players
1 team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
4 Magical Memorabilia cards: Helm of the Stegadon, Sotek's Sacred Jars, Cursed Totem, Carnosaur Shield
4 Benefits of Training cards: Catch Me If You Slann, A Lizardman's Tail, Dino-might!, Do You Think He Saurus?
8 universal Special Play cards
The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse


Key Features

Full set of reference cards for your Lizardmen team
Includes blank cards for all Lizardmen positions
Speed up your games and keep track of your roster, players, and special rules


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Goblin Team Card Pack
description:
Coaching goblins can be a chaotic mess in all the right ways. Keep that mayhem to the pitch and get organised with this deck of 44 reference cards. Keep track of stats for each position, Star Players, Dirty Tricks and Miscellaneous Mayhem.

This pack also includes 6 Special Play cards, which can be used by any team!

This set contains:

Reference cards for Goblin, Bomma, Looney, Fanatic, Doom Diver, Pogoer, ‘Ooligan and, of course, Troll players
Reference cards for Star Players like Fungus the Loon, The Black Gobbo, and Bomber Dribblesnot
Blank cards to create your own players
1 team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
3 Dirty Tricks cards: Honest, Guv! Hideous Tittering, Total Con-Troll
3 Miscellaneous Mayhem cards: Oi! Where'd 'E Go?, Fanatic On The Loose, Mushroom Brew.
6 universal Special Play cards
The all-important card that explains how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse


Key Features

Full set of reference cards for your Goblin team
Includes blank cards for all eight positions
Speed up your games and keep track of your roster, players and special rules


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Telepathy
description:
Telepathy is a dynamic and fun boardgame, occurrence and original, based on the association of ideas between players.

It can be played individually or in teams. In each turn a player writes, in the maximum time of one minute, all the words thinking, related to a certain image. The other players must try to match the maximum number of words the active player has written, writing their own list.

—user summary
mechanics: Communication Limits, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Flip-Flop Agents
description:
An unidentified spy is approaching you. That would be one of the 8 spies who belong to one of the two factions.
In this game, you can see other players' cards but not your own. Under such situations, you have to report the number of FALSE’s spies and the spy approaching you.

—description from the designer

name: Speed Racer
description:
Your car is speeding down the road to nowhere. You’ve got to keep building as fast and furiously as you can, or you’re headed for a dead end. How long can you last in this endurance challenge?

SETUP:
Separate the Blinks so each piece resets to a loose road, indicated by spinning orange lights. Connect the Blinks together in a single line, then double-click any Blink to create a playable road.
Extend your road by connecting loose roads at the endpoint indicated by a red light. You must connect to the red side- connecting to any other side will not create a thru road.

You can also attach built roads together by connecting their red lights.
Road setup process
Click any connected road piece to start a car. Single- clicks will create standard cars, and multi-clicks (3 or more) will create faster and faster cars.

GAMEPLAY:
Cars will travel from Blink to Blink, constantly increasing in speed. If your car reaches the end of the road, it will crash in a fiery wreck.
Car traveling and crashing
To keep your car from crashing, extend the road in front of the car using available Blinks.
Connecting two existing road segments

WIN CONDITION:
There is no finish line in Speed Racer - eventually, every car crashes. The question for you is how far and how fast can you go? Race side-by-side with your friends or set up time trials.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Real-Time

name: Grimoor
description:
Grimoor reimplements the combo driven card play of Hordes of Grimoor, with a heavier emphasis on combos, card play, and multiple scoring avenues, with a quicker game tempo and more fluid in-game scoring choices, as well as updated graphic design.

Grimoor is a two player, single deck card game. Each player controls a Horde, as well as three undeveloped territories. Over the course of three rounds, players use their actions to play Cohorts a variety of ways, including combo-based abilities, unlocking powerful Curios, and build Strongholds, with each choice having the potential to score points, set up additional combos, or end the round.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Monkey Mischief
description: Roll the dice to collect monkey tokens matching the highest total of one colour. Bananas can double, triple or quadruple your score. When all tokens are taken, phase 2 begins. Roll the dice, pick a colour and the player with the matching coloured monkey must replace that number of tokens. The last player to have tokens remaining is the winner!

name: Trivia Trolls
description:
The first party trivia game that embarrasses your friends through the art of trolling.

On each turn, one person draws a clue card and reads the category to their teammates. The teammates select the clue difficulty they want, 1 point being easy, 2 points being medium, and 3 points being hard.

The opposing team then has the opportunity to play a troll card or a trap card to add an extra layer of difficulty. Troll cards are played face up. They can make players do things like “sing the clue in their best opera voice,” “read the clue while smiling through clenched teeth,” “read the clue in their best Australian accent” “read the clue with a mouthful of water” or “text the clue using only emojis” to name just a few. Trap cards are played face down and revealed after the clue is read. They can make teams skip turns or lose points.

If a troll card or trap card is played, the answering team has the opportunity to play defense with a trench card. Trench cards can negate troll and trap cards, award extra points or give extra turns.

Once all troll, trap, or trench cards have been played for the round. The clue is read, hilarity ensues, points are awarded (or not) and then the next team draws their clue. The first team to 11 points wins! Let the trolling commence!

Happy Trolling friends!

—description from the publisher

name: TBH: The Game of Honest Answers to Outrageous Questions
description:
TBH is a game about creating absurd dilemmas, and then predicting how the other players will react to them. Points are awarded for guessing the other players' responses correctly. The game consists of various cards, a Player Board for each player, and a score tracker board.

One player is the Dilemma Boss, and chooses two cards from the deck of prompts. They choose one to ask the rest of the group. The other players then respond with follow-up questions, to try and define the parameters of the hypothetical situation.

The Dilemma Boss gets to make up any answers they like about the situation. In this way, the round becomes a type of group storytelling exercise.

Once all players are satisfied that they know how to respond to the dilemma, everyone answers for themselves secretly on their own Player Board, and also plays a limited number of Guess Cards on other players' boards.

Upon the reveal, explanations are given, and correct guesses earn points. The number of points scales with how many other players guessed on the same person.

The game is created and published by Cut.com, creators of Truth or Drink and Fear Pong.

-description from publisher

name: Mulligan: The Golf Card Game
description:
Mulligan is a lighthearted, strategic golf-themed card game which can be played using a scorecard from any golf course in the world!

Players use dual-function cards as both Clubs to advance down the course, and as Actions to improve their own shots or mess up those of their opponents.

Mulligan utilizes a simultaneous-turn style of gameplay, and distance markers on all the Club cards which match up to each player's distance board to easily track progress down each hole.

Gameplay is easy to pick up, and little-to-no knowledge of golf is required to play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Movement Template, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Elementile
description:
Elementile - is a tile-based 1v1 card game which rewards key decisions and adaptive play. Utilize 6 base elements with their own strengths and weaknesses to summon units and cast spells on the 4x4 field of play. Gain resources by sacrificing cards from your hand, creating play patterns that vary based on the individual match up and your opponent’s actions. Each player has full control over their resource pool so the ability to engage is always at their fingertips. Push your advantage to your opponent’s front door and unleash a powerful attack to win the game!

Get together with friends and draft your decks with our core set – a complete 462 card cube intended for drafting with 138 unique cards of varying “rarities” to ensure no two drafts play out the same. Utilize the head to head deck lists published in the rulebook to get right into the game, or choose your favorites from our complete card list to make the constructed deck of your dreams!

Inside the base box of Elementile is a complete 462 card cube (enough for a draft with 6-10 players), 120 element cards (20 of each element), 16 6-sided dice and 64 attack/frozen tokens (for tracking the current board state), two neoprene playmats (for a single 1v1 game board), and a rulebook complete with constructed decklists.

In Elementile, each player has a deck of 40 cards, either pre-constructed or drafted. There are six elements (fire, water, earth, wind, light, and darkness) each with 23 unique cards that players can use to create their decks (limited to 3 copies total of any specific cards). Players summon units and cast spells to control the 4x4 field of play. Your goal is to advance your units across the board to reduce your opponent’s health from 10 to 0.

The last player standing, wins.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Square Grid

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Direchasm – Arena Mortis
description:
Arena Mortis gives you a variety of new ways to use your existing Warhammer Underworlds collection. 3 to 6 players choose a single fighter from any warband to send into brutal melee, either in a free-for-all brawl or in teams. Arena Mortis offers fast-paced fun, and it's a fantastic way to mix up your game night and settle grudges.

The latest edition of Arena Mortis is fully compatible with the previous version and brings the action into Direchasm. You'll find a completely new deck of hazard cards to represent the deadly environment and add depth to your games. You'll also nab a fresh set of gambit and upgrade cards to mix into your Warhammer Underworlds decks.

Inside the set, you'll find:


20 gambit cards – designed for Arena Mortis but usable in any version of Warhammer Underworlds
20 upgrade cards – also compatible with standard games of Warhammer Underworlds
20 hazard cards, usable only in Arena Mortis (including the previous edition)
A double-sided game board to play on, compatible with existing Warhammer Underworlds boards
Tokens and Cards for keeping track of the game, including six new Mortis Lenses
Fighter cards for Regis Fulbringer and Dolorghast, available in print for the first time


—description from the publisher's website

name: Sherlock Holmes, Consulting Detective ー Baker Street 221B
description:
In Sherlock Holmes, Consulting Detective - Baker Street 221B, detectives venture to the darkest parts of London trying to solve six different Sherlock Holmes cases.

On their turn, a player moves their detective piece one or two spaces on the board. Travelling from location to location, they collect clues to be the first to solve a case. Once all clues have been collected, the player must arrest the criminal before the case is finally solved. The game ends once all tiles have been removed from the board (or a player forces it to end), and the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Point to Point Movement

name: Schätz die Welt: Wer wird Tipp-Weltmeister?
description:
This geography game runs for 6 rounds: Each round, everyone receives 3 country cards, flag side up. Then 3 category cards are placed in the center of the table.

Now players have to assess their own countries according to the categories and place the country cards accordingly. As soon as all the country cards have been placed, it's time for the evaluation: The player's own game piece may advance according to the score on the game board. When the three categories have been scored, a question about the capital follows.

name: AdvanceQuest: An Abduction in Darkhill
description:
In a land ruled by an iron fist, danger flourishes in the shadows. Uncover a disturbing mystery when you witness... An Abduction in Darkhill.

AdvanceQuest is a compact adventure system. Generate a character with any traits you want, and advance your way through the story, rolling dice against challenges and trying to reach the end.

A new chapter in the AdvanceQuest story is coming.

Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the story will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two story elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue on. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects! If you can make it through the story, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to collect along the way – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Room: The Game – Family Edition: Candy Factory and Super Heroes
description:
Candy Factory (3/5 difficulty)

Your sweet-as-candy Uncle Lucas Ollie has got himself caught in chewing gum while making the biggest batch of candy ever. He needs your help in the Candy Factory now to get everything sorted before Halloween. If only you had paid closer attention during all those -boring- factory tours... But then you accidentally stumble across Uncle Lucas's massive secret!

Super Heroes Next Generation (3.5/5 difficulty)

In one hit, an ageing ray has turned Super Team X into powerless old folk! Who's behind this? Is it professor Sprout, Sir Charles Gourmand, or rebel Ann Archy after all? It is up to you, the new generation of superheroes, to work this out and to rescue your parents from the care home. Quickly, before it's too late!

It's always a race against the clock; you only have 60 minutes to escape.

Contents: Electronic Chrono Decoder, Hint Decoder, 16 Keys, 3x8 Hint Cards,

--description from publisher's website
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Tijvin 1941: el Tifón del Norte
description:
The German offensive and the Soviet counteroffensive in the Tikhvin area, November-December 1941.


Published in Alea_Magazine #39

name: Hijacked: Pilots
description:
This expansion adds six pilots to the list deck of passengers cards.
These pilots can be discarded or played to give.
If played they replace passenger required to free one of the pilot of the plane.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Line of Sight, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Atmosfear: 30th Anniversary Edition
description:
Atmosfear, the iconic horror-themed board game, has returned in its 30th Anniversary Edition, and it's as thrilling and immersive as ever! This modernized version of the classic game comes with updated components (through the Kickstarter campaign) and a nostalgic nod to the original, making it a must-have for both longtime fans and newcomers alike.

Components:
The 30th Anniversary Edition of Atmosfear comes with high-quality components that are visually stunning and tactilely pleasing. The game includes a beautifully illustrated game board, six character pawns to collect keys for, multiple types of cards (Time, Fatez and Chance), and 2x 6D with the Gatekeeper's head in them! The game now comes with a QR code to find the video of the game on Vimeo instead of a VHS or DVD featuring the iconic Gatekeeper, who sets the tone for the game with his sinister presence. The components are durable and well-designed, adding to the overall immersion and enjoyment of the game.

Gameplay:
The gameplay of Atmosfear remains true to the original, with some modern updates that add to the excitement. Players take on the roles of six different characters, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, as they navigate through the various regions of the board, trying to collect keys and make their way to the center to face the Gatekeeper. The video is used as a timer, adding a sense of urgency to the game, and the Gatekeeper's appearances on the screen are both thrilling and chilling (and loud!).

One of the standout features of the 30th Anniversary Edition is the addition of new event cards, which bring a fresh level of unpredictability to the game. These cards can affect players in various ways, such as forcing them to swap places, lose turns, or face challenges that can alter the course of the game. The combination of the video, cards, and unique character abilities creates a dynamic and engaging gameplay experience that keeps players on their toes and eager for more.

Theme and Atmosphere:
Atmosfear is all about creating a spooky and immersive atmosphere, and the 30th Anniversary Edition does not disappoint. The game's theme of horror and suspense is brought to life through the video, which features the iconic Gatekeeper, who taunts and challenges players throughout the game. The game board is richly illustrated with dark and eerie artwork that adds to the overall ambiance. The combination of the components, gameplay, and theme work together seamlessly to create an immersive and thrilling experience that will keep players on the edge of their seats.

Fun Factor:
Atmosfear 30th Anniversary Edition is an absolute blast to play. The combination of the video, event cards, and unique character abilities create a highly interactive and unpredictable gameplay experience that keeps players engaged and entertained from start to finish. The sense of urgency created by the timer adds to the excitement, and the overall atmosphere of the game is thrilling and immersive. The game also encourages player interaction, with opportunities for strategic decision-making, alliances, and betrayals, making for a highly enjoyable and memorable gaming experience.

Overall:
Atmosfear 30th Anniversary Edition is a fantastic board game that successfully revitalizes the classic horror-themed game for a modern audience. The components, gameplay, and immersive atmosphere make for an engaging and thrilling experience that will keep players coming back for more. Whether you're a longtime fan of the original or new to the world of Atmosfear, this anniversary edition is a must-have addition to your board game collection. Get ready to face your fears and embrace the darkness with Atmosfear 30th Anniversary Edition!
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Snack Match
description:
The sun is shining and a gentle breeze is blowing. It’s the perfect weather to have a picnic: divide the food and tablecloths between yourselves. Mix the tablecloths and food items in front of you, trying to group the same kinds together. This is how you’ll make this picnic as appetizing as possible!

—description from the publisher

name: 50 Clues: The Last Journey
description:
The Last Journey is the third episode of the story-driven escape game trilogy, Sunshine Island.

Disguised as a soldier, you sail away from Bornholm, where a deadly fungal disease has spread. A test tube and a memory card with your sister’s potential cure for the disease must be handed over to the researcher MALM. He can complete the job and perhaps stop the extremely dangerous infection from spreading. Unfortunately, not everyone wants you to succeed. Gaia agents are also looking for the material and MALM. Take on a challenging mission in the role of Sigrid.

50 Clues is an award-winning immersive puzzle game that offers the experience of an escape room, but in a format that can be played at home. You combine objects, solve puzzles and decipher codes to complete the story. A smartphone or tablet keeps track of the solutions and provides multistep hints if the need arises.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Quicksand: Danger Mode
description:
Test your Quicksand skills with Danger Mode!

This mini-expansion allows you to replay all of the levels from the base game with a higher difficulty level thanks to a Dangerous sand timer that triggers game over as soon as it runs out of sand.

Do you have what it takes to beat the DANGER MODE?

—description from the publisher

name: Eleven
description:
Eleven is a shedding card game from Japan.

The game is played by making a sequence of cards with numbers on them to reduce the number of cards in your hand. The cards come in five different colours, and you draw as many cards as the number of colours in the sequence number you have played. In other words, you can reduce the number of cards in your hand by making a sequence of cards of the same colour as far as possible. When the hand is reduced to one card, it is revealed, the number is scored and the game continues by drawing the same number of cards as the number. The player who scores a total of 11 points wins the game.

数字の描かれたカードで連番を作り、手札を減らしていくゲームです。カードは5種類の色があり、出した連番の中に含まれる色の数だけカードを引きます。つまり、なるべく同じ色で連番を作った方がカードをたくさん減らすことができます。手札が１枚になったら公開し、その数字が得点になり、その数字と同じ枚数のカードを引いてゲームを続けます。合計で１１点獲得したプレイヤーの勝利です。
--description by publisher
publishers: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)

name: Mage Battle
description:
from the publisher's website.

Mage Battle is a party game. The players act as Mages, casting spells using cards and competing with other players. The players need to collect as many stars or wands as possible and can change their existing class to the highest position in any of three types of classes i.e. Necromancer, Wizard and Summoner.
Each class has its own ability and play by using only one card deck. The winner could be anyone who collects all the five types of wands and twenty stars.

name: Kiev & Rostov: Battles of Army Group South, 1941
description:
Kiev & Rostov: Battles of Army Group South, 1941, is a set division/regiment level simulations of crucial campaigns in the southwestern Soviet Union during World War II.

Kiev: The Battle of Encirclement, 1941, depicts the German Blitzkrieg campaign that lasted from 29 August to 26 September 1941. It ended with one of the largest encirclements in history, Nearly the entire Southwestern Front of the Red Army was encircled, with the Soviets losing over 600,000 troops, 3700 guns and almost 900 tanks.

Rostov: The First Soviet Counterattack, 1941, depicts the German drive across the Donets Basin in the fall of 1941. Army Group South attempted to seize the valuable communications junction at Rostov and establish bridgeheads across both the Donets and lower Don Rivers. In the ensuing fighting around Rostov, the Germans suffered their first strategic setback in their campaign against the Soviet Union, as the Soviet Army drove the German mechanized spearhead from this vital area.

Army Group South game system is an adaptation of the system pioneered in SPI's Panzergruppe Guderian.

Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #188 - Nov/Dec 1997.

Kiev Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 days
Hex: 5 miles / 8 kilometers
Units: Regiment to Division

Rostov Game Scale:
Game Turn: 5 days
Hex: 10.5 miles / 17 kilometers
Units: Regiment to Division

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
Two dual-side printed countersheets (400 1/2" counters)
One 16-page Army Group South rulebook
One Player Aid Card

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-6 Hours
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Aether Captains: Triad
description:
3 games innovatively using 1 deck of 54 custom cards, all set in the steampunk-themed Aether Captains game world.

Players supply 5d6 to share and 24 eurocube sized markers per player. All the games are designed to share components and be able to be played quickly by 2 players in a compact space. Deck includes all cards to play each game, cards which are the game boards, and rules. Designed for print and play fans of Aether Captains (printable on standard 8.5" x 11' paper), also available as an Artscow order.

The Games:

Intrigue (27 cards including rules): a 2 player game of area control across the city states of Arkady, using 24 eurocube style markers per player. Players take on the role of Grand Council members, vying for influence in the city states. Players use groups of matching cards to place 1-3 markers in each city state during their turns, trying for a majority, or can use cards to remove an opponent's influence. The game is played in 2 rounds, scoring each round, and takes 10-20 minutes.

Zeppelin Derby (12 cards including rules): a simple 2 player race game in the skies over Thoia. Players roll 5d6 and use cards as roll modifiers to race across a 3 card course. Cards include Dirty Tricks and Engineering bonuses. 5-10 minutes.

Celinian Trader (14 cards including rules): a pick up and deliver style game of trade on the Celinian Sea for 1 or 2 players. Needed are 14 eurocube style markers per player and 5d6. Players fill their holds with different types of goods - copper, glass, coal and linen - as they sail from port to port buying and selling goods, amassing their fortunes. The game is played over 4 rounds whose length is determined by a series of events both players are subject to. Different values for buying and selling are set by a Trade Market that changes prices from round to round. Competing for victory points, players may also purchase upgrades to their ships. This game is also suitable for solitaire play and takes 20-30 minutes.

All three games are designed to be quickly learned, easy to play and fun.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Nautical, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dragonrealm: Hidden Treasure! Expansion
description:
This mini expansion adds four hidden treasure cards to the draw deck, and ten face-down treasure tokens. Upon a player drawing or revealing a hidden treasure card, it's immediately discarded and a random hidden treasure token is taken by that player. Most of the tokens are kept secret for end game scoring, while some will allow the player to draw a random level 1 Enhancement card.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Wendy Pferdebasar
description:
This is a variant of Bohnanza using horses instead of beans; it is a licensed product for Wendy magazine, a German magazine focusing on horses. (There is also an animated TV show and so forth.)

from the Bohnanza entry:
As card games go, this one is quite revolutionary. Perhaps its oddest feature is that you cannot rearrange your hand, as you need to play the cards in the order that you draw them. The cards are colorful depictions of beans in various descriptive poses, and the object is to make coins by planting fields (sets) of these beans and then harvesting them. To help players match their cards up, the game features extensive trading and deal making.

The game is not identical to Bohnanza. The deck does not include an equivalent to the Garden Beans (6s), and from two to five of each type of horse are foals. When a foal is turned up as one of the cards to be traded, if there is only one player breeding that kind of horse they get it automatically. If a paddock has a foal on top when it is scored, it is worth nothing.

Other differences include the lack of the ability to buy a third paddock (field), the lack of a rule prohibiting scoring a paddock with a single horse under some circumstances, and the inclusion of rules for two players.

name: Bomarzo: Seasons
description:
Promo Expansion for the game Bomarzo: Shuffle the 12 Season tokens, then randomly take 1 token and put it on the Game board near the first Season number. Repeat the procedure for each Season number on the board until 8 tokens have been placed. Give to each player a Resume card.
Each season, a modification is applied based on the color of the token for that season:
White token: No modification.
Black token: Villages do not have a Production Phase for this season.
Green token: A maximum of 2 actions per player are allowed.
Yellow token: Divinity action copying is not allowed.
Brown token: Card powers/incomes do not work.

13 cards can be arranged in over 6 Billion possible combinations ... 6,227,020,800 to be exact.

A version of this game is said to have been found at a UFO site in Texas back in the 1980s. With its mysterious origin, we are still unclear as to the strange effects of achieving the "13" result. Some say it sharpens intuition, improves focus, and intelligence.

But who knows....

"13" is primarily a solo card game, but more can play as well, using just 13 cards. It can be played by yourself just trying to get the highest score, break the code per say, or you could play it with two or more people as a betting game to see who can come up with the highest score over a three round match.

RULES:

The cards are mixed and dealt out randomly and face up in this configuration:

X X X X X
X X X
X X X X X

Cards will have either an arrow/arrows showing in which direction they may affect another card. These arrows only affect cards immediately next to them, whether horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. The arrow on the activated card must be pointing to a card immediately adjacent to it, otherwise there is no effect. Some cards will have simple written instructions. When a card refers to “first position” or “last position” they are referring to the original dealt out top left position “1” or the original dealt out bottom right position “13” exactly. If the cards in those specific positions have been removed (the space is empty) then nothing happens.

So once the cards are shuffled and dealt out, you will “activate” one card and remove both the card activated and the card it affects from the tableau.

The objective is to remain with one card in the end, otherwise it’s an automatic loss. Remaining with one card in the end is usually possible, so avoiding mistakes is crucial. You’re shooting to remain with the highest value card in the end, preferably the “13”.

www.DualBrainGames.com
www.thegamecrafter.com/games/131

name: Against All Odds: Battle for the Golan Heights
description:
Against the Odds: Battle for the Golan Heights is a game simulating the Syrian attack on the Golan Heights during the opening stages of the Yom Kippur War, between October 6-9, 1973. The Israeli forces were extensively outnumbered in the opening thrust but in the end, they held their ground, blunting the Syrian thrust and forcing them to withdraw.  The withdrawal was a timely break for the Israeli’s, as unbeknownst to the Syrians, the Israeli defenses were on the brink of collapse. Against the Odds: Battle for the Golan Heights concentrates on a small segment of that desperate battle through both historic and variant scenarios.

Complexity: 4 out of 10

Solitaire: 7 out of 10

Ages: 12+

Players: 1-2

Time: 30-60 Minutes

name: Sim Novel
description:
Sim Novel is a card game in which the players create settings for imagined typical youth fantasy novels (or so called Japanese "Light Novels").

The game consists of a deck of cards with either characters, relation or attributes. Each player creates a network of cards where the characters are connected by relation arrows, and have various attributes. Points are awarded for fulfilling the relationship arrows' special conditions.

name: Hollywood Sensation
description:
Hollywood Sensation is a trick-taking game for two players, each of whom takes on the role of a starlet hoping for fame — but not too much fame, mind you, as that would be gauche, and besides, it would be harder to hide any scandals!

Each round, the players randomize the strength order of the four suits. Cards collected in two suits are worth positive points, and the other two suits are negative points.

Each player is dealt a small hand, then the top card of the deck is flipped face up. The players compete in a must-follow trick-taking game, with the winner of each trick taking the face-up card from the deck in their hand, and the other player doing the same with a face-down card from the top of the deck. After the round, the players' points are converted to a type of meta points by moving a pawn on a red carpet.

In subsequent rounds, the player who is behind in meta points begins the round by setting cards aside from their hand to create a small private deck; they will draw from this deck once the main draw pile is exhausted.

name: Deutschland: Das Kartenspiel
description:
This card game variant of the Deutschland board game works without a map. Instead, 3-5 city cards (depending on the number of players) are revealed and players take turns on placing bets underneath. Bets can be:
- This city is the northernmost/easternmost/southernmost/westernmost of the revealed cities
- This city has the most/fewest citizen of the revealed cities

The earliest (correct) bets for each city score the most points.

name: 狩猟の時代 (Shuryou no Jidai)
description:
The game is set in prehistoric times. Each player represents a leader of the different tribes. To enhance tribes, the leaders go hunting, finding new caves, making new companions, and building new dwellings. The leader who did the best wins the game.

Era of Hunting is a worker placement/displacement game with individual player boards to lead your tribe to expand and enrich your hunting grounds and prosper.
By placing each worker, others are moved or removed from their current positions.

During a turn a player takes up to 3 types of actions: hunting, developing and checking food supply. Then the turn moves to the next player in clockwise order.

If a player places all five of their dwellings or has 10 or more points on the score track, the game end is triggered.

—user summary

name: Star Realms: Disposal Bot Promo Card
description:
Disposal Bot
Machine Cult Ship
Cost: 2
Ability: Draw a card.
Ally Ability: Scrap a card in your hand or discard pile.
Scrapping Ability: Draw a card.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Discoverers Pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Formula Fun
description:
Formula Fun is a card driven car race.

Cars move three times around a 30-space track on which the spaces are numbered from 1 to 10. On his turn, a player plays a card and moves a car. The cards have different powers depending on which number your car is sitting on. For instance, a card might move you 8 spaces if you're sitting on an 8, but only 3 spaces otherwise.

At the end of each race, the car that came in last is removed from the game, and the next race has one fewer starters.

The game ends after the last race with just two cars.
The player who wins the last race is the winner of the game.

In the "Racing Stable" Variant each player has their own deck of cards.
The "Night Race" Variant is played on the back of the board.
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Race

name: Zające na łące
description:
Players play cards and move colored hares on the board. Until the very end nobody knows which hare belongs to which opponent. The game has simple rules and victory is decided by tactics and the ability to bluff.

In Zające na łące ("Hares in the meadow") every player controls two out of four hares. It may happen that some hares are controlled by two players. On a turn a player chooses one card from hand and moves proper hare.

The game ends after 3. round. At the end of each round hares are awarded points. Hares can also earn points during the race by landing on a carrot. The player who has the most point at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Mini Crimes: The Strange Cup
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!
