In Mini Crimes: La strana coppa (Mini Crimes: The strange cup), the precious cup of a struggling football team has mysteriously disappeared from the headquarters, despite being kept in a alarmed case.
How was that possible?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Citadel
description:
Two-player adventure game set in a six-level citadel represented by six square-grid maps. One player takes the side of the forces of evil and places doors, monsters, pitfalls, sinkholes, and a talisman in the citadel. The other player takes the side of the forces of good and begins sending heroes into the citadel. The evil player must kill all the heroes to win; for the good player to win, a hero must capture the talisman and escape from the citadel.

Counters are provided for all citadel components and heroes, but miniatures can be used instead. Playing time is a guess.
mechanics: Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Winner's Circle
description:
Each player is dealt a "Program" card that specifies a colored horse pawn and the betting odds for that horse. Each player is also dealt four movement cards. Based on the strength of those movement cards, each player places bets on his horse. Bets can be to Win, Place or Show on a player's own horse. The players have the option to place a Daily Double bet, which in this game is betting that the player's own horse will win the first two races. The players, one at a time, play a movement card. Most of the movement cards specify a number of spaces to move the player's horse pawn. Some of the movement cards state, "Ask Jockey". "Ask Jockey" means that the player turns over the top card of the "Ask Jockey" deck. The Ask Jockey cards are marked on their backs with a blue dot if the card has advantages for the player, red dot for disadvantages for the player, question marks ?? for instructions that may or may not affect the player that plays it. Holding an Ask Jockey card until that deck has a card with a blue dot on top is ideal. After the players have put into play and discarded all of the cards dealt, the entire movement deck is shuffled and four more cards are dealt to each player. "Ask Jockey" cards can require a player to give a number of his movement cards to another player or just discard them without using them. Therefore, players may use more or less than four movement cards per hand dealt. After the second race is complete, the Program cards are shuffled and dealt for each race. The race track board is proportionally marked for all of the common lengths of horse races. A game is complete after an agreed upon number of races and the instructions recommend 8 races. The most money wins.

This is NOT Knizia's Winner's Circle

name: Leningrad '41: What If Manstein had Attacked?
description:
Leningrad ’41: What If Manstein had Attacked? (L’41), designed by Joseph Miranda, is a two-player alternative history wargame of intermediate complexity that simulates a hypothetical German attempt to seize the city of Leningrad in late July through August 1941. The assumption is Manstein, rather than pausing for two weeks as he did historically, simply charged ahead into the city immediately upon crossing the Luga River.

To control complexity and present an overall-force-commander’s-view of the battle, the game uses a tactically scaled map and units of maneuver coupled with an operationally scaled game turn length. The German player is generally on the offensive, trying to clear the Soviet defending force from the city prior to the end of the game. L’41 uses the system originally created for our earlier published Manila’45 game.

Each game turn equals three days. Each hexagon on the map represents 0.3 miles (0.5 km) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver for the Germans are mainly battalions, while those for the Soviets range from battalions to regiments and brigades. Thus each unit may represent anywhere from 100 to 5,000 men and their equipment.

Special rules cover such things as: fog of war, replacements, reinforcements, defensive fire, indirect fire, combat air support, command control, leaders, fanaticism, gunboats, the cruiser Aurora, the Komsomol, the metro, and optional German airborne assault. The turn sequence is as follows.

I. German Player Turn
A. German Replacement & Reinforcement Phase
B. German Air Strike Phase
C. German Movement & Soviet Defensive Phase
D. German Offensive Fire Phase

II. Soviet Player Turn
A. Soviet Reinforcement Phase (skip on Game Turn 1)
B. Soviet Movement & German Defensive Fire Phase
C. Soviet Offensive Fire Phase

Originally published in World at War No.17 Apr-May 2011.

World at War magazine version:
Game Scale:
Game Turn: 3 days
Hex: 0.3 miles / 0.5 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Brigade

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 9/16" counters)
One 16-page rulebook (12 for rules, 4 for marketing)

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

name: Final Lap: the card game
description:
Final Lap: the card game is a standalone card game that challenges up to 6 players (can be played solo) to lead their team to victory in the racing championship. A challenging card game with a great balance of skill and luck, and lots of interesting card combinations. Average play time is around 10 minutes per race, with the players deciding how many races they want to play in order to decide the championship winner, allowing Final Lap to be played as a time filler, or an entire evening of entertainment.

Players each manage a racing team of two cars and compete in a number of races through to see who can accumulate the most championship points and become the champion. In each race players need to correctly manage their hand of cards, reaping the biggest rewards possible from their good cards, and reducing the negative imapct suffered from their bad ones, to ensure the cars in their team score as many championship points as possible.

Championship points are only scored in a race by the cars that finish in the top 6 positions. At the beginning of each race the cars are laid out in the reverse finishing order from the previous race. Each player is dealt a hand of cards and during a race a player must use all of the cards in their hand. As a car finishing in last place will ensure that it begins qualifying in the following race in first position, it is therefore beneficial for cars to finish as low as possible in a race if they do not finish in the top 6 positions, which results some very interesting and tactical game play.

After the cars are laid out in order at the beginning of a race, and players have received their hand of cards, qualifying will take place. Certain cards can be used during qualifying or during a race. If a player uses a card during qualifying to improve the qualifying order of one or both of their cars, they will discard the card and draw a random card to replace it. Since players must use all of the cards in their hand during a race, they will need to evaluate whether they can afford to use such cards during qualifying as it may result it them drawing a very bad card as a replacement.

During a race players can have their cars take pit stops. When a car takes it pit stop it allows the players to discard a card from their hand without having to play it, which acts as an outlet to remove bad cards from a players hand. Pit stops need to be managed effectively as they can only be taken by cars that require them, and any cards not discarded through pit stops must be played even if they have severely negative consequences for your cars.

Excellent hand management is crucial in this game. After you receive your hand of cards you need to formulate a race plan, working out how to get the most out of the cards you’ve been dealt. Adaptability is also key, being able to change a race plan or abandon it altogether as interactions with other players may not go as expected.

Final Lap is a hugely flavourful card game, with a whole range of racing events covered by cards, including qualifying, pit stops, crashes, oil spills, spin outs, tyre punctures, yellow flags, team orders, defensive lines, slip streaming, car setup, racing strategies, repairs and mechanical problems with engines and gear boxes.

name: Space Yoghurt
description:
Space Yoghurt is a competitive game for two to four space adventurers. By rolling dice and making use of the moon's strategic places, the player maneuvers his or her crew into the spaceship's cockpit and strives to win the cosmic vacation. Will you be the one who receives the Golden Ticket from the Galactic Empress Yolibolibana III?

Each player has a crew of three spaceters and takes turn to roll the three crew dice to move along the moon track. If you end up on a Bouncy Crater you can make haste and bounce all the way to the cockpit, soaring past the other spaceters. Ending up on a Yoghurt Pool gives you special powers, but the Space Yoghurt is wacky strong and must be handled with care. It might win you the game, sending other players' spaceters home or be so bitter that you must go home and rest for a while. Easy rules, fast play and big wins! See you out there, brave space adventurers!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dino Dodge: Survival of the Fittest
description:
~STORY~
65 million years ago, the Earth was dominated by Dinosaurs. They lived together in peace and harmony. Always being kind and courteous to their dino neighbors. That is…until the meteors came…

Now it’s every dino for themselves! Push, shove and dodge your way out of falling meteors! Do whatever it takes, even if it means moving another dino under the meteor, to be the Last Dinosaur on Earth!

~OBJECTIVE~
Play Action Cards to dodge falling meteors, move your enemies under meteors and avoid new threats. Meteors fall by utilizing its ticker. Whoever is under a meteor and cannot escape are eliminated from the game.

Manage your hand carefully or leave your fate in the claws of your enemies. Meteors continue to fall and the world turns into lava, as the age of extinction lays way for only one dinosaur left standing!

~SPECIFICATION~
AGES: 8 and up
PLAYERS: 2 – 5
DURATION: 15 – 30 minutes
GAMETYPE: Competitive
MECHANICS: Take that, Hand Management, Free-For-All
REPLAYABILITY: Yes

LAUNCHING ON KICKSTARTER SOON:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bluegeargames/dino-dodg...
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Marvel: Rock Paper Heroes – Enter the Danger Room
description:
Rock Paper Heroes: Enter the Danger Room is a fast and frantic reimagining of the classic game of throwing hand gestures. Now, these gestures represent the powerful mutant abilities of eight iconic heroes who are training to become protectors of mutantkind!

Whether you want to use a mastery of the weather like Storm, cosmic-fire like Phoenix, or you're simply the best at what you do like Wolverine, get ready for some fun in the Danger Room that can't be missed! The hero that makes the best use of their powers and has uncanny reactions to the situation they're in will win.

name: Decktective: Lock Up Sherlock Holmes!
description:
Decktective is a co-operative crime game that can be played alone or in a group.
Decktective: Lock Up Sherlock Holmes! is the seventh game of the series.

A mysterious inscription stains the floor of 221B Baker Street.
Does it have something to do with the theft at the Royal Palace?
Is the arrest of the most famous detective of all time really the right solution? First, you must discover what has happened to Sherlock himself!

Collect the clues: documents, traces, witness statements...
...and solve the mystery!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Storytelling

name: Across America Fluxx
description:
Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

Across America Fluxx uses the basic gameplay of Fluxx, but now you're traveling across the United States of America to check out famous landmarks and national parks, from the Golden Gate Bridge to the Statue of Liberty, including the Grand Canyon, Hollywood, Cape Canaveral, Devil's Tower, the monuments of DC, and, of course, amusement parks. Across America Fluxx also includes a few special twists, including the new rule "Play All Day" and an action called "Route 66".

name: Renaissance of Alchemy
description:
Renassance of Alchemy is an alchemy-themed worker placement game by Kuro, set in the same world view as his previous title Ars Alchimia.

Each player has three workers, each represented by a die: one 4-sided, one 6-sided and one 8-sided. The smaller the die, the weaker, but quicker. There are roughly two types of places to place, either material-gathering places, which number varies depending on number of players, and the University, which allows players to play upgrade cards from their hand. The four-sided worker allows the player to take the selected action 3 times, the 6-sided twice, and the 8-sided just once. However, the player can strain the worker in order to perform certain extra actions, and this will lower the endurance of the worker – a worker with just 1 endurance cannot be placed. Being pushed out by another player's larger worker will also lower a worker's endurance.

The game is played in 3 "years", each year being divided into the above first phase of gathering of materials and playing cards, and the second phase of completing the tasks of the year. Once a player starts completing tasks, they cannot go back to gather materials, but first to the mill gets more points.

The special upgrade cards that players play when placing a worker on the University customizes the player's various abilities, giving their workers or the laboratory improved or new functions.

Ater 3 years, the collected VP for completing tasks is tallied with bonus points for various things, and most VP wins.

name: Ultimate Battle
description:
Ultimate Battle challenges players to use creativity and think on their feet. The arena: a sheet of paper set between the players. The fuel: Ultimate Battle cards and a good, thick marker! Do you have what it takes to out-think, out-maneuver, and out-sketch your opponents? Combine cards, launch devastating attacks, and defend against a barrage of creativity!

In Ultimate Battle, the goal is to utterly destroy your opponent. In this creativity-fueled game it's one-hit destruction, so players must plan attacks and defenses carefully.

The gameplay centers around two to four players each drawing from a deck of Ultimate Battle Cards. These fully illustrated cards contain everything from powerful weapons and creatures (like sharks and poison) to more mundane objects (like a brick). Using their imaginations, players must illustrate attacks against their opponents on a large sheet of paper rolled out between both players. The attacking player uses any combination of cards in their hand to launch their attack. The defending player must then use cards from their hand to defend.

If players disagree on whether an attack or defense is valid a Disagreement Card is drawn, which quickly resolves any qualms. This gets the group back to playing as quickly as possible.

If a player can't defend an attack, or loses a disagreement when trying to defend, he or she is destroyed! Whether a world-class artist or a stick-figure impresario, everyone can draw out wild attacks in Ultimate Battle. Think quick, sketch even quicker, and may the best battler win!

name: Telecraft
description:
Telecraft is a board game jointly developed with Oink Games Co., Ltd. With the theme of communication, memory, and comprehension, this work is a board game using the educational toy Mini Geofix.
Let's tell other players the theme made of triangles, squares, pentagons, and hexagons in 1 minute. that? But it's hard because I don't know how to tell you! It is difficult for the listener to understand what he is saying. However, if you don't make it according to the theme, you won't get points unless you make it according to the theme, so let's turn your head! It's a recommended game that can be enjoyed by children and adults who can't help but laugh because they don't understand what they're telling or listening to.

name: Kids Express
description:
Dastardly bandits have stolen Mountain Valley’s gold. They’re escaping on the train to the city and have hidden the gold nuggets in the passengers’ luggage... You decide to ride to the rescue in your stagecoach and help your friend Sam, the Marshal’s son, get back the gold.

We're relying on you, kids. We've got to snatch the loot from the clutches of the bandits!

In Kids Express, you take turns. On your turn, follow the two steps below:
– Step 1
You can move your Kid standee OR shoot with Sam.

– Step 2
You must pick up 1 Baggage token from where your figurine is located, and then apply the effect of this token.

Step 1 in detail
Move your Kid standee: Take your Kid standee and place it in the Train car of your choice, so long as there are no Bandits in that location.

OR

Shoot with Sam: Move the Sam standee. Use your Player Aid board to position Sam closer to or farther away from the Train and then place the Slingshot on the platform and flick or use a finger to hit it toward 1 or more Bandits, aiming to knock them over.

Step 2 in detail
Pick up an item of Luggage AND apply its effect : Take 1 Luggage token from the stack in the location your Kid standee is in. Turn it over and apply its effect. Keep it in front of you (Unless otherwise specified.)

The game ends immediately as soon as 1 of the stacks of Luggage tokens RUNS OUT.

-description from publisher
publishers: Lord of Boards, Ludonaute, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: VUGHEX
description:
VUGHEX is a two-player competitive, strategy card game that uses only 18 cards. Players alternate playing six unit cards with the aim of gaining control of the three lanes, then the powers of the units for each lane are summed, and the player with the higher power wins the lane.


If you win a lane not controlled by you, you gain control of this lane.
If you win a lane controlled by you, you deal 1 damage to your opponent.


Repeat this procedure. The player who deals the opponent 3 or more damage wins.

—description from the publisher

name: They Died With Their Boots On, Volume 1: Custer's Last Stand
description:
They Died With Their Boots On, Volume 1: Custer's Last Stand is part of the first volume of "They Died With Their Boots On", which uses an interactive game turn in which both players command an overall force made up of several sub-commands. During each turn, players alternate picking "command markers," which designate the sub-command within their force they may then use to conduct operations. The player then moves units of that sub-command and, at the completion of its movement, conducts attacks with units of that same sub-command. Play then passes to the other player, who similarly picks a marker and moves and fights. That procedure continues until all command markers have been picked. Additionally, certain events cause players to pick "heroism markers" at random, which may generate anything from mad, impetuous charges to abject surrenders.

The rules are divided into the standard rules, which are common to all games in the system, and the scenario rules, which provide deployment and reinforcement instructions, as well as victory conditions, for each specific battle game.

In this game, each turn represents from three days to three weeks, depending on the level of intensity of campaigning, and each hexagon on the map represents 12.4 miles (20 kilometers) across. US Army units are battalions (actually task-organized sub-divisions of regiments). Indian 'units' each represent groups of warriors, with about 80-120 individual per strength point.

name: Pocket Golf
description:
Pocket Golf simulates an 18 hole round of golf using custom made dice, Caddy tips and an exclusively designed course.

Play solo or in a group. Stroke play, tournament or skins formats. The winner will be the player with the lowest score for the round. Try to beat Par for the course in solo play and then try to beat that score next time your play.

The game contains 8 custom engraved dice for your clubs, rules and a uniquely designed 'Green Moose Valley' golf course that shows the course layout with hazards, a quick reference distance chart and Caddy tips. All designed to fit in your pocket!

Ideal for quick game at the 19th hole!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: MAATAC
description:
MAATAC (Multi-functional Armed & Armored Tactical Attack Computer) is "The Intergalactic Wargame of Great Armored Fighting Machines."

Relatively simple and fast-playing, MAATAC covers small engagements between robots and tanks from five different races: Terrans, Entomolians, Avarians, Carnivorans, and Aquarians.

(from the product webpage)

This is the original classic game released by Superior Models in the early 1980s.

THE RULES INCLUDE: All the original rules released in the original set, plus all the supplemental material we could lay our hands on. These are the same rules, fast, quick, and a great game for playing large numbers of tanks and robots in one game.

PLAYERS: At least 2; At Most = As many players as you can fit on the table

TIME: Varies a great deal, depending on the number of vehicles being used. During playtesting, we found that a game with 10 to 15 vehicles per side and four players takes us about 2 hours from put down to pick up.

AGE: Recommended for players 12 years and up (even younger children will enjoy with adequate supervision). This age limit is only based upon the use of miniatures with small parts. One of the playtest groups for these rules is the Strategy Club at a local Middle School!

name: Étoile
description:
The playing pieces in Étoile are of radiant colors, and they are placed on the rays of the star and beam almost like the sun.

On each turn, you may put another marble on the board, then distribute the marbles from one ray. The first player to complete an entire ray with marbles of his color wins the game.

name: Jatkosota: Finland's Continuation War for ASL
description:
A 12 page historical background booklet, one page of Chapter H notes, 36 unmounted counters, including a Maj. Tapio, and 8 scenarios. Six of the scenarios are Finnish-Russian, one German-Russian, and one Finnish-German.

8 scenarios:
1) Toast Victory with Vodka: Petrozavodsk, Russia, 1 October 1941
2) At the Gates of Viipuri: Viipuri, Finland, 20 June 1944
3) Back to the V-T Line: Kuuterselka, Finland, 14 June 1944
4) The Gods of War: Kuuterselka, Finland, 13 June 1944
5) Forests of the North: 20 miles southwest of Louhki, Russia, 11 August 1941
6) Mannerheim's Cross: Karhumakea, Finland, 5 December 1941
7) Brothers in Arms: Tornio, Finland 5 October 1944
8) Artic Strongpoint: East of the Litsa River, Northern Finland, 1 February 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: MIK 2 Extension Kit for 1853
description:
MIK2 Extension Kit for 1853 (Shares and Commodities)

Contents:
* Two Director's certificates for the Bengal Assam Railway, 140 Pounds Each
* Four Director's certificates for the Bombay, Baroda & Central India Railway, 168 Pounds Each
* Two Director's certificates for the Bengal Nagpur Railway, 176 Pounds Each
* Four Director's certificates for the Great Indian Peninsula Railway, 192 Pounds Each
* Four Director's certificates for the Madras & Southern Mahratta Railway, 160 Pounds Each
* Four commodity cards (Coal, Cotton, Rice, Tea)
* One Disturbances card
* Six place cards (1 to 6)
* One rules sheet

Comments:
When using this kit, control of a company now rests with whoever holds the majority of Director's certificates. Commodity cards permit ordinary track to be changed into stations and thus represent the revenue that can be earned by goods traffic. The Disturbances card closes a chosen city for one round.

The rules sheet contains alternative rules for 1853, which include the use of the place cards in this kit to determine the seating order.

Expands:

1853
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: Isla Tetra 2
description:
Following in the sandy footprints of Isla Tetra comes its card-driven 2-player cousin, Isla Tetra 2.

It’s been three days since that terrible event: The violent turbulence; the acrid smell of smoke; the sudden descent and then the panicked screams of other passengers. You’re in shock, hungry and disoriented. The shore is littered with debris from the crash, but what to do first? Food? Fire? Explore the island? Help!

Expert survivors will accrue more points during their time on Isla Tetra through cunning inventory expansion, clever health management, and successful completion of a set number of survival tasks. The game is played solo, or as a survival competition against the clock between 2 players - yes, it didn’t take long for an argument to break out over scarce supplies and resources, and now it’s a race to simply stay alive.

You might think you can get by, simply walking the sun-kissed sands hunting for red snapper, allowing the hypnotic effect of the crashing waves to ease your injuries, but as you soak up the sun events back home are taking a turn for the worse: As the months tick by, the search for your downed plane is eventually called off, your job is readvertised, and your car has been sold to keep up with the bills. After two years of waiting, your family holds a memorial service and your partner is now returning to a social life as a single person.

Players must strike a balance between plundering the island’s resources for points while ensuring they’re not last off the island to face the worst news once home (and the most penalty points). Each day you’ll beachcomb the golden sands to see what has been gifted to you from the azure, salty brine. Use this flotsam and jetsam, such as rusty cans and broken umbrellas, represented by chunky, 3D DriftCube shapes, to build a shelter, craft essential tools and a fishing spear; then explore deep into the island's heart. Link the same DriftCubes together on your playmat to ‘build’ action grids, such as exploring, fishing, and foraging for food. In these instances DriftCube shapes represent time as opposed to raw materials.

It’s a race for survival. It’s a race to get home...

"It's Ubongo meets Lost" - review comment

name: Dystopian Legions
description:
From the company website:

DYSTOPIAN LEGIONS is a fast-paced, action-packed 28mm scale tabletop game set in the exciting world of Dystopian Wars, where Victorian super science fiction has created a fascinating and brutal arena for a deadly world war. The game is scalable from a small number of models right the way up to a full blown company of men with armoured support. A modular approach to army building guarantees the game embraces further new releases and game expansions.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Sibylla
description:
1180... the King is dead... the Barons seek power, while a powerful enemy observes... Who will take the throne of the Latin Kingdom of Sibylla? Battles, betrayals, conspiracies... Use all the power of his noble family, lead your armies, to become the new King!

Sibylla is a board game for 2-5 players, developed by Julio Trois, where you must seek power in a game whose theme is the Age of the Crusades!

The game has the mechanics, the area control, through 5 dices, search combinations that allow you to insert markers in each area of the game (same system used in the Poker Dice). You can also use action cards that increase the strategic factor, seeking to undermine the moves of opponents and open up new gameplay opportunities.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: MIND
description:
About the Game

M.I.N.D is a tactical strategy board game set in a sci-fi setting in which players are in control of a colony and have to manage and expand it while facing different crisis and invaders. M.I.N.D can be played solo or in two players, but also with up to four players with the help of an extra copy. The goal is to build your colony and complete the set of five achievements required by the game before the last turn ends. Players can play as a purely cooperative game where everyone wins or loses together. Or they can play competitively, in which case they can sabotage or attack their opponents.

Players build new sectors, train new citizens and manage their command to do as many actions as they can to maximize production of credits, influence, equipment or overpower while also progressing. The game requires lots of planning since there are many things that can intervene and ruin your plan if not paying attention. Players interact and can either help or sabotage each other. Units can be sent to start fires, break structures, close doors, start an epidemic or even unpower structures. To resolve all these players need to assign command to their units and use them to repair, build or interact with different things from the colony. Players can improve their units by equipping them with items or assigning them influence thus enabling them access to the faction's unique super power.

If you like strategy games, games that can be played solo, games that have confrontation or simply that let you cooperate with a friend while facing a great challenge then M.I.N.D may be the perfect choice for you.
categories: Civilization, Dice, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Solar Angel Expansion Pack
description: The Solar Angel Auroniel is the competitive prize for Month 6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Why The Long Face?
description:
Why the long face? is a face charades game that brings taxidermied faces to life!

Why the long face? has been a delight for players of all ages and is fun for kids, parties, and waking your face up in the morning. With this fresh deck, you'll be face to face with the animals from the L. C. Bates Museum in Maine.

The Kickstarter funded a print run large enough to supply everyone who has expressed interest with a deck full of dour addaxes, snarling coyotes, and quizzical squirrels. Each set of Why the long face? includes a deck of cards, die, and mat to lay out the game.

Each turn, the acting player secretly rolls a die, which corresponds to one of six animal faces. They have to try and replicate the face on the card, and the other players will attempt to guess which animal they are emulating in order to earn a point.

name: Operation Jupiter: Churchill's Plan to Invade Norway, 1942
description:
"Operation Jupiter: Churchill’s Plan to Invade Norway, 1942" (OJ) is an intermediate complexity, two-player wargame simulating the possible events that could have unfolded during the first 30 days of this planned but never run World War II campaign. The British prime minister had intended it as a strategic alternative for Operation Torch.

A complete game takes from two to three hours to complete. Each hex on the map equals 10 miles (16.2 km) from side to opposite side. Each full turn represents three days. Every ground unit represents a regiment, brigade or division (or ad hoc equivalents) of about 2,500 to 12,000 men and/or 50 to 350 armored fighting vehicles.

—description from the publisher

name: Machi Koro: Plus
description: Machi Koro Plus is an expansion to the game Machi Koro. It includes new cards that add more complexity to the game, including seaports and airports that can be upgraded with additional boats (in the case of seaports) or facilities. Thirteen new types of cards are included, with 68 cards in total.
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Wild Assent: Kickstarter Stretch Goals box
description:
Inside this very box is a bounty of stretch goals unlocked during the Wild Assent Kickstarter campaign. It includes two miniatures suggested and voted on by fans, two crossovers, and one very lazy squire. The Wilds is a richer and more dangerous place thanks to you, the backers, and late pledgers, who made not just this box but Wild Assent itself possible. So, pat yourself on the back, pick your favourite Assent or Seeker, and we'll see you in the Wilds!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler
description:
The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler expansion includes:

- 4x miniatures: The Ravenous Wattle Gobbler, 3x Wattle Gobblets
- Over 20 game cards including Wattle Gobbler boss announcements and events.
- Digital PDF Scenario to battle the the Wattle Gobbler
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Spuntino in Sardegna
description:
If you too have eaten Casu marzu, if you always carry the Island in your heart, you have chosen the perfect game.
Spuntino is quick and easy, perfect for an evening with friends or family, ideal for adults and children who love good regional cuisine.

With Spuntino's illustrated cards, you can indulge yourself in inventing new culinary combinations and combine a thousand flavors to get more points than your opponents.
Are you ready for an explosion of Sardinian tastes?
Each game lasts about 30 minutes, just like a real snack, and then you'll be ready for a new game where you can enjoy new delightful flavors.
You will have 110 illustrated playing cards at your disposal to create the most combinations and declare a snack. You can also create delicious combinations with wine and "filu'e ferru" and become the sommelier of the family.

The aim of this board game is to get the highest number of points by making combinations of typical Sardinian dishes. To win, you will have to become the Snack King by getting more points than your opponents.

name: Tricky Dicks: The Richard Measuring Contest
description:
The adult card game about describing your Richards. How do you decide Victory? By claiming to have the Longest, Shortest, Thickest, or Thinnest picture of Richard in your hand. Any Challengers? Whip out the ruler card and see which Richard is best! No matter what party you're in, Tricky Dicks will fit right in.

Go around in a circle playing cards and claiming if you have the biggest, smallest, thickets, or thinnest and compare with your opponents. Most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Pentaquest Heroes
description:
Pentaquest Heroes is the first expansion for Pentaquest, a card game with many dice rolls that won the heart of countless fans for its easy, stress-free and funny gameplay. Zero setup, solo play and multiplayer.

Like the base game, Pentaquest Heroes is print-and-play, accessible, and black-and-white, with a pleasant old-school style.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pokémon Trading Card Game: Battle Academy
description:
Enjoy the thrill of battling right out the gate with the latest version of the ready-to-play Pokémon Trading Card Game Battle Academy! Updated with fun new decks and cards, this version contains everything that two players need to charge headlong into battle, along with guides to the decks so your first game is easy to follow.

Choose between fiery, feisty Cinderace or electrifyingly engaging Pikachu to lead your team in a heads-up battle against another Trainer. Then, switch up the decks to play adorable Eevee against Cinderace or Pikachu, and lead a different team of Pokémon into the arena!

With a little strategy, a little luck, and the contents of this incredible box, you can battle with the best and have a blast while doing it. Best of all, this latest version of the Battle Academy is fully compatible with other Pokémon TCG products, including the first Battle Academy.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Black Stories Junior: Adventure Stories
description:
The successful mystery series "Black Stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "Black Stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Adventure Stories are exciting riddles for young adventurer. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.
publishers: Kaissa Chess & Games, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: CORONA NERVT!
description:
At the beginning each player has 5 action cards, 5 coronas & 5 nerve cards in hand. Try to keep your nerve in this card game. You only have five of them at the beginning. In return, you should do everything you can to get rid of the coronas. Whoever got rid of all of their coronas first wins the game.

There are 60 action cards in the game. One action card is played per round. If you demonstrate strategic skill, you win the card game at the end.

As soon as a player falls below 0 nerve cards, he is eliminated. So you always have to have at least one of these nerve cards in hand.

When it is your turn, you have the option of using your action cards to have an effect on all players or only on a certain player - you can assign them even more coronas or take away nerves. After you have played an action card, you draw a new one. You continue to play until the stack of cards is used up or a player has already got rid of all his coronas or all others have lost their nerve.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Bei CORONA NERVT! starten alle MitspielerInnen mit 5 Nerv-, 5 Corona- und 5 Spielkarten. Die Aufgabe ist es nun Coronas loszuwerden, dabei die Nerven beisammenzuhalten und dies mit den eigenen Spielkarten geschickt zu steuern.

Wenn mich beispielsweise meine MitspielerInnen besuchen, setzen wir uns alle einem bewussten Risiko aus und erhalten daher alle eine Coronakarte und müssen eine Nervkarte abgeben. Nur nicht die Nerven verlieren und Corona wieder loswerden. Das ist die Strategie!

Es ist doch echt frustrierend, da hat schon wieder jemand beim Niesen nicht den Ellenbogen davorgehalten und im Bus trägt der Sitznachbar die Maske unter der Nase! Zack wieder drei Coronas gesammelt und drei Nerven verloren. Aber da! Ein Lichtblick! Impfstofflieferung in Sicht und endlich Sommer!

Ein schnelles Spiel in dem man nicht nur die eigenen Karten im Blick behalten muss, sondern auch die der MitspielerInnen. Kann ich mit der nächsten Karte eine/n MitspielerIn rausschmeißen? Wer ist fast geheilt und braucht dringend mal wieder eine Schippe Corona? Werde deine Coronas los, behalte die Nerven und bring die anderen zur Verzweiflung.

Dieses spannende Spiel, versüß die Zeit nicht nur im Lockdown und lässt uns über Corona und seine Auswirkungen auch mal schmunzeln!

Wer gute Nerven beweist und alle eigenen Coronas besiegt, gewinnt das Spiel. Wir sagen DANKE Jana!!

name: Munchkin Fairy Dust Handbag Of Holding
description:
User SummaryThe Handbag of Holding was a promotional item originally given away by Steve Jackson Games during the August 2009 Gen Con in Indianapolis. It was reprinted in February 2012 and given away to people who spent $75 or more at the publisher's online store. Starting on March 6th, 2012 it briefly became available for purchase at the online store. So what had once been a highly collectible item due to its rarity, was now just another piece of Munchkin merchandise.

The handbag is a standard handbag, colored pink and with a picture of the Sparkly Good Fairy from the Munchkin Fairy Dust booster pack. As a handbag, it's nothing exceptional, but it also comes with a special rule for use in any Munchkin card game that includes the Munchkin Fairy Dust expansion. The rule allows you to take a card from the Fairy Dust deck's discard pile, once per game (see the corresponding board game version for details).

Part of the Munchkin series

name: KUAN
description:
KUAN is a two-player abstract strategy game using a 5×5 grid board and two types (colors) of pieces. The players take turns placing a piece on the board. Try to trap pieces between those of a different color to capture them.

If your opponent captures some pieces, you must place your pieces on the spots where the captured pieces used to occupy. You win either by placing five pieces of the same color in a straight line or making the opponent unable to place any piece on the board.

name: Ultimate Backgammon
description: Ultimate Backgammon adds "swirl dice" (they show the Winning Moves logo on two sides of an otherwise blank d6) and "captains" (they show the Winning Moves logo on one face of a standard man) to the game. The game is played like backgammon, except that the goal is to be the first to bear off your own captain, which starts on top of the 24 point. If the captain is unprotected (either a blot or on top of a point, no matter how many men are below), it may be moved backwards if your opponent throws a swirl. If the opposing captain is not in its inner table when you score a gammon, it counts as a backgammon instead.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quatro
description:
Quatro is a small card game for 3 to 5 players. The deck is numbered from 1 to 13 in four different suits. Each suit is on a different language (Portuguese, Spanish, French and English) so that the players can learn the numbers in all these languages.

The objective of the game is to form more collections than the other players of the four suits of the same number. You start with 5 cards on your hand and each round you ask another player for a number. That player must then give all his cards of that number to you. Your turn continues until you ask someone for a card he does not have.

The game continues until all quartets are formed.

name: Might of Arms
description:
Might of Arms is a set of rules for battles using miniature figures for armies ranging from the stone age through to the 15th century AD. It focuses on large-scale battles rather than small unit actions.

MoA is a 108-page rulebook of which the last 40-odd pages consists of army lists. It is aimed at 15mm gaming, but has options for 25mm and 6mm (1:300 scale).

name: Xtra Innings
description:
Check out this XTRA great review for XTRA INNINGS!
http://www.amazon.com/Xtra-Innings-Action-Strategy-Basball/p...;showViewpoints=1Check out the great new XTRA INNINGS VIDEO right here !http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJ754XL6Io4

NEW VIDEO FOR 2011 ! PLAY ALONG FOR 1/2 INNING WITH FRANK AND DWIGHT ! SEE HOW TO USE THE "PITCHING CHANGE". THE "PINCH HITTER". THE "HOME RUN" AND "SUPER CATCH" CARDS !
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QRtmsBHt278

FOLLOW XTRA INNINGS ON THEIR SPIFFY NEW FACEBOOK PAGE !
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Xtra-Innings-board-game/185521...

"XTRA INNINGS" is a great, new, rapid play board/card game which duplicates not only the strategy but also the pace and emotion of a real baseball game.
.Match wits with your opponent in a baseball card/board game that duplicates the classic confrontation between PITCHER and HITTER, or OFFENSE and DEFENSE. The PITCHING SEQUENCE is a "brain-teaser" - you choose every pitch and every base running play. No dice, no luck and no trivia - just you, your cards and the strategy and intensity of the great game of baseball. It's baseball chess with a touch of poker and a complete game, played by either two or four players, can be can be completed in less than two hours.

For younger and more novice players, the game also includes a "Little League Editon" It is a great way to learn all the basic plays before moving up to the Major Leagues. Hours of fun and educational too !

XTRA INNINGS - It's the National Pastime in a box! Play ball!
For more information, or to order the game, log on to www.xtrainningsgame.com.
To see how to play a half inning of the game, see the new slide show at http://www.xtrainningsgame.com/?p=48&;v=198727258948ee31d81c0503.57368139

name: Spellcaster: Spiel 2014 Promo Pack
description:
The Spellcaster: Spiel 2014 Promo Pack is a promotional pack of cards available at Spiel 2014 to those who purchase the base game.
It consists of 4 cards (1 of each color).

name: Répáskert
description:
Reckless rabbit rascals penetrate the Carrot Yard ("Répáskert"). The rabbits are trying to loot as many carrots as they can, competing with each other. But their hardest challenge is to avoid the two hostile mastiffs chasing them among the bushes.

Players control their own rabbit, and they also move the dogs. Their objective is to collect as many carrots as possible and to increase their scores by making the dogs bite the opponents’ rabbits. Everyone has a set of movement cards to direct the steps of the animals. One half of each card instructs the rabbit, the other half instructs the dog; players have to choose carefully which part to use and when.

Rabbits also leave droppings on the board, which obstruct movement: if a rabbit crosses or lands on a space where there is a dropping, it loses a carrot. Dogs don’t care about the droppings.

Répáskert (Carrot Yard) is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced family game. A party lasts 2-5 rounds, depending on the number of players. However, the game may end sooner if the upper limit of bites is reached or no more carrots are left on the board. The player with the highest scores wins the game.

Despite the theme, the the game requires some strategic thinking. Therefore it is recommended from 7 years of age, but it is real fun for the older generations as well.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Csibész nyulak vakmerő csoportja hatol be az óriás sárgarépáiról híres Répáskertbe, hogy akciójuk révén minél több zsákmányt szerezzenek. Egymás riválisai is egyben, de legfőbb ellenfelük az a két szelindek, akik mindenkit megmarnak, aki csak ismeretlenként beteszi a lábát.

A Répáskertben minden játékos a saját nyulát irányítja, de egyben ő a felelős a kutyák lépéseiért is. Üldözőt és üldözöttet ugyanazon lépéskártyák által irányítjuk – csak éppen a lap másik oldalával! Tehát egyszerre célunk minél több répát szerezni, de eközben a pontjainkat gyarapítja, ha lépésünk során az egyik kutyának sikerül elkapnia valamelyik konkurens nyulat.

Ugrándozás közben a nyulak bogyókat is elpottyantanak. Ezek akadályozhatják a mozgást; ha egy nyúl kénytelen átszaladni egyen, elveszít egy répát. A kutyákat bezzeg teljesen hidegen hagyják a nyúlbogyók!

A Répáskert könnyen megtanulható, gyors játék. Egy parti a játékosok számától függően legfeljebb 2-5 fordulóból áll, de ennél hamarabb is véget érhet, ha elfogy a játéktábláról az összes répa, vagy a harapások száma eléri a felső határt.
A legnagyobb pontszámmal rendelkező játékos lesz a nyertes.

A gyerekekhez szóló téma ellenére a játékban jelen van a stratégia, ezért elsősorban a 7 év felettiek számára ajánlott.

—description from the publisher (Hungarian)

name: A Thief's Fortune: Common Danger Mini Expansion
description:
The common danger mini expansion can be included in games of 2 or more players.

When paying a bribe, each player must pay the resources indicated on the common danger board based on how many are on it, in addition to any basic resources paid for any Danger token on their own Danger track.

All players who are unable to pay must lose 1 Fortune point for each resource they cannot pay.
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Robo Junkyard
description:
Robo Junkyard is a fast-paced game about getting rid of all of your cards (junk) faster than all of the other robots! Count cards and strategize, push junk onto other robots, or just blow up the pile entirely. Do what it takes to get those shiny victory credits!
description from the publisher's website

Robo Junkyard is a card shedding game. Each player chooses a robot which has a 12 card deck associated with it. Each deck is identical except for one card unique to that robot. Players set up by placing four cards in their Extra Stack (cards in the Extra Stack will be added to a players hand later in the round), one card in the Collection (a shared pool of hidden cards that players don't need to get rid of), and the rest of the cards in their hand.

Gameplay consists of players taking turns playing cards into a pile in the center of the play area, or, if they cannot play a card, picking up the pile and adding the cards into their hand. Each card has an ability that might do things like blow up the pile, skip player's turns, or tamper with cards in the collection.

Players who get rid of all of their cards earn victory credits. The first robot to receive six is crowned the winner!

-description from designer

name: The Majority 2
description:
It was good and came back to the dark assembly of the pandemonium!
A player is one of the members of the darkness assembly which a bribe and assassination fly about. It is a boom there to get more grants and power by crossing a faction.

This game is an irregularity type draft card game for exclusive use of two. By the turn, I play a hand in the range of an income. A playing place is somewhere in a row that is three before oneself. If cards gather in either row more than five pieces, I can get a faction as a representative with one card of the cards. A score to get changes which card you make a representation. In addition, incomes increase when a faction is completed.

You must hand the card which you were not able to use up during your turn to an opponent at the time of the turn end. While a hand comes and goes like a baton, among each other, a game goes. It is important how it processes the card which does not want to be played by an opponent.
When the factions of oneself or the opponent gathered more than five, the game is finished by the next turn. It is the victory of the player who got more scores. The score adds up the score by the representative of the faction and the score by the income.

name: [dp6]
description:
In a two-nation crewed submarine station, mysterious experiences became more and more frequent, until, in a fateful day, something terrible and powerful was discovered. With the outbreak of a world war on the surface, a sea-bottom race begins. But only one side can emerge.

[dp6] is a 2-player mini-game in which they try to reach the escape pod that will lead them to the surface, crossing 5 station rooms (tiles) that are blocked by coded doors (from 1 to 5). To open them, you got to tune these numbers through decoders represented by a d6.

Each player has 3 actions per turn, then the Freak do 2 actions based on AI.
The player’s actions can be: Move the meeples between the tiles, roll the dice to open or close the doors and move the pod, take tokens, use tokens to open or close doors automatically and to modify the dice results.
The Freak’s action can be: Spawn, walk and eat a meeple.

Risk yourself to get into unknown chambers, utilize your limited resources to open the doors automatically or push your luck using the dice, reach for the escape pod before the unbeatable freak decimate all of your crew, or your rival reach the escape pod and leave you behind!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Wakanda: Three Little Coyotes
description:
Wakanda: Three Little Coyotes adds three coyote tokens to the Wakanda base game, but these can be substituted by any tokens should you know the rules for how to use them.

At the start of play, place one coyote token on each of the three starting village tiles. At the end of each player's turn, if possible he must move a token from one unclaimed tile to another unclaimed tile. When a player takes a tile with one or more tokens on it, he places these tokens on the table before him. At the end of the game, in addition to their other scoring each player scores 0, 1, 4 or 9 points for having 0, 1, 2 or 3 coyote tokens.

name: 数律 (Suritsu)
description:
Suritsu is a game of number and scenery making for 1 to 5 players.

Players play cards from their hands, connecting with previously played cards to create a two-digit number. The number that can be made changes depending on which side the "UP-DOWN card" ois showing. If the UP side is showing, a number larger than the previously played number must be played. If the DOWN side is showing, a smaller number must be played.

In addition to numbers, each card has lavishly illustrated "scenery", such as forests, the sea, and city. By completing scenery through card play, you can perform consecutive turns.

Skillfully manipulate the available numbers to ensure your opponents cannot play, allowing you to empty your hand!

name: Bhazum: Ksari
description:
Welcome back to Bhazum! A city once ruled by the Councils of the four Cliques, now ruled by a lone Ksari. In this city, who you know is key, and players will draft the best character cards to use to influence the Ksari's Advisors. Influencing the Advisors is key, but ignoring the Military, Merchants, and Entertainers of the city could lead to your District's downfall.

Ksari takes place over a series of 12 rounds. Each round, players will play cards to strengthen their Districts, persuade the Advisors, and gain Military, Entertainment and Market influence. Each player scores points for the cards in his District, and the player with the greatest District wins the game!

name: The Rivals for Catan: Participation in the Big Game
description:
At the Internationale Spieletage (International Game Fair) in Essen, Germany, which took place from October 8 to 11, 2015, during his signing session at the Kosmos booth Klaus Teuber gave away the Special Cards 2015 for the game "The Rivals for Catan."

Because of the Catan - Big Game Event on Gen Con and on the games fair in Essen this year an additional special card was produced. The German title for this card is "Teilnahme am Big Game".

Card text, in English: "If you have registered for a Big Game or would like to participate in the next Big Game, in addition to the resources you receive as a result of the production roll you also receive the same resources your opponent obtained."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Q-Memory
description:
Q-Memory is a game where your memory is the only asset to fix the quantum link. With 18 hexagonal tiles, game modes that bring more challenging experiences and a 5-10 minute duration which makes this game the perfect filler game.

On their turn, players will try to finish the quantum link (which means revealing all of the tiles) but in order to do so, they need to follow the quantic sequence.

Each time a player flips up a hex-tile, it will have to connect with the previously revealed tile either on it´s core colour(black or white) or the background color. If they match, then the next tile revealed must match the opposite(if it matched the core, now it has to match the background color and vice versa). If, at any time, the conditions are not met, the player must flip back down all the tiles and the next player starts their turn.

The first player to finish the quantum link will be the winner of Q-Memory.

—description from publisher

name: Retropolis
description:
From the mid-18 th century through the 19 th century, the Western world experienced a period of rapid technological innovation that transformed its manufacturing industries.
You are the mayor of a British city, striving to achieve new prosperity in the midst of the Industry Revolution by developing your municipality into a hub of industry through the introduction of factories and railroads.
Simply expanding your city is not enough; you will also need to secure coal to fuel the steam engines powering these technological marvels.
Will you succeed in creating the world’s greatest industrial city and leave a lasting legacy as its mayor?

In the game, players are bidding in an auction for tiles that they will add to their city, generally overlapping already existing tiles. In the auction, rather than bidding money, players bid with how many squares of their existing city they will cover with the tile they acquire. However, at the end of the game, some of the scoring will be based upon who has the most squares showing of certain types. Some squares require special resources to operate, and other squares cannot be covered.
mechanics: Auction: Fixed Placement, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: analog lunchbox (アナログランチボックス)

name: Universal Fighting System: Mega Man
description:
Join the fight and defend the world against Dr. Wily and the evil robot masters! Use this tin to begin your training in the Universal Fighting System and play your friends to become the ultimate universal fighter!

The combat system employs a "progressive difficulty" mechanism, which means the more you do in a turn, the harder your later actions become.

UFS is modular and works with other games in the system, so you can have those epic Mega Man or Proto Man vs. Street Fighter or Soul Calibur or Penny Arcade battles.

Compatible with:


Universal Fighting System: Street Fighter
Universal Fighting System: Soul Calibur III
Universal Fighting System: Soul Calibur IV
Universal Fighting System: Darkstalkers
Universal Fighting System: SNK Playmore
Universal Fighting System: Penny Arcade
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: California: New Bonus Cards
description:
Contains:

Die California Extrakarte
California: Bonuskarten Katalog Edition 7


6 cards on cardstock with rules

name: NHL Big League Manager: Platinum Edition
description: A hockey lover’s dream! In this bilingual board game (French and English) with a Monopoly feel, players take on the role of General Manager of a hockey team. Each player selects their starting line-up: a goalie, two defensemen and three forwards. Players must build and manage their teams, negotiate salaries and trades and win matches against other players' teams. The game is quite complex and initially, regular references to the instructions are required; however, after a few times, children find the game straightforward. The game has many realistic details and young hockey fans are thrilled with this game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Pixel Lincoln: Bonuses Pack
description:
Description taken from official preorder page:

The Pixel Lincoln Bonuses Pack includes a Pixel Lincoln button, Pixel Sentinels, Cheat Codes, the Celebrity Custom Cards pack, the Lincoln Coin Card Pack, and a shiny penny*


Penny may not actually be shiny.


Contains all the promotional extras created during the KS campaign.

name: The Everlasting Glory: Chinese War of Resistance 1937-1945
description:
The Everlasting Glory (英烈千秋) is the first independent box wargame made by Formosa Force Games. It is a two-player operational wargame simulates the War of Resistance (抗戰）1937-45. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Army (大日本帝國陸軍）and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Army（國民革命軍).

Leonard To who is the designer of War of the Suns（天無二日） tried to use another way to show the history of War of Resistance in this new game.
The Everlasting Glory (英烈千秋) uses the same research and basic game concepts as War of the Suns: The War of Resistance 1937-1945, while focusing less on the non-military aspects.

There are also 4 fundamental changes in the game design:
1. The use of area movement instead of hexes. Each area is a province. It speeds up the game. By organizing combats in an area, similar dynamic like that of hex and counters has been maintained.
2. The use of generic units instead of unit IDs. This is a tough choice. It reduces the effort of the player to locate individual units, and makes it more flexible in losses and breakdowns calculations. Historical unit IDs are provided in the OB for those who are interested in unit history.
3. A 2-players instead of a 3-players game. The game is now played between the KMT and Japan players. Game mechanism controls CCP. British and part of the Japanese forces in India and Burma are removed cause they do not represent the core of the Chinese struggle. It again speeds up the game, and removes a player who has little to do sometimes.
4. The use of cards. This is not a card-driven game but strategy, command and logistics cards are included to handle those aspects.

There are 6 scenarios included:

1 Campaign scenario
2 Operational scenarios: Space for Time, Operation Ichigo
3 Introductory scenarios: Fist of Fury, Retreat to Victory, Plan B


Components:

540 5/8" counters
60 Cards in English, 60 Cards in Chinese
1 A1 map in Chinese & English (mounted)
1 Chinese & English Rule book
1 Chinese & English Scenario book
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement
publishers: Formosa Force Games, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: Beast Master Tale
description:
A player becomes Kyuubi and travels through the corrupting world.
While fighting with Beasts, you will gain allies, collect sacred treasures,
and train up your party.
Your goal is to go to the celestial realm, fight against Izanami,
and win before the world completely perishes.

■ Objective of the game
When either of the following two are fulfilled, the game ends.

① Victory in decisive battle
Fight against "Izanami," whom the decisive battle board indicates.
When a player wins the battle,
the game immediately ends and the player will be the winner of the game.

② Destruction of the world
At the end of a turn, when 8 land boards are face down,
except for "The Road to celestial realm," the game ends.
The world is destroyed and all players will lose the game.

■ Game flow
You will repeat destruction phase and travel phase.

1, Destruction phase
A bad beast begins to appear in the peaceful world under the influence of Izanami.
The world where two bad beasts appeared becomes the destruction.

2, travel phase
Start the game from the player with Jewel token, and ao around once clockwise.

■ Play
① Move
Move your own kyuubi token.

② Encounter
If there is a Beast card on your Kyuubi token, you will start a battle.

③ Effect of land
Execute the land effect, where your Kyuubi token stays.

■ End of battle and rewards

Victory


• If you win the battle, you get either of the following two rewards.
① Acquire the enemy card
② Acquire experience value

■ Decisive battle
You will battle against Izanami in a decisive battle.
Its strength is determined by the position of decisive battle status cubes.

When you win the battle against Izanami, you will be the winner of the game!

■ Items
① jewel token
A player, who has a jewel, plays the game in journey phase first.

② mirror token
A card that has a mirror token placed on it acquires magic attack power value,
which is equal to the number of cards of the player's party, except the Kyuubi card.

③ sword token
A card that has a sword token placed on it acquires physical attack power value,
which is equal to the number of cards of the player's party, except the Kyuubi card.


Herb


If you use a herb, you can recover up to 3 strengths of any one card of your party.

name: Nuns on the Run: The Monk
description:
Father Robert (a visiting monk who happens to be deaf) begins the game in the Outer Garden by the Garden Entry (location 84). The Guard player takes the 6 movement tokens. The Guard player doesn't take a Blessing Card for the monk. One turn one, the guard selects one of the 3 garden gate paths to have the monk follow: either to the Pharmacy (122), the Kitchen (147) or the Scriptorium (101). The monk moves during the Guards Move phase of the game, and only walks (3 or 4 spaces).

Since the monk is deaf, he does not get a sound check, nor do novices need to check to see if he hears them during the novice's noise check. He does, however see just like the other guard characters do (180-degree vision, up to 6 spots away). If a novice enters his field of vision, they must reveal themselves. The monk cannot capture a novice, and novices may move through his position without penalty. If a novice shares the same space as the monk the novice is detected. When the monk arrives at his path destination, choose another token that includes his current location and continue his movements.

You will only use 4 of the 6 tokens during the game - 2 of the 3 garden gate tokens (entering and leaving the convent) and 2 of the 3 tokens that allow travel between the Pharmacy, Kitchen, and Scriptorium.

The guard player may use any combination of tokens, but you may visit a convent location only once (with the exception of the Garden Gate). Once the monk returns to the Garden Gate, remove him from the game.

name: Munchkin Tails
description:
Munchkin has gone to the dogs...plus foxes, mice, and ponies!

Anthropomorphic animals have always been popular, from the beast-headed gods of Egypt to Mickey Mouse and Bugs Bunny today. Now you can bring them into the dungeon in Munchkin Tails, fighting off opponents such as the Human Rights Activist, the Robot Vacuum, or even the feared Animal Control Enforcer. Use a Tail Flail or a Cone of Defiance as you work to be the first of your species to reach Level 10!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Numero
description:
From the publisher:

Numero® is more than just a card game.

It is an invaluable resource for maths educators. Numero® has been designed for use by students of all ages and is ideal for developing numeracy concepts and problem-solving skills. Playing Numero® is a great way to improve maths, while having fun at the same time. Learn to play so you can help your children with their maths, or contact us about our staff, student or parent workshops!

Numero® features

Significantly boosts mental maths ability when played regularly.
A focused Numero® program can assist with achieving better results in mental computation testing.
Adaptable for any ability and suitable for ages 3 to adult.
A fun educational activity for the whole family.
Increases children’s confidence in the classroom.
Encourages tactical thinking and thinking ‘outside the box’.
Complements any numeracy program.

name: Suspicion
description:
One of you is guilty...

The adult murder mystery game where a party of "guests" (the players) must discover who among them is guilty of doing away with the host--the mysterious Doctor Fenn. Logic and reasoning are the keys to success.

It is midnight. Dr. Felix Fenn, world famous surgeon, has just been found in his private study, dead! Murdered! You and the other players are the only guests at Fenn Manor. One of you is guilty. The rest must find out who did it, before the murderer has a chance to cover his tracks; before the murderer leaves at dawn; before the murderer strikes again!

Contents:

6 clues envelopes (one for each player)
6 tokens
1 notes pad
1 pair of dice
1 gameboard
60 evidence envelopes and corresponding clue cards divided into four suits: Weapons, Alibis, Motives, and Circumstances.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: National Liberation Front
description: National Liberation Front: A Game of Guerrilla Warfare in Today's World . . . ntroduces new and unique design concepts that promote realistic military situations, including command problems that must deal with secret and simultaneous unit movements. Your strategy, consequently, must be based solely on the last known position of the enemy. A given enemy unit's strength is not known until contact has been established. Both, the government and the guerrillas, have different but equally difficult tasks ahead of them. Every aspect of the game has been carefully developed for easy playability but maintains a high level of combat simulation. Many original and innovative design concepts make this rare combination possible. When it is over, perhaps we, as players, will have reached a greater insight into the most prevalent type of warfare in the world today."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tupamaro
description:
The internal war between the Tupamaros and the forces of the Uruguayan State security from 1968 to 1972 fought in Montevideo. The game is an unusual treatment in that because all the action took place inside a single large city, the map is a non-representational 'map of attitudes' of the people of the city of Montevideo, with an abstract troop and time scale. The guerrilla player has many subtle strategies to try while the Government player struggles to train his security forces and keep the people on his side.

The One Small Step Games edition is revised from earlier editions and includes:

Two 11 x 17" playing surfaces
100 die-cut counters
One rulebook
Folio cover and counter storage bags
publishers: BTR Games, One Small Step, Schutze Games, Strategy Gaming Society

name: Drag-Ominos
description: A difficult to find version of Pressman's many "Omino" games. This one features 3-part colored dragons. The object is to be the first player to use up all his Drag-Ominos.

name: Honeycomb
description:
This game is similar to boxes (where you take control of an area by closing in a box), but is played on a board of hexagons. At least it is a bit more attractive.

Similar to:

Punto y Raya (standard Boxes game)
Squares (Boxes on a cross-shaped board)

name: Step by Step
description:
Step by Step uses excellent components to create a climbing game requiring thoughtful placement and sound planning. The game board is a square frame holding nicely-made square pieces. To begin, the frame is populated with one level of pieces on all spaces, except for the center on which five pieces are stacked and stabilized with a rod through the middle. Each player gets a large ball that fits on the hole in the pieces, and the starting position is determined based on the number of players (2-4).

With the goal being to get your ball onto the center tower, you progress by moving your ball anywhere on the same level you start and then placing another piece on an adjacent space (adding a level to that space.) You can move down the structure for free as long as you don't skip a level, but once you move onto a higher level in your turn it is over. Using this mechanism, players try to craft a path to the top of the tower that can't be used by others or use their ball as a blocking point to keep someone off the level you need.

name: Cuba Libre!
description:
(from Simulations Workshop website:)

In April of 1961 a force of Cuban exiles, trained and equipped by the American CIA, landed on the south coast of Cuba. The game covers the historical fighting around the resort of Playa Giron at the Bay of Pigs.

Units are companies and battalions, with 1 km to the hex and 6 hours per turn.
One 17 by 22 color map (in two 11 x 17 sections), 120 color counters, rules, option cards, charts and organization displays.

Rules are included for Air to ship attacks, parachute drops, pilot fatigue, ranged fire support, ammo shortages, the FRD provisional government, and options such as US Marine intervention and world reaction.

name: Felix the Cat Game
description:
Felix the Cat board game published in 1960 by Milton Bradley. This game is based on the old Felix the Cat cartoon, and all of the old characters from the 1950's/1960's cartoon are represented here.

Spin a spinner and collect cards - as simple as that. Game featured a bright, colorful game board.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Ultimate Football Trivia Board Game
description:
In this trivia game players move from space to space and answer questions relating to football. Questions are primarily about the NFL, but there are also questions about college football, football history, rules, and other leagues. The first player to get back to the starting space wins in this pure trivia game.

Originally copyright 2001, an updated version was dated 2004.

name: Iron Stars
description: Iron Stars is a game of space combat in an age of steam and steel. Set in a fictional universe based loosely on the writings of H. G. Wells and other fantasists, it provides a back story and ship designs from an alternate history in which the Martian Invasion actually happened, the ether is all-pervasive, and Cavorite is a reality. But, as with Starmada and other Majestic Twelve Games products, the focus is on players' imaginations; a clear and concise ship construction system is provided so you can pit your own space dreadnoughts against the likes of the Royal Navy Ether Squadron or the German Äthermarine.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: TG3
description:
TACTICAL GAME

The "TG" is a complete system of rules for tactical naval combat using miniatures of any scale. It covers the period
1890 to 1945 and contains data for 563 classes of ships from 19 countries. This system is an improved version of our
highly acclaimed TG-2. It uses new randomization and torpedo methods which will make it a classic in tactical games.
It still maintains the features of realism and rapid speed of play. TG can be played solitaire or with a number of players.
A data and calculation CD-ROM are now available.

http://www.panzerschiffe.com/
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Simultaneous Action Selection

description:
1914 is an introductory wargame about the first 5 months of World War One.
It deals with the initial mobile phase of the war, The German offensive in Belgium and France, part of the modified Schlieffen Plan, the Race to the sea... not the trench war.
Victory points are scored by capturing enemy cities / fortresses as well as troops
Casus Belli 21 contains the 1st map covering part of Germany, Belgium, Luxemburg, North of France - Northern map
Casus Belli 22 contains the 2nd map covering south of the Marne, Lorraine, Alsace - Southern map

The game was included in the French magazines Casus Belli (Issue 21 - Aug 1984) and Casus Belli (Issue 22 - Oct 1984).

Scale:
1 hex = 15km
1 counter = 1 Army for infantry - 1 division for cavalry
6 turns for the short scenarii (on N or S map)
25 turns for the full campaign on both maps

name: Valley of Hell
description:
Valley of Hell is a game of the Army of Vietnam's (ARVN) invasion of Laos in 1971. It was the first major ARVN offensive of the Vietnam War and its objective was the North Vietnamese Army's (NVA) supply base at Tchepone, Laos.

The designer published the first edition in 1981, and a second edition was done by Strategic Games Publications in 1986.
publishers: Perry Moore Games, Strategic Games Publications

name: E.S.P.
description:
From the publisher's site:

E.S.P. is a game for two players, powerful ESPer (person gifted with mental powers).

Five dice are rolled and put as a prize. Players put and move multipliers played hidden near these dice, struggling to match on their side their best tiles with the highest rolls, in order to gain victory points.

During each round, after the initial placement, you can use five special mental power in order to manipulate dice and multipliers: your goal is both to increase your score and to prevent your opponent in doing the same.

Each round may be either very quick or slow because of long reasoning; the ESPer winning three games will be the winner.

This game was available in the free web magazine GiocAreA OnLine (former partner of daVinci Editrice) as a promotional tool.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play

name: Star*Chess
description:
"The Game of Circular, Spiral, and Straight Manneuvers"

Star*Chess is a chess derivative that features a board of tesselated quadrilaterals surrounding a ten-pointed star. Each player has a general, two brigadier generals, colonels, majors, captains, 1st lieutenants and three 2nd lieutenants. The first five types move like kings, queens, rooks, bishops and knights, respectively. Of the last two, the 1st lieutenant moves like a pawn but moves two spaces throughout the game while the second lieutenant moves only one space. The game is won by either getting your general to the center star or by capturing the other player's general.

name: Cirkle 2
description:
The game contains an 8×11 board and two armies (Yellow & Blue). Each army consists of 16 pieces (4 of each kind) with different abilities for each group.

The players deploy their armies (chess like) and try to capture 2 objective points on the enemy side.

There is a 4-player version of the game called: Cirkle 4

name: Ultra Quick Tennis
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Announcing Ultra-Quick Tennis!

My goal in designing this game was to develop a mechanism to quickly play through a tennis tournament. With other tennis games, either the game took too long to realistically complete a full tournament, or the game was too simplistic and produced far too many upsets. As with all of my games, I wanted a quick playing design that closely mirrored reality in the tennis world. The end result is a game that I´m very proud of.

Ultra-Quick Tennis has been thoroughly tested for statistical accuracy. I am extremely confident that the formulas employed in the game accurately represent each player. To make it a game, I´ve added some elements of chance, as well as some rare play results. Overall, I think you´ll find the winners to be on par with what you would reasonably expect.

Ultra Quick Tennis includes over 300 professional men from the 2005 ATP Tour and well over 400 professional women from the 2005 WTA Tour. Also included are the full schedules for both Tours.
