Players are accurately rated for each playing surface found on the respective Tours. You'll experience the sheer dominance of Roger Federer on grass. Clay court specialists like Guillermo Coria will shine at Roland Garros, but prove to be mortal on the hard courts at the US Open. Every player will realistically perform as they did in actual tennis competition during the 2005 campaign.

All of the unusual events that can happen in tennis like injuries, retirements, loss of concentration, arguing line calls all happen in Ultra Quick Tennis as well. The ball is in your court, purchase Ultra Quick Tennis today!

name: Die California Extrakarte
description:
Postcard expansion to base game California by Michael Schacht published in 2006.


Number 2 in the Abacusspiele / Spiele aus Timbuktu postcard-series


Also part of the expansion NEUE BONUSKARTEN.

name: Traffic
description:
Traffic is a game about traveling in Switzerland. The board shows a route of 45 spaces. 8 of them are petrol stations, which can be extended to service stations. The background of the board shows a detailed road map of Switzerland.

Each player travels across the route with a car, that can be chosen from 22 car cards. Some cars have cheaper upkeep costs than others, but they will reduce the income received when they land on the profitable bank spaces on the board. But money can also be earned through petrol/service stations, obtained by correctly answering the question cards as well as by chance cards and the possession of special star chips.

These star chips are the main objective of the game, because the first player having 70000 francs in money plus 7 star chips, wins the game.

Traffic comes with some unusual components. First, there is a plastic bar with 23 holes.
Rolling a glass marble in that bar replaces the roll of a die. Second, a 1.5 x 3 inch model car serves as challenge trophy. The winner gets this car until a next game is played. And third, 2x36 (traffic) question cards for children and adults are somewhat like a game in the game.

name: Mine-Shaft Gap
description:
Mine-Shaft Gap simulates a battle for resources on, above, and under the surface of a lifeless but treacherous planetoid. Players must seek out valuable metals and fuel materials and mine them, using the materials to feed their home planets, and inch closer to victory, while at the same time allocating resources to maintain or strengthen their armed forces and fortifications. Drill tanks tunnel beneath the surface of the planet while drilling stations pound away from above. Drilling stations are faster and more efficient, but are vulnerable to attack from above and even capture by enemy troops. But tunnels can cave in… And market forces are unpredictable. The resource making your planet rich today might be better off greasing the treads of your tanks tomorrow!

The game takes place on two maps – one representing ground level and above, the other representing underground terrain. The rules differ slightly depending upon the map on which action occurs. At the beginning of the game, the subterranean map is unmarked: it is solid. As the game progresses, units will drill beneath the surface of the planet, creating tunnels through which they and other units can explore the sub-surface, mining for riches and engaging each other in combat. Each map parallels the other, in that each hex on one map represents the same coordinates, just at a radically different elevation (above or below ground) on the other map. Maps are labeled in columns and rows so that it is possible to find corresponding hexes quickly. Hex B4 on the surface map is considered to be directly above hex B4 on the subterranean map, and so on. It is recommended that a new subterranean map be printed out for each game, so that it can be marked throughout the game and discarded at the end.

Counters represent mobile units such as drill tanks, transport vehicles, hovertanks, missile launchers, atmo-craft, and squads of infantry with jump-jet powered armour; structures such as command posts and drilling stations; extracted resources; and rubble. They are printed with varying information. Resource counters show the type and quantity of resource with a letter and number. Units are printed with a movement type, attack strength, range, defense strength, and movement points.

Elements include tactical level sf combat using a terrain-and-elevation-based combat system, satellite searches for ore deposits, in-game allocation of resources to build units and outposts, resource extraction and re-use, resource allocation towards victory, varying resource value depending on market fluctuations, airstrikes, cave-ins, and underground combat.
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Honeypot
description:
Honeypot is an abstract strategy game in which the players fight for control of the hive, turning their opponent's pieces against them and jostling for position right up to the last moment. Players may flip an opponent's token a couple of different ways, requiring both long-term planning and quick tactical thinking.

From the rules: "Little known fact - bees are the three-dimensional projections of six-dimensional hive minds. When they're bored, they play this game. Turns out, they're bored a lot."

name: Strippopoly
description:
Strippopoly is a game that will add excitement, romance, and mystery to your life. You can play it with a group of friends, with your “ significant other ”, or both at the same time if you prefer. Whoever you choose to play with, you will get to know them much better and in more interesting ways before the game is over
2 games 3 levels soft core, hard core, & Extreme. You pick the level you'd like to play!
Soft core :A lot of stripping & putting on your clothing. Non-sexual with non-partner, touching partner
Hard core :A lot of stripping & putting on your clothing. Hands, sexual touching, partner and non-partner
Extreme :A lot of stripping & putting on your clothing. LOOK OUT!!! Anything goes!
2 games alcohol & non-alcohol

name: Dead Pan
description:
Object of the game is to win by being the first player to clear all the marbles out of the 6 oblong pans in his/her own tray, OR to win by "default", when some other player fills all of their six penalty holes at the top of their tray.
Very mancala-like.

Description from Selchow & Righter Co. Catalog:

Just like eating Peanuts - when you play Dead Pan, you keep coming back for more. Another Winner following on the heels of Scrabble. Novel in appearance, new in method of play and easy - so easy to learn. Nothing to do but drop Marbles into the beautiful plastic trays - but it's a real Challenge to WIN. For all ages.

Contents:

In beautiful modern box 16 3/8" X 9 3/4" X 2" containing four colored plastic trays, 72 colored marbles, short easy-to-read directions in the box cover.

name: Battle of Gettysburg
description:
Battle of Gettysburg is a two player brigade level game depicting the largest battle of the American Civil War.

Battle of Gettysburg recreates specific portions of the battle as game scenarios, using historical units and arrival times, and also includes various alternative history options.

Playing times: MacPherson's Ridge (July 1) 60-120 minutes; Longstreet's Attack (July 2), Pickett's Charge (July 3), Meades' Counterattack (alt-history July 4) 120-180 minutes.

Battle Games (historical & alt-history) 6 to 12 hours, depending on start date and time. All Battle Games have sudden death conditions that can end the battle whenever fulfilled.

Solitaire friendly

Components:


22"x25" Game Map
324 9/16" pieces, representing historical combat units and unit or formation status markers.
4 Setup Cards, 2 Order of Appearance Cards and a Game Reference card for each player.
24 page color booklet of rules, play illustrations and detailed historical commentary.
1 Six-sided Die

name: Phase 10 UpSets
description:
From the box:

Phase 10 UpSets, the vertical rummy game!

The challenging and exciting twists of the popular card game go 3-D! Try to complete each of the 10 specific phases on the vertical game grid but watch out for the upset. As you get close to winning, one of your opponents can upset you and the grid with one single tile and more than your hopes will come crashing down.

Game contains:
Playing grid,
4 tile holders,
Dice and 61 tiles.

Ages 5 and up

name: Futile Gallantry: The Fight Against Tyranny in the Early Days of World War II, 1939-1940
description:
From the publisher website:

The Fight Against Tyranny in the Early Days of World War II, 1939-1940: Includes the information you need to field French, Belgian, Dutch, Norwegian, Danish, Polish, and Finnish troops. 80 pages of infantry platoons, artillery, vehicles and aircraft. As a bonus, information for the Continuation War Finns is included. Note: Early War Germans are found in Angriff!, Early War British are found in Go Forward Together.

An Early Days expansion for Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Full On NRL
description: NRL (the National Rugby League of Australia) present Full On NRL. The object (as in proper rugby) is to score as many tries and conversions as possible, moving your thirteen players around the board using the Direction Dice. Each of the league's 16 teams are represented in the game as you play the Telstra Premiership or just for fun.

name: Caliphate
description:
Caliphate focuses on the rise and fall of Islamic civilization in the (approx.) 7th to 12th centuries. It is a game of conquest, trade, diplomacy, and building up your emirate economically, culturally, military, etc. Inspired by historical events, but not a strict historical simulation.

Players represent different Emirates that are rivals for control after Muhammed’s death at the end of his conquests. Each player controls an area on the map, along with a number of army units with which he can battle others and take over more territory.

In addition to combat, there are economic issues to attend to. Emirates produce a number of goods according to the size of area controlled, and players trade surplus commodities with each other to generate earnings. This trade income is combined with taxes to pay the required expenses of maintaining the army and to purchase infrastructure improvements.
categories: Arabian, Economic, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Star Trek Battle Manual
description:
Star Trek Battle Manual was Zocchi's first foray into space combat games. It is very similar to his later Alien Space Battle Manual and Star Fleet Battle Manual, with good reason. Zocchi did not have a license to publish a Star Trek game when this came out, and in addition to the title the game uses images of ships from the series (the Enterprise is on the cover), not to mention the names and pictures of the characters. Paramount objected and Zocchi was forced to recall the game from stores. A few copies had already been sold, which are the ones occasionally seen today.

The following year, Zocchi released Alien Space Battle Manual, with all the Star Trek references replaced with ones he invented. When he obtained a license from Franz Josef Designs (allowing him to use ship designs and names such as "Klingon"), he published Star Fleet Battle Manual.

In this game, optional rules are given for the special abilities of some of the Enterprise crew - these of course do not appear in the later games.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: UNO: Philadelphia Phillies
description:
Another Uno variation. Philadelphia Phillies Uno comes with 112 Custom cards featuring the Phils' 2005 line-up including Jim Thome, Bobby Abreu, Jon Lieber, Pat Burrell and more.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Acquisition card and rule.

name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Terror Tactics Command Deck
description:
With the race for supremacy becoming ever more desperate in a world driven by the war machine: with extremist views becoming the mainstay and with the political system being domineered by tyrannical warmongers, the time has come for...TERROR TACTICS!

No longer do bureaucrats endlessly try in vain to foster peace treaties between opposing factions. Instead they too have picked up their arms and having lost heart, fight for the ultimate stake – their own survival.

Where will this struggle end? Who will become the dominant power? The world's fate is in your hands!

DESCRIPTION

Terror Tactics is a 20 card second generation expansion to the Risk 2210 AD universe designed for use either in place of one of the five original command decks or through the introduction of an additional command token.

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Solaria
description:
It is the “Year of Unification” 01 in the star system Solaria, and aliens from all planets celebrate the beginning of a new era of peace and prosperity!

From the neophyte interplanetary capital on Luna, moon of Prime, to the local governments on the five planets, the newly united races of the Solaria system seek to spread their influence and control the fragile system-wide bureaucracy. As the leader of your race, can you build support on the planets, wisely assign your Councilors, and seize power as the Emperor of Solaria?

Solaria features area control, limited actions and resource management. The main action plays out on the five planets that rotate around the sun in different orbits. The ever changing rotation of the planets can dramatically affect game play, as planet position determines travel costs (the greater the distance between planets, the more fuel it takes to get there), scoring (elections only take place when a planet is in the same sector as the capital), and deep space exploration.

By winning elections, players appoint their Councilors to positions in the Solarian government that can best serve their own race (different assignments reap game-altering benefits). Competition for privileges is fierce. Choosing where to increase your power base on the planets, where to move your Planetary Base, whether to mine asteroids or the best method to explore deep space (and other options) is a careful balance of managing money, Councilors, and your rivals’ best-laid plans.

After six rounds, all planets hold their final elections. The player who exerts the most influence in the government becomes the Emperor of Solaria and wins the game!

Actual playing time is 90-150 minutes.

Note: The game was selected for participation in the 2008 Hippodice international game design competition. It is currently unpublished.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Point to Point Movement
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Erasmus Fox Games

name: The 70's: A Game for Your Generation
description: The 70's is a Monopoly based on the 1970's. Squares are based on historical and cultural trends of the day.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Tafel Tour
description:
Dutch cycling game from the 1960's, released by the small publisher "Es-Es-Es" from Voorburg. The game could be ordered by readers of the dutch television magazines Avrobode and Televizier (years 1960-1965), and was advertised in several newspapers between 1960 and 1966. However, the game wasn't sold in most of the regular toyshops. According to an advertisement in the local newspaper (1960) the game could be acquired at the bigger sport shops in greater towns.

The board measures 50x32cm.

What makes this game unique for it's time was that it was a racing game that didn't use any die but action cards for movement. There are several étappes (including an individual and group time trial etappe and a mountain etappe).

For the overall leader there is yellow jersey, for the leader of the point standings there was a green jersey. Both jerseys were flat plastic circular "counters"(0.3mm thickness), which could be put over the head.

There are at least 4 different box-versions of this game, coloured white (the Televizier version), black and red (both square and rectangular). The mapboard has 3 versions (one with the Televizier log, one with tables and one with no tables and logo).

name: Blitz!
description: A short game for 2 or 3 players. The game contains of 18 tiles, six of each of three colours: Yellow, red and blue. Each colour is placing a tile alternately. The player paying Yellow can place any of his tiles adjacent to own tiles already placed. Red and blue has to throw the die before placing tiles of their own, determining the form of the tile to be placed according to certain numbers, adjacent to a tile of any colour. The yellow player has the goal to place all his tiles (forming a "Blitz"), blue and red are trying together to hinder yellow from doing so.

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder Down Under
description:
Jimmy Skydoch, owner of Australia's most popular TV company "Shooting Star"is found dead after falling over the balcony at Sydney's most exclusive restaurant.
Solve the mystery but "can you guess who it is yet?

Have a party to find out who wanted to cancel his contract.

Each player has a boook with a description of their roles. There are 10 rounds. Each rounds some information and hints are given. During some of the rounds, players get an extra clue, to solve the mysterie. The players have to honest with their answers, according to their roles. Only the murdere is a liar.
In all the rounds there is information that has to be told. Players can ask questions the other player to have some background information.

At the end of round 10 players can accuse one other player being the murderer.

name: Dado
description:
Vous lancez les dix dés a 10 faces et choisissez ceux que vous voulez conserver, selon la case que vous décidez de remplir (à noter quevous avez une possibilité de 24 cases donc,24 combinaisons différentes à faire).

Vous pouvez lancer les dés indésirables jusqu`à quatre fois.

Et avec la case DADO vous avez la
possibilité de relancer huit fois les dés indésirables au cours d`une partie.

À noter avec 10 dés à 10 faces il y a
plusieurs combinaisons possible donc
beaucoup plus de stratégie et de hasard
que les jeux traditionnels.

Le gagnant est celui qui obtient le plus de points.


You roll several ten 10-sided dice and choose which ones you want to keep, according to the box you choose to fill out (note that you have a possibility of 24 cases, therefore, 24 different combinations to do).

You can roll the same die up to four times.

And with the DADO box you have the opportunity to relaunch eight times during a party.

Note with 10 to 10-sided dice there are many possible combinations and much more strategy and luck
that with the traditional games.

The winner is the one who gets the most points.

name: Second Chance
description:
In this two player abstract strategy game, players attempt to capture or eliminate all their opponent's pieces. Pieces are captured by jumping over them, checkers style, and placing them in a special zone on the board. These pieces can be rescued by an uncaptured piece moving through the capture zone. The piece which freed the others is then crowned. This offers the piece more options for movement while at the same time making it vulnerable to elimination, as the crowned pieces are removed from the board if an opponent jumps them.

The first player to capture or eliminate all opposing pieces wins.

name: Hi-Bol
description: Hi-Bol is a portable skee ball dexterity game for any number of players. The game folds up and seals with velcro; once opened a small ramp flips out while two straps hold it somewhat less than open. Set it down and you're ready to go. Increase the distance to increase the challenge. The game includes 7 wooden balls (6 white; 1 red); the red ball scores double so when to use it is always a tactical decision on the part of each player.

name: Snack Factory
description:
Donuts, chocolate, and chips!

In Snack Factory it’s up to you to keep the world supplied with their favorite snacks. In each round you will need to balance profit and sales while maximizing productivity to stay ahead of the competition.

Think you have what it takes? Reach for a delicious snack and try your hand at running the best snack factory!

Snack Factory incorporates a climbing style card game with clever scoring mechanics to give players interesting and challenging decisions!

(Publisher Blurb)

name: Navy
description:
From the Rulebook:

NAVY is a fantastic and all absorbing pastime in air - naval strategy in which aircraft carriers, cruisers, frigates, submarines, tenders and fighter planes - a total of thirty perfectly detailed models - engage in combat (on a sparkling blue sea plan, criss-crossed by meridians, parallels and clearcut coastlines) to conquer islands, ports and airports, force naval blockades or impede the beforehand selected ever challenging military objectives from being hit or reached by the adversaries. This navy game can be played by two or more players (up to 12) from 8 years upwards.

IMPORTANT:
This navy game exclude blind luck, so badly needed with cards or dices, because the man-o-war and air attacckers move in precisely the same way as the teal task forces when sent out on a mission, having similar displacement, speed, navy apparel and airplane armaments.

GAMEPLAY:
Board represent an hypothetic Pacific Sea divided into meridians and parallels, where only the intersections are marked. There are two home lands drown on the map, and other six movable.
There are two factions in the game (Copper and Nickel) that face each others in order to accomplish certain objectives (capture the flag, dominate the sea, defende transport, tow home a captured enemy frigate ecc... scenarios are countless).
Each faction has always an ADMIRAL, that decide where put the mines (secretly marked on "Admiral's plot"), his fome flag (the tower) and which unit group will move. An Admiral could have COMMANDERS, in charge to manage the units (there could be a commander that handle all units, two commanders that share the army or specific commanders that handle a group or a type of units... depends on the number of players).

Teams take turn by moving one unit at time (like in chess) orizontally or diagonally without change direction (planes can) and in case check if they hit a target.
Each unit has three characteristics, Life points (1 to 3), speed (2 to 5 crosses) and range (0 to 3 crosses). Submarines can shoot only forward or backwards, and can immerse themselves (admiral removes the miniature from the board and tracks down their path on his plot), Airplanes can be very fast on high altitudes but can bomb (and be shot) only on low altitudes, they also can patrol 12 crosses away from a land or a carrier otherwise are considered lost.
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Munchkin Booty D10 Dice
description:
The Munchkin Booty D10 Dice is a single 10-sided die that was sold by itself and in the Munchkin Booty Dice Set with a Munckin Booty Dice Bag, and a pair of Munchkin Booty D6 Dice.



From the Munchkin Booty D10 Dice package



If you use this die in a game of Munchkin Booty:If you are a pirate without a Ship, you may at any time during your turn, except during combat, take a Ship from the discard pile.

Place the die on the Ship. The Ship now has a value worth 0 Gold Pieces, but the die grants a combat bonus equal to your level. The die and the ship can be lost as any other ship.

In any other game of Munchkin the die acts as a Cheat card. Remove the die from the game after using it.

The rules for Muchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.






From the Munchkin Booty Dice Set package



If you use this D10 die in a game of Munchkin Booty:[Hide the Booty]

At the end of your turn you may place cards underneath your Hide Away. You can hide a number of cards equal to your level.

These card are now considered out of the game for all purposes. You may retrieve any of them at any time during your turn, except during combat.

If you lose levels discard a random card from thse for each level you loose.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.






UnofficialThese dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.



OtherPart of the Munchkin series

name: Boggin'
description:
Experience all of the drama and excitement of professional Mud Bog Racing with Boggin'.

Boggin' includes 21 of the best Modified trucks from all over the world.

Boggin' simulates every facet of the sport from mechanical failures to full runs.

Mud bogging, also known as mud racing, is a form of off-road motor sport popular in the United States in which the goal is to drive a vehicle through a pit of mud of a set length. Winners are determined by the distance traveled through the pit or, if several vehicles are able to travel the entire length, the time taken to traverse the pit. Typically, vehicles competing in mud bogs are four-wheel drives.

There are many types of mud bogs. From Hill and Hole, Flat or Progressive Track, and Open Bog. They come in many shapes and sizes from 150 feet to over 300 feet. Hill and Hole is just as it sounds, usually is 60 feet wide 200 feet long and is a series of hills and holes, and make challenging to each truck. Progressive tracks are generally flat with the consistency of the mud varying as the vehicle advances through the pit.

Boggin' features 24 of the best mud bogs in the world. And each is uniquely rated for length, type and difficulty.

You need not be an expert or even a full-fledged fan of mud bogging to enjoy the game. Everything needed to "bring you up to speed" is included in the rule book. Even those with no knowledge of the sport itself will love this racing game.

name: ドナドナ (DONNA DONNA)
description:
Players collect animals through an unique auction system. First, an active player decide the price of the animal tiles. Then, everyone simultaneously decides either to accept or to refuse this offer. This process can be repeated at most three times. There is a bonus when exactly one player wants the tiles but no one knows who bid what except the active player.

Also players would like to collect all 5 animals but having an excess of animals will cost you at the end of the game.

User summary
In the game of ドナドナ (DONNA DONNA), players try to collect valuable animals through auctions.

In an auction, the active player declare a price for auctioned animals, and the other players secretly decides whether they accept or decline the offer.

At end of the game, you score points according to variety and quantity of animals you have acquired. However, each animal has an acquisition limit, and you will be taxed if you have acquired animals of that type more than the limit. The highest scorer wins the game.

このゲームは、競りゲームです。各プレイヤーは、より高価値となるであろう動物タイルを競りによって獲得することを目指します。
競りでは、ターンプレイヤーが販売希望価格を宣言し、他のプレイヤーがそれに応じるか否かを秘密裡に回答することで進行していきます。
各プレイヤーのポイントは獲得した動物タイルの種類数と枚数によって決まります。ただし、各動物ごとに非課税対象枚数が決まっており、それを超えると税金がかかります。
ゲーム終了時に、最もポイントの高いプレイヤーの勝ちとなります。

name: VI Sup
description:
Very unusual board game from the late 70's. Each player is a mountaineer and must climb the Mont Blanc to win the game. However, the player has to earn experience points to get the skills to climb mountains, so there are 22 mountains to conquer. Each climb is harder than the previous one. You don'Ät have to climb them all, you can choose which to climb. You might, for example, climb Number One (Aiguille du Belvédère) successfully, and then try Number Four (Aiguille Purtscheller), and so on.

Each climb is illustrated for the player, with various points along the route when equipment (Alea) cards might be asked for, the more equipment you have, the better for you. And the Descent (Rappel) might cause you problems.

The board is very attractive, showing the mountain ranges. There is a curious box in the right hand corner, on which you place two tiny green frogs. These frogs move during the game and when they reach certain points on the track, the weather changes (Meteo). This weather change can be catastrophic. You might not to be able to get down a mountain you have climbed and a helicopter might be needed to get you off the mountain.

The game looks great with all the Climbs being illustrated in some detail. The playing pieces look good but are completely impractible. They are plastic Picks, in 6 colours. And they fall over far too easily. And not to forget, the two green frogs.

In my game there was a card asking me to buy their next game, which would be about skiing. However, I got no reply and I never did see a second game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Uber-Six
description:
A pencil-and-paper dice-based solo roleplaying adventure. Players build a character and face hordes of enemies in an attempt to level up or die. The ultimate grindfest.

Players create a character of one of four classes (Warrior, Mage, Ninja, or Druid) each with a special ability, and adventure off into the wilderness to slay countless foes. In between each fight, the character rolls on the monster tables to determine which foe they will face in the upcoming round. If they so choose, they may spy by paying one gold before the roll--spying allows the player to decide whether or not to face the enemy. After the enemy is determined, the game continues to battle. During battle, initiative is determined each round by a roll of the dice modified by attributes, and whichever side has the initiative is allowed to make an action--either attacking, running, or using magic if possible. Combat is worked out in this way until one side or the other is reduced to 0 health, at which point if the character survives they gather gold and experience, and lives to fight another monster. If the character is dead, the game is over.

The goal of this game is simply to kill time in a fun way. Surviving characters can last for several sessions, and allow for a feeling of progression.

name: Black Powder: The Last Argument of Kings
description:
At the beginning of the Eighteenth century, warfare entered a new era. The widespread use of the flintlock musket had transformed the way armies trained and fought.
This period was a golden age for the crowned heads of Europe. They commanded professional troops, gloriously outfitted in splendid uniforms, and fought each other over land, wealth and the succession of their thrones. Some even led their armies on the field of battle. Yet by the end of the century, the real power of kings was gone or greatly eroded parliaments would decide the foreing policy of nations, democracy had taken hold in the New World and the divine right of kings was being questioned everywhere.
These were the last wars fought to protect the succession rights of royalty. These wars were the Last Arguments of Kings.
This supplement for the Black Powder game overviews the main conflicts and armies of this period, and includes army lists and special rules to enable you to refight these wars using the Black Powder rules, as well as scenarios for the most dramatic battles of the time. Featured conflicts include:
The War of the Spanish Succession (The Battle of Blenheim 1704)
The Great Northen War (The Battle of Holowczyn 1708)
The Austro-Turkish Wars (The Battle of Petrovardin 1716)
The War of the Austrian Succession (The Battle of Fontenoy 1745)
The Wars of the English Succession (The '45 Rebellion)
The Seven Years' War (The Battle of Hundorf 1762)
War in the Colonies (The French Indian Wars & The War in India)
Raids and Invasions (Amphibious Warfare in the 18th Century)
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Cantuun
description:
With a map of Switzerland as board, Cantuun is a call for travel along with four young and curious people, who began a challenge on Facebook: be the first to arrive in canton Uri after having visited each and every Swiss canton. The game pursues two clear objectives: to add to one's knowledge on what one thinks to know on Switzerland, and to have a good time.
(translated from the french official description)

Cantuun is a trivia game about the cantons of Switzerland. Each player has a set of card representing each Swiss canton, and plays them hidden to answer the questions. Each correct canton selected brings points, and the first player to reach 26 points wins. There are three different types of questions (easy, hard and speed questions), which makes the game more dynamic than a regular trivia game.

name: Alle Falde del Kilimangiaro
description:
Licia Colò takes us on a fantastic voyage around the world, discovering famous places, that we are not always able to locate in the exact place on the map. An easy game, especially suitable for children, with also a high educational content.
Each player has a "marker" and must be the first to arrive at the place written on a card "destination".
Each time you reach a goal you add a stamp on your "suitcase travel" and the first that is able to have five wins the game.

name: Dark Horse: The Salty Troll
description:
The Salty Troll is the name of a store that deals in many different goods, but most importantly connections within the county.

This card is for the board game Dark Horse and may be used to add a Limited Action Space to the game. A player taking this Action always collects it last after all other Actions have been collected. The player will receive one Wild Die token and may look at the top two cards, from any card deck, and then put them back on top of that deck, face down.

Came from SaltCon 2012.

name: Warriors & Traders: Italia
description: Warriors & Traders: Italia, a mini-expansion for Warriors & Traders, comes with a new map depicting medieval Italy. Players can choose to lead Rome, Naples, Sicily, Tuscany, Venice, Genoa, Sardinia or Milan to fight a fratricidal war to dominate Italy.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Trading

name: Bitter Heights: The Battle of Mitla Pass – October 29-31, 1956
description:
Bitter Heights: The Battle of Mitla Pass: October 29-31, 1956, is a low-complexity game on the battle for Mitla Pass during the 1956 Arab-Israeli War. The Israelis were to take and hold the Pass to prevent Egyptian forces from reinforcing their counterparts to the east, as well as establish a credible force that could threaten the Suez Canal. This would provide the pretext for Great Britain and France to intervene and take the crucial waterway back from Egyptian control.

The battle would come to represent the confused and tragic aspects of this war. The Israelis underestimated the strength of their opposition, the indecisive actions of their British and French allies upon which this operation depended, and the diplomatic victory Nasser and the Arab Allies would realize despite the military defeats they sustained. General Sharon’s controversial decision, to attack and take control of the pass in disobedience of direct orders, led to high losses in a fight that did nothing to further the Israeli cause.

As the Israeli player you will have to keep your losses low, while keeping hold of the roadway through the pass, as the Egyptian player you want the Israeli's to pay a high price.

Activation takes place by the use of a deck of cards, similar to the Pocket Battle Games by ATO. This creates the chaos of war that makes play unpredictable and interactive.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 3 hours
Area: 1 inch equals 2 miles / 3.2 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Army

Game Inventory:
One 11x17" full color map
One dual-side printed un-mounted countersheet (90 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 4-page rulebook
One Player Aid Chart

Player Provided: One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2 to 3 hours

name: Angels One Five
description:
From the introduction -

"This is a simple grand tactical simulation game of the interception of an escorted formation of multiengine daylight bombers during World War Two. Two players or teams direct the actions of the escorting and intercepting fighters as they seek to inflict losses on the opposing aircraft while minimising their own losses. In team play, each player controls one or more specific fighter units, depending on the number of players and the amount of time available."

The counters come in four different sizes, with each larger size corresponding to the next higher altitude band (hence giving an intuitive representation of height, since higher units appear closer and so larger from an overhead perspective).

One of the games in Philip Sabin's book "Simulating War", with counters and map downloadable from his website.

This game has now been published in a deluxe edition by Victory Point games, with full colour components and added historical scenarios.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Class Prez!
description:
Finally, you have reached your senior year at school and are recognizing that this is your time to shine!  And what better way to gain recognition then by being elected the class president.   Ohhhh the prestige and honor can all be yours (as well as special treatment) if you can convince the leaders of the different cliques to vote in your favor.  However, to them, you are still considered an outsider and you need an 'in' at the low end of the hierarchy before speaking to the likes of the elite of the student population.  

Running for Class Prez is harder than you thought.  Everyone wants something in return for their vote and when you promise something to one clique, you end up alienating another.  Fortunately to make up for this, you are given the OK to participate in different events to campaign.  During the events, you can use the favors of your supporters to gain political advantages over your opponent.  However, watch out for the class clowns as they will help or hinder you by sending mixed messages.  

You're going to have to keep your campaign clean as you have the hall monitors keeping watch on you and your opponent and they have no qualms sending your potential voters to the principal’s office.  Also,  your opponent will try to spread rumors and expose scandals.  If all else fails, do what you can to gain the favor of the clique leaders because, only then, you will win the elections and become the Class Prez!

The first electorate to gain favor from 3 of the 4 clique leaders will win the election.  Good luck to both candidates!

Class Prez! is a quick paced 2 player game in which players vie to gain the favor and votes of the student population by making promises to the various cliques as they work their way up to the most influential leaders of the Jocks, Nerds, Preps and Goths. Using set collection of promises (suits) to place the favour tokens on the students, you work your way up from the Wannabe to the 2nd in Command and finally, the Leader of the clique. The first player to have a favour token on 3 of the 4 clique leaders wins.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Breitseite
description:
Breitseite ("Broadside") is a naval battle dexterity game for two players. Each player builds a pirate ship consisting of three wooden blocks resting on round sticks, with two masts and some sailors on top. Now they take turns putting a thinner stick between two blocks and hitting it with another stick so it flies toward the other ship, hopefully damaging it (and hopefully without accidentally knocking over their own fragile vessel). A player who loses either two decks or both masts loses the game.

An simpler version of this game was included in the game system Ombakado (1984).

name: Aether Magic
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Today is the Festival of Aether, and your chance to prove superior magical skills and wit against your peers. Summon raw Aether from the Aether Realm and trade shrewdly with the other magi to collect a variety of Runes and Magical Elements. Use your collection to cast the best combination of Spells before the Realm closes and claim the title of Master Mage!

Aether Magic provides an engaging and exciting experience for any Mage up to the challenge!

name: KIN: Steam Racers
description: New description soon
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Contrées
description:
Contrées is a two player abstract game based on the mechanism of majority and surrounding.

Short resume of the rules:
The board is modular, it is made of specific hexagonal territories.
On that board each player plays his pawns on the corner of the hexagons and try to control as much territories as possible.
When a player have 4 pawn around a territory, he can place a possession mark on it and remove the enemy pawns from it.
It is pretty simple but be careful, like in the game of GO, you can surround the opponent pawns and capture them.
When both player have played all their pawns, the one who control the most territories wins.

name: The Good, The Bad & The Funny
description:
The Good, The Bad & The Funny is an Apples-style party card game for a bunch of people. Players make compound words or phrases from a set of word cards to satisfy a mission. The dealer decides which of the submissions is Good, which is Bad, and which is Funny, and rewards the players appropriately (3, -2 and 5 points respectively). The first to 21 (or -10) wins.

There are three main differences between The Good, The Bad & The Funny and other Apples-style games:

The three main differences are:

1. Scoring. Apples games with strangers can be aggravating - will they choose the funny card or the clever one? Or the realistic one? Or just choose something terrible.

The dealer always has to choose The Good, The Bad & The Funny.

The Good is the best representation of the mission card. It’s worth three points because, while good, it’s boring and obvious. And you probably had the perfect card, so whatever.

The Bad is the worst submission that round. It’s worth negative two because I’m sick of players constantly ditching cards instead of actually thinking about a good answer. You’ll also notice that many of the players that think they are funny will end up with a lot of bad answers.

The Funny gets the biggest laugh. Subjective, of course, but it’s worth five points for entertaining the room.

The first to (or above) 21 points wins, unless there is a tie, in which case play continues as normal until a single player has the highest score.

There’s another small twist, which is that players can also win by scoring -10 points. This makes it a bit more fun to be chosen for that bad answer in round 1.

2. Players always play two cards. This is a game about compound words and phrases. Our lives are surrounded by such combinations - you’ll start to notice much more after reading this sentence. Creating compound words and phrases is a wonderful challenge - it forces players to think about the many ways that a word can be interpreted and manipulated by another word. And the essence of this game is a carefully created wordlist that is composed of the most commonly occurring bits from compound words and phrases in the English language, almost all of which are nouns.

There are a couple of key benefits to this approach. Most answers are not reliant on a shared understanding of pop. Many other Apples games assume a certain level of 21st Century culture familiarity while the word cards from The Good, The Bad & The Funny are timeless (the mission cards, however, do have a bit of pop-infusion). Answers won’t get stale, as the likelihood of a one playing the same combination twice within a play session or many, many play sessions is infinitely low. Even playing the same word card won’t have the same negative effect as in other games because it is about how two cards react together, not simply a funny reference. Even if the same two cards are played together, the order can be changed to dramatically alter the meaning.

The game is very replayable without the need for many, many expansions.

3. At any given time, three mission cards are face up. Dealers get to choose which mission they want to judge, which allows for another layer of strategy. Players can hold onto cards that match future possible missions (don’t you hate throwing out the perfect card right before getting the matching mission?).
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Scout 255 Expansion Pack
description: This ship is one of the ships players purchase as an entrance fee to parcipate in the Star Trek Attack Wing "Resistance Is Futile" tournaments.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Polak Mały
description:
Polak Mały is a new memory based educational board game from Institute of Polish Remembrance. With help of puzzles, that you can also use for memory game, players can learn Polish national symbols such as Poland coat of arms, Polish flag and national anthem. Quick and fun way to teach children from age of four basics of national identity and heritage.

Game features five mini games for example a quick game where three teams are racing to arrange a line of Polish anthem, the one which succeeded to do it first without a mistake wins - you check it by flipping cards if they are correct they will form Polish ensign. You can also play a game for two people by dividing puzzles by colours (red and white) once you have done it you lay them down in six rows (three white and three red). You start by playing memory game by finding cards from red and white rows with matching texts of Polish anthem, if a player succeed to do so he takes cards, player with most cards wins.

name: Warhammer: The End Times – Glottkin
description:
From the publisher's website:

Archaon has sent the Glottkin, triplet champions of Nurgle, to infest the lands of men with their supernatural plagues. Gods and monsters clash as the doom of the civilised world fast approaches. These are the End Times.

Warhammer: Glottkin continues the epic saga begun in Warhammer: Nagash. This terrifying new chapter in the history of the Old World is revealed over two softback tomes.

Warhammer: Glottkin Book 1 is a 128-page volume which provides a narrative sweep of the events surrounding the Chaos invasion of the Old World led by the Brothers Glott.

Warhammer: Glottkin Book 2 is a 64-page volume that contains six new scenarios and new rules based on the events in Warhammer: Glottkin Book 1. It includes the rules that will allow you to field the Glottkin, Maggoth Lords, Gutrot Spume and the Putrid Blightkings in your games of Warhammer. It also includes all-new rules for Karl Franz Ascendant (who is changed by the horrors of the End Times, but you will have to read the book to find out more) and Festus Empowered.

Armies of the End Times can field more Lords - to up 50% - and there are brand new rules for fighting battles in the streets of war torn cities. The new army list - The Legions of Chaos - allows you to create a unified army of Chaos drawn from Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Incy Wincy Spider
description:
A 3d board game based on the children's song "Incy Wincy Spider". Here, little spiders living in a run-down house are trying to safely traverse its four rooms and turn off a giant dripping tap.

The plastic tap standing in the centre of the board contains a mechanism that, when the handle is twisted, lifts up small blue marbles (droplets) and releases them at the top, creating a genuine "dripping tap". The droplets can flip one of four "traps", sending any spider that happened to be standing on it back to the starting point.

name: Chaosmos: Mor'ls The Mimic
description:
Exclusive alien miniature not contained in retail copies of Chaosmos.

Comes with miniature, alien sheet and power tokens for the campaign mode.

He doesn't have a native planet and his alien power lets him copy other alien's powers!

After the aliens have been dealt to the players, Mor'ls collects the unused alien and puts them in front of him face up.

At the start of his turn he activates one alien and puts it face down. For the reminder of the turn he can use the powers of that alien. Next turn, he chooses a different alien and puts it face down using that power instead...

He must use all the powers before he can refresh all of them.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Game (2014)
description:
The Game is a realpolitik boardgame where the players step into the role of the most influential people of the planet, the ones who control governments and nations. To win the player must avoid to identify himself with a faction such as North America, the Soviet Union or the Middle East. These factions should be "puppets" that the player must maneuver to get richer than other players.

During a play of The Game players manage governments, banks, religious congregation and mass-media, creating conflicts, speculations, war debts and political scandals. These events can decree the well-being or the failure of the world factions, provoking wars, truces and weapons trade. It doesn't matter if the factions controlled by the player prosper or suffer: the winner will be the player who benefits the more from the world situation: when you sell weapons you can win even losing the war.

Some notes regarding actual game mechanics, actions and win conditions.

There are six factions: Europe (black), USA (blue), Sovietic Area (red), Chinese Area (yellow), Arabian area (green) and Third World area (white). Players are not associated to factions but they control them. From this point of view the game paradigma remembers Imperial.

The game is played in turns. During each turn a player draw one card from the common deck, then can play one card from his hand. Other players could play also a card during current player's turn, but this is not mandatory and not often worthy. Part of the strategy relies on the decision about if, when and what to play during the turn of another player. Aside from the card, each money holds some money, which can be spend during the game and it's considered as victory points at the end of the game.

The deck contains 72 cards. 24 cards are named "Controls" and are permanent cards, i.e. they remain on the table after being played. The other 48 cards are temporary cards, i.e they are discarded after their effect took place. All cards are of four types: Military Control, Economic Control, Mass-Media Control and Religious Control. Since we have 6 factions and 4 type of control cards, this makes up the 24 control cards. The other 48 cards are also divided into these 4 categories (Military, Economic, Mass-Media and Religious) but, as stated above, they are temporary.

After playing a card, and carried on its effects (if not permanent) the current player can activate all his permanent cards. Each card allow differect actions.
A military control card allows to move military units on the map, triggering wars and occupations among the 6 factions. Economic control cards allow to directly attack another player (not a faction) by stealing his money. Mass-Media control cards allows to move tokens from any position, changing the "meaning" of the token. This is probably the most innovative game concept: by activate a Mass-Media control a player can take a token from a Military card (depicting a was loss) and move it to a Economic card (depicting a return of investment). By this mechanism the player can use the power of Mass-Media to change the way facts are explained to people, and then changing the way the history events affects social groups. Finally, Religious control allows to steal a control card from another player: this is probably the most powerful card, but it's not always easy to manage.

Player roll dice only when manipulating factions. Factions are not balanced, and this is the game's core logic. For instance, a player controlling blue Military Control (USA Military control), white Economic Control (Third World control) and red Mass-Media Control (Sovietic Mass-Media Control) could decide to trigger a war between USA and Sud Africa, being almost sure that USA military forces will win easily. This could create a debt to his white Economic control card, and then he could use his red Mass-Media control to move this tokens away from white Economic card to another card of his own. An historical lecture of these strategy could be read as follows: in the real history USA won a war against Sud Africa, but russian Mass-Media managed to tell another version of facts, and this could produce a money income for the player controlling russians Mass-Media enterprises.

Playing The Game should give players the same feeling you can get by movies as "Wag the Dog" (1997) or from the historical events as the attack to the World Trade Center (2001). Players should manipulate factions, sometime carrying them to financial crises, war or destruction, in order to enrich themself (and not the faction). The game ends when a player reaches the victory condition or the deck runs out of cards. At the end of the game the richest player is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Modern Warfare, Political
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Take That

name: Age of Craft Expansion #2: Architecture Alliance
description:
This expansion for Age of Craft introduces Alliance Building cards, which can be purchased by neighboring players pooling their resources together. The Alliance Buildings are placed in between the two neighboring players and provide benefits to both.

This set also contains extra cards for use during 2-player games to make negotiation more effective, tweaked versions of base set cards, variant rules for a longer game, and additional cards for use with the first expansion.
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: Pokémon TCG: Jungle Expansion
description:
Jungle is the name given to the first expansion of new cards and Theme Decks for the Pokémon Trading Card Game. Are you ready to explore the jungle? If you look hard, you`ll find 48 new Pokemon Trading Card Game cards in the exciting Jungle expansion for the Pokemon trading card game.

----

Collect all the Jungle cards and you`ll discover awesome new holographic cards with super attacks - a must for every Pokemon collector! Each pre-constructed theme deck contains 60 cards, a cardboard holographic foil Vileplume coin, 10 damage counters, and an english rulebook.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
publishers: The Pokémon Company (Japan), The Pokémon Company International

name: Sheepdogs
description: Sheepdogs is a trick-taking game in which the sheepdogs are trump and four types of sheep are the different suits. Players bid to predict the number of tricks they will take and must be exactly right to gain any points. However, the player who collects the most black sheep always gets a point. Mind the wolf and the penned sheep as these cards can derail the best made plans.

name: Idunn's Apples
description:
Loki once got in trouble with the gods by helping the giant Thjassi steal the goddess Idunn and her marvelous Apples of Youth. Loki was successful in getting Idunn back, but the gods are not done punishing Loki for his misdeeds! They demand that Loki find all the missing apples and return them to the Gods.

The goal is to find 5 Apples of Youth and return them to the gods, before Loki is caught or killed.

There are 15 Story Cards which the player reads through on Loki's quest.

Loki, trickster that he is, has four options for getting through the encounters on the cards. He can:

1) Whisper sweet lies.
2) Leave and sneak back later.
3) Boast of greater treasure.
4) Transform into a falcon.

But will those options be enough to steal back the apples?

This was an entry in the 18 Card MicroGame Contest [2014].

• It won first place for Best Theme.
• It won second place for Originality/Innovation.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Mythology, Print & Play

name: Order of the Gilded Compass: Coveted Artifacts/An Ally Inside expansion
description:
Includes 2 mini-expansions:
- Coveted Artifacts that are mixed in with the Private Artifact tiles.
- Special Agents of the Illuminati that are mixed in the the ability tiles.

name: Labyrint Flip
description:
A children's game based on a famous Swedish TV-show for kids. 28 double-sided tiles are spread out on the board. The goal of the game is to collect as many as possible of the things that has been spread out in different rooms and workshops of the Daedalus.

On your turn you try to get completed sets based on the picture of the tile. The sets are between 2 to 5 tiles. You can even steal tiles from the other players if you can take a complete set. Then you flip the tiles over for the other side.

The player with the most tiles when every tile is taken wins the round and gets a point-marker. First player to get three points wins.

Labyrint: Flip is a standalone game but can also be played an extra challenge to Labyrint.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Easy Play XXL
description:
4 Easy Play games in one box plus two additional variants per game.

The games contained are :
· Mountain Goats
· Finito!
· Big Points
· Numeri

name: Magic: The Gathering – 2011 Core Set
description:
Magic 2011 contained 249 cards (101 Common, 60 Uncommon, 53 Rare, 15 Mythic, 20 Basic Lands). Like its predecessor Magic 2010, nearly half of the cards in Magic 2011 were new.

Ten thirty-card sample decks released in 2011, consisting of basic lands, commons and 4 uncommons from Magic 2011 and the Zendikar block were given away and distributed to stores to promote Magic to new players. Due to a lack of rare or valuable cards, the Magic 2011 decks are generally regarded has having low value to collectors.

name: Luther: Das Kartenspiel
description:
Description from the publisher:

We are in the 16th century, after the death of Martin Luther, the world-changing Augustinian friar. Most of his discouraged followers and admirers are still asking each other hopelessly: how to go on without him? What’s next now?

Some of them, however, know very well what is to be done in times like this: to write down the events of the reformer’s earthly journey as detailed and as true as possible. This is the only way to pay due tribute to their friend and professor in order to educate the world and the church. So, they organize themselves into a handful of scriveners and set to writing the great biography. But they might get hard pressed for time!

While playing Luther – Das Kartenspiel we have the chance to slip into the shoes of these scribes. The teamwork, as usually happens, swings into a little rivalry: who will reap the glory, which comes with chronicling certain stages of life? Who will be the one taking the most manuscripts to the printing house? What’s more, from time to time, the diligent work of the scribes is interrupted by the least expected incidents such as: a carefully inscribed sheet of paper burns or changes hands “accidently”, or a crafty fellow scribe filches a page, or mixes foolish rumours into the reliable notes.

name: Ladybug
description:
You are Remington Smythe, captain of Ladybug and your all-purpose scruffy-looking scoundrel for hire. You will travel from planet to planet and from system to system delivering cargo, people and bounty hunting, which earns you money - the universal substance used both as currency and fuel. Your goal is to increase your rating from harmless to fearsome, thus becoming the best unscrupulous mercenary in the galaxy, and not to go bankrupt in the process.

Some cards make up the modular map of systems and planets. Other cards present you with job opportunities, or events that happen as you travel.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Candrageni
description:
Description from the publisher:

In the ancient time of Java, there was once a prosperous kingdom called Mataram. The nature was extremely generous, yet dangerous. And their technology was so advance they began to trade with foreign nations.

As one of Rakai (noble), you are entrusted by The King to build Candi or Temple (a mega structure to worship Gods and Nature) and establish profitable trading with foreign nations. The most successful Rakai is entitled as the successor of The King. But beware of Megatsunami and Ultravulcanian Eruption for those great disasters can easily wipe the entire civilization of Mataram out!

In Candrageni, you play as Rakai. Your ultimate goal is to be the first Rakai who collects 15 victory points. You collect points by building temples or trading with foreign nations. Once this goal is achieved, the game is over. Or, in case one of two final disasters occur (Megatsunami and Ultravulcanian Eruption), the game is over and (unfortunately) no one is winning.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Round House: 2nd Expansion – Port City
description:
Round House: 2nd Expansion – Port City provides four kinds of new tile for the Round House base game:

>>1.Port city Tiles:
1)You can move a assistant from a town to the nearby port city.
If you pay the resource cubes, you will move to more far place to take a Bao-Chao Banknote Tile.

2)If you stop your scoring assistant on the “small temple” space of the score track on the game board, you may gain the small temple reward.

>>2.Bao-Chao Banknote Tile:
Bao-Chao Banknote, the front have a value of 5 coins, the back is bonus points calculated the end of the game.

During game setting, place Bao-Chao Banknote face up in the coin supply.Anytime when a player receives 5 coins or more, player can choose take a Bao-Chao bank note instead of 5 coins. Player must immediately decide to flip to the back side for scoring and place below the player board. (*Flipped tiles cannot be used as 5 coins.)

1.Receive 1 honor points when you take coins.(each used once per turn)
2.Receive 1 honor points when you perform Traveling merchant action.(each used once per turn)
3.Receive 2 honor points when you perform Recruit action.(each used once per turn)
4.Receive 3 honor points when you perform Helper action.(each used once per turn)
5.Receive 2/3 honor points when you SELL the specified resource cubes to any kind of market.(each used once per turn)

>>3.Amulets extra scoring tile
The special Blue Amulet(x2) will be put on worship area(the rightmost reward space that near by 16). When you get the rewards in the reward spaces of your chosen spot. you can choice the special Blue Amulet for game end scoring.
when you get a special Blue Amulet, your Red Amulet gain extra 2 prestige points each.

>>4.50/100 prestige points Tile
Player can calculate the quantity of 50/100 prestige points.

name: Café Express
description:
In a wild west were adventurers, outlaws and citizens are addicted and powered by coffee, a devastating plague threatens to end once and for all the storages of the precious black gold. Now, the last 3 beans are traveling in a reinforced train in order to be planted in a safe soil, but not without dragging the attention of everybody across the railroad.

In this 2 / 4 players game, you must fight as an Authority or an Outlaw to keep or steal the last 3 fertile coffee beans in the State.

Each character has its own set of actions printed in transparent cards, which are inserted in a bigger card with the opponent's actions as well, creating the base game cards. Then, each player must chose a card and play it at the same time. The person with the initiative executes his or her action first, then the other does this as well. After that, cards are swapped. It means the Authority's card goes to the Outlaw and vice-versa.

The Outlaw must then use these actions to move alongside the train to steal the beans before it arrives its destination, and, off course, without losing all his or her health points. Meanwhile, the Authority must keep at least one bean until the final station. The time track advances everytime the cards are swapped out.

Fight to save, or maybe even steal, the last hope of this coffee-driven civilization in this quick and strategic game by Potato Cat.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Exodus: Proxima Centauri – Ymnighet Mini-Expansion
description:
This is a planet hex promo tile for Exodus: Proxima Centauri, Edge of Extinction, and Event Horizon. It is available at conventions and via the BGG Store.

PROMO RULES:

Ymnighet is a Dual Resource planet. During setup, two separate dice are placed on the planet. During production, both resources are gained and tracked separately.

If playing without the Event Horizon expansion, you may use Ymnighet in place of a standard CP Planet hex.
categories: Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Willkommen, Bierfest!
description:
Today is a festival that drinks beer a lot and deliciously. However, do not drink without thinking. Timing is important for delicious drinking. It is important to taste after raising your desire to drink as much as possible.
Also, occasionally everyone forced participation "Prosit!" will interfere with your plan.
How much can you deliciously enjoy beer?

Willkommen, Bierfest! is a card game of a set collection that collects cards of the same type, and a chicken game in which all hands are lost when "Prosit card" gather.
What you can do is simply to collect cards or convert cards to scoring in two choices. But, so, should you better collect as many cards as you can and aim for a high score? Or should it be better to change to scores earlier? Which is good judgment of the, you should become troubled.
Also, this game is an interesting place where you can control the cards that the next player draws since it draws cards from the deck after returning cards that do not need to the deck.

name: Unlabeled: The Blind Beer Tasting Game
description:
The game is simple! Each player brings one or two beers to the game, keeping their identities hidden. Unlabeled is played one round at a time. Each round, a small portion of “unlabeled” beer is served. Players taste the beer and ATTEMPT TO IDENTIFY THE BEER’S CHARACTERISTICS, GENERAL BEER CATEGORY, OR SPECIFIC BEER TYPE. The label is revealed and points are awarded. Next round!

Points are awarded based on your accuracy to identify the “unlabeled” beer… Earn 1 point for identifying a simple beer characteristic (ALE OR LAGER?). Earn 2 points for identifying the beer’s general category (PORTER OR STOUT?). Earn 3 points for identifying the specific beer type (OATMEAL STOUT OR IRISH STOUT?). Earn maximum points for identifying the EXACT NAME AND BREWERY. Careful! Push your luck too far and you could score zero!

name: Crop Rotation: Bug Plague
description:
Crop rotation is the practice of growing a series of dissimilar or different types of crops in the same area in sequenced seasons. In this game, you'll cultivate corn, beans and soybeans, and to win, you'll need to harvest more than your opponents.

To do that, you must complete the patterns in the objective cards, all while outsmarting your opponents so they do not harvest before you. Each turn extra events can help you, allowing you to plant more, exchange crops, or even destroy parts of the farmland.

Crop Rotation: Bug Plague contains the base game and the Bug Plague expansion. The expansion adds an action rondel as alternative to the die to define the turn's extra event. Each player must evaluate if it is Worth pushing their luck with the die or discard objectives to use the rondel and ensure the desired event. This lowers the base game's randomness and increases the game's strategic possibilities.

But the defining characteristic of the expansion is the appearance of a locust swarm that endangers the whole farm. Using it, the game changes from competitive to solo/cooperative, and the players must work together to complete the objectives before the bugs devour everything.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Cyclix
description:
Cyclix is one of the "Atlantis Triplets" that employ different implementations of the "atlantis effect", the gradual disappearance of the playing area, eventually leaving one king or the other without refuge.

The other two are Shakti and Caïssa.

A captured piece is removed from the board and returned to the owner, who is then said to have the piece "in hand." A piece in hand may conditionally be re-entered. This is done by moving the king and placing the piece on the tile thus vacated.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Modular Board

name: #no secrets
description:
In #no secrets, players must answer one of two questions with "yes" or "no". Which question you have to answer, depends on the hidden team card you got. Players must then analyze the answers to find one of their team members. You score points if you guess right. Whoever has the most points after three rounds wins.

—description from the publisher

•••

Bei #no secrets beantworten Spieler eine von zwei Fragen mit "Ja" oder "Nein". Welche Frage sie beantworten, geben Teamkarten vor, die zunächst geheim sind. Spieler wollen anhand der Antworten ihre Teammitglieder finden.

—description from the publisher (German)

name: Cul de Chouette
description:
Cul de Chouette is a dice game originated from the French comedy series Kaamelott.

The winner is the first player to reach 343 points (343 = CDC, the initials of the game).

The rule are deliberately complicated, with different rules to add to make it more or less difficult.

The player throws two dice, then the last die, and sees his result. Other player may interact, be the first to shout a peculiar sentence in order to win points or not to lose them, bet another player points to do a specific result...

Any mistake makes you lose 10 points.

—user summary

name: Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde
description:
The theme of this game is based on the famous book by Robert Louis Stevenson, where he tells the story of the good Dr. Jekyll, who drank a mysterious potion that turned him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

Each player has 8 characters Jekyll / Hyde. All figures show on the front Dr. Jekyll, but on the back are 4 really Dr. Jekyll and 4 are instead Mr. Hyde.

These true identities remain unknown to the enemy until the characters are captured.

There are 3 different goals:
conquer the 4 Dr. Jekyll figures of the opponent
lose your own 4 Mr. Hyde figures
escape with your own Dr. Jekyll figure through an exit in a corner of the opposite side of the board

How does the game start?
Each player takes 8 pieces of one color and then places them on the board as shown in Figure 1, with the names directed to the player and the unnamed part (or Dr. Jekyll) to the opponent. Place the pieces carefully so that the enemy does not see the true identity of the pieces.

Now you play alternately by moving one character forwards, backwards or sideways - never diagonally. If you move through a field occupied by the opponent, this figure is hit.

To win, one of the following conditions must be met:
conquer all 4 opposing Dr. Jekyll figures
lose all 4 of your own Mr. Hyde characters
leave with your own Dr. Jekyll figure in a corner on the opposite side of the field
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Champions of Hara: Bloodstone Promo
description:
This is a promo card for Champions of Hara.

The card is a new item card that you add to the item deck. Specially, "Bloodstone" counts as a new dreamstone (a level 0 item card). It a discard type item, with the following effect: "Pay up to 5 Health; look at that many cards from the top of any World deck. Choose one and spawn it on your space. Shuffle the other cards back into that deck. Only usable while on an empty space. Bloodstone is considered a dreamstone."

This card has item number IP01.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Equilibrix Connect
description:
"The game is based on the theme of universal geometric pattern which is known as The Flower of Life. The pattern is comprised of two different shapes in a ration of 3:5. At the start of the game each player gets 9 triangular an 15 biangular stones and three bases in the same colour. Dice show various positions and each player has to respect them when it is their turn to play."

The objective of the game is connecting opposing sides of a curved hexagon (3 sides in 2 players, 2 sides in 3 players). At each turn two dice are rolled that indicate the possible pieces to play stating from pieces already on the board. Special configuration of pieces lead to the elimination of opponents pieces from the board.

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building

name: Breakout: First Panzer Army
description:
Breakout: 1st Panzer Army allows one or two players to examine the operational possibilities inherent in the battle between the Soviets and Germans that occurred in the northwest Ukraine during March and April 1944.

Each full turn represents three days. Each hex on the map represents 4.2 miles (6.8 km) from side to opposite side.

Designer: Ty Bomba. Developer: Antony Birkett.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Dancing Fish
description:
Find all the fish which are hidden below the water lilies.
Take all the 9 water lily tokens. Turn water lily tokens face down (fish can't be visible): shuffle them and place them randomly on the rotating area of the board. Each player choose a colour, take the corresponding fish token and place it on the scorekeeper on the 0 slot. At his turn, each player rolls the dices: he should choose between the 2 colours of the dices and rotate the swamp till the firefly stops in front of the insect of that colour. Then, the player turns 2 water lily tokens in order to find the correct fish indicated by the dices.
Did you find the correct fish? Place tokens back face down and move your marker for 3 slots on the scorekeeper.
Did you find only one correct fish? Place tokens back face down and move your marker for 1 slot on the scorekeeper.
Did you find both wrong fish? Place tokens back face down in the swamp and your turn ends.
Did you find a black fish, but the dices didn't show that colour? You can't move on your scorekeeper.
Attention: If you get the green colour after rolling the dice, ask another player which fish you should search for.
Game ends when a player reaches 9 points slot on his scorekeeper.

—user summary

name: Safari Turbo
description:
You have been chosen to participate in a car race on a hidden, magical island. The island has transformed you into a specific character with unique powers and abilities. You must use them to help you win the race.

The object of the game is to be the first player across the finish line.

There are three levels of play:
Beginner - Playing as yourself (without a character)
Intermediate (Basic Game) - Playing with a character
Advanced - Playing with a team of characters

In a Basic Game, each player begins with a Guardian Card, a Dashboard a Turbo Card and a Character. The Guardian Card is a log of the training that you have received from the guardians of the island. The Dashboard contains a Health Meter which indicates the health of your character, a Damage Meter which indicates the condition of your vehicle and a Binoculars Meter which helps you look into the distance. The Turbo Card allows the player to take a Turbo Roll when rolling a 6. During the Turbo Roll the player is completely defenseless.

During a player's turn, they can play any of their character powers and abilities. A player then rolls the High Speed Die to move their vehicle down the road (during certain times they must roll the Low Speed Die). They collect Game Cards and Coins along the way. They must traverse difficult terrain and battle hostile animals and other players.

Each character has at least three unique powers and/or abilities. A "power" requires a player to spend tokens and are limited. An "ability" is constant throughout the entire game.

There are different areas of the board that present unique challenges, such as the quicksand, Gator Lake, Wildebeest Canyon, Rickety Bridge, Andy Straightaway-Ice Road, and finding their way out of Tarancon Volcano.

There are friendly animals which help you such as Jora-The Lion which provides you with strength which is used in battling, the cheetah which provides you with speed, the meercats which energize your binoculars and others which provide you with coins to buy items at the Trading Post.
There are four hidden paths. The player who possesses the compass is able to find and go through these paths. Other players may steal the compass.

During certain conditions, Game Cards can be flipped. If so, the player cannot use them. To un-flip them, the player must roll a 4 and choose not to move their vehicle.

The game ends when the first player crosses the finish line. The next closest player is declared 2nd Place and so on.

There is also tournament format. A tournament is when 2 to 5 players have agreed to participate in 10 races. During tournament play, points are awarded for pole position and guardian training. The winner of the tournament is the player with the most points.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Mindblock
description:
Mindblock plays similar to Rummikub in that players have a hand of items and want to play them into a common space in sets and runs, with those sets and runs being breakable should you be able to rearrange things in order to play more from your hand.

What's different about Mindblock is that players can stack smaller blocks together in order to use them as a larger number, giving you more play opportunities to get pieces out of your hand.

name: メトロックス (MetroX): Ishikawa Promo Map
description:
In MetroX, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with ◯s in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices.
