Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

メトロックス (MetroX): Ishikawa Promo Map was released for the 2018 Kanazawa Board Game Market. It consists in one simple map to use with MetroX's standard rules.

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Barty Crouch Jr. & Death Eaters Expansion
description:
Pack of high quality resin miniatures, ready to paint and assemble. Includes character cards and upgrade cards for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game.

The Barty Crouch Jr. & Death Eaters box contains the following:


4 High Quality Resin Miniatures ready to paint and assemble
Barty Crouch Jr.
3 new Death Eaters

4 30mm Plastic Bases
4 Character Cards
2 Spell Cards
5 Artefact Cards
1 Potion Card



1 Wizarding Wars rulebook (tournament rules)
15 Duelling Cards


From the publisher: The Wizarding Wars are an exciting new way to play the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game. These official events allow players to compete against each other in a fast, fun and furious day of gaming, proving themselves the ultimate champion of the Wizarding World...
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Aether Revolt
description: Kaladesh is a Magic: The Gathering expansion block consisting of the sets Kaladesh and Aether Revolt. The block debuted with the release of Kaladesh on 30 September 2016. The block is set on the plane of Kaladesh, the original home of planeswalker Chandra Nalaar, and features an emphasis on artifacts, their creators and the magical "aether" which powers them.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Mystery Detective Vol. 2: Funny Death and Real Life Cases
description:
Mystery Detective is a mystery solving party game that you can start playing almost as soon as you open the box.

One player, the Chief, takes one of the 100 illustrated cards and reads it to himself. The front of the card has the mystery, the back the solution. Then he reads the front of the card to the players and shows them the illustration. The other players are the detectives. Singly and together, they try to solve the mystery by asking the Chief questions. But he can only answer Yes, No, Close, or Not Relevant.

Here is a mystery:
Title: Nasty Finish
Excessive hurry led a man to a stinky situation.
The picture on the card shows a man about to step into it.

What’s going on?

The detectives discuss and try to form theories that can be proved or disproved by their questions:
Is the man afraid? - no
Did the man die? - yes
Was he murdered?- no

So it must have been an accident…

Now we're getting somewhere…

Bit by bit the detectives try to piece together the mystery. Often a question from one detective will give another an idea for a whole new line of questioning. There is no winner or loser but when you finally solve the mystery, you feel brilliant!

The mysteries, while not all crimes, are morbid and twisted and often very funny. You need to discuss, question and think outside of the box in order to solve them. Great fun, you can play almost anywhere, anytime. In the car, at the dinner table or at a gathering, all are perfect for this co-cop mystery solving game.

This volume contains 100 cases.
For Black Stories fans, this second volume includes never before published in English, translations of Black Stories Funny Death and Black Stories Shit Happens.

- description by the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Valhalla: Dawcy Krwi
description:
A promo which was given to people donating their blood ("Dawcy Krwi" is Polish term for "Blood Donors") at Pyrkon 2019 within a bigger set "Talia Kart Krewni Pyrkonu" made up of similarly themed promos for various games by various publishers.

Some copies were also provided to various bloggers in the board gaming scope who themselves distributed them further by their own means and ways.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Hamsterdam
description:
Hamsterdam is a tower defense game for the whole family. The water is rising and the only things standing between the sea and your town are a dam and a handful of brave hamsters. Place your hamsters on your dam and roll dice to see where the floods will strike. If you have a hamster there to protect your dam, they become part of your reinforcements. If the flood strikes an unprotected part of your dam, the flood waters seep through. Keep your town the driest and you win.

This new edition of Hamsterdam has updated artwork as well as a number of rules changes from the 2011 version. The main differences in the rules are:

You now pass two of your dam cards to your neighbors and get two in return which could cause you to end up with up to three of a single number.
The number of hamsters you get to defend your dam are based on which dam cards you keep and are passed.
You may arrange your dam in any order.
As you take on water, your dam now starts to collapse from the outside in.
There are now 18 special hamsters to choose from instead of the original 6.


—description from the designer

name: King of Tokyo: Teamwork Promo Card
description:
Promo card from IELLO distributed to partners to commemorate their relationship with IELLO.

TEAMWORK

Cost: 4 Energy

Type: Keep

When another Monster finishes his last Roll, you may offer him an extra Roll. If he accepts, he must pay you 1 Victory Point.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Carta Magica
description:
The unknown world is in chaos! Only the magical talismans can save these failing civilizations from total ruin. You must sail dangerous seas, trade skillfully, fight battles, and tame monsters to get them. But beware: the unpredictable winds may interfere in your mission!

The goal of the game:
Sail around the unknown world, trading goods and taming monsters to get gold. Use the gold to buy the magical talismans and be first to return to your harbour!

You are using a spinner to see what action you can take on your turn, cards can help with those actions (escape storms, move out of undesirable locations, etc..)

name: MAiAK
description:
MAiAK is a brisk, strategic turn-based game for 2 players with a variable game board in an elegant design wooden box.

Each player has five game stones (black vs. white) at the beginning of the game.

The goal of the game is to get one game piece to the opposite side of the game board before the opponent does. Sounds simple, but try it for yourself.

MAiAK uniquely combines the gaming principles of checkers, chess and pentago to create a whole new level of strategic thinking.

MAiAK is simply for everyone.

It attracts both older players who have already played some games and younger players, even younger than 5 years. Older players will enjoy the charm of discovering different strategies, and the youngest players will use a rather elegant educational design to practice fine finger work and to recognize different shapes and colors.

PACKAGE CONTAINS:

Wooden game board, consisting of 25 colored play fields, 10 game stones and instructions in Czech, English and German language, all in an elegant wooden case.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Physical Removal, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Superfight: The Nerdy Dirty Deck
description:
For years we've been throwing out cards that were "too dirty" for the nerdy deck, or "too nerdy" for the dirty deck. But now those days are over! From the Prefect [CENSORED] room at Howgwarts, to Podrick Payne's Magic [Censored], this deck is a dirty twist on all of your favorite nerdy characters and tropes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Sort It Out!: Mini Game
description:
Sort it Out! is a fast-paced game where knowing just a little about something can help you win everything! It is a party game based on ordering items in lists (e.g. which animal is faster). A card of colour-coded list items is drawn, and the players slot like coloured tiles into position in a plastic holder. The reverse of the list card shows the correct order.
Players score there answers and keep drawing new cards until someone scores 20 or more points.

name: Martial Art
description:
Martial Art is a subtle game of confrontation and brutally effective hand-to-hand combat, transforming each player to a master of their chosen fighting art, from capoeira and kung fu to bare-knuckle boxing.

In Martial Art, the Guardian of the Temple of Equilibrium is searching for a successor. From all over the world, the best fighters are invited to prove their worth and do battle to become the next legendary Guardian. Authorities in their chosen martial art, each contender brings a set of special skills to the arena. The fights themselves won’t be easy: the masters will not only have to battle each other in duels, but also with 3 or 4 person free-for-alls where they have to keep going until there is only one fighter left standing. Not only that, players will also have to compete in 2vs2 matches where they not only have to adapt to their opponent, but also their temporary partner. Each fighter is unique both in his techniques and in his reserves of energy and life.

In turn, players will choose one of the five areas on their personal Fighter Board and use the tokens on it. They will be able to hit their opponents with Action Tokens, but they will also have to use their Effect Tokens to control their positions on the Fighting Area, generate energy to trigger powerful special skills and prepare their defense for the next turns.

In Martial Art, your goal is to knock out your opponents. You have two ways to win the battle in the Fighting Area:
- Cause enough damage to your opponent's whole body, leading to a technical KO.
- Cause enough damage to a single body part to KO your opponent directly.

The last fighter standing wins!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Mancala, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Sweet and Spicy Truth
description:
In the adult party game, The Sweet and Spicy Truth, each player takes a turn being asked a Sweet, Medium, or Spicy question.

Sweet questions are innocent, general questions such as “Would you eat your favorite meal every day for the rest of your life?” Medium questions are more deeply philosophical, such as “Are people mostly good or mostly bad?”
While Spicy questions are much more intimate, such as “Are you OK with having sex on the first date?”

Once the reader chooses their answer, the rest of the players decide if the reader answered “Yes” or “No.” The reader then reveals their answer. Those that answered correctly will gain one point. Those that answered incorrectly will lose one point. The first player to get seven points wins the game!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Games by Bicycle, The United States Playing Card Company

name: Magic: The Gathering – Spellslinger Starter Kit
description: Two starter decks: One White and One Red.
mechanics: Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: Fingabol
description:
In turn, the players shoot to score in the opposing goal. Calculate your trajectories, bounds off the frame in an exhilarating one-on-one where every rebound counts.

Game starts form the middle of the central circle

Turn by turn, players shoot the puck once to score in the opposite side

A point is scored when the puck touches the goal area

When the puck goes out of field, the opponent puts it back in play on his penalty area line

The first player to score 5 points wins the game.

name: Футуриум
description:
Conversation party in a futuristic setting. The Futurium board game was released by Muravey Games in 2017.

Game participants are invited to become creators of the future, science fiction writers, and cyber prophets.

Imagine the world in 20-30 years, when it will change beyond recognition. Futurium is a conversation game that allows you to immerse yourself in this world! By playing, players can create a future that even great science fiction writers never dreamed of!

Each time they open the box, players become creators of a future reality. The game offers many versions of the future and a huge number of unexpected developments. For example, humanity in your game can move to live underwater or, conversely, fly away to colonize Mars in its entirety, or simply surrender all control in the world to intelligent robots, while ceasing to work at all. Each game takes place in a different future - each time in a new way!

The game is suitable for both novice players and experienced ones. Whether it's fun, serious, or completely insane - you choose what your future will be like!

It's easy to play:
1. Open cards with names of objects
2. Invent and tell what one of the objects will become in the future
3. Those interested can tell alternative versions
4. Vote for the most interesting version
This continues for several "circles".
At the end of the game, the one who gets the most votes will be the winner.

name: Little Family
description:
A GAME OF PAIRS
OBJECT: the animals are looking for their friends – can you help find them?
The “animal” cards are shuffled, and each player is dealt 4 cards. They place these cards in front of them so that everyone else can see them. The rest of the cards make up the draw deck. When it is their turn, each player draws a card and puts it in front of them. Then they look at all the cards on the table (their cards first, then the other players’ cards) and try to make a pair: either by using their own cards, or one of their own cards and one from another player. The game ends when all the pairs have been found, and the player who found the most wins.

+++ A game of pairs specially designed for little ones!

—description from the publisher

name: Beets Bombs and the Blüffs
description:
The life of a Blüff is simply really...

Plant beets, plant bombs to protect those beets, and try not to explode!

Blüffs take turns by strategically planting beets and bombs, and bragging or bluffing about how many beets they think they can find without blowing themselves up.

But be careful...there are all sorts of exciting action cards to keep Braggy Blüffs on their toes as they brag, plant, and bluff their way to a belly full of tasty beets.

—description from the publisher

name: Crimibox: Dossier Inkt
description:
Just after securing a monster deal for his new book, Menno Morris is found dead behind his desk. The evidence appears to indicate suicide. But where is Menno's cell phone? And where is his mysterious manuscript that all this research seems to revolve around?

In this case, fiction and terrifying reality merge seamlessly. Where does the story end and where does the truth begin? Will Menno's murderer get away with his atrocity or will you rewrite the end of this case?

Some features:
- Unravel passwords
- Study lifelike websites
- Search social media
- Question your suspects
- Call to mysterious numbers

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: The Final Light-Year: The Beta Sector
description:
March 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, minion and commander ships and new ship part upgrades.


Released in the March 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: El Futbolero
description:
El Futbolero is a board game about soccer. Exclusively for those who know football, it brings a thousand questions with options to answer and test what you know. Local, international, UEFA, AFA, Libertadores, FIFA, World clubs and sports anecdotes: everything is covered in this game for fans.

It is also a strategy game because with each correct answer a goal is scored on the board. The objective is to form two goal lines on the board, lining up 4 balls.

It can be played individually or in teams.

name: Wine Merchant (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
description:
With the ever increasing growth in the lands around Carcassonne comes the ever increasing need for religion and refreshment. Monks requiring sacramental wine and nobility wanting all the wine they can get proves a lucrative market for the crafty wine merchants.

If a segment of a completed road contains a wine cellar, the thief earns additional points for each cloister and/or pennant(s) in a city connected to the road. The amount of additional points earned is based on the length of the road, which determines the wine’s vintage.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Gare aux Relous
description:
Gare aux Relous is the new game from the Freaky 42! A fun game based on auctions and bluff where the goal is to get rid of the jerks that ruin the party for everybody... Will you be able to shake them off, or will you be forced to suffer them ?

In order to reduce our carbon footprint and shorten our distribution circuit, the game will only be available in French.

—description from the publisher

name: Ding Dong Donut
description:
Oh no! The donuts lost their other half. Can you try and put them back together?

Each player flips a card when it is their turn. While this is going on, everybody simultaneously tries to find matching donut halves. Did you find any? Quick! Ring the bell. If you were correct, you may take the two matching cards and the game continues.

The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins. If you have a draw, the player with the most double donuts wins (sets of two cards, that complete not only one, but two full donuts).

name: Last Aurora: Player vs. Player
description:
The enemies of your enemies... are still your enemies!

This module allows players to fight each other during the game!

name: Star Scrappers: Orbital Envoys Expansion
description:
The Envoys expansion is a exclusive gift for all supporter of the crowdfunding campaigns. Cards in this include:

Overlord Pash'tet - Immediately damage 1 module.
Custodian Anika - Immediately take any 1 card from the discard pile into hand.
Representative Ur - Immediately gain 4 crew.
Chief Engineer Batrii - Your repair actions cost 1 MC less.
Colonel T. Jones - You are always immune to money losses caused by other players' cards.
Domina Loeb - Immediately gain 1 MC per each module in a color of your choice on your orbital.
Commandor Daar - Protects against "Covert Ops" and "Sabotage" card effects.
Ancient Ursur - Building science modules cost 1 MC less.
Guildmaster Vorin - You can purchase cards from the market for 1 MC less (minimum 1 MC).
Harmonix Kira - Immediately gain 2 VP.

name: Dungeon Party: Happy Troll
description:
Dungeon Party is an easy-to-learn, raucous, play-anywhere, social role-playing game, where the rooms, monsters, and treasures are all on bar coasters. Players take turns bouncing a coin to "hit" the monsters, disarm traps, or avoid cursed rooms. Players work together to survive the dungeon and gather the most loot, but there can only be one winner!

On their turn, a player reveals a room and monster, battles the monster, and recovers treasure. The game ends if all players’ characters are defeated in an encounter and the adventure failed, or if the last Boss monster has been defeated and the adventure has succeeded and you win.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Flicking, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Set-up

name: Jungleball
description:
Jungleball is a small box dexterity game where you can draft a team of all-stars discovering powerful synergies between the large roster of unique players! You can assemble your players around an arena that changes with every game, toss dodgeballs at your opponents, move around the field, activate abilities, AND land critical hits until only one team remains!

Do you have what it takes to be a Jungleball champion?

Jungleball is a dexterity game that plays in about 15 minutes. The game is played through a sequence of turns where players will throw small wooden disks at their opponent's characters hoping to land on them and get them out. Every character has a number indicating the amount of dodgeballs that can land on them before they must go out. Activating a character allows the player to move that character anywhere on the board, use that character's unique ability, and then throw dodgeballs (wooden disks) from wherever they move that character to. Play ends if all the characters on one team go out, the player with characters remaining is the victor!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Open Drafting, Relative Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Olympe
description:
In this game, the trump is defined by the color of the god played by the player who engages the trick.

Let’s imagine our player, playing as Artemis (whose color is purple), played a purple card. They are playing their own color, so they are playing the trump suit.
Other players have to provide purple and have to rise (to play a higher value card). If they cannot rise, they have to play a lower value card, and if they don’t have any purple card either, they must discard any card from their hand.
Now let’s imagine our first player, still Artemis, playing yellow. Other players have to provide the lead suit (yellow), but they don’t have to rise, since it's no longer the trump suit.

Another exemple: a first player doesn’t have a yellow card, they must ruff with a purple card and therefore start the next trick.
New situation: a second player doesn’t have a yellow card, either they have a trump suit card and must over-ruff (play a higher value card from the trump suit), or under-ruff if they have only lower value ones (play a lower value card from the trump suit). If they don’t have any card from the trump suit, they must discard any card from their hand.


The player with the higher value card wins the trick.

There are special cards in each suit: the Monsters which can cancel a trick under certain conditions and the Heroes who disables the Monsters.

Scoring:
At the end of the round, the players count the points they scored during it.
The player with the most point gets 3 gems, the second only one, and the others take none.
The first one with 12 gems wins the game, and become the new god of gods.

–description from the rulebook

name: Night Express
description:
Starting on a blank European railway network you and your fellow players are aiming for the best routes, getting the best available trains, improving routes and trains, increasing the number of passengers and overcome a phase of events. You can get help from specialists in several phases of the game. Secret route targets and special bonuses can make you the winner. But you also have to keep an eye on your fellow players as they can compete with you on your routes and therefore reduce your scorer points. They even can place negative events on you. But you can do so as well!

The game is played in 4 rounds. You always start by choosing a route board from a given selection of available routes. You will prefer to get routes with many passengers, short travel time, good connection to your existing routes and whether they support your secret route targets chosen at the beginning of the game. You now need to establish a service point for each route in order to operate it. You can save money using one of your existing service points or using one of your competitors.

After 4 round’s validations you can get additional scorer points by fulfilling your route targets, having the biggest train fleet, the best single route or most money. Then you will know who this time is the winner of Night Expresss.

name: Emotional Intelligence
description:
Each person has different elements of their personality, from introversion and extroversion; to different types of temperament, from composed to volatile. In Emotional Intelligence, each player becomes a personality detective, and aims to deduce the personality traits of the other players before their own personality is revealed. The catch: players can only provide subjective This or That clues regarding their personality type. The result is a fast-paced, sometimes contentious social deduction game perfect for players looking for both mystery and social examination.

HOW IT WORKS:

You’re given a unique personality at the beginning of the game - you will play from the perspective of this personality for duration of the game. Every turn, you will take turns asking other players to answer This or That questions based on one element of your given personality. The clues, which are subjective This or That answers, may only be as helpful as how well you know the person. Is seeing the future Volatile or (K)omposed? Up to you!

You will be given a Deduction Pad, where you will jot down your notes and make your decisions on whether another player is more Extroverted or Introverted, Logical or EMpathetic, Concrete or Abstract, or Volatile or (K)omposed. Once you’re sure about all 4 elements of another player’s personality, you can instigate guessing their personality. Everyone else will guess as well, but you will get double the points for each correct guess. Additionally, you get points when other people correctly guess your personality, so it's a win-win!

The game ends when everyone's personality has been investigated. The winner is the player with the most points.

—description from designer

name: Escape Route!
description:
Chase gem thieves through an unknown city in this race to see who can find the escape route the quickest. Make your map, roll to see where the thief started, then see who can figure out their destination the fastest by following the streets, turning at all intersections and warping between matching points. First to capture 2 thieves wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Cthulhu Wars: The Dunwich Horror
description: This is the first Clan expansion for the Whateley family. In this expansion units can cross between unit types. You can recruit a unit from the Whateleys even it is already on the map, controlled by another player.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Beethupferl
description:
Beethupferl is an exciting nature experience for young vegetables.
The vegetable patch has dried out. The players grab their watering cans to lure the plants out of the ground. The fascinating mechanism is based on the fact that the pearl-shaped water drops sink into hollows in the game board and thus turn over the tiles on it. This causes different types of vegetables to appear. If a type is seen three times, it is harvested. But voracious snails also hide in the ground. If you can remember what is hiding under which tile, you can avoid snails and prove your green thumb.

—description from the publisher

name: One Page Expedition
description:
One Page Expedition is a print at home roll and write game for one to four players where you take a role of an explorer in untouched lands. Your job is to delve into new continents and explore them to the best of your abilities. During each of your turns you will visit parts of geographical regions all over the map. Each region you research will give you points depending on the progress of your exploration.

Players use only one common game sheet to play. Game has very simple but appealing mechanic. Just roll two dice, pick two sectors and make your camps.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Quests Over Coffee: Quest
description:
On your way home from completing a perilous 3-Star Quest, a stranger approaches you with the opportunity to participate in a 4-Star Quest. Having never attempted one before, there is much meticulous planning and harrowing danger to overcome. But the treasure. Oh, the treasure. Its very promise stokes the fire in your questing hearts!

—Description from Publisher

Quests over Coffee: Quest is a Quests Over Coffee side game that has you rolling 16d6 (14d6 is you're playing hard mode). The game has you rearranging those dice in certain orders so you can beat the quest's success criteria's, if you get all of them, you win! You also have abilities which can help you out in many ways, but can also be your poison if used wrong.

name: Escape Quest: Mystère sur Mars
description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ... Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

In this issue:

The near future, the planet Mars is now an Earth colony, some mysteries of which, however, remain unfounded. You are a renowned geologist, specialist in dating events of organic origin. That is why you are particularly intrigued that we are sending you there to study new samples taken from the Martian subsoil, not to mention the absolute secrecy surrounding the operation.

In the ship that takes you to your destination, you receive a message from your friend Maria, your contact on the spot. Perhaps you will learn more about this strange mission of which you seem to be one of the main protagonists…

—description from the publisher's website (translated)
categories: Adventure, Book, Deduction, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Egmont Polska, Hobby World, Ynnis Éditions

name: ドラフトポーカー (Draft Poker)
description:
In Draft Poker, players draft cards and score points. Each card in the game has a letter and shows scoring conditions.

Players each contribute a card from their initial hand to a tableau of scoring conditions which is at first hidden. The scoring cards are shuffled, and then one is revealed. Players then keep 3 cards from their hand and pass 4 to a neighbor. Next, a second scoring card is revealed, and players pass 3 cards. Then, a third scoring card is revealed, and players pass 2 cards. Lastly, a fourth scoring card is revealed, and players pass 1 card.

Then, players score the 7 cards in their hand based upon the scoring tableau.

name: Monopoly: Fortnite Collector's Edition
description:
The goal of the game is to survive by building walls, attack your enemies, and avoid the storm.
Health Points are the currency of the game, and it usually gets paid to/from the bank.
Players roll one action dice and one normal dice. Properties are collected as safe areas for yourself, and you only collect HP if you own a full set.
Passing go provides 2 HP and reveals a storm card that usually increases the damage dealt when landing on that space.
There are 10 metal figures of popular characters from the video game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Kill Steal, Line of Sight, Map Reduction, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Gingerbread Towers
description:
Gingerbread Towers is a quick card-stacking game for 2-4 players.

The aim of the game is to contribute the most to the gingerbread tower. Each card features one, two, or three sweets. There are six different types of sweet in the game, and each player will be scoring on three of those types. Every turn you place a card on the tower, scoring for any types of sweet on your score cards. But cards on the same layer mustn’t touch, and any cards you knock off are deducted from your score.

As well as doing your best not to knock over the tower, you are also trying to pick up the highest-scoring cards and prevent your opponents from getting cards which benefit them.

Each game contains 54 cards including rules etc and comes in a printed tuck box.

-description from publisher

name: Score 5
description:
The title Score 5 indicates what you do at game's end: Score five cards, specifically the highest card of each color in your hand.

To start, each player has the same five cards — 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 — in one of the five colors. Each round, reveal one card from the deck; cards come in one of the five colors or gray (a joker that can be any color), as well as a value higher than 25.

Each player chooses one or more cards from hand to bid on this revealed card. Whoever bids the most wins this card and adds it to their hand, and the cards with which they placed the bid are redistributed among the other players, with players choosing one card from this bid to add to their hand in order from second-highest bid to lowest. (Numbers on the initial cards serve as tie-breakers, when needed.)

After a certain number of rounds, players sum the highest card of each color in their hand, and whoever has the highest total wins.

name: つめつめモンスターハウス (Tsume Tsume Monster House)
description:
Tsume Tsume Monster House is a game in which the players will cut out monsters from a piece of paper in their player color, aiming to successfully fit them on a central board.

Each player is given a colored piece of paper, that shows the values of 9 monsters on the back. They draw the shapes of their monsters on the back and then cut them out.

Then, players take turns placing their monsters on a central board according to the placement rules, possibly having to remove monsters already present.

The game ends after all players have placed their monsters and the winner is generally the player who had to remove the fewest monsters.

name: Jinxx
description: Jinxx is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players featuring striking stacking pyramid-shaped pieces in three sizes and four colors--black, white, gray, and clear. In Jinxx, players jockey for position on a 3x3 grid. Pyramid size and a die roll determine your possible moves on each turn. Use your move to capture an opponent's piece or better position one of your own pieces. If you own the topmost pyramids in any three-space line through the center, you win! But be careful — you can also be eliminated if you lose too many of your pieces!

name: Villageo
description:
Become a renowned city planner by creating the most beautiful cities possible in Villageo! You must watch out for planning restrictions by placing businesses, houses, lakes and gardens in the right places to respect the proposed plans and build your ideal city. Rules are easy: The colors of the tiles have to match with the map, and two tiles of the same color can't be connected even by the angles. Will you manage to complete the sixty Villageo projects?

—description from the publisher

name: DICTADORES
description:
DICTADORES is a card game for parties in which you must avoid being punished while getting drunk.
The dictator sets the laws of the game, if someone does not comply, he will be punished.
There are cards that force you to drink and others in which you must play to avoid it.
Each player will have his turn as a dictator, with all the privileges that means.
But beware of coups d'etat.
Do you dare to play it?

The game is played in three decks, the dictator will play with the punishment deck and the law deck, while the rest with the town deck.

A player starts assuming the role of DICTATOR and takes two punishments that he keeps in secret and a law that he puts on his back.

When the first player takes a card from the village deck he must comply with the instructions and this letter, and if it is his turn to drink, he must also comply with the laws.

If the player does not comply with a law, the dictator gives him a punishment.

When the dictator runs out of punishments, it is the turn of another.

In the town deck there are 4 coups. The first three allow the player to end the dictator's turn by removing his punishments. The fourth coup d'etat wins the game, and you can choose any punishment from the deck to give to the current dictator.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Mozaa
description:
Mozaa is a tile laying game, consisting of 64 square, unique colored tiles.
There are 3 different rule sets included.
The base game lets each player put down tiles and score points for completed color fields. These fields are completed when all open edges of a area are closed with an adjacent tile. To close an edge you need a tile with a single triangular area to that edge. Sand clock shapes are not considered connected.
The first rules variant lets each player choose a color and only score points for completed fields in that color.
The second variant lets you claim uncompleted areas by placing a marker (not included) before they are completed and scored.
In each variant you have a different number of tiles in your hand, enhancing the strategical aspect of the game(s).

name: Roszada wśród zwierząt
description:
Three animals: a cat, a mouse and an elephant roam the fields to get their favorite treats. As much as they want food, they fear each other so much. The mouse runs away from the cat, the cat runs away from the elephant, and the elephant runs away from the mouse. Demonstrate your best strategy to move your animals in this seemingly simple game. Gather the most food to win.

—description from the box (translated)

name: Pack O Game: Set 1
description:
Pack O Game is a series of easily portable card-based strategy micro games in a gum-sized tuck box with a variety of mechanics, complexity and theme. Each game is 30 cards size 1"X3" and a 1 sheet rules.

Pack O Game: Set 1 includes all 8 games from the 1st set of Pack O Game from Perplext. This set includes: HUE, TKO, GEM, FLY, TAJ, LIE, SHH, and BUS.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fighting, Negotiation, Party Game, Sports, Transportation, Word Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Voting

name: All American: The 82nd Airborne at Shanley's Hill – June 6-9, 1944
description: 'Squads & Leaders' module ALL AMERICAN: Shanley’s Hill depicts the fighting of the 82nd Airborne to secure the exits from Utah Beach during the Normandy Invasion. This new edition provides ten scenarios and a scenario-generating campaign system that ties the entire series of three ALL AMERICAN releases together. Includes one 28" x 15" and one 17" x 14" map sheet, and 77 optional counters (to be cut out from card).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Templar Queenie 3: The Catacombs
description:
Templar Queenie 3: The Catacombs, a mini-expansion for Templar: The Secret Treasures, consists of one module that can be used individually or in combination with any other modules for the game.


The Catacombs: This new room is placed adjacent to the game board. Players can pick up scrolls in the harbor, then deliver them to the catacombs to score 4 VP. In the advanced version of this module, a player must deliver one of signet rings in addition to the scroll; in addition to the 4 VP, he scores a bonus based upon how many of his rings are orthogonally adjacent to the ring just placed.

name: S.P.A.C.E.
description:
S.P.A.C.E. (Space, Planets, Asteroids, Conquer, Explore) is a game about the exporation of the Solar System.
It has some didactic contents (such as planetary features, rudiments about the probes etc.) but it's a "real" game in every aspect.
In each round, a player must choose one of these actions:
a: scientific research (i.e. draw 2 cards)
b: build a part of the probe by spending cards
c: start a mission toward a planet, once the probe is complete
d: play a mission card
e: play an ALERT card (normally against other players)
f: send an already built part of probe to supply the ISS station.

Each time a player explores a planet, they can choose the Discovery side of the planet card (full amount of Victory Points) or the Technology side (less points, but they'll gain a special power for the rest of the game. Each planet has a different one).

It's also possible to explore asteroids through mission cards.

The game ends when 3 planets have been totally explored (i.e. when 3 planet decks are finished) or when all the asteroids have been explored.

At the end of the game, the players will score points according to the explored planets, explored asteroids and contributions to the ISS station.

In the box there is also an atlas with infos about the Solar System.

name: Mower Mania
description:
Description from the designer:

In these days of recession, it's not that easy to scrape an honest living. But there's always a neighbour’s lawn waiting to be mowed.
Fortunately you have inherited your grandfather’s MowMaster 2000, in it’s day the height of grass removal technology. Unfortunately that day was about 100 years ago and mowing with it now is tricky, due to the machine’s somewhat limited functions.
Mind you don't smash it into those trees, because it'll cost you for repairs and watch out for that dog. Above all try to steer clear of the customers' flower beds and prize vegetables as they get very upset at the sight of beheaded daffodils or mashed marrow.

Mower Mania is a mix of puzzle/strategy (working out best routes through the gardens), resource management (your mower functions) and luck (dice for movement and randomness of garden tile layout).

When you land on a long grass tile, you turn it over to reveal it nicely mowed. Landing on vegetables or flowers, however, results in loss of points (money). Land on a pot, or go too fast into a tree or garden feature, and you'll also sustain damage to your mower.

The amount you earn will be based on how much of the lawn you've successfully mowed (a minimum amount required to progress to the next garden) and how much damage you've caused. You'll then need to pay for mower repairs and to replenish mower functions you used.
.

Mower Mania was an entry in the 2016 Mint Tin Design Contest and did exceptionally well:

1st place: Best Overall Design
1st place: Best Theme
2nd place: Best Artwork & Graphic Design
3rd place: Best Written Rules
Top pick: of Guest Judge, Caroline Berg
.

Thanks to all those at BoardgameGeek who played the game, and gave feedback and suggestions, during the contest, especially:
John Kean, lelo Arrowsmith. Scott Allen, GreenTea532, Laura Blachek, G. Uitz, Janine Viglietti, Marianne Waage, Benjamin Wack, Andrew Orel, Niklas Hook, Alex Johns, melbards and James Ronald Lo.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sky Scrapers
description:
Sky Scrapers is an abstract and strategy board game for 2 players.

Each turn, a player moves one of his own stacks a number of spaces equal to the height of the stack, stacking it onto of another stack. A stack is owned by the player whose piece is on top.

The game ends when a player cannot make a legal move. Then, each player counts how many skyscrapers (stacks of four or more pieces) he has. The player with the most skyscrapers wins the game.

name: Hilal Hattı
description:
Hilal Hattı (Crescent Line) is a strategy game loosely based on the Ottoman History. In an alternate timeline, the Ottoman Empire is in turmoil and the local lords (players) have to reconquer lost land and establish control over the empire. For this they have to expand, raise their cultural level and recruit new armies that can adapt to geography and their enemies.

Hilal Hattı is a unit and resource management strategy game that focuses on a smart but easy battle management system and tactics. Players will build and conquer while gaining “historic” textbook titles that will carry them to the victory.

—description from the designer

name: Infected: The Carrier
description:
Infected is a quick, strategic, secret role, semi-cooperative social game. One of the party is a Plague Doctor, spreading the Bubonic Plague. The Villagers need to find and rid themselves of the evil doctor before they succumb to the greatest plague in history.

The Carrier is an expansion which adds new characters, roles, abilities, and chain reactions. New cards, new dice, and new miniature included.

The Plague Doctor now brings his Ravens with him, and they too carry infections. If a Villager receives an infection, they must pass their Raven card on their next turn.

Many new roles include abilities to fight against the Plague Doctor and Ravens, including the new Huntress, Blacksmith, Apothecary, Priest, and other Villagers. However, a new powerful Plague Doctor exists, and a new Sinister Villager could even be in your midst. You'll never trust your friends again.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Tribes
description:
This game by Jim DuBois uses only things that gamers usually have lying around in plenty: lots of six-sided dice and chips/tokens in 4 colors. The story as told in the Overview: "You are simulating a small tribe seeking to establish itself. Your goal is to survive and make 3 art (culture) before anyone else does." Each die represents an individual in a tribe, and the four types of markers represent food, houses, art, and penalties.

Each round all players roll all their dice to determine the productivity of the individual tribe members. Players then allocate the roll values, aka productivity, towards food, housing, more tribe members, or art. "Bad luck" as determined by a separate d6 and penalties also play roles in determining which tribe will become the most culturally successful, but the main factor is a good deal of strategy on the players' parts.
publishers: (Web published), Print & Play Productions, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: World War II The Expansion
description:
This expansion for Axis & Allies is designed to add realism, historical accuracy, strategy enhancement, and play balance to the base game. New elements added to the game include increased production, destroyer escorts, sub patrols, anti-sub patrols, destroyers, cruisers, capital warships, depth charge attacks, wolf packs, air search missions, and more.

Includes: 30 counters.

Expands:

Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Battle Games in Middle-earth
description:
An official game, under license from New Line Cinema, created by Games Workshop and published by DeAgostini, a company best-known for their partwork magazines. Battle Games in Middle-earth was a fortnightly publication with each issue containing game rules, painting and modeling articles, card "standee" figures, etc. Included on the cover were sprues of plastic 25mm figures (by GW sculptors), paints, etc.

The wargame rules, as might be expected, were very basic and die-roll heavy. Later issues of Battle Games featured more advanced rules to cover special abilities, magic, etc.

The title proved more popular than the publishers expected and the deadline was extended several times. Issue 91 was the final issue in July 2006. The title was published/distributed in the UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand, Malta, South Africa, Netherlands, Belgium, France, Germany, Spain, Austria and Poland.

Battle Games in Middle-earth is related to The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game with some overlap in the range of miniatures, but it was marketed as a game in its own right.
categories: Collectible Components, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Warhammer: Dark Shadows
description: A campaign book for the 2001 WFB campaign of the same name - includes rules for fighting in the campaign setting of Albion, including descriptions of the setting, special army lists for running battles, the running of the campaing itself, etc.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Police City
description:
You play as a young officer whose ambitious goal is to become the leader of the NYPD. Thanks to your staff and the support of your colleagues, you will stop gangsters, regain control of neighborhoods, traffic capture, in brief all which will allow you to be promoted and to fill the quotas of the mayor of the city.

City Police is based on a mechanism of simultaneous placements: each turn, you send your staff (inspectors, sergeants, lieutenants ...) on the site of the city by conducting joint actions with other players. The hardest part will not necessarily stop the gangsters, but you agree you later for the distribution of benefits of each intervention.

Thus, at every moment of the game, you will make the right decisions and advance good arguments in a very short time. Negotiation and reactivity are your main weapons. But beware: if you and your colleagues will too shoot in the legs, it will be the Mafia who eventually win the game.

City Police is a fun and relaxed which makes great negotiation and role-play. Unlike Gangs City, you need to know to make decisions very quickly, on the stroke of the pulse. It will show you reagents both intellectually and physically, since the investments are trades like an hourglass time of 30 seconds. Thus, the parties are very lively and rhythmic.

So, all the time of the game(set,play), you will have to make the good decisions and to move forward the good arguments in a short time. Negotiation and reactivity will be your main weapons. But pay attention: if you and your colleagues if you do not hear enough, it will be the Mafia who eventually win the game.

City police is a funny and relaxed game which leaves the beautiful part in the negotiation and in the role-play. You will have to know how to make decisions very quickly, at the time impulse. It will be necessary to show you reactive at the same time intellectually and physically, because placements and negotiation are made the time of an hourglass of 30 seconds. Thus, the parties are very lively and rhythmic.

name: Uruk II: Promokarte Plünderung
description:
The achievement Card Plundering introduces a new color: black

It was included in the 2018/07 edition of spielbox magazine.

name: The Space Base Race
description:
The Space Base Race is set in the somewhat distant future where asteroid mining is a huge industry. The mega companies involved in the process are fiercely competitive. When a new mining location is discovered, each company sends out a fully robotic mining base. Before mining begins, the companies attack each others bases. When only one base is left standing, the victor gets exclusive rights to reap the benefits.

Players play as one of the companies and try to build their own base while eliminating the competition. The last player with a base still standing wins. The base game mechanism involves laying cards in a grid to form a "base". Each card or "Module" acts differently. The five base cards are the solar panel, the turret, the repair bot, the ray shield and the processor.
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Zombology
description:
The Zombie Plague is decimating humanity. In a last ditch attempt to save the species, the governments of the world have turned to you and your peers: ‘scientists’ who believe that Healing Crystals or Magnets can cure anything.

You’ve only got 8 rounds to work out which cures might work and collaboratively build enough evidence to cure the plague - but watch out, only those who’ve backed the right cure will win the Nobel Prize, the others are prepared to take the whole human race down to stop you shaming them.

Zombology is played over eight rounds, each round players choose a card from their hand to either contribute to the eradication of the disease by performing research in one of six therapies or to play an event either boosting one of the therapies or overrunning an opponent's lab with zombies. The remaining cards in their hand are then drafted to the next player, so players build up a picture of which therapies might offer a cure as the game goes on. Therapy cards range in value from 1 to 6 and can only be played if any player has played the card below it (i.e. playing a four requires a 3 in that therapy in play) and then game ends when one or more 6s are played in a round. Players work together, trying to cooperatively generate enough evidence for a cure, but not everyone will win - only those who have backed the right cure will be lauded, or everyone might die!

name: Fight The Fall: Faesulae A.D. 405 & Tricamerum A.D. 533
description:
Fight The Fall: Faesulae A.D. 405 & Tricamerum A.D. 533 is a two-player wargame system that simulates the battles that occurred during the era AD 376 to 560, roughly the time from when the Goths crossed the Danube to the Byzantine reconquest of the west.

The game system emphasizes command control, leaders and unique tactics. Players pick command markers to generate actions, modeling the chaos of the battlefield. The objective is to gain victory in battle, usually by destroying enemy units and morale. Each hex represents an area about 100 yards across. Each unit represents from 400 to 2,000 men. This game includes two scenarios:

Faesulae AD 405: Gothic chieftain Radagaisus vs. the Roman warlord Flavius Stilicho.
Tricamerum AD 533: Flavius Belisarius vs. Gelimer (King of the Vandals), mid-December AD.533 west of Carthage.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

This is the game contained in Strategy & Tactics Magazine #324.

name: Scipio: Sworn Enemy of Hannibal
description:
Aut viam inveniam aut faciam. (I shall either find a way or make one.) — Hannibal the Barcid. In 203 B.C. two genius strategists vied for the fate of the world.
Hannibal: The renowned Carthaginian general; and Scipio: The Roman Hero.

SCIPIO is a two-player strategy board game: players take on the role of military leaders to command the armies of an ancient age to crush your enemy. Develop a formation and give orders to your armed forces — never be too aggressive nor too passive.

The game is played over a series of rounds.
Phase One
1.Place command cards.
2.Reveal Command Cards.
3.Deal Damage.
4.Draw New Orders Cards.

Phase 2
The second phase repeats the steps of the first phase.
The only difference is the Command cards available to you. Both players can only use the remaining 3 cards that they didn't play in the first phase.

Phase 3
Shuffle Strike Order tiles and Return Command Cards to Hand.

If any one of your opponent's Formations becomes empty (has no tokens in it) when they remove Troop Tokens, The game is over! and you win.

—user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution
publishers: Studium Mundi (スタジオムンディ)

name: Pulp Invasion: X3
description:
You thought after your last mission that you had finally successfully driven the cosmic hegemony out of the universe. Wrong! The three alien races known as The Red Hegemony are back and have already infiltrated several Intergalactic Alliance planets — but that's not enough for them! They want domination, no matter what the cost...

As a secret agent of the Intergalactic Council, it's your job to prevent this from happening. The fact that this sounds like a hopeless task doesn't stop you from grabbing one of the new ships and assembling a strong crew to embark on a journey to the farthest reaches of the universe and crush the Red Hegemony once and for all!

In Pulp Invasion X3, you have new spaceships and a new bridge crew to help you eliminate the threat once and for all. Use your skills in combat, diplomacy, and super science to track down their world-shattering super weapons before it's too late!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ole-Kaji
description:
Send out your ships! Construct cities! Can you be the one to control the seas and land?

This is a worker placement game. Players are managing their resources to send out ships to bring back treasure and bounty, and to build up their cities. On a turn you:
get workers, get income, remove or add workers, and then place your workers on the various places on the board to get money including going to the casino, going to the witch to gain favour, and sending out your ships.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Pentactic
description:
Pentactic is a game in the line of FITS or Ubongo, but with more player interaction, where players try to place all their pentominoes on their boards while dropping stones on the opponents’ boards to prevent them from doing the same. The board features three different, overlapping playfields, in order to increase replay value:

8×8
9×7
11×6


A pentomino is a piece composed of five congruent squares, connected along their edges. There are 12 different pentominoes. Pentominoes are well known in the board game community and lots of games use them.

Néstor designed the first version of Pentactic (basic gameplay) back in 1980, while playing with a home-made set of pentominoes. 30 years later, he fine-tuned it and added the 'duel' and 'multiplayer' options.

There are 4 types of gameplay:


Solo play (1 player): You’ll need 1 PENTACTIC set.
Basic play (2 players): You’ll need 1 PENTACTIC set.
Duel (2 players): You’ll need 2 PENTACTIC sets.
Multiplayer (3-6 players): You’ll need as many PENTACTIC sets as players.


It is recommended to use different colored sets in ‘Duel’ and ‘Multiplayer’ modes if possible. PENTACTIC sets are available in different colors.

name: Nite Lights
description:
Players take turns placing blocks, or rotating blocks already on the board, trying to create color patterns that match their Firework Cards. Once a match is created, they lay their card over the corresponding blocks and set one of their Show Blocks in the center of the card. Players can also see their opponents’ cards, so they may choose to try and prevent other players from being able to place their Firework Cards and Show Blocks. The goal is to be the first person to play all six of their Show Blocks.

—description from the publisher

name: Агенты: Щит и меч
description:
Cold War. You are in charge of foreign intelligence for one of four countries in protracted conflict. It is you who are the invisible force that the state uses when it is necessary to resolve the issue quietly. A difficult task falls on your shoulders, for the implementation of which you must use the most sophisticated techniques. Expanding the intelligence network is a kind of art ... Brute force, surveillance, blackmail, propaganda, bribery are just a small part of your arsenal. After all, the end justifies the means, especially when the interests of the state are at stake. And you also know for sure that all the links in your chain: informants, operatives and diplomats must work harmoniously, and only then will you achieve your goal.
Place your spies in different parts of the world, introduce reconnaissance of rivals, eliminate enemy agents, complete secret missions and get victory points for all these actions. The first player to reach five Victory Points is declared the winner.

name: Jutaku
description: In Jutaku you will take on the role of a famous or emerging Japanese architect with the goal of building small homes on a strange or limited size property. It is a real time dexterity based game where players will build with geometric pieces to stack up to certain building requirements.
categories: Action / Dexterity, City Building, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Enclosure, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Pacific At War
description:
Looks and feels very similar to "Axis & Allies: Pacific". Description taken from the game manual:

Pacific at War is a multi-player military strategy game taking place in the Pacific theater of operations during World War II. Players must fight battles successfully to win territories and therefore increase their income. The more income a player has, the more buying power he has to purchase the combat units necessary to win battles and gain territories.

In order to achieve their goals, the players have at their disposal playing pieces representing infantry, armor, artillery, fighters, bombers and various types of naval vessels. A player must use clever strategy and planning and purchase units wisely in order to make the most of his resources.

The Japanese player starts the game at war with China. He must decide how much military equipment he wants to commit and for how long before the United States and Britain are brought into the war.

The Chinese player must attempt to inflict as many Japanese casualties as possible and hold out until the Allies enter the war.

The U.S. and Britain will enter the war simultaneously. Until then, they can only prepare the best they can for the inevitable Japanese attack...

name: La Conquête du Monde
description:
The very rare ancestor of the famous RISK game by Parker Brothers. Risk's origins go back to the summer of 1957 when Mr. Boisseau of Miro approached Parker Brothers with La Conquete du Monde, a game invented by the French writer and movie producer Albert Lamorisse, best known for his award-winning film The Red Balloon.
The game board has evolved much since then!
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Yamato: The Game of Fleet Battle in the Pacific Ocean
description:
This game is a tactical-level simulation of the naval combat that occurred between the Allied fleets and the Japanese Navy in World War II. Yamato can simulate battles of many scales, ranging from a full-size fleet-to-fleet engagement to a small ship-to-ship duel.

Contents:

Scenarios
4 Introductory
10 Historical
3 Fictional

6 identical mounted sea maps
2 Countersheets (304 counters on each)
Ships cards
16 Japanese
14 American
6 British
2 Dutch
1 Australian



(from the English translation introduction and user's description)


Title "Yamato Battleship" (in Japanese), subtitle "The Game of Fleet Battle in the Pacific Ocean" (in English).

English language translation by Quarterdeck Games:

Translator: E.Lipset
Production of English version: Jack Greene and Beth Queman

name: Anno Domini: Sachsen
description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The set "Sachsen" contains historical events which are related to Sachsen. This relationship is not necessary obvious. Like all Anno Domini the Sachsen edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Part of the Anno Domini series

name: Shoulder of Orion
description:
Shoulder of Orion is a fast paced starship boarding action game. Two players will construct a modular board that is unique from game to game. One player takes the role of the attacking forces and other the defender. Each takes turns exploring the board and coming into conflict with each other.

Players have a limited set of moves and military pieces they may use during the game. The attacking player is trying to win via the listed victory conditions before a set number of turns elapses. The defender is trying to prevent this.

The turn sequence is broken into three phases (Command, Movement, and Firefight) and each player completes his turn fully before it is passed to the other.

Advanced rules are provided which gives players access to a set of six fleet cards with unique abilities that will alter their play-style.

Shoulder of Orion is part of a series of print and play boardgames published through Bell of Lost Souls. This series is provided as a downloadable pdf which includes everything needed to play except dice. Players may download, print out the pieces, and start playing. The game is designed to be enhanced with common playing pieces found in other games for those would prefer to not use counters.

SHOULDER OF ORION is available FREE at BoLS Board Games: http://www.bolsboardgames.com
categories: Dice, Fighting, Maze, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixel Tactics: Game Show Host/Roy
description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a Master Plan game crossover.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Pixel Tactics: Robot / Mark.PT0
description:
Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a kickstarter/convention promo

Card text: You may alter the game state freely when your opponent is not watching. If your opponent notices the changes, you must undo them and this leader loses 4 life. After a complete wave passes, all changes stand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Mound of Bacon expansion
description: This expansion features 2 Mound of Bacon cards to add to the Jack deck and 1 custom Bacon die. When you play the Mound of Bacon card you roll the Bacon Die. The Bacon die has "zzz" for the 1 face meaning you ate too much bacon (like that's possible!) and fell asleep, lose your chopping roll this turn. On the 2-5 sides there is 1 slice of bacon and you add 1 chop to your tree. On the 6 side there are 2 slices of bacon giving you 2 chops to your tree!

name: Keep Talking
description:
This is a game where thinking - and talking - fast is always an advantage. Can you describe a list of ten people, places or things to your team mates before your minutes is up? Can you keep a game of work association going without any hesitation? It's a hectic game where getting your tongue in a twist could be your downfall!

Players are split into teams. Each card has two parts. First you have to describe a list of ten things - these might be movie actors, sports people, cities, countries or things like herbs and spices, to give a few examples. Sometimes there are limitations to what you can say, such as describing actors without mentioning the films they've been in. Then the second part of the card is "Don't Hesitate", when two players keep up a game of word association for as long as they can, from the given start word on the card.

name: The Depths of Durangrar
description:
The Depths of Durangrar is a dungeon crawler table top game that is played in the dark. Individual explorers will light up to illuminate only what is in front of them in a 3D maze. The goal of the explorers is to find treasure in the maze and bring it out of the maze from where they came. However, explorers must be careful for a monster hunts them in the maze. The monster does not light up and remains hidden in the darkness. The monster player is wearing night vision goggles and can see the whole maze.

Players move throughout the maze using action points. Action points are spent moving space to space, rotating, picking up gold, using their unique abilities, using items and attacking other players. Explorers can also team up with one another to increase their odds of killing the monster, however, it leaves them open to betrayal where another explorer can steal the gold they have collected for their own gain.

The explorers are the Scout, Knight and Demolitionist. The Scout can have more action points than other explorers. The Knight can reduce damage they take in combat and the Demolitionist can permanently remove walls from the maze.

The monsters are the Thresher, Excavator and Sentient Fungus. The Thresher can jump over walls to ambush explorers. The excavator can build temporary walls to trap explorers and the Sentient Fungus can build environmental traps to injure and slow the advance of explorers.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Love Formula: Lucky in Love
description:
Love keeps popping up in unexpected places, which is great news for a matchmaker like you! But sometimes the whims of chance can get in the way, so get ready to help your couples meet all of their relationship goals in this double-expansion!

The Lucky in Love Expansion includes the #RelationshipGoals and Take a Chance on Love mini-expansions for Love Formula. The #RelationshipGoals pack introduces a new game mechanic that allows players to earn extra points by completing #RelationshipGoals! Take a Chance on Love adds a random event each round!

name: Pokémon Trading Card Game: My First Battle
description:
If you’ve always wanted to play the Pokémon Trading Card Game with family and friends, the Pokémon TCG: My First Battle set is the perfect introduction. With a streamlined game and foolproof guidance, you’ll be ready to train and battle together. Everything you need for two players is included!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Stalin's World War III
description:
"Stalin's World War III" is a two wargame package: Part 1 – Operation Pincher & The Soviet Offensive in Europe; and Part 2 – Operation Sandown & The Soviet Offensive in the Mid-East. This is an alternative history monster-size wargame, designed by Ty Bomba, intended to investigate the strategic parameters that would’ve been in place during the first 10 weeks of operations had that dictator lived long enough to put in motion one of his many plans to start a global conflict in 1953.

The full combined grand campaign is over 3.5 mapsheets.

—description from the publisher

name: Lord of the Fries: McPubihan's Irish Pub Deck
description:
This is an 54 card expansion deck for Lord of the Fries continuing the Zombies working in a restaurant theme to an Irish Pub. Ingredients: bread, potatoes, stout, whiskey. veggies, cow meat and fish meat are combined in various humorously renamed Irish recipes.

The mechanics are essentially the same as the base game with the addition of the "stew pot" a collection of face-up cards created by a discard of a single card by each player after the initial deal. Players may, on their turn, exchange one card with one from the stew pot prior to filling an order.

Besides being an expansion to Lord of the Fries, this can be played as a stand alone.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Omegha: il Gioco
description:
Description from the publisher:

Omegha: il Gioco is a science fiction cooperative card-game for 1-4 players based on the Omegha comic book created by italian artist Enzo Troiano.

The game is based on an original engine which allows to setup different adventures using the same deck of cards. Four different characters are available to the players, each with its own set of distinctive skills and abilities.

Omegha: il Gioco can either be played in autonomous sessions - by selecting one of the available missions - or in a continous campaign based on an original story.

Even though the game is based on a comic book it can be played by gamers who did not read the original story, as it is based on a completely new plot set in the same universe.

The game cards and components are illustrated with Enzo Troiano's artwork.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Napoleon's Last Triumph
description:
"Napoleon's Last Triumph" is a tactical/grand tactical game of the Battle of Wagram (July 1809). Scale is 360 yards per hex with each turn representing one hour. Infantry & cavalary units are at the brigade/regiment level and artillery at the battalion level. Army, Corps and Cavalry Division leaders are also represented with counters.

Components include one map, 16 page rulebook, brown/green shaded map and 6-sided die. Rules include command considerations, facing, formation, fire/melee/charge combat disorder/rout and corps demoralization. Rules also give brief design notes, bibliography and an offer for copies of the 2 documents containing designer's notes and commentary.

- scale = 360 yard/hex (329 m/hex);
- time = 1 hour/GT;
- strength = (brigade/regiment level)

name: Magic: The Gathering – Born of the Gods
description:
Theros is a Magic: The Gathering block, consisting of the expansion sets Theros (September 27, 2013), Born of the Gods (February 7, 2014) and Journey into Nyx (May 2, 2014). The block is a "top-down" design inspired by Greek mythology.

The second set of the block, Born of the Gods, was released on February 7, 2014. Born of the Gods is a small set consisting of 165 cards; of those, one is a planeswalker, the blue/green Kiora, the Crashing Wave. The set also introduces the ten "demigods" of Theros's pantheon, which are dual-colored and care about their controller's devotion to two colors. Born of the Gods features five of them with allied-color combinations; Journey Into Nyx will feature the remaining five.

In addition to the block-wide mechanics, Born of the Gods features two unique mechanics:

Inspired: a triggered ability that occurs whenever an Inspired creature becomes untapped. When an Inspired ability triggers, it provides additional bonuses such as drawing a card; occasionally, it may require additional costs to be paid.
Tribute: an activated ability of creatures, replacing Monstrous and intending to evoke a similar flavor. However, it occurs only when the creature comes into play. At this time, an opponent may choose to give the Tribute creature a certain number of +1/+1 counters. If no opponent chooses to do this, the Tribute creature has a separate effect on the game state, such as spawning token creatures or causing the player to gain life.
In addition to more enchantment creatures, Born of the Gods also introduces cards that can create enchantment creature tokens; these tokens are also printed with the starry Nyx background.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Propaganda Game
description:
The game consists of an 88 page book which includes the rules of play and descriptions of numerous propaganda techniques, 40 cards containing propaganda quotations, four 'prediction dials', and a score chart.

Players decide on which section of techniques they wish to compete. (e.g.-Self-deception, Language, Irrelevance, Exploitation, etc.) One player reads a quote and then all players secretly decide which technique is being employed. Players then vote on the outcome... majority rules. Each player who did NOT vote with the majority MUST then try to sway the popular voters to change their vote... each minority voter gets one minute to do this. The majority voters then cast their ballots again.

Once the second vote is complete, the minority still has an option to challenge, whether they convinced anyone to change their vote or not. If a quote is challenged incorrectly, the challenger loses two points while everyone else gains one. If a quote is unchallenged, the majority voters gain one point each.

The first player to 20 points wins the game.

name: Celebrity
description:
From the box:

How would you describe Julia Roberts without ever saying her name? How would you charade Jacques Cousteau?

In Celebrity, you try to get your team to guess the names of celebrities in 6 different categories ranging from entertainment to sports without ever saying the celebrity's name!

The same celebrity names are used for all three rounds but the clues become more difficult and hilarious as the rounds are played.

The players create the celebrity names for each game, making Celebrity timeless -- and unique every time you play.

Based on the public domain game known as Celebrities.

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): Blood in the Badlands
description:
A campaign expansion for Warhammer Fantasy Battles, 8th Edition, Blood in the Badlands details the conquest of the Badlands as multiple armies search for the legendary citadel, Fozzrik's Flying Fastness.

This 96-page hardcover includes new campaign rules, multiple scenarios (including several for team battles), siege rules and equipment, rules for battling underground, and new magic items and Cataclysm spells.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Anno Domini: Fussball WM
description:
A regular Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

This small expansion Set "Anno Domini - Fussball WM" contains only 54 events related to Soccer Worldcups. As it is conceived as a free give away (on occasion of the 2006 Worldcup in Germany) it consists only of those 54 cards (no rules, only cards in shrinkwrap). These are to few for a regular game, but can be added to any other games of the series.

In 2008, this expansion was included in "Anno Domini - Jubiläums Metallbox", a metal box designed to hold 8 regular Anno Domini games. It has no own entry on BGG.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.
