Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly. Anno Domini is a blast to play, it is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Part of the Anno Domini series
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: Draft football card game
description:
All the football (soccer) in a card game.

This is a card game where you try to have more goals than your opponent. The idea is to start by a draft of 12 card in the center of the table face up. Each player will have 6 to start with at the end of the draft.

You have 6 types of card representing a (or two) football action like :

pass
center


etc.

The the player will alternate playing card in a common pile in the middle, the card you play will dicdate which card you opponnent has to play next.
If he don't have the card, he will draw, play if possible.
If he still can't play you will continue your action by playing an other card.

An "unstop" shoot will trigger a goal. BUT wait you have to check the referee by flipping the first card of the draw pile and check if the goal is accepted.

In case of a fault committed (red card), then the player will draw the first card of the pile and get :

yellow card (two yellow will remove you a goal)
free kick (nothing happen)
penalty (the opponent check the referee for the GOAaaaallll).


The end happen when the pile is depleted twice or at the end of the match if you use the app.

name: Mini Crimes: The End of the Games
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

MiniCrimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyze a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

'In Mini Crimes: La fine dei giochi' ("Mini Crimes: The end of the games"), a fan of comics, toys and science fiction is found dead in his house, hit on the head by a vase.
How can a simple person loved by all make such a terrible end?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: The City: Eco expansion
description:
A 6-card Eco mini-expansion for the 2019 English edition of Tom Lehmann's "The City" published by Gryphon Games. This mini-expansion features all new cards to build, including: Pedestrian Zone, Alternative Transportation, an Eco-Building, Green Energy Plant, and Ridesharing.

Unlike the iconic city replacement cards, these cards are simply added to the game. These cards include new icons and scoring possibilities to add more variance to the game.

This expansion came together with the 2019 Kickstarter edition of the game, but is not included in the standard retail edition. It is expected to be available for separate purchase, e.g. as a separate promo pack through the BoardGameGeek store.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Farao
description:
Farao is a family game with strategic elements and a modular board. Players are trying to discover the mysterious tomb which might hide the grave of the famous King Tutankhamun. While navigating the labyrinth of passages and diving deeper into the heart of the pyramid they ecounter various traps and other dangers, but also find usefull items.

Althought the game is usually full of suprise and mystery (and has a certain amount of luck present), there is also a fair amount of strategic thinking required. You will be able to influence the labyrinth, plan ahead and work together with other archeologists.

Farao can accomodate different playstyles - with beginners you can go for pure theme or with the thinking heads you can opt for more strategy. For example the strength of individual items depends on the random board setup (you gradually reaveal the game board during the game), so players may want to take this into consideration.

The game can be played in two ways:

The small pyramid is suitable for beginners, as it only contains half of the obstacles and the labyrinth is smaller. This game lasts around 30 minutes.
The large pyramid is suitable for a longer game, giving the players more freedom in combining items and using various tactics. The basic rules for the game are always the same, so even beginners and younger children can easily pick this longer version up after a few plays of the smaller pyramid.


Farao is largely language independent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board
publishers: Czech Board Games, Dino Toys s. r. o., REGIO Játék

name: Elfenland: Favor of the Towns
description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 Promo for Day 6.

Important: The rules for Elfenland remain valid. Any additions and changes to these rules are detailed in the inclusded rules.

Contains:
20 Favor tokens
12 Obstacles
12 "Free path" tiles
Rules in German and English

The rules also contain 2 variants: Small Favors and Great Favors.

Small Favors:
Shuffle the 20 favor tiles and randomly place them on the towers on the game board. Each tower gets one face up favor tile except the Elf Capital (Elfenhold) which remains empty.
Rules: Immediately before you start your movement in phase 5 (Move the Elf Boots), you may use the favor of the place your elf boots are currently in.

Great Favors:
Shuffle the 20 favor tiles and randomly place them on the towers on the game board. Each tower gets one face down favor tile except the Elf Capital (Elfenhold) which remains empty.

Rules: Each time you reach a town during phase 5 (Move the Elf Boots) and collect the town piece, you may use the town's favor immediately.
Note: Turn over any favor tiles when you use them the first time. They remain on the game board face up for the remainder of the game and can subsequently be used by all players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Gateball?
description:
Based off the Japanese sport of Gateball, which, while different, bears a few resemblances to Croquet.

Each team has 5 balls that they need to hit through 3 gates and then over the finish area. They get 1 point for each ball that gets past each gate, and 2 points for going over the finish line. These must be done in order. You can get a maximum of 5 points per ball (3 for the 3 gates, 2 for the finish).

There are 6 game turns, and in each turn, each ball can move (with different types of shots, such as power or technique). Each time you hit another ball, you get to shoot that ball off (whether its your own or an opponents), and then take an extra turn. You cannot have your current ball hit the same other ball multiple times, but if you hit different balls (or pass through gates) in succession, you can rack up many shots in a row.

The seventh in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label "Aeronaut". They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring binder in bags and pouches.

name: China: Erweiterung
description:
This small expansion for China was available for free at the ABACUSSPIELE booth during Essen 2005. It is now freely available for download from Michael Schacht's website (see the Links section below).

With this expansion, bonus chips (in three colors) are randomly placed on house spaces at non-intersection points -- two per region. Players placing houses at these spots take the bonus chips. At the end of the game, points are awarded to whoever holds a majority of each color chip.

Expands:

China
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: RPGQuest Dungeons
description:
RPGQuest Dungeons is a RPG (Role Playing Game) and Modern Board game that takes place inside Stone Labyrinths, dungeons and secret passages called "Dungeons" or "Seth's Tunnels" in the Kingdom of Arcadia.
Legends say that the ancient Egyptian god of death built these living labyrinths in the Underworld and that these labyrinths could change and change their position over time, making the task of mapping them impossible.
Portals and passages sometimes pop up in the Arcadia Mountain Chains, often accompanied by reports of attacks by monsters and other creatures in nearby villages. Seth's Tunnels serve as shelters for Orcs, Goblins, Cultists, Necromancers, the Living Dead and the terrible Svartalfenheim (The Black Elves), as well as the Scorpion People and other even more terrifying creatures.
Dungeons can be ancient abandoned mausoleums, ancient crypts of lost dynasties, subterranean labyrinths built by already extinct races, dens or orches and caches of orcs, gnolls or goblins, serving as the basis for powerful necromantics or even demonic portals for other dimensions. All of these sites have legends about lost treasures and valuable artifacts and attract the attention of Kingdom Adventurers groups.
Our game begins when a group of Four Brave Heroes decides to investigate these locations in their quest during Hero's Journey.
The RPGQuest can be played from 2 to 5 people (or up to 6 people if one of them takes the role of Narrator). Each of them will take on the role of one or more Heroes (out of 12 initials) within a team of 4 Adventurers and together they must face the challenges within the Dungeons.

RPGQuest is played in stages, called ADVENTURES. During an Adventure, a Hero can find or gain treasures and valuable artifacts. Weapons, Armor, and Magic Items that can be used in the following Adventures of a Campaign. You can also improve the powers and attributes of your Characters by making them stronger and more powerful on your Journey.
Heroes must act together to win the Adventures. RPGQuest is a Cooperative game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): Undead
description:
Warhammer Armies: Undead is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Undead faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ripple
description:
Ripple is a card game for 2-6 players. Players have a "beach" created by lining up 2 rows of 5 cards each.

Players replace one of their beach cards with a card from the draw pile or another player's discard pile. As player replace cards, they are trying to build matches, block sets, and complete combos.

Once a player reveals all of the cards on their beach, the game is over and players will add up their points. The player with the lowest score after 3 rounds is the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Murder to Go
description:
David Landau staged "live" large-scale murder parties for a couple of years before designing a home, boxed version of some of his scenarios. That's according to the box copy.

This box includes three separate murder parties: Murder's the Game, Centerfold for the Coroner, and Circumstantial Evidence. Much like traditional murder party kits, except that this one includes more props and requires (for at least some of the scenarios) a little more up-front preparation of the crime scene for visual clues. Includes more props than other murder party lines.

name: Chronicles
description: Chronicles is a trivia game that asks players to guess when certain historical events took place. The questions are designed to enable players to reason their way closer to the answers, and partial credit is given for how close one comes, dependent on question difficulty. The partial credit element of Chronicles makes it somewhat distinct from other trivia games in which players either know the answers or they don't.

name: La Battaglia dei Cinque Eserciti
description:
"So began a battle that none had expected; and it was called the Battle of Five Armies, and it was very terrible. Upon one side were the Goblins and the wild Wolves, and upon the other were Elves and Men and Dwarves."

The game is a classical wargame. The rules are quite simple: on one side there are Men, Dwarves and Elves trying to defend the gates and the slopes of the Lonely Mountain. The Free People are few but can use the advantage of the terrain (mountains and rivers). The game is played in turns (12): the Free People must defend the gates and try to survive the dark hordes.

Each units has a movement value and a combat value (attack and defence); the combat value of the defender can be modified by the terrain. The leaders (King of Orcs for the goblins; Wizard, Dwarven Hero and the kings of Elves, Man and Dwarves for the Free People) are really strong in supporting the troups and could really change the odds of the battles.

The goblins could also win the game killing all the troops and leaders of one of the Free People army (Elves, Dwarves or Men).

Close to the end, the Eagles and the Bear-Man come to help the Free People.

name: The Beverly Hillbillies Game
description: The board has a central floor plan of the Hillbillies mansion, along with an outside track. There are many markers for items belonging in each room. Unfortunately, the rules are missing from the copy we have.

name: From Golan to Sinai: The Arab-Israeli Wars 1956-1973 – A Clash of Armor Module
description:
Containing six scenarios spanning three wars, this Module includes all the supplemental rules and data needed to carry the CoA system through the Arab-Israeli Wars. Each scenario includes an 8 1/2" x 11" map, a brief historical commentary and tables with all pertinent data extracted for the players' convenience.

Although this module was designed to be used with CoA system, the scenarios can be easily adapted for use with other tactical armor systems.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Space blabla
description: Each player places a card made up of funny words associated with humorous gestures. Each time you place a card you have to repeat all previous card words and gestures from your opponents' cards. When a player is mistaken and is caught he or she loses that turn and the card (which remains in the hand) becomes crushed small aliens.

name: Battle of Marignano
description: A free wargame about the Battle of Marignano. Takes place during the Italian wars, and simulates a large battle which took place in Italy between the French and Swiss in 1515.
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid, Zone of Control

name: Lee at the Crossroads
description: Lee at the Crossroads is a brigade level study of the 3 day battle of Gettysburg in early July, 1863. The players are placed in the positions of the leaders of the opposing Armies with leadership and command control systems modeled on the strengths and weaknesses of Civil War era command techniques as well as the influences of the participating individual commanders. Turns represent 2 hours of daylight and 5 hours of darkness. Hexes are scaled to 350 yards.

name: MSK 1 Extension Kit for 1829 (Northern & Southern Boards)
description:
The 18xx MSK 1 extension kit adds 6 new tiles for either the 1829 Northern Board or 1829 - 2 gray 'universal junction' tiles, and 4 '5-spoke' double-station city tiles that can promote any green station tile, with a half-page of rules for their use.

Expands:

1829
1829 Northern Board

name: It's All Chinese to Me!
description:
You are starving. You are in the middle of Chinatown and only one restaurant is open. Oh no! The menu is written only in Chinese. You only know 5 Chinese characters, one for each meal type (beef, chicken, lamb, fish and vegetables). For each meal type, you are hesitating between two Chinese characters. You will have to try to order using your very limited knowledge of the language. The waiter, slightly confused, will bring you what he thinks the majority wants. The player who successfully orders the most meals will score the most points and win.
The players will do this by predicting which meal type is the most abundant in a common pile of Meal cards. To help them, they will be able to add Meal cards to the pile. However, the more cards they add to the pile, the less prediction they will be allowed to make. To win, a player will have to balance memory, risk-taking and bluffing.

The game is made of 110 cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), (Web published), Print & Play Productions

name: The Key to the Kingdom
description:
This is a trivia game that comes with a set of transformation playing cards based on traditional nursery rhymes designed by Tony Meeuwissen.

from the rules: "These cards have been designed so that all the familiar games can be played with them. However, by means of the verses printed on the following pages, you may like to test the wits of your friends in the following simple game (for two or more players).
Discarding one Joker, neatly lay out all the cards, in any order, face upwards. Reading aloud from the verses, in the sequence shown, you invite the players to call out the card that matches the verse. The first player to guess correctly, keeps the card. Whoever holds the most cards at the end of the game is declared the winner."

name: Classico
description:
A trivia quiz game about classical music.

Players roll and move their pawn on a board with different colored squares. There are five colors, corresponding to five categories of questions (history of music, opera, instruments, man and music, recognizing music fragments). You must answer a question of the category corresponding to the color you land on. Your turn ends when you give a wrong answer.
For each category of question there is one special square on the board. When you answer correctly there, you earn a category token. The first player to win a token for each of the five categories wins the game.

The game comes with a board, 198 cards with questions, 2 CD's with music fragments, category tokens and a regular die. The player tokens are images of busts of famous composers.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Addenda
description: Addenda is played with a standard deck of cards. A trick always consists of four cards. If the total value of the cards is more than 17, the trick is lost by the player who took it above 17, otherwise it is won by the player who played the last card in the trick. Other rules give many strategic options.

name: Coin Clusters
description:
A quick light-strategy coin game for 2 players (or more, but with the drawback of an unavoidable kingmaking situation).

Starting from a semi-random setup using only coins, players alternate turns moving coins to make them touch other coins on the playing surface.

In certain contact configurations, a coin will not be able to move any more.

The last player able to make a legal move wins the game.

name: Battle Strikers
description:
Taking top battling to the next level. These magnetic powered tops spin at high speeds and can top out over 6000 RPMs with the turbo launchers.

Battle to the end with customizable tops to adjust Attack, Defense, and Control. Once in battle these tops don't just spin and move randomly, you can control them with a magnetic glove to direct your top to attack or avoid your opponent.

User Description

name: Боец
description:
From publisher:

The card game duel The Fighter (Men can do anything!) has been created based on the popular Russian reality-show about mixed martial arts: M1-Fighter. Now, anyone can step into the ring and participate in fights with their TV heroes! Swings and uppercuts, throws and low-kicks, holds and yellow cards – this original fight simulator contains all those elements which we love to see in the martial arts. The game presents eight fighters: actual participants from the TV show. They all have unique fighting abilities: strength, speed, stamina and coordination. Using their skills, the fighters attack each other, avoid hits and maneuver in an attempt to gain a tactical advantage.

The unique game mechanics lie in the interaction of the move cards and 40 multicolored dice. However, to win, you will need not only luck, but also the ability to plan your actions and turn the game situation in your favor.
publishers: Fantasy World, Inc., Hobby World, Igrology

name: Little Bighorn Rummy
description:
On June 26, 1876, Lt. Col. George A. Custer drove his seven companies of the U.S. 7th Cavalry into the valley of the Little Bighorn River in search of that last big victory to cement his place in history. There he met a vast gathering of Native American nations not willing to back down from the normal tactics of the U.S. Army. Custer planted his name in history, but for the wrong reasons as he and 255 of his men were slaughtered at the Little Bighorn.

Little Bighorn Rummy brings back both the famous and infamous cast list of this incident to create an unusual style of rummy, specifically a set collection game in which players collect both Native American and U.S. Cavalry melds to secure points while attempting to empty their hand. Special cards and support cards alter play, allowing players to play single cards (chiefs) to their table, look through the discard pile, and help Lt. Col. Custer (worth -20 points) escape the scene, among other actions. The first player to achieve 150 points wins.

name: This Day In History: The Game
description:
Players test their knowledge of historical events by putting them in chronological order from earliest to most recent.

Each player can arrange up to eight events chronologically on each turn. The more accurate they are, the quicker they move on the game board.

By using ‘Power' cards strategically, players can outsmart their opponents.
The first player to reach the ‘Finish' board space wins the game!

name: Zombie Kidz: Character Cards Expansion
description:
This an official freely downloading expansion for the game "Zombie Kidz".
4 cards that makes the game a little bit more difficult.
Each turn, two zombies arrive in graveyard instead of only one.
In compensation, each character has specific powers.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: ISIS War: The Next Middle East War
description:
This game is set in a timeframe of the near future – 2017 through 2020 – in which the Iranians may have developed some kind of military nuclear capability. Even so, with the US likely still in another post-Vietnam-funk-type of “neo-isolationism,” the possibility for a blitz-style conventional Iranian victory across the region – aimed at fully establishing and certifying Tehran as the unchallengeable hegemon of the Gulf region – moves to the fore. The game’s scenario can also be taken as a model of a possible Iranian reply to a US and/or Israeli precision aerial campaign targeted against their nuclear development facilities.

More particularly, though, the game examines what may well prove to be the precipitating event for such a war: a declaration of full independence by Iraqi Kurdistan. Such a move would almost certainly be quickly followed by similar declarations from the Turkish and Iranian portions of Kurdistan. In turn, no new regime in Irbil could then possible do anything other than admit those two additional territories into a “Greater Kurdistan.” That would then just as quickly mean Iran and Turkey would effectively find themselves at least becoming cobelligerents (if not outright allies), with a shared interest in destroying the new country as quickly as possible.

This wargame examines the strategic possibilities and parameters inherent in the opening Iranian offensive of such a war. There are no rules for the use of nuclear weapons or any other weapons of mass destruction. The situation is on such a hair trigger in relation to that aspect of things, if one such weapon were to go off, many more detonations would be certain to follow. The idea for Tehran (and Ankara) would be to gain a victory without resorting to “game changing” WMD.

Further, the entirely playable on its own, Isis War can also be played as an expansion and update of my earlier design, Oil War: Iran Strikes. See the note below.

Modern War #33 January 2018

name: Lords of War: Orcs versus Dwarves – Return Fire Booster Pack
description:
Containing 10 Kickstarter exclusive reinforcements cards:

2 backwards-attacking Dwarf Marauders
2 backwards-firing Dwarf Sharpshooters
1 backwards-firing Dwarf Balista
2 backwards-firing Goblin Bowpests
2 backwards-firing Orc Catapults
1 backwards-attacking Goblin Spider Rider
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Last Front: Expansion Deck
description: This 54 card expansion deck includes new Special, Icon and Event cards to add even more variety to your game play. French and Italian territories are also included, giving greater variety of bonuses as well.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, World War II

name: Operation Pointblank: Strategic Bombing Campaign Feb-Dec 1944
description:
This is a small wargame of Operation Pointblank, included in "This Sim-Game is Awsome! 2017", an annual zine of wargame review.

Operation Pointblank is the US 8th Air Force's strategic bombing campaign of Germany between February and December of 1944.

One player is cast in the role of the US 8th Air Force planners, allocating bombers and their fighter escorts to key targets and also fighters on fighter sweeps. The other player is in charge of the German defenses (fighters and AAA). Each turn players commit their forces to the different map sectors secretly and then air battles are fought first between fighter sweeps and defending fighters, then between fighter escorts and remaining defending fighters and finally the latter against bombers.

Victory is measured in how many months the war in Europe is shortened or lengthened compared to May 1945. Victory Points are accrued by the US player for destroying targets and achieving air superiority in the most sectors, while the German have to hinder those efforts before the game ends.

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Universal Product Promo Card
description:
Mind gift Promo card for the Apocrypha Adventure Card Game sent to Kickstarter backers. Also available when purchasing the base game through the Penny Arcade web store and at conventions.

Mind Gift
Discard: Boost Mind.
Support - Comes with a scannable QR code. Scan the QR code to discover the card's special power. Integrates with the Apocrypha app.

Keywords: Golem, Hack, Study

Card # 1004
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Werwölfe: Streunende Katze
description:
When you are playing with the Streunende Katze ("Stray Cat")(character value +6), the following rules apply:

Game Preparation
The game master replaces a villager by the stray cat. That villager is set aside.

Night Phase
On the first night, the game master calls the cat before any one else. He replaces stray cat with the set-aside villager.
The player who owned the cat becomes a villager.
(If possible, place the cat as a reminder open in the middle of your playing surface.)
From the second night phase and then in each other Night phase, the cat changes hands (without actually passing on the cat). The cat is called before any other character. The current owner opens his eyes and chooses a new player to become the owner of the cat. If the cat ends up with a werewolf, both are out of the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Ka Pai: Toku Wakapapa
description:
In Ka Pai: Toku Whakapapa you trace the heritage of life between all generations. Connect the five ancestors with each other and wisely use the help of the special spaces to recite your own lineage.

The aim of Ka Pai – Toku Whakapapa is to complete your lineage by connecting the five ancestors through identical symbols. The rules for connecting the five ancestors are similar to the original game. The special spaces with an orange border helps you to connect your lineage with those ancestors.

—description from publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Comic Book Bubble
description:
In The Comic Book Bubble, you invest in comics of the modern era, represented by covers of comics from publisher Red 5 Comics. Buy comics when the market is low, and sell for a profit.

Each turn, players simultaneously select action cards - buy a comic, manipulate the market, or use the card's superpower. The market is comprised of various genres that rise and fall throughout the game.

Comics are bought and sold for the current market value of the genres on the card. As the game progresses, the genre variance increases - comics become worth a lot more - and less!

Are you savvy enough to make money before the bubble bursts?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, End Game Bonuses, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rule of Three
description:
Rule of Three is a fast-paced strategy game for visual thinkers. Shuffle the cards and prepare to collect matching triplets of shapes, colors, and numbers. Can you outwit the other players and steal the cards they need?

In this game players score points by matching sets. A matching set is any three cards that share two qualities from the following: Color, or Shape, or Number of Bars. Wild cards are also part of the game, and enable you to form a set with cards sharing two qualities.

A round ends when a player has 3 matching sets, scoring them 3 points. Players with 1 or 2 matching sets score -1 point, and players with no matching sets score -3 points. The first player to score 10 points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: 8 Ball Pool The Board Game
description:
In this highly strategic board game, opposing teams must race to pocket their group of balls first, for a chance to end the game by pocketing the 8 ball for the win. Take advantage of unique movement mechanics such as shot selection, controlled positional play, dead ball extractions, tactical safety play, rebound doubles, combination shots and more. The game gets more and more intense as both players fight to control the board and edge closer to the 8 ball.

The Game starts by dealing out the breaking cards to form the starting layout of the game. Two groups of balls (solid & stripes) along with the White and 8 Balls. Once the first ball is pocketed (directed into 1 of the 6 pockets), that group of balls will be designated to that player for the rest of the game.

The first player to pocket all their balls and then pocket the 8 Ball wins. Winning the game is determined by players shot selection and tactical safety play.

Balls can only move in straight lines, either Vertically, horizontally or diagonally along the board. Much like a queen piece in the game of chess. Always moving the white ball first, players choose which direction to move other balls and in addition have the option to move the white ball in preparation for their next shot. Using the dice, will help to determine how many moves a player possess and how they want to use them.

-description from designer
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Influencer!: #fame #shame #game
description:
Influencer! #fame #shame #game is an action-packed board game, 100% analog, with simple rules and retro charm. The satirical look at the business of influencers, pumped full of clichés like the lips of some social media beauty queens, ensures gaming fun and moments of foreign shame.

You'll roam the city hunting for the most lucrative posts. Get in shape at the gym, chill in the park, or get your wrinkles removed at the beauty doctor. Show it all to your fans, because oddly enough, hundreds of thousands are always interested! A visit to the café will give you new power, and hip mega-hypes offer you chances to get lots of new followers - but do you have time for that? Always choose the best challenges and plan your route. Quickly give your competitors a shitstorm, make an illegal YOLO-posting (...if no one sends the police after you!), and then rush off to the disco for the coolest party-posting ever! Crap, now you have to dodge the groupies blocking your way...

Will you be the first to get 1 million followers?

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Command Cards, Events, Movement Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Take That

name: The Expedition
description:
The Expedition is a small box game full of fun for 1 to 3 players. Compete against other Explorers to Mark your claim on undiscovered locations across the stars in order to gain prestige and write your name in the history books.

Be careful, though, your claim can be taken by another enterprising Explorer.

The Expedition is a small box area control game where players will try to keep their Marked Locations and score Exploration goals. The game plays lightning fast and is very portable for on-the-go gaming!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hidden Victory Points

name: National Geographic: Secret Clue – Animals
description:
A cooperative game of animal deduction. One player has a clue card specifying three spots in a nine card grid of animals. They draw three animal cards and place each as "similar" or "dissimilar". Then all the other players discuss and agree on an animal they think fits.

If they get it wrong, they flip a guess token and turn the animal sideways to indicate it's the wrong one - then the clue-giver draws three more cards to use as clues.

If they get it right, the clue-giver resets the guess tokens and clue cards and moves on to animal two.

Find all three animals without running out of guesses to win the game!

name: Rêvelune
description:
Rêvelune is a cooperative game of storytelling and deduction. As Guides, you take it in turns to imagine the adventures of your teammate, trapped in his dream. In turn, he or she must deduce the hidden meaning behind each intervention. Will you succeed in freeing your teammate by guiding him wisely to the end of his dream?

Game summary:
The game is played in several chapters. During a chapter, the Guides take it in turns to invent the adventures encountered by the Dreamer, respecting the narrative constraints of their Guide card (examples: simple description, obstacle, cute moment, etc.). The Dreamer, meanwhile, listens attentively to the story and then - once all the Guides have spoken - must find the hidden meaning behind each intervention, with the help of his Dreamer cards (identical to the Guide cards in play). A certain number of successful associations enables the Dreamer to move on to a new chapter, with changing constraints. Conversely, each failure draws the Dreamer deeper into his dream, at the risk of not being able to get out... If the players all reach the end of the dream together, the Dreamer is freed and the game is won.

—description from the publisher

Rêvelune est un jeu coopératif de narration et de déduction. En tant que Guides, vous devez imaginer à tour de rôle les péripéties vécues par votre coéquipier, prisonnier de son rêve. Celui-ci doit en retour réussir à déduire le sens caché derrière chaque intervention. Parviendrez-vous à libérer votre coéquipier en le guidant judicieusement jusqu’au bout de son rêve ?

Résumé d’une partie :
Le jeu se joue en plusieurs chapitres. Au cours d’un chapitre, les Guides inventent tour à tour les péripéties rencontrées par le Rêveur, en respectant la contrainte narrative de leur carte Guide (exemples : simple description, obstacle, moment mignon, etc.). Pour cela, ils peuvent s’aider de leur carte Inspiration qui leur suggère des mots-clé.⁠ Le Rêveur, quand à lui, écoute attentivement le récit puis – une fois que tous les Guides se sont exprimés – doit retrouver le sens caché derrière chaque intervention, à l’aide de ses cartes Rêveur (identiques aux cartes Guide en jeu).⁠ Un certain nombre d’associations réussies permet de passer à un nouveau chapitre, avec des contraintes qui évoluent. A l’inverse, chaque échec entraîne le Rêveur plus profondément dans son rêve, au risque de ne plus pouvoir en sortir…⁠ Si les joueurs arrivent tous ensemble au bout du rêve, le Rêveur est libéré et la partie est gagnée.⁠

—description from the publisher (French)
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Subbuteo Free Kick
description:
Subbuteo Free Kick is a football (soccer game). It focuses on set pieces. The attacking player flicks his Player to chip the ball into the goal using a ramp. The defending player positions a three man wall and operates the goalkeeper on a stick to defend the free kick. The first to five goals wins.

A self contained game, it is designed to encourage younger players to build their skills ready for the full Subbuteo game. Promotional version available in conjunction with Nestle Yorkie.

name: Wild Fun West: Golden Age
description:
The Golden Age is an expansion which requires the Wild Fun West base game. It is made of 30 Event cards and 1 Event info card which describes the rules of the expansion.

Every event card is written in the memory of an important event of the Old American West period between 1840 and 1890 and the effects on each card reflect in some way the historical significance of that event.

Although not a game changer, the Event cards bring another layer of planning and fun to Wild Fun West.

name: Geminoa
description:
Two girls, one who supports the Heavens and the other the Demons, their souls eternally reincarnated. Over many lives and deaths, the two confront each other in that forgotten place. A battle beyond the boundary of human knowledge is about to take place once more.

Lives as songstresses. Lives as assassins. Through the memories of your past lives, you have learned to wield swords and summon powerful beasts. But the power of memories alone will not be enough to defeat the formidable opponent before you.

By eliminating the unnecessary memories and connecting together those that are more compatible, it is possible to bring these abilities to a much higher level. When you find a power you like, master it. Upon mastering it, you may continue to use it forever. Will you become a mighty master swordsman? Or perhaps master the power of flame as a great mage...?

Geminoa is a dueling card game for two players, with a twist on the usual deck builders: rather than start with a small deck and acquire new, powerful cards, players instead start with a large deck of 30 cards. As cards are played and discarded, it is possible to return a card from the discarded pile, optimizing your set of cards by discarding the those that do not align with your strategy and emphasizing those that do.

The game also includes rules for solo play, in which you will duel a strong enemy which varies its tactics every game.

name: Scottish Quest
description:
A trivia game about Scotland. Answer trivia questions to gain gold which can be spent either collecting the letters to QUEST or moving to other areas. Additional random effect cards.

From the website:

The overall objective is to complete a tour of Scotland by answering a wide range of multiple choice Scottish general knowledge questions (4 topics: History, Nature, Modern and Culture), collect the letters 'QUEST' from various destinations and then travel to the capital city Edinburgh, answering a final question to win the game! Sovereigns are used to help you move around the board and there are a few Destiny cards along the way to trip you up or help you along!
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Microbe
description:
Players are playing cards from their hands into a 3x3 grid of 9 cards that act as a common game area for all players. Each card has a microbe type represented in the middle and dots at corners. The dots are red, white, or grey. Players score colored markers by placing cards next to each other on the grid in such a way that one or more of the dots on their card line up with similar dots on other cards. For each dot that matches, that player scores a colored scoring marker for the card that their dots matched (not the card they just played).

During scoring sessions, scoring markers are converted into point chips depending on the current layout of the 3x3 grid. Once a scorecard is drawn, play immediately pauses and scoring begins. Of the 4 types available, the one that is represented the least among the 9 currently on the 3x3 grid is worth the most. This means that each colored score marker of that type that a player has may be converted into a 2-point chip. The most abundant type represented on the 3x3 grid is worth negative 1 point. All other types are worth 1 point. Players may never have a negative total. If there are 2 or more types that are both the least represented type, they are both worth 2 points, likewise, if there are 2 or more types that are tied for being the most represented type, each of them are then worth negative 1 point.

After scoring has completed, play resumes where it left off and the game continues until the next scorecard is drawn or the draw deck is exhausted. Once the draw deck is exhausted the third and final scoring round takes place. Players then total all of their scoring chips. The player with the highest value wins!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #8
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #8 is composed of 3 expansions:

Mad City: The Capitol
The Capitol tile can be used to expand the scoring of tiles that adjoin it. Clever placing and timing is the main key to using it.

Station Master: Flags & Whistles
Includes two tiles.

Tile #1: The Station Master's Whistle
After the first train leaves the Station and has been scored give the Whistle tile to the player with the lowest score. If there is a tie for lowest score then wait until the next train has left the Station - basically as soon as there is a clear lowest score that player is given the tile. They may use it at any time in the game to send any train out of the station early (as in immediately the whistle blows). However, if the tile hasn't been used and another player becomes the lowest scorer then they take the tile. The tile may only be used once during the entire game (that is ONCE not once per player) - put it back in the box when it has been used.

Tile #2: The Guard's Flag
This tile may also only be used once per game. It begins on the table next to the train stack. On their turn any player may decide to use the Flag instead of taking their normal turn (ie they do not get to play a carriage or place a passenger chit). The Flag is placed above a train which shows that the train has a fault and cannot be moved. Remove all the passenger chits and return them to their owners, then discard the carriages and the train engine - no one scores this train. After use place the Flag back in the box

Zen Garden: Raked Sand
The two tiles allow a player to remove and replace a previously played tile - except a feature tile with a cube on it already.

This is available in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 173 - July 2014).

name: Última Fortaleza
description:
A Ultima Fortaleza (The Last Fortress) is a cooperative AND competitive game of intrigue, bluff and tower defense. It's a game where humans, elven and dwarven heroes are the enemy and you play in the role of the monster, protecting your race from extinction.
The Last Fortress is the first Brazilian big board game with hundreds of components, several game modes and a rich fantasy background brought to life from the creative mind of the designer Fabiano Saccol.

Tha game is subdivided in a serie of seasons. In each season the players select two actions (build, recruit, buy cards, etc). After performing the actions, the players can move your units and engage the enemy heros. At the end of each turn new heros are put in game and move against the fortress.

The players win if the fortress is not destroyed. Then, the player with the most Power wins the game. If the fortress is destroyed all players lose.
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Star Fleet Battles Supplement #1: Fighters and Shuttles
description:
There are two versions of Star Fleet Battles Supplement #1: Fighters and Shuttles.

The first version requires ownership of the "Boxed" edition of Star Fleet Battles (known as the Designer's Edition) as well as all three (ziplock) expansions to that version.

The second version of this is also the first expansion for the Commander's Edition of Star Fleet Battles, adding new rules for direct firing drones, fighter vs. fighter dogfighting rules, and new ship types. Includes 10 new ship and 5 new fighter group SSD pages, a 20 page rule/scenario book, and 216 die-cut counters. Races covered are the Federation, Tholians, Romulans, Gorns, Kzinti, Klingons, Hydrans, and Lyrans
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Orctions
description:
Nominated for UK Game Expo 2015 Strategy Card or Dice Game of the Year.
Bid. Build. Battle.
Orc Warlords buying Orc Slaves at Orction to then fight to the death in Gladiatorial Combat.
Uses a variety of classic auction techniques and a blend of worker placement strategy to build a gladiator school of Orcs.
Culminates in combat via a dice system of d4 and d6 based on Orc and Gladiator equipment gained.
Players bid on Orc Lots from a deck of 84 individual Orcs in 7 categories to build sets. Orctions occur when a player decides to visit the city of Ve'Tath during the worker placement rounds. Orctions are in 6 different styles. Once one player has the designated number of sets they win stage one of the game and then decide which pairs of other players must fight in the dice combat game in the arena until there is only one Orc left alive. The player who has this Orc is the winner of the entire game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Butine!
description:
In the meadow of Butine! (which is French for "forage"), many flowers bloom. Their diversity will allow you to produce a delicious honey by collecting combinations of three flowers, with these combinations being revealed only to you on your cards — but the task can be exhausting for a bee! Identify the possible routes that will permit the bee to make these combinations by moving only on the flowers that are in its immediate vicinity, but all players play with the same bee counter, so it's up to you to anticipate their choices!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Mafia
description:
Will you survive the game of Mafia? Two teams compete in this delightfully deadly party game. Based on the classic role-playing strategy game, it’s kill or be killed as innocent city folk pit their wits against a mob of ruthless international gangsters. Engage in a tangled web of intrigue, subterfuge, wild accusations, protestations of innocence and bluffing. Includes 24 street character cards, crime-scene notepad and definitive game guide with rules, case files, tactical tips and ideas for advanced play.

To begin a judge must be picked and they will take notes of moves. Character cards are dealt face down to each player. There are three levels of game you can play, described in The Ultimate Mafia Bible. In the most basic version of the game the judge asks all players to close their eyes. The mafia are then asked to open their eyes and silently pick a victim. All players then open their eyes and the victim is announced. The living players must then identify a suspect. That suspect is eliminated and this marks the end of round one. The game continues until all mafia or all civilians have been killed.

—description from publisher
publishers: Gameology (Gameology Romania), Laurence King Publishing Ltd

name: LAP
description:
Lap was published in Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games and was described by him as a second or third cousin to the well-known pencil and paper game Battleship.

Each player secretly draws dividing lines on a grid of 8x8 cells, creating four sectors of exactly 16 squares. Players then take turns gathering clues by asking how many cells in a particular 2x2 square belong to each sector. The game is won by correctly deducing the opponent's setup.
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Games and Puzzles (magazine), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Raiatea: Additional Rituals
description:
This promo pack adds 10 new Ritual Cards to Raiatea. These cards are shuffled into their respective draw piles (either Normal or Forbidden).

—description from the publisher

Error : 8 cards, not 10
as in the picture
categories: Ancient, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Religious
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Turtle Bay
description: Today is the big hatching day: the cute baby turtles in Turtle Bay are finally hatching from their eggs. And of course they want to get into the ocean as fast as possible. But with so much turmoil, the clumsy sea creatures quickly end up on their backs and can no longer move forward without your help. In the beastly good children's game, a lucky hand with the dice is just as important as a little bit of tactical skill.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Powers
description:
Players take on the role of super-powered beings, who make their homes on a city board and gain victory points by acquiring new powers and defeating villains.

Each turn, two dice are rolled to determine which type of power resource is generated. Players gain the resource by moving to the space or having a base on the space.

When the right resources are collected, super powers can be purchased, but you must have training (tokens) to use them.

If doubles are rolled on the resource phase, a villain appears that the heroes must defeat by either:
giving up the proper power resources,or
giving up a training token to activate a purchased power.

If the player can't do either, the must give up a token to pass.
Once a villain is defeated the spoils of victory are spread among the players.

The winning hero is the first to reach 80 victory points.

Super Powers has been updated to Second Edition in December 2009. The second edition changes mostly include the main board where energy tokens are aquired. They no longer are placed based on a die roll. Also, players are able to perform actions based on the number of their own tokens placed on the main board. The art has been upgraded. The changes increase the strategy options against opponents and the new art makes the game much nicer.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: WWII
description:
At 4 hours and 45 minutes of the 1st of September 1939 began the greatest of all wars ... was the beginning of the Second World War! During the following six years, nearly 100 million people lost their lives, Churchill, Stalin, Roosevelt, Hitler, Mussolini and Hirohito changed the world ... It is time to relive history commanding your armies in the most important battles of this unprecedented conflict! Welcome to WWII!

"WWII" is a board game for 2 players created by Julio Trois, which has the theme of the Second World War. During 10 rounds each army will win the largest number of cities...

The game has several maps of battles of WWII, being able to play a single battle or play the Campaign Mode with 19 maps!

"WWII" is a tactical game, where military strategy is very important. Each player must organize his troops, composed of tokens of infantry, tanks, artillery and bombers. The clashes follow the style of the best wargames using dices and tables, for the resolution of battles.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Pocket Sports: Cycling Tour
description:
Pocket Sports Cycling is a competitive dice game for 1 - 4 players. Each player controls a team/rider as they travel through 42 stages over 3 countries.

The game includes 6 custom dice, 4 team cards showing a rider and his unique abilities, instructions, 3 country courses and 12 wooden cubes to track fatigue, H2O and position on the Leaderboard.

A simple mechanic uses a control die that determines what style of attack a rider will use, attempting to overtake the rider in front. Each attack has an 'intensity' value that the Peloton must equal or better to stifle the attack.

There are decisions to be made on when to use special abilities and skill checks to avoid hazards.

It's fast, dice rolling action, that fits in your pocket.

name: Boss Monster: Reactor Core
description:
Reactor Core (Trap Room) was handed out to visitors of Brotherwise Games booth at Origins 2016.

Card Text:
Advanced Rooms in your dungeon have +1 Heart.
Value of 2 Hearts.

The Reactor Core is a room that can be added to the deck of rooms for the Boss Monster base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Flamme Rouge: Vuokatin vaara
description: A promotional track card for Flamme Rouge. The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

name: Kiev: The Battle of Encirclement, 1941
description:
"Kiev: The Battle of Encirclement, 1941" is a simulation wargame of the German Blitzkrieg campaign from 29 August to 26 September 1941. It ended with the largest encirclement in history: 665,000 Soviets were destroyed; 3718 guns and 884 armored fighting vehicles captured; and the remains of the great Soviet prewar army of April 1941 was finished as a fighting force.

2 days per turn, 5 miles / 8 kilometers per hex.

This stand-alone wargame is also contained in Army Group South quad-wargame which is the fifth title in SPI's "Moment in Conflict Series", an operational simulation set on the Eastern Front in World War II.

All four wargames use a set of Standard Rules derived from "Panzergruppe Guderian" as the basic core game rules. Each wargame then, has it's own set of Exclusive rules.

name: Monster Maker 5: Sofia's Holy Knights
description: 5th in the Monster Maker card game's main series. This time they tried to make it a little more complicated (monster are differentiated by more than just strength).
publishers: Galaxy Plan Inc., Hobby Base, Sho-Kikaku

name: Flying Tigers
description:
Game recreates the gallant and unparalleled success of Chennault's famous volunteers in a challenging two-player WW II air-to-air combat game. With less than 100 obsolete fighters and no spare parts, the Flying Tigers destroyed 399 Japanese aircraft in a six-month period.

Game includes: die-cut counters, full-color map board and three variations to cover "what-if" options. Even American Brewster Buffalo fighters are included in the mix.

The game was originally published by Gamescience in 1969. A second edition was published by Third Millennia in 1973.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Top Secret
description:
FROM THE BOX: Are you Houdini...Hong Kong...or a Hot Dog?

Your TOP SECRET mission: To "un-mask" all your opponents - and keep your own identity under wraps. Based on TV's cleverest new game show. TOP SECRET requires the same intelligence and cunning when you play at home, each player assumes the identity of a person, place or thing. Now, you all vie to answer toss-up questions to earn money and the chance to buy clues to one another's I.D.'s But you only get four clues to each - and you have to buy each one separately!

If you can keep your own "cover" secret while everyone else reveals theirs, you'll go on to the Super Sleuth round: Decipher six identities in sixty seconds - from just three clues each - and win $5,000!

TOP SECRET...Confidentially, it's just too much fun to keep under cover!

Each player is given a secret subject. Each subject has four clues, with each clue having a purchase price: $250, $500, $750, and $1,000.

One player is selected to read aloud a trivia question. The player who answers that question correctly receives a random reward between $200 and $1,000. A player must buy a clue from an opponent when afforded. Guessing an opponent's subject earns the guesser $500, with the other player eliminated from the game.

The process repeats until only one player remains, who then goes on to play the "Super Sleuth Round" where s/he must guess three secret subjects in under one minute for $5,000.

The player with the most money after two games is the winner.

This is a faithful adaptation of the unsold 1988 CBS daytime game show pilot of the same name, although the show itself never actually got past the pilot stage. The board game was only released briefly before being pulled, mostly due to this but also because it shared its name with a TSR, Inc. RPG that was already on the market.

name: Valdora: Additional Commission
description:
This is a very small print & play expansion to Valdora found on Michael Schacht web site.
This special commission can be done with two golds and any other precious stone and works just like the other commissions.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Transportation

name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3050
description: BattleTech Record Sheets 3050 provides more than 250 filled-out record sheets for the BattleMechs, tanks, hovercraft and VTOLS described in BattleTech Technical Readout 3050, including variants and alternate configurations. As an added feature, the game information for the relevant weapons and equipment is printed on each record sheet for easy reference. The appendix provides an alphabetical listing of 'Mechs and vehciles included in the book, along with their C-bill costs and combat values.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Siberia: Warehouse expansion
description:
Both warehouse tiles will be mixed up together with the investment tiles during the preparation period. A warehouse can be obtained like the other investment tiles during the Investment action.

If a player obtains one of the warehouse tiles, he places it beside his gaming board visible for the other players. After a Resource action, resources can be stored in the warehouse. They can be sold at a later time. Storing resources is voluntary, i.e. a player can choose to sell his resources immediately after the Resource action. But he can also choose to store one or two resources in his warehouse, up to a total capacity of 2 resources (same or different). Resources in the warehouse can be sold later in addition to any other action of the player, either before or after that action. If a player has stored two resources, he decides whether to sell both or only one resource. If he sells both resources, he may sell them at different stock exchanges. Each player can only own one warehouse.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: 1850jr
description:
An 1830 mini-game for 3 to 6 players designed by AICS LABS.

To play 1850 jr you need a copy of the original 1830 game from Avalon Hill. All 1830 rules are in effect, with some modifications.

The goal of the game is to become the richest robber baron, and also to play a shorter game with the same full flavour of 1830.

The game is set in the island of Sicily, and the map is smaller than 1830.

Published with the Italian fanzine Bollettino T.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Munchkin Legenden 2: Fauntastische Spiele
description:
Munchkin Legenden 2: Fauntastische Spiele consists of German versions of the two small English-language Munchkin Legends expansions Munchkin Legends 2: Faun and Games and Munchkin Legends 3: Myth Prints.

Thus, Fauntastische Spiele introduces a new race — the Faun — as well as the Gladiator, who gets tougher when his life is at stake! This 112-card set has new monsters to fight, new Treasures to gain, and jokes and puns based on figures from mythology and history. You can use the "Spear of Destiny" to fight "J.R.R. Trollkin" or fend off the "Wendigo" with your "Hell Toupee".
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Mythology
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Upon a Fable: 6-Card Promo Pack
description:
A 6-pack of promo cards distributed to Upon a Fable Kickstarter backers. The six cards are marked with a Kickstarter green 'K' logo in the bottom right corner and include:

TYPE: Ever After
EFFECT: When scoring at the end of the game, gain 4 Bonus Points.
WONDER REQUIREMENT: 1 any Wonder

TYPE: Ever After
EFFECT: The maximum number of Fate cards you may hold in your hand is increased by 1.
WONDER REQUIREMENT: 2 any Wonders

TYPE: Epic Realm
EFFECT: Gain any 2 Wonders of choice every Story.
WONDER REQUIREMENT: 2 Followers and 2 Castles

TYPE: Dream
EFFECT: Convert up to 4 Wonders to an equal number of any other Wonders.
WONDER REQUIREMENT: 2 any Wonders

TYPE: Enchantment
EFFECT: Play immediately after any Blessing card is revealed to receive the same benefit as the other blessed players.
WONDER REQUIREMENT: None

TYPE: Blessing
EFFECT: Every player gains 2 Wonders of choice.
WONDER REQUIREMENT: None
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): Full of Surprises
description:
This promo card was available with the release of the expansion
Ca$h 'n Guns: More Cash 'n More Guns.

After choosing your Surprise card, take all the Surprise cards from the discard pile and choose two more.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mafia, Negotiation
mechanics: Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Pioneers of Mars
description:
Pioneers of Mars is a long term generational story of the arrival and advancement of industry and civilization on Martian soil. You are the Commander, assigned to the Red Planet on behalf of a Terran Government or Corporation (who can tell anyways these days), in order to gain enough Prestige to ensure your place in the annals of history as the First President of Mars.

Game-Play consists of a 5x5 grid of Generational cards which allows for variable turn order each game. Balancing the constraints of energy, life support, prestige and resource management, you must expand your own territories, colonists and prestige to allow for personalized work placement on your own Base, while still countering other players moves in the main game space through military actions.

Commanders are assigned 5 faction trait cards from the player deck, allowing for specialized strategies and providing additional replay value.

Prestige is gained or lost through a variety of personal base cards, generational space cards, and negative actions. Grants are representative of permanent negative prestige points and are representative of the populaces negative view of your choices.
categories: Economic, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Taiko
description:
A strategic table-top card game set in Japan during the age of samurai.

Taiko was designed in Pittsburgh with the goal of creating a fast-to-learn game that engaged the attention of both casual (social) and strategic players. The number of players can be extended from a minimum of 2 seamlessly to an unlimited number of players (Present record is a single circle of 14 players). Taiko has a unique starting setup since each player begins with an identical army (selected from the available cards), and there is no random shuffling or dealing anytime during the game.

Gameplay: Each player begins with a castle to defend, and 7 warrior cards. Simultaneously, each player put facedown a card from their hand on their left and a card on their right which will attack that neighbor. Cards are resolved based on their value (higher wins) or by special abilities. After resolving, all cards are traded. The game continues until all castles are defeated except for the last castle standing: the round champion.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Wargame

name: Żercy
description:
'With the birth of the Kirs, shape, space, and time have been moved. The universe was determined by "Kir of Run" — the direction of movement — and the gods settled in their Tums on the edges of the world.

Slavic mythology is a little-known theme for games, one that can hide many secrets. Żercy is both a card game and a first attempt to create a complete representation of the Slavic gods and disclose this mythology full of mysteries.

Who are the Żercy? They are priests of ancient gods who attempt to manipulate reality in subtle ways. They are mercenaries in the hands of tribal chieftains, who attempt to divine success or disaster in coming wars. Żercy, by making proper sacrifices, want to obtain a favor of Kir, the one they serve, while striving at the same time to change the natural balance of power.

In the game, each player impersonates a Żerca, a priest of one of four Kirs, gods who represent both the seasons and the directions of the world:

Jaruna (spring, east)
Rujewit (summer, south)
Jesz (autumn, west)
Kostroma (winter, north)


You must read signs in the continuous changes around you. Choose a direction for your actions and for the Kir that you want to serve. All gods who appear in the game belong to one of four Tums created by Kirs; the inspiration for the graphic representation of the gods comes from images of nature, in which the attentive observer can notice much more than just a chaos of random configurations.

name: Pirates: The Cursed Isle
description:
Lors de votre dernière aventure, un mystérieux perroquet, avec un parchemin accroché à la patte, s’est posé sur l’épaule de votre capitaine. Il ne s’agit certainement pas d’une de ces cartes au trésor comme on en trouve dans tous les livres de pirates. Non ! C’est un message à votre attention. Une malédiction semble avoir touché les habitants d’une petite île lointaine et isolée, et ils cherchent désespérément la personne qui pourrait les aider. Et si c’était vous ?

Ce livre est totalement indépendant des deux premiers !
—description from the publisher

On your last adventure, a mysterious parrot, with a parchment hung on his leg, landed on your captain's shoulder. It is certainly not one of those treasure cards as found in all pirate books. No ! This is a message to you. A curse seems to have touched the people of a remote and remote island, and they are desperate for the person who could help them. And if it were you ?

This book is totally independent of the first two!

Pirates 3 is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher (translated)
publishers: FoxGames, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: Zombielife Insurance
description:
In Zombielife Insurance, you play as salaryman going about your business as a slow-spreading zombie virus makes its way through the population. The insurance company "Zombielife" came up with a series of insurance policies covering the different stages of zombification. As you try to survive this zombie epidemic, you can decide to invest your money, buy protective equipment to prevent yourself getting infected, or simply purchase insurance for that huge payout in case you do become a zombie. Will you survive the epidemic or become a zombie trying to infect others while your family lives a high life on your insurance money?

Zombielife Insurance is a 2-5 player game of making decisions to buy or not to buy insurance!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Educational, Humor, Zombies

name: Mary Anning
description:
Follow in the footsteps of the 19th century English paleontologist and collect the best fossils as you excavate the dangerous cliffs of Lyme Regis.

A family friendly push your luck game inspired on the classic blackjack, with set a collection scoring mechanic and variable powers to spice up your games.

Players draw fossil cards from Lyme Regis' deck and add them to their excavation one by one. At the end of the round, the player who has come closest to 21 points, without going over, will be able to collect the fossil he wants from among all those played.

The game ends when one player fills all his boxes with fossils. It is time to evaluate the collections and determine which paleontologist deserves the victory.
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Big Box
description:
Legends of Andor is a co-operative adventure board game for two to four players in which a band of heroes must work together to defend a fantasy realm from invading hordes. To secure Andor's borders, the heroes will embark on dangerous quests over the course of five unique scenarios (as well as a final scenario created by the players themselves). But as the clever game system keeps creatures on the march toward the castle, the players must balance their priorities carefully.

At the heart of Legends of Andor is its unique narrative, the linked scenarios of which tell an overarching story as the players successfully complete objectives. For each scenario, or "Legend", a legend deck conveys the plot of an ever-unfolding tale...one in which the players are the protagonists. A wooden marker moves along the board's legend track at key points during each scenario, triggering the draw of a new legend card, the introduction of new game-altering effects, and the advancement of the story's plot. In the end, the players must endeavor to guide the fate of Andor through their heroic actions, bringing a happy ending to their epic fantasy tale.

Die Legenden von Andor: Big Box includes the Legends of Andor base game, the New Heroes expansion that allows for games with up to six players, a promo "Wolf Warrior" hero, and additional legends and variants on top of those in the base game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Welt der Türme
description:
Translated from the publisher's game page:

Towers have always been symbols of power and freedom. In this game towers give the knights the opportunity to find their way to the goal. They are not tied to a fixed location or a fixed set of rules; they have the freedom to find a place anywhere on the game board. This creates a fascinating landscape for the knights among the towers – a world of towers.

Whoever first manages to move his knight to the opponent's start line wins. The road to travel is always on the towers, upon which you can freely move. The higher the tower, the farther the jump...

name: Pokemon Battle Chess
description: A quick chess-like game for two players. Each player controls a small team of Pokemon and tries to take out the enemy Victini (king piece). The pieces have power ratings like Stratego, but a weaker/equal attacker gets to draw a "plus power card" in hopes of luckily winning the fight. A piece is flipped over to its reverse side (which usually has weaker power) when damaged once, and destroyed when damaged a second time. Lost pieces count towards the cost needed to summon the legendary Pokemon, impressive 2x2 pieces with high power but mediocre movement. The Victini is protected by its egg, which can absorb three hits.

name: High Treason: The Trial of Louis Riel – Defense Testimony Promo Card
description:
A single promo card from Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

Defense Testimony (4 actions)
Jury Selection: Reveal and peek at 1 Occupation
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Paper Pinball: Goblin Circus
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: Zombicide: White Death
description:
Winter is upon us and its dark and cruel night brings forth dreadful menaces, worse than frostbite...

Zombicide Medieval Fantasy is back!

With new survivors, new zombies, new setting, and new rules!

Scale the great walls to your advantage
Use the added height of the fortress walls to escape the Zombies' grasp, dump cauldrons of hot tar onto enemies below, and gain superior line of sight!

Arm yourself to the teeth
Command a retinue of guards to push back against the Zombie Horde and use unique Survivor skills to bolster their abilities.

Melee Attack… From a distance
Cut down the Zombie horde with shiny new polearm-type weapons. Melee without ever having to get in close range!

Freeze Zombies dead in their tracks!
Draw on the surrounding icy elements and channel it towards your foes preventing them from taking any actions.

Mind the ruin zones
The constant zombie siege has wrought devastation onto the lands. Crumbling buildings offer little to search for, yet remain challenging to shoot through.

And stop the corruption!
Necromancers send waves of corruption close to the beacon to steal its power and spawn zombies each time they activate. If the beacon gets corrupted, all hope is lost!

And this is only the tip of the iceberg!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: High Rollers
description:
This was based on the classic TV game show original hosted by Alex Trebek along with Ruta Lee (Elaine Stewart in the syn. version) as co-host on NBC Daytime in 1974 and in Syndication from 1975 for which both have ended in 1976 along with a revival under the name (The New) High Rollers with Trebek once again as host along with Becky Price, Linda Hooks and Lauren Firestone as co-hosts respectively which also aired on NBC Daytime from 1978 until 1980. Then was once again revived briefly in Syndication hosted by Wink Martindale along with Crystal Owens and K.C. Winkler as co-hosts respectively airing from 1987 until 1988.

Each number one through nine is assigned a random, secret card that has a value between $50 and $500. The game master begins the round by asking a trivia question of the two players. The player who answers the question correctly wins control of the dice.

The controlling player may roll the dice or force the opponent to roll them. If the player who rolls the dice can use any combination added together of the numbers one through nine to make the total rolled the player wins the value of assigned values of those numbers. Numbers used are removed from play.

A players wins by removing the last number. A player loses when the player cannot make the dice roll using the remaining numbers in play.

The winning player plays the "Big Numbers" round solitaire. Rolling the dice to remove numbers. Rolling doubles earns the player an Insurance Card which gives the player a free roll when needed. Removing all the numbers earns the player $10,000. Failing to remove all the numbers earns the player $100 for each number removed.

The player with the most money wins the game.

When the game was revived in 1978, gameplay was changed slightly. The numbers 1-9 are put in three columns of three and assigned prizes to each column at the start of the game. A player had to remove the last number of a column to win the prizes. The object of the game remained the same, as did the Big Numbers.

The 1975 home games from both the E.S. Lowe and Milton Bradley era were called Big Numbers: The High Rollers Game while the 1988 Parker Brothers home game was just simply called High Rollers.

The show was inspired by the board game itself called Shut the Box.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., Milton Bradley, Parker Brothers

name: That Snow Moon: Know This Integration
description:
Bounty hunters, smugglers, crime lords, and other opportunists join the fray, getting involved in galactic affairs to line their own pockets. You will never find a more wretched hive than that of villain and scummy.

Contains:
6 Bounty Hunter Contacts

Adds:
A fifth player to That Snow Moon
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Pearl Harbor
description:
Empires of Apocalypse part IV. The Pacific Theater of Operations in WWII.

Pearl Harbor features the "China Incident", a limited war of Japan against China, which eventually develops into a full scale war. Step by step the diplomatic relations between Japan and the USA worsen. This first leads to diplomatic and economical pressure of the USA against Japan.
