Finally Japan opens the struggle for a Pacific Empire of the Rising Sun with its surprise attack on Pearl Harbor.
Scenarios:

September 1939
Since July 1937 a war between Japan and China rages unlike in Europe a mere partisan and guerrilla war. Will the USSR interfere? Will Japan go for the Pacific, or wage a full scale war against China? Or will Japan help the Axis in wearing down the USSR?

June 1941
The Axis has assaulted the USSR in the ETO. Will Japan join in or stick to its non aggression pact with the USSR? Japan and the USSR have more time to prepare for the inevitable war against each other. Will Japan operate even better than historical? Or will the USA be able to repel the Japanese assaults?

Pearl Harbor Dec 1941
December 7 1941. The Japanese aircraft carrier elite is on its way for a surprise strike against the US Naval base Pearl Harbor, Honolulu, Hawaii. Will the US Navy been crippled for months? At the same time Japan launches a series of Invasions against the Philippines, the Netherlands' East Indies and other important islands.
With this infamous attack Japan wakes the industrial giant USA ...

Each of the scenarios can be used as a starting point for a full PTO game till 1945. Pearl Harbor uses the same system as its predecessors Morsecode ···–, Triumph & Fall of the Desert Fox, and Cold Days in Hell. Together with these ETO games Pearl Harbor can be combined into a true MEGA game of WWII.

Contents (see Community wiki below):

A3 maps
6 counter sheets with 1680 counters total
Player aids cards
EoA Rules book 2.0
Pearl Harbor Scenario book
Tutorial and example book
Quick start card


Unit Scale: Corps
Time Scale: 1 turn = 1 month
Map Scale: 1 hex = 50 miles
Playing time: 40+ hours
Number of players: 1 to five
Complexity: 6 out of 8
Solitaire Suitability: 4 out of 8
Game Designer: Udo Grebe
Developers: Andreas Bertram, Dirk Blech.
Map Art: Christian Specht.

(from the UGG website and user's description)


All components have been disseminated in Command and Strategy magazine issues 1 to 6.
Also sold as a complete package.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Emmerlaüs: Destiny
description: Fixed deck of 50 additional cards to play with Emmerlaüs: Duel of Mages and/or its other expansions (Abundance, Communion, Power).

name: Legacy: Forbidden Machines – Deep Vault
description: Several unique "Activation" and "When Established" abilities didn't make into the final version of the Legacy: Forbidden Machines expansion – but since those cards are still interesting and fun, they're available as the promotional expansion Legacy: Forbidden Machines - Deep Vault and are playable with all other technologies from the Forbidden Machines expansion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Tortuga: Queenie 1 – Treasure Tiles
description:
This mini-expansion was a non-exclusive stretch goal during the Kickstarter campaign of the Tortuga base game and will be available as promo. It adds 17 alternative treasure tiles.

Playable only with the Tortuga base game.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Ratosha Bajoran Expansion Pack
description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Ratosha Bajoran Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 15 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Chrononauts: Live Woolly Mammoth
description:
This was part of the Mammoth Fun Pack, the Looney Labs Holiday Gift for 2013. This promo Artifact card can be used with Chrononauts or with Early American Chrononauts.

The text on the card reads:


Live Woolly Mammoth
His name is Harry
Counts as any Live Dinosaur or a Woolly Mammoth Steak.
Recovered from 12,000 BCE.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: City of Gears: Dice Tower Promo Tile
description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Every Player rolls 1 die, Gain 4 victory points for each result which matches the result you rolled ( including the one you rolled).
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Familiar Alchemy
description:
The illustrious botanist Beira needs an apprentice! Will you and your familiar heed the call for a friendly competition of botany and brewing at her Highland Glasshouse? A wondrous world of plants, potions and familiars await in Familiar Alchemy, a semi-cooperative game rooted in Scottish folklore.

You and your friends will bond with cute and powerful Familiars to help channel your alchemical abilities and carefully select plants you want to include in your gardens. These plants can be grown and harvested for ingredients by taking a "Channel" or "Harvest" action on your turn.

Beira will set out a collection of Communal Brews that you will need to work together to complete, and a Communal Garden that you must tend. Each brew requires a different combination of ingredients. Taking the "Brew" action on your turn will allow you to add ingredients you have collected to one of the brews.

Your Familiar can also help you by turning unneeded ingredients into alchemical compost to speed up plant growth or by performing powerful alchemical rituals.

Once all Communal Brews are complete, you score points based on the number and type of ingredients you contributed and how well you looked after your plants. The one with the highest score will earn their place as Beira's Apprentice!

-description from designer

name: Flipa
description:
Flipa is a fun word game for 1 to 12 people. Plan your way across the board to form the longest word and show off your vocabulary in your new favorite word making game.

Make Words, Flip Letters. Flipa!
This game of words will become the delight of wordsmiths in almost any part of the world. Follow the best path to form the longest words adapting yourself to the changing board. Give free rein to your vocabulary and Flipa with friends, family or at school with its many game modes for up to 12 people

How to Play Flipa?

Shuffle and place the letters on a table forming a symmetrical structure.
In turns, we will form words following a path of adjacent tiles. Each letter will give us a point.
Turn over all the tiles used to form the word. The next person to play will have to form a word with the new board.
Whoever manages to exceed 20 points will win the game.
Flipa is also a party. Play in teams and compete in its fun word-making challenges.


—description from the publisher

name: YET
description:
In this race for time, players race their Airships around a clock, capturing face-up Time Capsule cards for points at the end of the game.
Each round, the clock ticks one hour, flipping over the card in that hour's position. Players draft Action cards, then perform precise movements and card or Airship rotations in order to position themselves to capture the most Time Capsules at the end of the round.










Time Capsules are numbered 1-12 and reward their face value in points. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Deduction, Exploration, Memory, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Drafting, Closed Drafting, Map Reduction, Memory, Multi-Use Cards

name: Bezzerwizzer Fragenerweiterung 2.0
description:
The 2nd expansion set for Bezzerwizzer.

The game contains 2,000 new questions on 100 cards in the same categories and layout as the base game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ausgerechnet Fernweh
description:
Ausgerechnet Fernweh uses the same game play as the other Ausgerechnet titles: Players deal three piles of 15 location cards from a deck of roughly 200 cards (naming locations related to Hamburg for this edition), then place an interlude card between each set of piles to make a deck of 45 cards. One location card is placed on the direction board, which has arrows pointing north, south, east and west.

During a turn, a player draws a location card – keeping the latitude and longitude on the back of the card secret from all players – then places the card next to the direction board, indicating how he/she thinks this location relates to the starting one. Is Lüneburg west or east of Blankenese? Why sure, so place it by the west arrow. Location cards can be placed between cards already on the board.

After each location card is placed, any player can challenge the positioning of that card. That player reveals the back of the most recently placed card as well as one adjacent card. If the challenge was correct – and the card placed wrongly – the challenger wins a point chip from the placer and the card is removed; otherwise the challenger hands over a chip to that person.

After fifteen cards have been placed, the interlude card signals an interim scoring in which all players secretly guess how many cards have been placed correctly. Guess correctly, and you score two chips; if no one is spot on, the closest guesser wins a chip.

After three rounds and the final interlude scoring, the player with the most chips wins.

name: Diesel Demolition Derby: Arenas
description: Arenas are large cards with 15 more unique illustrations that represent venues constructed or set aside for this dangerous league. In some cases they are made to challenge the combatants, and in some others they are made to contain them. Every one throws a wrench into the proverbial machine and are recommended for those who have dabbled in the ‘Derby once or twice before.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rebuild Ukraine
description:
Welcome to Ukraine, the country of talented people, rich lands, and amazing nature.

The events unfold in modern Ukraine, in the post-war period, where peace and well-being already reign. You become one of the governors of 4 regions in Ukraine.

You can mine resources on your holdings and use them to rebuild industry and economy. Your region, like any other, has a predominant resource that can be mined in much larger volumes.

In the game, as in reality, each region of Ukraine does not have some of minerals or resources. So, with the help of diplomacy, you have to make trade agreements with other regions for the sale of certain resources. When the first-player's token passes to you, you become the main trader for the given season and have the right to make a deal with every other player.

To develop industry, you need to rebuild 4 buildings in your region: 3 industrial buildings and 1 regional bank.

Three Cossack workers have been working on your lands since the beginning. But to rebuild the region, you will need new workers, whom you should train.

In order to improve the economy, you must fulfill government orders, that is, invest your resources in the development of Ukraine. Instead, your region will receive growth in the foreign-exchange reserves and various bonuses from the state (bonus cards).

The term of your governance is 12 seasons. In each season, various events occur that affect the general situation of the regions – shortage of extraction of certain resources, crisis, moratoriums on construction, over-extraction of resources, etc.

Check whether you have enough inspiration to be ahead of other governors in the fight for the prosperity and development of Ukrainian lands!
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Commodity Speculation, Constrained Bidding, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Saus und Brau's
description:
First she breezes, then she brews! On a wild whirling flight, Winnie the witch follows the tip of her broom. The ingredients for her favorite potion are widely scattered across mountains and valleys. To collect them, players let Winnie spin around until her broom determines the direction of her flight route. If you can elicit the right witchy magic from the magical folding books, you'll collect the ingredients the witch has flown over — but jinxed books swap places...

In Saus und Brau's, children (but also adults!) can combine the magic power of their fingertips with the sharpness of an alert mind.

name: King's Crown
description:
Combining Go’s open gameplay with the chance taking of Bingo, this game does not only require strategic thinking, but also a good memory. It is divided into two phases: stone acquisition and stone playing. Your goal is to get a bingo by playing your chosen stones. Choose what information you will give your opponent and try to remember what you know about their game plan.

King's Crown is the last of three games of the game series Wiz Stone, developed by Go grandmaster Lee Sedol.

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men - Hawkeye: Avengers Disassembled
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 19.

1 Hawkeye Heldenfall card with German text

Hawkeye and his die originally appeared in Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men, but this version was a participation promo from the Avengers Disassembled Organized Play event. You can find his dice in Avengers vs. X-Men boosters (available at your local retailer). Like all Dice Masters cards and dice, you can combine it with your favourites from other Dice Masters expansions!

The card’s text translated into English:
Once per turn, during your Main Step, you may knock out a Hawkeye die you control. If you do, you may deal damage equal to his attack divided any way you choose to your opponent’s characters.

name: Bi-litaire
description: This an abstract game with some balls like in abalone. On each turn you remove one ball from the board and after that you walk with one ball over the other. The one you jumped over should be removed too. The special thing about this game is that you are able to move some of the squares of the gameboard too. It is made out of plastic.

name: Redneck Life: Livin' the Dream
description:
Livin’ the Dream Expansion will give you more Rigs, Homes, all new charts, Go Redneckin’ Cards, name chart and score sheet pad... all of the amazing pieces and parts to be Livin’ the Dream!

Livin' the Dream is an expansion for Redneck Life Board Game by Gut Bustin' Games. This is not a stand-alone game. In this fun-filled Expansion for Redneck Life Board Game, we have included a Score Sheet Pad, 20 New Rigs, 10 New Homes, 50 fun-filled Go Redneckin' Cards, Rig Sleeve, All New Charts, and a new Name Placard for the center of your existing game board! Be the player with the most teeth remaining to win this Gut Bustin' Game Expansion for Redneck Life! Play Redneck Life Board Game with the Livin' the Dream Expansion for a Gut Bustin' Great Time!.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Ominoes: Hieroglyphs
description:
Ominoes: Hieroglyphs is the second game in the Ominoverse adding to the Best Abstract Game of UK Games Expo 2017 - OMINOES.

Ominoes: Hieroglyphs is a tile laying, tile flipping game where players are racing to complete their temple ahead of everyone else.
The temple is made of five parts each of which is bought and activated using blessing tokens. The blessing tokens are gained by placing tiles on the Frieze of Ominotep in groups of four or more. Once a group is formed it earns the active player a blessing of that symbol, plus any bonus blessings from being adjacent to special altars. Once score the tiles of that group flip to the other side and a second scoring may be possible. If a second group scores then those tiles are removed - but without breaking the Frieze.

Place Tiles. Score Blessings. Build Temples.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Rommel: The War for North Africa
description:
"Rommel: The War for North Africa", one of the "Great Battles of History" series wargames, actually should have been titled "Battles for Tobruk", since it only covers the general area around that famous fortress/Port.

The container for this is a pinkish fold-over cardboard with a large cut-out on the Front and smaller cut-out on the back for storage of the Mapsheet(front) while some sort of "pocket" is used on the inside back. It's best to provide your own plastic baggies for counter storage and you supply the 6-sided DIE needed.

The Game components consist of the following: a 17-inches by 24-inches Mapsheet; a HUGE fold-out RULES sheet(about the same size as the Mapsheet); a Turn Track Chart(with RULES modifications); over 72-5/8-inch rounded corners cardboard Counters including some small round ones for Supply Record keeping; and a very small Sheet with Combat Computation Charts on one side and Historical Notes on the reverse.

On the mostly GRAY Mapsheet at the upper portion is a RED section which contains the Sequence of Play; Unit Movement Abilities; Terrain Analysis Chart; Attack Analysis Chart; Attack Taken/Supply Expenditure Chart; and a Supply Point Index for EACH player. The Mapsheet has some RED features while the rest are of a BROWN color. The Counters are ORANGE with BLACK print for 8th Army units and GRAY with BLACK/ORANGE print for Axis units, with a few PINK informational markers. The UNIQUE symbols used for the AXIS units is actually what the Wehrmacht used for their "unit types" on their situation maps and vehicles! A FIRST for any company at this time in the industry. They take some getting used to for NON-historical minded folks.

There are 3 Scenarios from which to choose to play: Battleaxe-3-Turns-14-15 July 1941; Crusader-10-Turns-18/19 November-7/8 December 1941; and Gazala-15-Turns-27/28 May-24/25 June 1942. Sequence of Play is: 1.Reinforcement Segment; 2.Initial Movement; 3.Combat Segment; 4.Exploitation Movement; 5.Supply Point Index Adjustment and then the second Player repeats these. Optional Rules include Reserve status indication & possible Breakdown of Armor types using a die-roll after Exploitation Movement. Units are back-printed for step losses and allows for Replacements to be incorporated when available.

Overall, this wargame introduces some aspects used by other companies later on, such as Wehrmacht symbols(used by Avalon Hill in the Longest Day game), single Combat factor printed on the counter and having a "set" movement rate for EACH type, and differing Combat results tables for various combinations of attacks. I was unable to determine ANY credits by anyone involved in the production of this.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Cup-Game
description: Each player becomes both manager and trainer of one of the most important soccer teams in Europe. Players must show their financial abilities buying the best defenders, midfielders and strikers available in the market, as well as making good deals when they sell other players to keep the club’s treasury in good shape. When teams meet each other in the field, the most skillful trainer will likely choose the best winning tactics and lead his/her team to the victory and eventually to the Cup’s Final match...
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Great War
description:
The Great War is an A4 soft back with 160 pages, lavishly illustrated in colour with plenty of photographs of the armies for reference when painting and collecting.

When war broke out in August 1914, the majority of military commanders felt that the war would be over by Christmas. The early clashes developed into huge offensives all ending in stalemate.
Battlefield technology and tactics evolved at a spectacular pace with the tank, airplane support and coordinated bombardment becoming commonplace.
As 1918 dawned these new weapons of war spearheaded the offensives, but it was still the soldier’s war to win or lose, where men endured heroically under fire.

The Great War rulebook contains the following:
• A brief historical overview.
• Western Front 1914 and 1918 British, French and German Battalion level army lists.
• Sample army rosters so you can start collecting and playing quickly.
• Standard and Operational Missions.
• Inspiring photographs of the armies for reference when painting and collecting.

The Great War core rulebook is the first in a series enabling gamers to recreate the conflicts of World War One on the table-top.

name: Deep State: High Society Mini-Expansion
description:
Deep State: High Society is a promo mini-expansion that you can add to your games of Deep State.

The High Society is a closed club, admitting only members of the old dynasties that have not yet lost their influence and capital.

These families have centuries of experience in the behind-the-scenes of warfare and hold many secrets and privileges. By winning and retaining their support, you will put the full power of traditional institutions at your service.

During your turn, you may use your Action to capture a High Society card. It costs you 3 Agents.

At the end of the game, the player with the most High Society cards scores 20 Influence points. The second place for the number of High Society cards brings them 10 points. Next, 5 points for being third and no points for being late.

High Society is fully compatible with Deep State: New World Order and the Global Conspiracy expansion. It is designed for 1–5 player games. It comes packaged in its own zip-bag.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: The Best Worst Ice Cream
description: In The Best Worst Ice Cream, player build ice cream cones with wacky flavors such as pizza, eyeballs, and earthworms.

name: Eddy Merckx
description:
This game (named after one of the best cyclists of all time), simulates a cycling race. Each player controls a team of cyclists and tries to earn as much prize money as possible during a three lap race.

You move either by rolling a die (other players who are in the square behind the moving player can 'go with the flow, and follow up for free) or by playing a 'break away card' (other players cannot follow). The number of 'break away cards' that can be played, is determined by the number of players.

If a cyclist is alone in the lead, he moves slower. Cyclist can also choose to wait for a following group in order to save their strength.

Prize money is awarded each round, according to the position in the race.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Path to Yaaru
description:
Path to Yaaru, a.k.a. イアルへの道 (pronounced "Iaru he no Michi"), refers to the Egyptian heavenly paradise of the Fields Of Aaru.

This is a card-drafting game set in Ancient Egypt in which you head to Yaaru, the promised land, with help from the Egyptian gods. The card-drafting system has a twist in that you may not freely pick any card. Hence, while advanced players may plan deeply beforehand to control the later stages of the game, beginners may simply focus on the current state and pick from the smaller choices. Who would be the first to Yaaru, passing the obstacles alongside the path?

With cute illustrations, the game should appeal to a broader audience. The game is published in Japanese, with English rules available online.

Publisher's summary:
古代エジプトで神様達の手助けを借りながら楽園（イアル）を目指すドラフトゲームです。
途中にある関門を抜けつつ、最初に楽園にたどり着ける人は誰でしょうか？
通常のドラフトルールではなく、ピックできるカードに制限があるという少し変わったシステムを採用しています。
このシステムにより、上級者はその後の状況をコントロールすることを目指し深く考えることが出来、初心者は現状の選択肢を良く見比べてピックすることが出来ます。
可愛いイラストもあり、幅広いそうに遊んでもらえるゲームになっています。

name: StoryTellers
description:
StoryTellers is a storytelling game for 3 to 5 players, Ages 10 and up

Setup of the game is very quick. Every player gets a Hat Card, 5 (random) Craft Cards, and 3 Bravo Chips. The Heckle Cards are placed in the middle of the playing area, and the StoryTimer is handed to the player who is going first.

The game starts with the first player reading aloud one of the 53 included storylines. There are three phases to play:

Phase I: StoryTelling
The player holding the StoryTimer creates (speaking out loud) the next part of the story (typically a sentence or two). Play moves around the table, with each player creating and speaking a new addition to the story. During this time, if a StoryTeller uses one of the elements on your Craft cards, you place it next to your Hat Card. Bravo Chips can also be tossed to StoryTellers who do a particularly good job.

Phase II: Discussion
Anyone who played a Craft Card points it out to the others. If no one object, it goes on to that player's Hat Card and will be a point at the end of the game.

Phase III: Recitation
The player holding the StoryTimer gives a Recitation of the story so far. Other players can toss Bravo Chips for a Recitation well done. The StoryTimer is passed to the left, everyone draws back up to 5 Craft Cards, and we go back to Phase I.

At the end of the game, players vote to assign awards (most creative, most hilarious, most surprising, most dramatic). These go into the recipients' hats.

The winner is the player with the most points in his or her hat.

A couple notes about the cards are in order. Craft Cards contain elements of the StoryTellers Craft, which means that players score points by either using or recognizing good storytelling. There are also Heckle Cards which are common to everyone and can be tossed to stop things from getting out of hand.

Home Page: http://www.liveoakgames.com/storytellers
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Word Game

name: ASAKUSA: The Game
description:
Asakusa was the commercial heart of old Tokyo. And now it is one of the most famous sightseeing area in Tokyo, because it has retained the spirit of Edo-era,

Players are city fathers of Asakusa. You walk around sites of Asakusa, and place your men to the sites. When there are already other player's men, you can kick them out by placing more number of your men! You can get income from the sites with your men when you arrive there again. But please keep in mind of the cost to hire the men -- to be the king of Asakusa, better business sense is also important as well as the power.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order
publishers: B2FGames LLC., Game Market, Japon Brand
